text: An employee was cutting a doorway frame using a saw when the frame fell onto the employee and struck the back of his hand. The nails or other protrusions punctured the skin on his right hand. He was hospitalized.
An employee completed his deliveries for the day and later experienced cramps. He was hospitalized overnight for dehydration.

An employee was walking up the stairway while carrying a sheet of sheet rock. A gust of wind came and caught the sheet rock like a kite, knocking the injured employee backwards. He lost his balance and fell 5 to 6 feet to the ground, suffering a concussion.
An employee was unloading a coil from a forklift when the forklift pinched the employee's hand, crushing the right ring finger. The finger had to be amputated.
A maintenance employee cleaning out a machine motor sustained left forearm lacerations when his hand slipped while trying to stand up.
An employee amputated a toe at the Quad B construction site.
On May 5, 2015, an employee fell 15 feet while creating a temporary work surface between two bridge beams with 16-inch long, 4x4 lumber.
Injured employee was pinned between a concrete wall and the bucket of the backhoe. Another employee was driving the backhoe that struck the injured employee.

An employee was lifting an 8" pipe to place it on a pickup truck when the pipe slipped out of his hand and fell on his right index finger. The pipe severed his index fingertip, which had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was unloading trash into a bin from a loading dock area when he slipped on ice and fell onto his left side, breaking three ribs. He was hospitalized.

The employee was assigned to perform housekeeping of the shielding/work platform and clean the deck panels and grinders. At the start of the shift, the employee was walking and stepped on a conduit pipe causing him to roll his ankle.

An employee was holding meat in front of a vertical saw blade to cut it when the employee's foot slipped on the floor. The employee's right index finger then impacted the saw blade and was partially amputated with bone loss.
On 7/8/2016, an employee was trying to repair a conveyor when the right hand was caught in the conveyor belt resulting in amputation of the pointer fingertip.
An employee's right arm was amputated while he was operating an edge grinder machine.
An employee was cleaning roll former dies when his rag became caught in the moving dies. His left hand was then pulled into the dies, amputating his middle finger to the second knuckle.
An employee was jointing a piece of wood when his hand slipped. His pinky finger went into the blade and was amputated.
The employee was doing a quality line check in the hot fill area. As she turned around, she tripped over the water hose, fell, and sustained a comminuted fracture to her left elbow.
An employee was using a hand-grinder to remove a burr on a receiver hitch when the grinder wheel broke apart and sent a piece of the wheel into the left side of the employee's knee.
An employee was checking a tote that had a mix of sulfuric acid and chlorine when it exploded. Shrapnel from the tote amputated his right arm and partially severed his leg.

An employee was gathering parts from a conveyor, placing them in a hamper on an adjustable work table. The employee moved the knee-high work table and then tripped over the cord, which was stretched and above the floor. She fell to the floor, fracturing her left femur below the hip joint.  She was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee slipped and fell while walking to the water fountain, hitting her head on the floor. She injured the left side of her head and her upper neck.
An employee salting the parking lot slipped and fell, breaking his left arm and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was dumping a plastic trash cart into a compactor. Her right ring fingertip got stuck between the plastic receptacle and the metal frame around it. She sustained a fingertip amputation.
An employee was placing a tube in a clamp for a drill press when the clamp closed on and crushed her lefty pinky finger.
An employee was checking one of the label-making machines in the cooler. When she bent down, she lost her balance and grabbed a step ladder. The ladder folded and crushed her left pinky finger.
An employee's left pinky finger was amputated at the last joint while he was using a horizontal press/trimming machine.
The lime kiln flashed and an employee received second degree burns to the face, arms, and legs.

An employee was attempting to help the mill operator start a strip of sticky rubber on the take-off belt when his left index finger came into contact with the mill knives and was amputated behind the nail bed in front of the first knuckle.

An employee was performing maintenance on the line when he placed his left hand into the moving and high-temperature components of the dehydrator drum. He broke several bones in his hand and the skin was de-gloved. He suffered burns.
An employee dropped steel he was carrying. The steel struck the employee's left bicep, cutting an artery. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery to repair the artery.
An employee threw an engine rigging chain and it struck his head resulting in a contusion and laceration to the left side of his head.
An employee slipped and fell while descending from a damp porch at a residence, rupturing a quadricep tendon in the left leg.

The employee was pulling a safety pin out of an outrigger on the telebelt and had his finger pinched in the outrigger. The employee sustained a flesh amputation to the fingertip of the right hand middle finger.

Employee was collecting shoes for her customer in the shoe stockroom when she tripped over a fitting stool sitting on the floor. She fell to the floor, fracturing her right ankle.  She was carrying four boot boxes and could not see directly in front of her.

An employee had used 2x4 to chock a trencher wheel. While working on the trencher, the wheel slid and caused the trencher to fall on the employee's arm, breaking the right humerus and requiring surgery and overnight hospitalization.
An employee was determing the generator when an arc flash occurred, causing severe burns to his face, neck, arms, and hands. The employee has been hospitalized.
An employee working in the basement of the paper machine was exposed to a hot, humid environment and was hospitalized for heat stroke.
An employee was walking out of the kitchen area and lost her footing. She fell and hit her head on the kitchen sink.
An employee was working on an oil drilling rig. While attaching a check valve to a vertical pup joint, the employee's right index finger was pinched between the two parts, amputating the fingertip.

An employee operating a rolling bar of a cold rolling machine (a machine which treads the metal bar) was injured during operation. 

The employee was running a previously treaded metal bar/bolt through the cold rolling machine; while standing on a one foot metal grading/platform.  The employee's shirt got caught on the spinning bar, and as the employee tried to break free, the employee's pant leg got caught, thereby flipping the employee over the bar onto a concrete floor and breaking his leg.

An employee was descending a fixed ladder on a de-ice truck and missed the last rung. The employee fell less than 2 feet and struck his head on the concrete ground. The employee has brain swelling and possible bleeding.
An employee was cutting wood with a table saw and amputated the right index finger at the middle knuckle.
On May 12, 2015, an employee was injured while changing the guillotine blade on the paper machine. The blade fell on his right leg, mid-thigh, resulting in overnight hospitalization.
An employee fell off of a ladder at a jobsite and was admitted to the hospital after sustaining broken ribs.

On August 25, 2015 at approximately 11:25am, an employee was attaching slings to a spreader. When the vessel moved, the sling hit his right middle finger and tore the nail bed off. The employee was treated and released from the hospital on the same day.

An employee was operating a manual lathe in the tool room when a metal stringer caught the employee's right hand and pulled it toward the metal on the lathe. The employee suffered deep lacerations to two fingers, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was cutting wood tack strips with a band saw and suffered a partial amputation of the left index finger.
An employee was walking out a door and was pinned between the door and a forklift.
An employee was moving a patient on a rolling bed and injured her back.
AN employee was loading potatoes into the trailer hopper and fell approximately 4 to 10 feet from a platform fracturing the pelvis.
An employee coating gas pipe with solvent experienced a burn to the left arm.
An employee was cleaning loose cotton from around a banding machine when he was knocked into the machine. He sprained his ankle and suffered leg abrasions, requiring hospitalization.
An employee operating a forklift had his hand on the roller and was turning and caught his hand between the roller and the compactor breaking his finger and cutting his hand.

Two employees were installing a 25-foot, 1000-watt halide light onto anchor brackets using a forklift when the metal fixture broke at the knuckle, striking one employee in the head and the other in the back. The first employee was hospitalized with a head injury, and the second was hospitalized with fractured vertebrae.
An employee was struck by a wine bottle during an attempted robbery of the establishment, suffering multiple lacerations to the head and face. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was crushed-by a concrete structure when it was being placed along the southeast section of the lake's shores/bank. The employee's pelvis was broken.

An employee was helping another employee clear out a 2 x 4 piece of board on a conveyor belt.  The employee's left hand struck the metal frame of the conveyor belt resulting in the amputation of his left index fingertip.
Employees were trying to maneuver a metal pipe into place using a hoist when the swivel released and caused the pipe to suddenly lift up about 6 inches and strike the injured employee in the jaw.
An employee was moving a bundle of I-beams on a conveyor when the employee's finger was pinched and amputated under a bundle.

On or about February 16, 2015, at the repair shop, an employee was pulling a wrench from a boat and slipped and fell backwards onto the floor, fracturing his hip. The injured employee was taken to the hospital and admitted overnight for treatment.
An employee was reversing a pallet jack when his hand was caught between the jack and a rack, partially amputating his right pinky finger.
An employee was distributing milk bottles to calves when his right foot was caught between a walking deck and the suspension wheel of a trailer.
While delivering mail on a walking route, an employee felt ill, vomited, and collapsed due to possible heat-related illness.
An employee was injured when his left leg got caught between the truss press and the table.  The employee sustained a left leg amputation from the knee down.

An employee crushed his left ring and middle fingers while flipping material that was going to be machined into a holding plate fixture.  The 280 pound material was on a sling using a basket configuration in which the sling had two holes attached to the 5-ton crane. His fingers were crushed between the material and the work table resulting in the amputation of the fingertip of the ring finger above the knuckle.
On or about 6/21/2016, at 1:30 a.m., an employee was inspecting a facility when he stepped into a fountain and twisted his right ankle, fracturing it.

On May 4, 2015, an employee was cleaning the strapper on the bailer unit.  The employee suffered a fracture and partial amputation of the right index finger after his finger was pulled into the pinch point between the two pinch wheels of the machine.
An employee was  hospitalized after a blade cut four right-hand fingers.
A Baker Boy Bake Shop, Inc., employee was hospitalized after receiving burns from hot water measuring approximately 180F while cleaning a conveyor oven.
An employee was trying to line up two pin holes when the pipes came together and amputated the first two left-hand fingertips.
An employee was stepping out of the elevator when her foot was caught on the 1/2-inch rise from the elevator floor to the work floor. She tripped and fractured her left wrist, requiring surgery.
An employee was replacing a flat tire on a flat-bed trailer when the jack supporting the trailer slipped. The trailer's fender came down on his left thumb-tip.
An employee was replacing a splicer case on a telephone strand while working  from a ladder. The employee then fell approximately 15 feet while descending, breaking the left ankle.
An employee was working at her desk when she got up and tripped over her sneaker. She then hit her head on a nurse's station and broke her wrist on the floor. She was hospitalized.
An employee was walking in the cafeteria and tripped and fell injuring their head, neck and hip.
An employee's left arm was injured when he attempted to stop a rolling 15-gallon beer keg.
An employee was installing acoustic panels while standing on a Perry scaffold system. The system became unstable and the employee fell breaking the left leg.

The employee reached around with her right hand to clean the front of the meat slicer and did not realize the slicer was on.  The tip of the employee's right index finger just below the fingernail was amputated. There was no bone loss.
An employee was relocating a tool cart.  While backing it down a ramp, he caught his finger between the cart and a steel column causing an open fracture to his right middle finger.
An employee was cleaning the dryer inlet duct from a ladder and fell, which resulted in a fractured right foot.

The first employee was using a backhoe to dig a 12" to 18" trench for the drill slurry, so the slurry water could be pumped away while concrete was being poured. The second employee instructed the first to pull forward so he could dig the pit for the pump head. The first employee put the backhoe in drive, but it lurched forward because it was still throttled up. The first employee tried to pull the shifter down into neutral, but it went all the way down into reverse. It backed up quickly, striking the second employee in the knee.
An employee tripped on an all purpose container (APC) netting and fell to the ground fracturing his elbow.
On or about April 8, 2016, an employee suffered a fingertip amputation when the left middle finger was caught between steel coils on a conveyor.
An I-beam rolled onto an employee's fingers, pinching and amputating the left middle and ring fingertips.
A worker was cutting flat meats with a band saw and amputated the tips of his left middle and index fingers.
After greasing equipment, an employee fell while descending metal stairs, breaking a shoulder and wrist.
While operating a divider, an employee's hand entered the guillotine, amputating the right-hand fingertip.

An employee was running the overhead crane to unload coil from a flatbed truck when his finger was caught between the board and the coil as he lifted the crane.  He lost 50 percent of the distal tip of his right index finger.
While standing in an aisle, an employee picking cases and loading them onto an electric pallet jack was struck by another electric pallet jack operated by another employee resulting in a broken leg.

An employee was hooking chains between a yard dog and a transport truck that was stuck in the parking lot. The yard dog driver exited the vehicle without parking it to help the injured employee unhook the vehicle. The yard dog rolled back and pinned the injured employee between the truck and yard dog, fracturing the employee's ankle and heel bone.
An electrician who was pulling cables and doing rough-in work in an electrical room became ill, possibly due to heat issues.
An employee fell 20 to 22 feet from a ladder while cutting a tie-wire, fracturing a rib and his L1 vertebra.

An employee was working from the ground prepping for setup at a home site when the homeowner attempted to pull a tarp, which was held down by bricks, off the roof. The bricks fell from the roof and struck the employee in the head, causing a concussion that required hospitalization.
An employee was moving racking material with a crane when he pinched his left third fingertip pad between the hook and rack. He sustained a fingertip amputation.
Employee had left foot caught between the steps in the escalator, resulting in a laceration to the foot.

An employee had just finished unloading a shipment of cardboard boxes.  The cardboard boxes were on pallets; the individual pallets and stacks of cardboard boxes were secured with banding straps.  The employee grabbed and pulled on a banding strap on one of the pallets to try and straighten the pallet by a few inches to align with the other pallets.  When the employee pulled on the banding strap, the strap broke and the employee fell to the floor.  The employee broke his left hip.  The employee was hospitalized for hip surgery.

On January 22, 2017, an employee was driving a skid steer in an outdoor yard area where bulk materials are staged. At approximately 8:40 p.m., he exited the skid steer cab as a coworker was backing up an agricultural tractor/trailer. The employee was then struck by the tractor/trailer unit, fracturing several bones in his right foot.
An employee was stung by a bee and experienced an allergic reaction.

An employee was standing on top of an excavation area flagging a trench box in when the ground gave way. The employee fell inside the trench, hitting the left side of his head and back, breaking four ribs, and bruising his head.
An employee was working on a press machine when he got caught in two nip points, degloving his right hand. The guard on the folder section was bypassed at the time of the incident.
An employee fractured his left ankle while working with a forklift.

An employee was transferring an erect package on an erect package cart.  The employee's thumb was underneath the package and when he pulled it out from under the package he sustained an amputation injury.

An employee was working in a winding station and applying tape to a cardboard core (on a rotating spindle). The employee's gloved hand made contact with the double sided tape pulling her arm into the spindle. The employee sustained multiple fractures to the arm and ribs resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was locking truck compartment doors in the parking lot when a coworker lowered an outrigger on his right foot, crushing it.

An employee was cutting foam with a disc saw when he contacted the blade, injuring his left middle fingertip. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated. The saw was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee fell from an drilling derrick while in the process of disassembling the unit.  The employee suffered injuries to the head, face and right leg as a result of the fall.

An employee was speaking to a coworker in a truck when he was struck by another coworker's reversing pickup truck. He was caught between the two vehicles and suffered soft tissue damage that required overnight hospitalization.

On January 28, 2015, an employee was using an 8-foot A-frame ladder to change out pipe fitting at the Hydro Cracker Unit.  The employee fell from the ladder while descending, breaking his lower right leg in the ankle area.  Employee was transported by ambulance to Pauls Valley, then transferred to the Norman Regional Hospital where he had surgery to set the bone.
An employee fell onto gravel and lacerated his head. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was struck in the head while removing a concrete form used to manufacture burial vaults. The form was being removed when a bar swung and hit the employee in the head, knocking him to the ground. The employee was standing on the floor at the time and was wearing a protective helmet. He was hospitalized after being knocked unconscious with a cut to the head.
An employee was lowering the scale box from a Lull when the scale box slid off the Lull and fell on the employee's lower right leg, breaking the employee's femur.
An employee was bitten by an insect while cleaning and the employee was allergic to the insect; the employee was taken to the hospital.

The employee was cleaning the windshield of a semi-truck with the hood of the truck open.  He finished cleaning the windshield and went to step down when his wedding ring caught on the hood.  The weight of the employee's body and the ring being caught on the hood caused the hood to cut the employee's finger.  The finger was later amputated at the hospital.

An employee observed a shoplifter with stolen merchandise and confronted the shoplifter as he entered his car. The shoplifter put the car in reverse with the door open and quickly backed out of the parking lot. The door struck the employee, injuring the employee's head and back.
An employee was pouring floor stripper in a bucket to dilute with water. While pouring, the chemical splashed into his left eye.
An employee was drilling a metal bracket onto a machine and was struck by the bracket, suffering an eye injury.

Employee was lowering trash from the edge of the flat roof he was working on. He fell 11 feet 8 inches when the soffit he was standing on collapsed. He broke ribs, shattered an elbow, and cracked his pelvis.
An employee was injured due to a fall from a 3-foot ladder.
While returning to the construction site from lunch, an employee slipped/tripped and fell onto the excavator blade lacerating the employee's right shin. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was walking down the hall, twisted her ankle, and fell.
An employee was walking to his truck when he slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell to the ground, breaking his right fibula in two places and dislocating his ankle.
The employee was putting paper products on a storage shelf and fell 2-3 feet from the step ladder fracturing a hip.
An employee received a laceration on his left hand and a skin avulsion on his right arm after being pulled into a conveyor in the coating department while performing maintenance.
An employee was cleaning an old fixture room. One of the fixtures was on the ground. The employee tripped over the fixture and sustained a fracture.

An employee was machining a bolt when his jacket got caught in the chuck of a horizontal lathe, which in turn pulled him into the rotating parts of the lathe. He injured his left hand and lacerated his head, requiring hospitalization.
While driving to a patient's house during a storm, an employee exited their car and was swept away by rushing creek water. The employee suffered hypothermia from the cold water.

Two employees were observing the transfer of solvent when an explosion occurred.  As a result of the explosion, solvent from the truck was released onto the employees. One of the employees also suffered a ruptured eardrum.
An employee was winding up a 42 inch wide belt and got his foot caught between the belt guide on the conveyor and the belt. The employee's right leg was broken just above the ankle.
A mail carrier fell and struck his head on the ground while delivering mail on his route. He was later diagnosed with bleeding in the brain.

An employee was manually moving the belt and gears of a high pressure pump. The pump was locked out and tagged out at the time. The employee's right pinky finger got caught in the belt. When the employee pulled his finger out, he lost his fingertip barely down to the bone.

An employee suffered a partial amputation of the left middle finger while connecting a tow bar to a forklift's attachment. The employee's finger got pinched between the tow bar and the pintle hook on the attachment.
On December 7, 2016, an employee fell to the floor while handling mail and suffered a fractured hip, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was repairing a meter run and began to experience cramping. The employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.

An employee was delivering products from a trailer when he became pinned between a pallet jack and product rack while moving the rack inside the trailer. He suffered a concussion and injured his lower hip and leg.
An employee was trying to pop a load bearing out. He put both fingers into the area of the locking pin and then it came down and amputated the distal aspect of the right index and little fingers.
An employee was loading boats onto trailers. The employee was moving a large boat and his left hand was caught between two boats resulting in the amputation of the index and middle fingertips.
A maintenance employee who was clearing snow fell while walking across the driveway.  The employee struck his/her head, requiring an in-patient hospitalization.
While cleaning the plunge plate of a pole using a foot pedal, an employee's left foot fractured after getting caught  between the pole and the ladder.
On or about August 9, 2016, an employee driving an electric pallet jack was struck by a coworker driving an electric sit-down forklift, suffering a broken ankle.

An employee was climbing on a baker's scaffold to reach a working platform when the scaffold turned over on top him. He fell approximately 6 to 8 feet to the ground, puncturing his lung and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was descending an extension ladder at a construction site when he fell approximately 15 feet to the ground below, suffering fractures and lacerations.
While delivering packages, an employee began to feel ill and experienced cramping throughout his body. He was hospitalized for dehydration.

An employee was delivering food product to a restaurant location.  The employee was going down the truck ramp, misstepped near the bottom and fell dislocating his right ankle and breaking his lower right leg. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.
An employee was walking in the parking lot, slipped on ice and fell breaking the right tibia and fibula.
An employee's leg was pinned between two 1200lb rolls of newspaper.

While clearing a jam on a material grinder, an employee's fingers came into contact with the material grinder blades. The middle and ring fingers were amputated to the proximal joint. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.

On January 19, 2017, an employee was operating an overhead crane to raise an 1,800-pound load. During the ascent, the load began to swing and pinched the employee's left thumb between a stationary object and the load. The employee's thumb was amputated.
An employee was hospitalized for heat related illness during the shift on Friday, August 26, 2016.

An employee was felling a declining ash tree. When the tree came over, it became hung up on a smaller oak tree, lifting the butt of the ash tree in the air. The butt of the tree then came down on the employee who sustained a broken right fibula.
An employee was using a spin blaster on the inside of a pipe when his hand got caught in the sprocket and chain, amputating his left-hand ring finger.

An employee was vacuuming mud at the bottom of a hill when the mud vacuum trailer rolled down the hill and hit him, pinning him next to a drilling unit. He suffered ankle, arm, and jaw injuries that required surgery.
An employee's right heel was caught in an auger while installing a choke ring on a press in the processing room. The auger caused lacerations/a fracture to his right heel.

An employee was changing over the assembly station. After she changed out the pop-up plate, she restarted the machine. The machine failed to cycle properly and a piece became stuck. The employee's hand then became caught in the cycling device. She sustained several right-hand fractures and a severe laceration by her right thumb.
An employee suffered lacerations to his head when it was caught in an elevator gate.
An employee was installing a joist when he fell down, breaking his shoulder and injuring his head. He was hospitalized.

An employee was cleaning the equipment and floors in an area when an ammonia release occurred. The employee was exposed to the ammonia and suffered second degree burns to her right leg, requiring hospitalization.

While operating a hoist, the grab device slipped allowing the metal sheets to slip and pinch the employee's left middle fingertip. The employee was taken to the hospital and the crushed tip of the finger had to be surgically removed.
An employee slipped and fell from a flatbed trailer, suffering a broken hip.

Two employees were moving a pallet with a manual pallet jack when a piece of the wooden pallet broke. While one of the employee's reached down to grab the piece of wood, the other employee lowered the pallet catching the injured employee's left middle finger. The left middle fingertip was amputated and surgically reattached.
An employee was removing some debris from a conveyor belt when another worker cycled the machine, causing the employee's right index finger to be crushed and partially amputated between two pallets.
A crew member became nauseous, was throwing up and had cramping in the hand and wrist. This incident occurred while working on a barge. The barge was not docked at the port.

Around 11 p.m. on January 20, 2015, an employee was attempting to load a trailer of frozen products. He went to roll up the dock door and the spring came loose, causing the door to come down on his left leg. He suffered a fracture to his left fibula and tibia and was sent to Memorial Hospital of York. At 8:30 a.m. he was evaluated for inpatient rehabilitation.
An employee amputated his thumb while sharpening a meat slicer. Guards were not in place at the time of the incident.
The injured employee was assisting another employee by holding metal wire. The second employee caught the injured employee's left thumb in the clamp gun resulting in amputation of the left thumb.
An employee was cleaning a jam in the cryo-vac machine and caught the left index fingertip on the propeller resulting in a fingertip amputation.
On March 4, 2015, an employee spreading ice melt slipped on ice and fractured his right ankle.
On 9/27/2016, at approximately 3:44 p.m., an employee was performing foundation concrete forming work when he was struck by lightning and suffered burns, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was measuring metal and lost his grip on the measuring tool. When he reached for it, his gloves were caught in the guide rollers resulting in the amputation of two fingers at the first joint.
An employee was using a ladder to clean the fascia at a residential home when he fell to the surface below, suffering a broken right arm and a head injury. He was hospitalized.

A temporary employee was running normal production operations on a stamping press. The employee hand-fed extruded aluminum pieces into the point-of-operation with actuation controlled by two-hand controls located at shoulder height. The employee cycled the press, and once the cycle completed he removed the punched part. Subsequently, he put new blank into the point-of-operation and at that time, without manual actuation, the ram drifted from its top-stop and came down while both of his hands were in the point-of-operation. Both hands were crushed by the ram.
An employee was operating a punch press to punch holes in an aluminum door frame when his left middle finger was caught in a ram, amputating his fingertip. The ram was unguarded at the time.

An employee was disconnecting chlorine gas system tubing to attach a chlorine cylinder to the water treatment system when a small amount of chlorine gas escaped. The employee was taken to the hospital and admitted.

An employee was descending a stairway while carrying two cardboard boxes in her left hand. She missed the last step above a middle landing and fell onto the landing. Both of her feet were bent backwards, fracturing both ankles and requiring surgery.
An employee was hospitalized when a pneumatic nail gun exploded causing fragments to be embedded in the right thigh and lacerating the right arm.
While bending to lift a product out of a box, an employee suffered a back injury.
An employee was struck by a forklift while unloading material.

Four employees were injured while attempting to set trusses on a barn. The trusses collapsed and the employees fell. Two of the employees were hospitalized. The first suffered a chipped shoulder bone and lacerations to his head. The second suffered compression fractures to three vertebrae.

An employee was filing quality documentation records in file boxes stored on metal shelves, which are about 10 feet high. She was later found unconscious on the concrete floor to the side of the metal shelving unit, which had fallen on the floor. She was hospitalized with a head injury and fractured skull.
An employee was attempting to attach his fall rope to the anchor on the roof.  He slipped and fell resulting in cracked vertebrae.

An employee was using a tugger machine to pull wire through a conduit when the machine mounts broke free, causing the employee to fall backward and strike the metal racking. The employee suffered a hand laceration and cracked ribs, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was assembling the printer pinion gear at his work bench when his right pinky finger was pinched between the bearing housing and the housing of the gear box resulting in the amputation of his right pinky fingertip without bone loss.
An employee was operating a forklift to move materials on a 16-foot high storage rack system. The materials, which weighed approximately 300 pounds, fell on the employee.

The employee was supervising the outbound dock. A PIT operator passed by her towing two over the road (OTR) containers. As the PIT passed, the door of one of the OTRs came open and hit another OTR that was staged near where the employee was standing. That OTR struck the employee causing her to fall to the floor and fracture her hip.

Employee was moving a pallet of materials off a shelf with a forklift. He hit the support for the shelf above while moving the pallet. The pallet of compact disks on that shelf fell, striking the employee. The employee suffered fractured vertebrae and ankle injuries.
While cleaning, an employee fell approximately 8 feet through an open hole in the floor, suffering a broken hip.
An employee was pushing a cart down the hallway, tripped, and fell fracturing her right leg.
An employee was using a wire-pulling jack when the employee's left hand was caught in the piston jack and wire, breaking the pointer and middle fingers.

On 4/3/2015 at 9:45 a.m., an employee was placing cardboard in the cardboard bailer. The employee closed the gate on his hand, amputating his left middle finger at the first knuckle.  He was hospitalized.
An employee was struck by an air hammer chisel, breaking a bone in his right foot.

As an employee was dismounting a forklift, a coworker approached with a motorized pallet jack. The coworker did not stop in time and struck the employee on the right leg. The employee was hospitalized for a broken bone above the right ankle.
An employee slipped and fell from an extension ladder while installing gutters, breaking the pelvis/hip.
An employee was working in Aisle 13 on a walkie rider. While backing out of the aisle he ran into another employee's cherry picker in Aisle 14. The employee broke his ankle.

Four employees were burned by hot plastic while working in the vicinity of a plastic extruding machine. One employee required hospitalization. The employees were purging an extruder machine and cleaning the die when they were sprayed with hot, melted PVC material. The hospitalized employee suffered first and second degree burns to the face and neck.
Employee slipped and fell in the parking lot suffering a broken leg.
An employee was using a horizontal milling machine to cut a cap for an engine when the employee's right hand was amputated.
On December 3, 2016, an employee was removing metal brackets from a semi truck trailer when a bracket struck the employee in the eye, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was lifting a forklift attachment and smashed this thumb between the swivel hook and the forklift attachment resulting in the amputation of his right thumb tip.

An employee on a ladder was caulking underneath eaves when the ladder slipped and the employee fell. The employee was approximately 12 to 14 feet from the lower level at the time.  The employee was hospitalized with a partially collapsed lung and fractured wrist.
An employee who became dizzy was hospitalized and treated for heat-related illness.

On July 20, 2015, an employee was climbing a fiberglass ladder to access a transformer when he was attacked by hornets.  While trying to quickly get off the ladder, he fell and broke his right arm and damaged his spleen.
An employee suffered the amputation of the left thumb when his glove got caught in the drill press he was operating.
An employee was operating a standup powered industrial truck (PIT) and struck another PIT. His left foot was caught between the two PITs and fractured requiring surgery.

Two employees were at the paint storage room replacing a container pan underneath a paint pail. One employee passed out; later, the second employee passed out.  Both employees were hospitalized. The levels of CO in the paint room were elevated at the time of the incident.
An employee was adjusting the chute on the T-Belt going to the FB4K hopper resulting in a fingertip amputation.
On June 23, 2016, an employee was found unconscious on the ground and was hospitalized with a knee injury.

Employees were near a hydraulic power unit that was slipping off a forklift. As the employees attempted to get out of the way, they tripped over other equipment and fell. One employee sustained a knee injury. The second employee sustained a head laceration.
An employee was conducting maintenance on a cylinder when the weld broke on an attachment plate used to lift a steel beam. The beam came down on and broke the employee's left forearm.
An employee was grinding a point on a steel wedge when the grinder pulled the employee's left thumb in and amputated the tip.

An employee changing filters on a filter system connected to a grinding unit dropped one of the filters into the filter unit. The impact inside the unit created a spark that ignited the aluminum dust, causing an aluminum dust deflagration. A fire ball discharged from the filter unit, contacting and causing second degree burns to the employee's hands.

An employee was operating a powered industrial truck when the right front tire hit a pot hole, causing the truck to tilt over. The protective cage fell on and injured the employee, who required hospitalization.
An employee was cleaning the area around a shaft at the end of a conveyor. An arm was caught by the shaft and fractured. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee suffered chemical burns to the arms, back, chest and legs when LBX-106 splashed onto the employee as the employee was preparing to mix products.
An employee was cleaning a machine when his sweatshirt was caught and wrapped around the roller bar, causing him to lose circulation in his right arm and wrist.

An employee attempted to move an electric pallet jack from the battery room. As he turned the pallet jack, his left thumb was caught between the pallet jack handle and a metal concrete pillar. He suffered a compound fracture his left hand, requiring surgery.

An employee and crew were attempting to install an I-beam support upright between two horizontal running I-beam supports in an existing structure. The crew carried the support and fit it in place. The injured employee tapped the bottom of the support with a hammer to make it fit. The bottom of the beam fell off and landed on the employee's right foot, breaking the fifth toe.

An employee was descending a ladder after installing communication cables at a communication pole when the ladder moved. He dismounted the ladder approximately 10 feet from the ground and landed on his feet, shattering his right heel and breaking his left ankle.
Employee slipped on ice and fell while crossing the street. Employee broke two ribs and punctured a lung.

An employee was loading a pallet into a pick up truck using a forklift. The employee placed the pallet onto the tailgate of the pick up truck, then got off the forklift and proceeded to push the pallet into the pick up. The forklift moved forward slowly and a fork struck the employee in the arm and pinned his arm. The employee suffered two cracked ribs and a fractured forearm.
An employee removed the guard on a conveyor to perform maintenance. His hand was caught in the chain and sprocket and the left ring fingertip was amputated.
An employee was injured by the blender lid-locking mechanism located in the bonding area. The employee fractured three right-hand fingers, requiring overnight hospitalization.

An employee was tracing a water pipe through a large warehouse with coworkers and climbed on top of an indoor office area to trace the line. The employee then fell through the roof/ceiling of the office, breaking an arm and suffering possible internal injuries.
An employee was speaking to a line mechanic about a film change on the bagger machine and suffered left-hand fingertip amputations.

An employee was in the process of setting up an RMC machine that takes mozzarella cheese and forms it into a block. The employee was installing a plastic wedge (approx. 2 ft. x 2 ft. x 1 in. thick, weighing approx. 25 lbs.) into the machine and amputated the right index fingertip.
While taking measurements, an employee was struck on the head by an elevator bracket, suffering a concussion.
An employee was injured by a customer's automobile when the car jumped the curb and pinned the employee against the Red Box movie kiosk on the convenience store's sidewalk.

On December 12, 2016, at approximately 11:10 a.m., an employee was using a hand-operated pallet mover to retrieve a pallet from the bulk storage area. As she moved the machine backwards, her hand was caught between a steel upright and the handle of the machine, fracturing her right hand and right ring finger.
An employee was cleaning their hands with a shop rag and got a steel splinter in their hand. The splinter required surgery.

An employee was attempting to move a log. He was riding on a box (5' long x 3' high x 4' wide) and the box changed directions, causing him to fall. His right foot slipped and was caught between the railing and the guide roller. His foot was crushed and lacerated between the fourth toe and pinky toes, and his big toe was dislocated.

An employee was removing a door from an upper shelf and carrying it down using a step ladder when he missed the last two steps and fell on his left leg/knee, possibly fracturing his kneecap and tearing ligaments. He was hospitalized.

An employee was calibrating the temperature for steam on a kettle. His coworker did not know he was calibrating the kettle and poured the hot water out of the kettle, splashing the employee's leg and causing second degree burns that required hospitalization.

The forklift operator got his hand caught between the top roll bar of the forklift and a piece of framing that was protecting a hydraulic fluid line resulting in a laceration to the top of the left hand, a broken ring finger, a crushed little finger and hospitalization.
An employee suffered an amputation while operating a sheer press.
An employee amputated part of his finger while operating an envelope-printing machine.

The employee was standing on a catwalk and using a cord tied to his hands to remove an empty film roll from a machine. The cord got caught in a roller beneath the catwalk and amputated the employee's left ring and index fingers.

A maintenance employee was trying to unplug the transfer line between the mixer and the packer.  The machine was not locked-out. The employee reached a hand in and it amputated the index and middle finge tips on the right hand.
A nail from a pneumatic nail gun struck an employee's eye.  The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.  The incident occurred on 7/15/2015 at approximately 10:30 am.
While adjusting a patient in bed, an employee experienced abdominal pain due to a hernia, requiring surgery and hospitalization.

An employee working South of Delta cooling tower was removing a 380 lb. stuffing box from packaging using a grove crane. The crane was not involved. As the employee was moving the stuffing box on the skid he pinched his left pinky between the box and the shipping crate amputating his left pinky tip.
An employee was making adjustments to a vise on a cold saw machine when the vise clamped down on the employee's left hand, fracturing two fingers and partially amputating the index finger.
An employee was pushing a pallet into a pallet dismantling machine. The blade caught the pallet and pushed it back into the employee's left side causing internal injuries.

While climbing down a military vehicle (MMPV) access ladder, the employee's wedding ring on his left hand got caught on one of the anti-slip barbs on the step.  When he dismounted the last step, the flesh was pulled from his ring finger, resulting in its ultimate amputation.
On April 1, 2015, the employee was participating in a training session at Las Cruces, New Mexico. At approximately 7:15 p.m., the employee exhibited signs of heat exhaustion and was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after falling off a truck and hitting their head.

An employee was laying on an inclined catwalk 30 feet above the ground to observe repair work on a beltline conveyor system below. As he positioned himself to stand up, he fell through the mid-rail and toe board of the catwalk, hitting the belt and the ground. He suffered three fractures to the right arm, multiple fractures to the right ribs, bruised lungs, and a bruised right kidney.
An employee was in the maintenance shop picking up parts when he lost consciousness; he was found on the floor by a coworker.
An employee was framing wooden walls.  A gust of wind blew a wall over and knocked the employee to the ground. The employee sustained a shoulder injury and a cut above his eye.
An employee was replacing the rubber skirt between the mixer and the cooler when the cooler grabbed the skirt and pulled the employee into it. His left hand was amputated.
An employee was loading the smoke house when a tree fell, injuring his right lower leg, foot, and ankle. The switch was not set at the time.
An employee experienced lower back pain from lifting a heavy pail.
On 11/6/2015, an employee lifting coils on dies with a crane overexerted their back. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee tripped over a linen cord, breaking both wrists and fracturing her knee. She was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was unloading a steel plate from a trailer at the dock when the steel plate fell from the forklift forks onto his right foot, breaking three bones.

An employee was washing out the RS2 screw. While the employee's hand was in the RS2 screw, another employee activated/enabled the A station via the computer, causing the RS2 screw to turn. This action lacerated the employee's palm, severing the tendons. The RS2 screw was not locked out at the time of the accident.

An employee was getting out of his semi-truck after parking in the terminal yard. The ground location where the employee parked was an uneven surface. As he stepped out of the truck, he heard a snap in his leg. He was hospitalized for knee surgery.
An employee was responding to an emergency alarm, got up from the desk and tripped over computer cords falling to the floor and breaking her left hip.

An employee injured his finger with a battery power drill while dismantling scaffolding.  The employee's glove got caught in the drill and twisted. The injury required a partial amputation of the tip of his right ring finger.
An employee cut his right pinky fingertip while using a vegetable slicer.

An employee had his hand on a spring he was building for a garage door. He pushed the lever to lock the clamp in its place, and his hand got caught under the clamp. He pulled his hand away, amputating his left thumb tip in the process. He was hospitalized and had thumb surgery.

An employee's right index finger was caught and injured while installing a battery into a fork truck. The employee was utilizing a "hoist" to lower the battery and bumped the control lowering the battery too fast and pinching his finger.

An employee had the tips of his ring and middle fingers amputated above the fingernail during an outlet valve installation.  The outlet valve moved suddenly during the installation, causing the injury.
Employee received an embedded tack in her thigh when walking by a pintacker. Employee had the micro pin tack surgically removed from her thigh and was admitted to the hospital overnight.

On 4-23-16, at 11:45 a.m., an employee was attempting to move materials out of the way on the bag line machine when his right index finger was caught between the chain and pulley, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was working on a stepladder and fell fracturing the right hip.
An employee was felling a tree when an adjacent tree fell on him, cracking several vertebrae and his right ankle.
The injured employee was stepping off of the bus. When he stepped down, he slipped and fell off of the bus step.

An employee was removing totes from the top rack of a warehouse with an industrial lift when he fell from the lift platform to the concrete floor below, fracturing his skull. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was climbing a 6' stationary ladder in order to unjam a line. He was approximately 6' high when he reached for and missed the handrail. He then lost his balance and fell backwards to the floor, hitting his arm on a conveyer and landing on his backside and knee. He complained of a sore arm and was hospitalized for surgery to the injured arm.

An employee was inspecting a load of incoming scrap material. While trying to close the grain chute door of truck, the employee's fingertip was caught by the door. The employee suffered a right index finger amputation.

An employee was operating a horizontal bender machine to bend rebar. While he was adjusting the rebar for the second bend, his foot contacted the footswitch and activated the machine, which then crushed/amputated his right index finger.
An employee slipped and fell on the ice resulting in a broken ankle.
An employee was cutting a piece of metal on an ironworker machine when his right index finger contacted the underside of the metal piece, amputating the skin from the bottom of his finger.

An employee lost control of a powered industrial vehicle and attempted to dismount the vehicle as it made contact with a stationary object. The employee's leg broke when it was caught between the vehicle and the object.
An employee was struck in the abdomen by a tree branch while trimming a tree.
An employee's right index finger was amputated while operating a trim press machine.
An employee suffered a finger amputation during machine maintenance.

At 4:15 p.m. on 7/18, an employee was cleaning a hot polymer glue press-pot using a scraper. The scraper broke, which caused both hands and her left forearm to come into contact with the hot glue. She sustained second degree burns to the palms and fingers of both hands and to the left forearm.
An employee was removing residual meat from the paddles of a grinding machine when the machine cycled and broke his right hand. The machine was on at the time of the incident.

An employee was selecting cases in the freezer area while driving a long jack. As he stepped off the long jack, he was still holding the accelerator and pinned himself between a rack and the long jack resulting in fractured ribs and a laceration to the lungs.
An employee was working at a meshing machine when his right finger was caught in the chain, causing a de-gloving amputation.

Employees were installing grating that consisted of 4 sheets (approximately 4 feet by 5 feet), cumulatively weighing approximately 800 pounds. When the employees disconnected the load from the crane, they realized the corner of the grating rested on the edge of an existing guard rail toe plate. The injured employee attempted to lift the grating upwards while his coworker used a spud wrench to shift the grating off the toe plate. The grating shifted and caught the injured employee's left index finger between the grating and structural steel. He suffered an avulsion to his left index finger flesh beneath his fingertip, which was crushed and cut. He required surgery and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee's ring finger became caught and was smashed in a pinch point while adjusting forklift tines.
An employee tripped, fell, and fractured her hip, requiring surgery.

On Wednesday, December 21, 2016, at approximately 2:30 PM, an employee was operating tube-straightening process equipment when a tube stopped in the process. He placed his left hand on the tube. As he did, the tube began rotating again. The motion caught the employee's left forearm, fracturing it and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was holding a piece of metal in his hand and sanding the metal on a belt sander. The belt sander grabbed the piece of metal and pulled the employee's right hand in. His right thumb contacted the belt sander and was amputated.
An employee was cutting a block of cheese and the knife slipped and punctured the employee's abdomen.

On November 2, 2016, an employee was pushing a rolling stack of 1" trusses toward center stage from upstage when one of the stage boards (which was on ice) shifted, creating a spot for a wheel to become stuck. The trusses began to fall over and the employee tried to stop them. When he did, the trusses struck him in the face and broke his jaw.
On 10/28/15 at 1:40PM, an employee was walking down a hallway and slipped and fell fracturing her right kneecap. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was struck on the top of the head by a piece of debris.
An employee was climbing a ladder after a rain storm to set a 2 X 6 on the roof.  The employee slipped and fell about 15 feet to the ground, fracturing his vertebrae and injuring his head.
An employee suffered an amputation to his left index finger when it was crushed by a chain sprocket on a conveyor belt grain thrower. The chain sprocket was unguarded at the time.
An employee was checking on some kids who were on the property up on the hill. When he was coming down the hill, he slipped and twisted his ankle.  He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was working outside on a very hot day, helping another employee pull 4-inch coiled plastic pipe off a trailer when he started feeling sick, vomiting, and experiencing muscle cramps. He was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was operating a hopper when his right index fingertip was pinched  between the hopper and the frame and amputated.

An employee was collecting shopping carts in the company's parking lot. While crossing the street to retrieve a cart, the employee was struck by a vehicle and suffered a right leg fracture, torn ACL, broken teeth and three fractured vertebrae.
An employee was feeding stock into an alligator shear when the shear amputated the employee's middle finger.
On January 4, 2016, an employee slipped on a piece of ice in the parking lot and broke the right tibia. The employee had surgery.
An employee was cutting metal with a miter saw when the saw jammed and shot the metal backwards into the employee's hand, cutting a right thumb tendon.
An employee was pulling a ground power unit to attach it to a truck when a coworker pushed the unit, which caught and amputated the employee's left ring finger.
An employee blacked out and fell down the stairs, breaking the right arm.
At 5:45 AM on 3/3/16, an employee was walking into work from her car when she slipped on ice in the driveway and fell, fracturing her right ankle and knee.

An employee tripped over a box of oranges in the walk-in refrigerator. She hit her head against the door, scraped both forearms, and fell to the floor on both knees, fracturing one kneecap. She was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was removing the exit guard on the bar peeler machine.  The top hinge of the guard fell and caught the tip of the employee's finger between the guard and the machine.  The tip of the employee's right index finger was amputated.  The employee was not hospitalized.
While walking into the post office, an employee slipped and fell on ice, fracturing her tibia.

The freight elevator door was left open, which causes a buzzing sound (alarm). The employee walked over and attempted to close the door to stop the alarm. As she pulled the metal door down, the door caught and amputated her left index fingertip.

An employee was ascending a scaffold ladder when his foot got caught in a rung and he fell backwards. A co-worker came to his aid and freed him. While descending the remaining scaffold he slipped and fell approximately four feet to the pavement. The employee was hospitalized for a head injury.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after receiving a laceration from a concrete saw.
An employee was cutting grass and started complaining of chest pain and shortness of breath. The employee was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was de-burring a piece of flat steel on the abrasive disc sander when his hand was pulled in behind the tool rest, trapping his left thumb between the piece of steel and the abrasive disc. The top of his left thumb was sanded down to the bone.
An employee's back was injured while lifting a waste basket, requiring hospitalization.

While moving a dumpster form underneath the garbage chute to empty it, the employee's left arm was caught between the dumpster and the wall, breaking it. The fracture required hospitalization and surgery to repair.
An employee's left-hand middle finger was amputated from the fingernail down.

On January 18, 2016, an employee's finger got caught in the cross auger (screw type auger) while clearing a product jam. The employee initially received an avulsion injury to the right ring finger. The finger was later surgically amputated.

On 3/30/16, at approximately 10:00pm, an employee crushed his left hand index and middle fingers between the dies of a hydraulic brake press while forming a metal part.  The tip of his index finger was medically amputated.
An employee was performing maintenance and changing the belt on a chip transport pump when his left index finger was caught between the belt and pulley, amputating his fingertip below the fingernail.
An employee was exiting an excavator.  The employee's foot got caught on the exit ladder on the excavator, causing the employee to fall backwards onto the ground resulting in a broken right hip.
An employee was attempting to open a gas cover/cap when a flash fire occurred and burned the employee's face.
An employee was clearing plastic from a packaging machine when his left index and middle fingers contacted the machine and were injured. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was polishing a tool on a polishing lathe when a finger slipped inward resulting in a right index finger injury. The finger was amputated below the first knuckle at the hospital.

A forklift operator was driving the lift back to the dock area when he struck the injured employee. The front side of the forklift hit the employee, then the right front tire ran over his foot.  He was hospitalized, where his foot up to his calf (left leg) was amputated.

Two employees were manually lifting a power cooling fan (approximately 60 pounds) off a stack of units on a pallet. While lowering a unit on a cart, the injured employee lost grip, or the unit shifted, and the employee suffered a left wrist laceration requiring surgery.

An employee was cutting pork on a band saw when the pork bone caught the blade and began to spin, causing the employee's left ring finger to strike the saw. He suffered a tendon laceration and was hospitalized for surgery.
On February 9, 2016, at approximately 10:30 PM, an employee was pressure-washing the inside of a scrubber unit and felt a pain in his back. He was hospitalized overnight with a strained back.

On Saturday, August 13, 2016, around 4:15 p.m., an employee was attempting to clean the push arm of a conveyor when a positioning device activated and caught the employee's right middle finger, amputating approximately 1 centimeter.
An employee was found unresponsive after being missing for approximately one hour. The employee was potentially exposed to struck by hazards while performing lay down hand duties.
An employee was flipping the mold tool on a press to strip parts when the press ram came down and crushed his left thumb.
An employee was loading a tire rim into a truck when the tire rim slipped and pinched his left pinky finger between the rim and a grease gun, fracturing his fingertip and requiring surgery.
An employee was cutting paper with a large paper cutter when her left thumb entered the cutting area. The paper cutter then amputated the tip of her left thumb.
An employee's hand was crushed while operating a dough machine.
An employee fell to the ground while exiting a rental truck after missing the second step. During the fall, he struck his head on the truck and/or parking lot, suffering lacerations.
An employee was working with the reclaimer. The valve released pressure crushing the employee's hand and amputating three fingers.
An employee was unloading paper products from a cargo ship. The employee's finger was crushed between two rolls of paper resulting in an amputation injury.
An accident occurred on or around January 26, 2015, when an employee was working on a MAC valve and was exposed to fly ash.
An employee was performing maintenance on a press when the press door closed on his finger, amputating the fingertip between the nailbed and first knuckle.
An employee was parking an electric cart. When she stepped on the brake, the vehicle accelerated and collided with the side of the building, breaking her leg.
An employee had his right thumb amputated above the first knuckle while using an alligator shear to cut aluminum pieces.
An employee was obtaining supplies from a closet and slipped and fell.

An employee was using 2-inch, clear packaging tape to secure boxes on a pallet. He inhaled a small piece of the tape while cutting it by mouth, and the tape adhered to a portion of his mid-to-upper throat. He was admitted to the hospital and underwent treatment.

An employee was operating a stack truck to move a pallet of materials from the racks. When he backed up the truck to reposition it, his arm became jammed between the truck and a pallet of materials on the racking behind him. His arm broke.

An employee was walking with a client along a public sidewalk. While she was trying to support the client, she tripped over an uneven surface and sustained injuries to her abdomen, ankle and lower back. She was hospitalized.
At the company location, an employee was struck in the head by a board that got caught in the powered rolls and shot out of a wood grinder.
An employee was mowing grass on a hillside when the lawn mower tipped over and rolled over him. He sustained a back laceration and internal bleeding.

An employee was attempting to re-thread a broken sheet through a roll on an extruder when he fell backward. His left hand hit the bottom pull roll, which pulled his left arm into the machine, crushing it and requiring surgery.

An employee was seriously injured and hospitalized when a large die fell from a crane and struck the employee after the lift cable broke. The employee was hospitalized with a C5 fracture, compression trauma to T4, and a bulging L5 disc. The left great toe was also fractured.

On September 22, 2016, around 12:45 p.m., an employee had an angle grinder under his arm. The grinder was already switched to the "on" setting when he plugged it in, and it severely lacerated his arm. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was trying to clean an overhead vent/filter with a broom when the 4-pound filter fell out and hit her head. She suffered a head contusion and was hospitalized.

An employee was standing on the back of a highway van trailer, pulling on a pallet with a hook. The hook disconnected from the pallet, causing the employee to fall off the trailer and hit the ground.  He was hospitalized with broken ribs, a punctured lung, and a displaced ribcage.
An employee was heating a paint spray can with a heat gun when the can blew up, burning his hands, wrists, neck, and face.

An employee was operating a radial arm saw when a piece of wood became caught in the travel slot behind the saw blade. When the employee attempted to remove it, the blade lacerated his right index finger. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was treating a patient when the patient assaulted her. She was hospitalized with possible lower back and neck injuries.
An employee was removing sweet potatoes from the oven and received a burn on the right upper arm from spattering grease. The burn became infected and the employee was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was working on a tool pack that was de-energized when the top of the tool pack (weighing approximately 40 pounds) shifted and came down on his left middle finger, crushing and amputating it.

Around 1:00 p.m. on 11/18/16, an employee was leaving the repackaging station when she tripped over a metal piece of the rolling warehouse steel. She fell on her right hip and was unable to get up and walk, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was cleaning a set of pinch rollers.  The employee's right hand and arm were pulled through the rollers and crushed. The machine was not shut down and locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee lost their footing and fell in the jet way while boarding the aircraft. The employee scraped both elbows and knees and broke their right kneecap, requiring surgery.
An employee was operating a machine when his glove was caught between a roller and a belt, dislocating his right arm.

An employee got his right foot and ankle caught in a pallet that was then pulled into the roller on the palletizer. When the pallet was rolling forward it cut his right ankle into the bone. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was electrically shocked when installing a 3 way switch.

The employee was tracing the power source of the AC unit on the roof and went to the third floor to disconnect the power. He stepped on a plywood piece that came loose, and he and the plywood fell down to the lower level. The impact caused him to tumble from that level to the ground. He was hospitalized with a gash to his head, three fractured neck vertebrae, and left wrist and back trauma.
An employee was straightening lumber on the landing table to the trimmer when a board or a cant caught his left middle finger between another board amputating it at the middle knuckle.

An employee was cleaning out her desk in preparation for her department's relocation.  She kneeled on the corner of her desk to reach the bookshelf located above.  The corner where she was kneeling broke, and she hit her head on the corner of the desk. She was hospitalized with a head laceration and back injury.
While rotating a motor housing on an auxiliary oil pump, an employee's left ring finger was pinched in the bolt hole resulting in the loss of left ring fingertip.
An employee ruptured his right patellar tendon while he was playing basketball for a scene.
An employee's finger was partially amputated in the pinch point of a weave machine loom.
An employee was driving an off-road vehicle at a jobsite when the vehicle rolled, breaking the employee's leg. He was hospitalized.
Two employees were hospitalized due to a fire at the manufacturing facility. They suffered first and second degree burns on the neck, back, and hands.
An employee was cutting welding rod with a band saw when the rod ejected from the cutting surface and impaled the employee above the knee on the left leg.
An employee severed the left thumb tip off including the entire nail while operating a band saw to process pork roast into chops.
An employee was unloading bushes on a truck flatbed when he/she fell approximately 4 feet to the ground below. The employee was hospitalized and required vertebrae surgery.
An employee was cleaning an empty space at the job site when a recluse spider bit his lower left leg.
An employee spraying weed killer slipped and fell. The employee experienced back pain and was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was working on a plastic film extrusion line when her clothing became caught in the machinery. Her left arm was then pulled in between two rollers in the extrusion line, causing skin and tissue trauma. She was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was using the scanner, tripped over the scanner cord and fell fracturing a hip.

Employee was carrying a building truss with a forklift and placed a truss into a stored area. The employee reversed the forklift and walked up to the stored truss. The truss fell on the employee, causing facial injuries and fractured ribs.
A letter carrier was bitten by dog. The carrier fell and injured a wrist.
An employee fell to the frozen ground while getting on a steel frame to lay out decking.
An employee was pushing a rack when the rack fell over on his left ring finger, amputating the fingertip.
On or about December 1, 2015, an employee's right middle finger was crushed and fractured while setting up the "straight draw" press.
A rural letter carrier injured his knee while descending the steps at a residence. He was admitted to the hospital for surgery.
An employee felt sick while sitting in his crane and showed signs of heat illness. He was hospitalized for severe dehydration.
After operating a hydraulic excavator, an employee began to experience heart-attack-like symptoms. The employee was hospitalized overnight for dehydration possibly due to heat.
An employee was installing a fiberglass grating when he fell off a platform, injuring his head. His harness was not tied off at the time of the incident.
An employee fell off of a roof while cleaning a window and landed on a concrete wall. The employee was hospitalized with broken ribs.
An employee suffered a right ring finger amputation when the finger was caught between a large metal door on the back of a truck and a metal trash container.
An employee was searching for a tool under a maintenance work table. He suffered lower back pain when getting up off the lowered position with bent knees.
An employee was pinned between a roll-off and a large construction dumpster.
A maintenance employee was hospitalized due to exposure to outdoor heat.
An employee received severe lacerations and was hospitalized when his hand entered an injection mold machine.
On January 30, 2015, at approximately 8:30pm, three 70 inch diameter rolls, weighing 350-380 lbs. each, fell towards an employee and pinned him against a wall resulting in a fractured hip and foot.
A material handler employee's foot was run over by a large aluminum air craft container.
An employee was conducting site preparation using a mini excavator when the vehicle flipped over, causing him to break his hip.
An employee was walking the plant floor, slipped on a wet spot, and fell resulting in a compound fracture of the left forearm.
An employee was cleaning tables when she touched fish juice on a dish. She could not breathe and was hospitalized for a food allergy.
An employee was bitten while grooming a dog, resulting in a puncture wound on the hand.
A warehouse employee fell while climbing over a forklift guardrail and broke her knee.
On July 20, 2015, an employee tripped when the right foot got caught on a printer. The employee fell and fractured the right ankle, requiring surgery.
While replacing switch components on a high-voltage contactor, an employee was shocked and required hospitalization.

An employee was operating an extruding repalletizer. The line jammed and when he broke the line loose, his fingers were pulled into the machine resulting in the amputation of the left index and middle fingertips. The machine was energized at the time of the incident.
An employee was webbing up a press when his finger was caught in the press, amputating his fingertip.
On February 13, 2017, an employee was trying to adjust a stack of pallets in a trailer when the pallets shifted, causing the employee to fall and fracture the right elbow and right hip.

An employee was closing a gate. A forklift driver came to help the employee. The unattended forklift then went backwards and pinned the employee against a wire fence, fracturing the employee's pelvis.
An employee was riding around the sales lot in a golf cart and fell out of the golf cart suffering head trauma.

An employee was removing an attachment from a skid steer. He released the locking devices of the bucket and disconnected hydraulic hoses from the machine, but the bucket did not separate completely from the machine. The employee operated the machine and raised the bucket to check if debris was preventing it from disconnecting. When he came over to check the bucket, it dropped on and broke his left foot.
Employee fell on ice when walking across the parking lot.
On July 21, 2016, an employee was hospitalized for dehydration.
On March 12, 2015, an employee slipped on ice and fractured his arm while getting back into his truck at the company's distribution/storage facility.
An employee suffered right index, middle, and ring finger amputations while cleaning a dust collector.
An employee was polishing a spindle on a lathe using an emery cloth.  A keyway slot on the shaft caught his right index finger, resulting in an amputation of the finger. There was no bone loss.
An employee was working a shaft in a CNC machine when the shaft flew out of the machine and struck the employee in the face. He suffered a right cheek laceration and right eye injury.
An employee injured the right ankle while exiting a stall in the restroom.  The employee required surgery and hospitalization as a result.
An employee's finger got caught between a chain and the utility pole.

Employee was cutting chicken at his work station on the deboning line. The chicken slipped to the floor, and the employee reached to pick it up with knife still in hand. The employee punctured his eye with the knife while picking the chicken up toward himself and required hospitalization.
An employee sustained a thumb amputation when he attempted to unclog a rotary valve. The machine was not locked out at the time.
An employee suffered a hand laceration and broken finger when bolting in a blind with a combo and impact wrench.

An employee was delivering a truckload to a customer on 6/30/15.  He was shifting freight to the edge of the trailer for customer access by pulling a chain attached to the freight. At approximately 12:05 PM, the chain broke or became detached and the employee fell out of the back of the trailer approximately four feet to the ground. He was admitted to the hospital for in-patient care of three broken ribs and a bruised lung.
An employee slipped and fell at the Atlanta airport, under Concourse E, Apron level, at the international baggage line. The employee slipped on black dust and broke his hip as a result of the fall.
Employee working from a ladder on live electrical circuitry received an electrical shock during testing and service installation. The employee fell from the ladder.
An employee was sandblasting pipe at the Rice Energy Compressor Station. The sandblaster slipped out of employee's hands, hit the pipe and struck the employee's upper right arm.
An employee was struck by a rolling mill and suffered a broken leg.
An employee was walking out of the building, slipped on ice and fell. The employee sustained a head/neck injury and a concussion.

An employee was loading a steel standard on a flatbed truck when his right index finger was caught and crushed between the standard and the steel, requiring hospitalization. Gloves were worn at the time of the incident.

A utility line construction crew was in the process of replacing a wooden utility pole with a new metal utility pole and metal cross arm.  After the new metal pole and cross arm was installed the crew wrapped an insulated blanket around the pole above the cross arm.  Insulators were installed on the cross arm.  A crew member was in a lift bucket and was using metal quick ties to connect the power lines to the cross arm insulators.  The crew member tied one of the quick ties to an insulator and was preparing to tie one of the power lines to the insulator. The free end of the quick tie slipped out of the crew member's hand and curled underneath the insulated blanket contacting the power line.  The power line arced and burned the crew member's face.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion while delivering mail.
An employee was walking on a support beam four feet high, lost their footing and fell breaking the pelvis.
An employee suffered a severe allergic reaction while cleaning up a fire extinguisher discharge, requiring hospitalization.
The last digit of an employee's right-hand index finger was amputated.
An employee was drilling holes in steel pipes when his glove got caught in the drill, pulling his right hand into the rotating part. His right middle finger was surgically amputated.
An employee fell from a ladder and was hospitalized with a broken arm.

The injured employee was cleaning elevated processing equipment from a ladder stand platform. A second employee cleaning the floor surfaces unlocked the stand's wheels and moved the stand. The injured employee fell to the floor and fractured their C-4 vertebra.
A flagger at the project was struck by car on November 3, 2015. The employee sustained two broken arms, a broken wrist and a broken leg.

At 11:45 a.m., a piece of lumber kicked back while an employee was fitting board through a machine. Three pieces of the lumber got stuck in the employee's forearm, requiring overnight hospitalization.

An employee was troubleshooting a seized motor when the motor started and pulled the employee's thumb through the pulley. The employee suffered an amputation of the left thumb above the knuckle and bruising to the left middle and ring fingers.

While using a powered roller to form a piece of metal, the employee's glove caught on a piece of metal, pulling his hand into the roller. Employee suffered an amputation of the left-hand pointer finger up to the second knuckle and damage to the left-hand thumb, which was stitched back together.
An employee was servicing a restaurant machine and amputated the right index finger.
An employee was greasing the wheel lift on a tow truck when his hand slipped, causing the lift to fall and crush his left middle fingertip, which eventually had to be amputated.

Maintenance employee for Southwestern Plating was working inside a circuit breaker box that was not locked out. A flash fire occurred, burning the employee's arms (upper and lower), face, neck, and torso.  The employee was rushed to Memorial Hermann Hospital (Burn Unit) where he is currently hospitalized.
An employee sustained severe burns on his whole body when heated wax spilled out of a wax tank.
