An employee had four fingers on the left hand amputated when his left hand was caught in the rollers of the paper converting machine.
An employee was removing plastic from the sprocket of a machine when his right thumb was pulled in and amputated above the knuckle. The machine was running at the time of the incident.
Employee cut his hand while picking up a piece of metal and stepping on the pedal of the power press brake machine.
An employee was manually lifting a roll of fabric material with a metal pole. The employee placed the pole into its holder and pinched their left index finger resulting in a partial amputation.
While driving a stand-up forklift in the warehouse, an employee was crushed between the forklift and a pole, fracturing the left leg.
An employee was observing equipment being offloaded when a piece of wood bounced out and hit his thumb, amputating the tip.

On 3/11/2016, at 09:30, an employee was performing a property claim adjustment on a one-story residential home roof. As the employee was exiting the roof, she fell from a ladder to the deck below. She was hospitalized with three broken ribs on the right side.
An employee was tending to a machine when his right-hand index fingertip was amputated. The machine was running at the time of the incident.

An employee's right hand and upper arm got caught while loading clothing into a baling machine used to form 100-pound, shippable units of recycled articles of clothing. The machine got activated during the strapping process to secure the load at various points. His hand/arm were caught inside the machine for at least three hours, causing a laceration and fracture.
An employee was operating a boring bar when the drawstring on his hooded sweatshirt became caught on the spindle. The boring bar then fractured his arm, requiring hospitalization.
A maintenance employee was driving a cart when it ran off the loading dock. The employee was hospitalized with head injuries.

An employee was driving a loader during a concrete mixing process. While he was dumping the loader bucket on top of a bin, some frozen pieces would not go through the bin's grate. He climbed a ladder to retrieve the pieces. He then slipped off the bin and fell 10 feet to the ground, injuring his ankle.
An employee was cleaning a 4,000-pound mixer when his glove was caught in the machine, which then pulled in his hand and amputated his right middle and ring fingers.

An employee lifted a hatch door by hand and was attempting place the door over the hatch opening when it slipped from his hands and his right ring finger was pinched between the hatch door and the hatch opening.  The right ring finger was amputated.
Employee amputated the tip of his middle finger.
A truck driver fell as he was getting into or out of the driver's side of his truck.  The employee was hospitalized with numerous bodily injuries.
An employee was operating a high-reach forklift to move product when the employee's left thumb was caught and partially amputated between a section of racking and the forklift's support beam.
Two forklifts collided in a warehousing operation. One employee was injured by the fork of the other forklift truck.
An employee was operating a chop saw and amputated one or more fingers on the left hand.
An employee was loading a tank when his left index and middle fingers were smashed and fractured under the tank frame.

An employee was installing electrical cables near the ceiling at a manufacturing facility. The employee was operating a scissor lift at a height of approximately 26 feet. While pulling the cable, a portion of the cable end became entangled on the lift and the lift overturned. The employee suffered left leg injuries that required surgery.
The rail that kept beef intact was broken, causing a side of beef to fall on the floor. A worker went to help move the side of beef, which struck his ankle and injured him.

An employee dropped an Allen wrench into a molder machine. When he attempted to retrieve the tool, his hand was caught on one of the gears. His right hand was pulled between the gear and the machine, damaging his right thumb and his middle and index fingers. The machine was still running at the time of the incident.
An employee was pulling a hose to pour concrete on the third floor of an apartment building. The employee leaned against a temporary railing that was not secure and fell three stories to the ground.
An employee was operating a stand-up powered industrial truck when the throttle became stuck. The employee jumped from the powered industrial truck, falling and fracturing the hip.
An employee fell in the gravel parking lot and broke their right ankle.
An employee was lifting a box, slipped and fell breaking her leg.
An employee was guiding a pipe bundle. The pipe shifted during crane transport and pinched off the employee's fingertip.

The company had identified that an underground short was occurring on a 7,200-volt line. The company was attempting to locate the short using a DC charge unit known as a "Thumper." The Thumper would shoot a charge through the line, and the employees would use equipment to triangulate the approximate location of the short. During one of these tests, a charge was sent through the line, and an employee received a shock severe enough to require hospitalization.
An employee was turning a piece of bar stock on the CNC lathe when it malfunctioned and the bar stock struck the employee's right arm and shoulder causing severe lacerations.
An employee was measuring wind turbine blades on a scaffold when the scaffold hoist malfunctioned, causing the employee to fall approximately 140 feet to the ground and suffer severe body injuries.
An employee had his right hand index, middle, and ring fingers amputated when his glove got caught in the horizontal lathe he was using to polish a 7/8 inch pin with an emery cloth.
An employee was picking up a piece of equipment when a mechanism broke off and fell on the employee's lower right leg between the knee and foot.
An employee was replacing a suspension spring on a rig. He had to insert a pin in the spring as he let out the jack. His fingertip got caught.
An employee slipped on black ice while opening the lid of a dumpster. The employee's leg was caught beneath the dumpster, breaking the ankle.
An employee was  getting out of the shuttle van, slipped and fell fracturing the L1 vertebrae.
An employee was standing on or about the third rung of a ladder working on a light fixture and experienced electrical shock. The employee fell off the ladder landing on his head and shoulder.
An employee was operating the tie machine when it moved unexpectedly and caught the employee's left foot in between the brakes.

An employee was preparing to clean the drum of a mixer truck. To access the drum, the employee raised the hopper, located at the rear of the truck, and placed a brace underneath it. The hopper slipped from the brace and fell onto the employee's right index finger crushing it. The finger was surgically amputated between the first and second digit.

On February 10, 2017, at about 2:00 PM, an employee was making a beverage delivery with a hand cart loaded with cases. While descending the ramp, the cases started to fall and as he attempted to catch them, his right hand contacted the ramp and his right middle fingertip was lacerated, causing the loss of his finger nail. 

He was admitted the hospital for surgery.

An employee was performing water lancing operations on the U.S.S. Baton at BAE Shipyard in Norfolk, Virginia. The employee was struck by water pressure at the discharge end of the water lancing equipment, resulting in injuries to the right middle finger. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was struck by a garbage truck while on delivery route, requiring hospitalization for a serious leg injury.
While working in a straight boom lift that was 5 feet off the ground, an employee bounced out of the bucket. The employee's harness stopped the fall, but the employee suffered torso and rib injuries.
On October 26, 2016, an employee was hospitalized for smoke inhalation from a fire that ignited in the dust collection system.

An employee was injured when a hoist that he was using malfunctioned, causing the basket on the hoist to fall into a tank of hot water caustic solution. This caused waves of the solution to develop and spill over onto the employee, resulting in severe burns to the employee's legs and feet.
An employee was climbing the stairs leading into a customer's mobile home to deliver a mattress set. The employee tripped and fell, breaking the right hip.

On September 27, 2016, an employee was unhooking the safety chain from the hauling trailer when the truck driver started to pull ahead. The employee's right-hand middle finger was pinched and amputated between the safety chain and the trailer's hitch.
An employee fell approximately five feet from a shelf while retrieving a motor.  The employee fractured his right wrist and his right hip and was hospitalized.
An employee engaged in tree cutting and trimming with a chainsaw fell approximately 30 feet to the ground below when his support rope was cut. He fractured his pelvis.
An employee was injured when he fell on ice and broke his leg.

An employee was performing maintenance, replacing lights in ceiling fixtures that are 27 feet off of the floor. He was using a scissor lift as a working platform. A coworker operating a gantry crane struck the scissor lift, causing it to topple over and land on conveyor systems that were being built. The employee suffered right heel injuries, a head laceration (requiring stitches), a concussion, and minor contusions and bruising.
An employee was replacing a door lock when a rusty screw went into the employee's finger on Thursday, June 4, 2015.

The injured employee was preparing to disassemble a meat grinder to clean it. The injured employee unplugged the meat grinder when he unscrewed the collar. The die was tightly fit and he was unable to remove the die and blade. The injured employee plugged the grinder back in to bump the power and then reached down to remove the die. His shoulder hit the power-on switch, amputating his right middle fingertip, which came in contact with the blade.

On 11/03/2016, at approximately 5:15 PM, an employee was troubleshooting a gizzard machine that was not running properly. He was attempting to identify the problem and got assistance from a coworker. He closed the cover and shut down the machine. The machine was turned back on while the employee's right hand was in the moving/rotating parts of the chain drive and sprocket, amputating 3/4 of his index finger and 1/2 of his middle finger.
An employee was grinding on tack welds when the grinder lost power. As the employee was checking the cord, the grinder restarted and lacerated the employee's left thigh above the knee.
An employee tripped on the wheel of a medication cart and fell to the floor, suffering a hip injury.

An employee was operating the shrink wrap machine. As he was lowering the stretch wrap to the bottom of a pallet, his left ring finger was caught by the spinning plate that the pallet was sitting on. His finger then became caught in the machine and was amputated.

An employee in the shop's face-frames department was operating a machine press that punches holes into cabinetry. As the clamping mechanism came down, it amputated her left-hand pinky finger. The employee required surgery.

The employee was traveling on his PIT to put it away and plug it into to a stationary charger stored on the second tier of racking. As he approached the area to park the PIT, he noticed the charging cord hanging down from the racking. He stopped and reached to move the cord and the truck moved forward catching his fingers between the truck and the racks.
An employee was cleaning up debris and creating a drywall barrier. When he shifted the drywall, it fell on him, breaking his right tibia and fibula.
An employee suffered a hip injury while breaking up an altercation between two inmates.
An employee was moving a cement head that weighs approximately 400 lbs when it fell onto the employee's left foot.
Two employees received electrical burns when an anchor cable was touched by a live electrical cable near the trench where the employees were working.

An employee was erecting a portable ready mix concrete plant and was lifting steel plates into position when one of the plates became unattached from the boom and fell on the employee's foot, amputating three toes.

An employee was operating a router. When he bent over to look at the router, his hair was caught in the router. The router pulled him in, and his face slammed into an angle iron frame. He suffered head trauma and face lacerations, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was removing a 700 lb. flange from the side of a winder coil of wire when the flange released and fell on the employee. The employee suffered a mild concussion, broken arm, and fractured L2 vertebra, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

On or about January 13, 2016, a molding can rolled off of the transfer car (stationary steel rollers) and pinned the injured employee against the dust collector. The employee's pelvis was crushed by the molding can, which weight approximately 600 pounds.
An employee was trimming palm branches when a falling branch struck him in the back and punctured a lung.
An employee was lifting a 1,000-pound piece with a magnetic lifting device. The piece fell and struck the employee's right arm, lacerating it and requiring hospitalization.

On 4-21-15 an employee was walking into the rear entrance of Medical Office Building B when the employee's shoe got caught on the pavement and the employee fell striking his/her face on the sidewalk. The employee was admitted to the hospital for a sub-arachnoid hemorrhage.
An employee was walking down the hall when her foot caught the floor causing the employee to fall on her left knee and right arm. She broke her knee and was admitted to the hospital.

Employees were using a Hydrovac to find an underground line.  The Hydrovac has a nozzle to shoot high pressure water and suck up water and mud.  One employee works the vacuum hose and another works the water nozzle. The employee working the vacuum hose saw a rock that he didn't think would go up the vacuum hose. When he reached down to pick it up, he stepped in front of the water nozzle.  The pressurized water punctured his knee on the inside of his right leg.
An employee lost his grip while descending a fixed ladder and fell approximately 8 feet, hitting his head on the floor.

An employee was drilling holes in a half-inch steel plate using an electromagnetic drill. As he was removing the drill bit from the last hole, a stinger caught his glove and pulled his hand toward the drill bit, amputating his left index fingertip.
An employee was changing a knockout on a press die when a chain came loose. The employee's left ring finger was then pinched between the die stem and the die knockout, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was operating a snowmobile to conduct fishing license checks and fell off the snowmobile after catching a patch of ice.  The employee was hospitalized with seven broken ribs and a dislocated shoulder.

An employee was nailing shingles at the edge of the roof of a new one story house when he lost his footing, fell 8 feet to the ground, and landed on a pile of wood. The employee was not wearing fall protective equipment. He was hospitalized with six broken ribs.

An employee was working with a sealer for packaging shipments when it jammed.  The employee tried to clear the jam, triggering it to close, and burned the four fingers on his left hand, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was unloading a truck. When he pulled on a tote, he fell onto a metal step and broke his hip.

Employee was operating a stomp shear with a co-worker. The employee was inserting some metal into the shear to be cut when his fingers slipped into the machine as the co-worker activated the stomp shear.

An employee was inspecting pipe threads on a production line. A set of stops were removed for single-pipe roll down. After manually moving a pipe, another pipe came into contact with the employee's hand. His hand got caught and crushed between both pipes, resulting in an amputation from the tip to the first joint of his right-hand pinky finger.
An employee was removing a C-hook from the inside diameter of a steel coil. The employee's left index finger was caught between the C-hook and the steel coil, partially amputating the fingertip.
An employee was working on the reactor when a chemical reaction in a tank caused a metal pump housing to burst. The employee's right leg was fractured below the knee.
An employee was moving drywall on a motorized pallet jack when his leg was caught and fractured between the jack and a scissor lift.
An employee felt light-headed and suffered asthma exacerbation while walking down a recently waxed hallway. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was exposed to crushing-hazards and sustained serious injuries.

An employee was climbing a fixed ladder with a cage inside of a containment unit when she lost her footing and subsequently lost her hand grip and fell approximately eight feet breaking her right ankle. She had surgery to repair the damage to her ankle.

An employee was dumping powdered graphite/carbon debris from a drum suspended from a crane by a nylon sling into a hopper on the ground. The employee's left hand was on the hopper as the caked carbon material fell out of the drum and into the hopper causing the hopper to shift.  His hand was caught between the edge of the hopper and the drum resulting in the amputation of the left pinky finger between the first and second knuckle.
An employee was unloading his trailer when it tipped over and amputated his lower left leg.

An employee was on a ladder winding the tension spring for an overhead door when the tension spring blew apart, causing the employee to fall off the ladder. The employee suffered shattered heels and a back injury.

An employee was carrying a ladder on his hip when he tripped and fell, landing on top of the ladder. He later experienced irregular breathing and was hospitalized with nine fractured ribs, a collapsed lung, a broken collar bone, and shoulder and hip sprains.
An employee was rouging corn in a field when he lost consciousness due to heat stress. He suffered burns to his legs and hands from direct sun exposure, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was waxing a moving, horizontal bandsaw blade. The blade caught his work gloves and pulled his hand onto the blade, causing serious injuries.
An employee with a sledgehammer struck the injured employee's left middle finger while he was holding a board. The injured employee's fingertip was amputated.

An employee was turning a shaft on a lathe and polishing it with an emery cloth. The employee's glove got caught in the lathe pulling the employee's left hand into the machine and amputating the left middle fingertip and crushing the index and ring fingertips.
An employee injured the left hand with a spray gun.
An Employee fell into a phosphoric acid tank sustaining burns and was hospitalized.

An employee was using a vertical belt sander to deburr a piece of metal. The metal became caught between the sanding belt and a tool rest, which pulled his thumb into the belt behind the tool rest and amputated his left thumb tip. The sander was guarded at the time.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet from a ladder while installing a sign, suffering a fractured hip that required surgery.
On 5-14-2015, at 8:00 AM, an employee picked up a snake inside of a building and was bitten on the right thumb. She was hospitalized.

An employee had his left thumb crushed by the wheels of a semi trailer as he tried to avoid being run over. The employee was knocked to the ground and pulled into the wheel well of the trailer crushing his left hand and amputating his thumb. The employee also sustained injuries to the lower left side of his body.

An employee was cleaning a pump near the marination mix tank. She removed the piping but did not remove the cover and reached into the opening. She felt the sharpness of the impeller and quickly withdrew her hand. The distal portion of the third finger on the left hand was amputated.
An employee was pushing a buggy with windows near the shipping department when he struck a pole and crushed his left pinky finger between the buggy and the pole resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was performing work in a 24-volt DC electrical cabinet. While working, a loose wire grounded out and arced; the employee received an electrical shock and his left hand sustained a second degree burn.
An employee's finger was pinned between a machine part and the frame of the machine. The employee was hospitalized and received treatment for crushing injuries.

An employee was hospitalized after being hit by a forklift that was unloading boxes of pulp from a flatbed stationed in the roadway. The forklift backed up and ran over the employee's leg as he was leaving work, resulting in a fractured ankle and leg.
An employee was observing the pallet machine and attempted to access the platform to adjust the limit switch sensor. The employee then fell and suffered an avulsion fracture to the left leg.
Employee was struck in the face by a handheld, gas-powered saw he was using.
An employee was bitten by dog.
An employee was collecting plastic scrap in a tote near a press when she tripped and fell backwards, hitting her head on the concrete floor.
An employee was climbing a ladder to secure a load on a trailer when he fell about 6 feet to the ground, breaking his right ankle.

An employee was clearing a small pine tree from the road using an axe. The axe went all the way through the tree and struck his right shin, causing lacerations and a small fracture. He was hospitalized.

A temporary employee was loading a truck full of pipes. The load became unstable and a pipe rolled off of the truck and onto the temporary worker's legs.  The worker was hospitalized and his left foot was amputated.
An employee was making a home delivery of propane when the gas released and ignited, causing a flash fire that burned his right hand, left leg, and face.
An employee fell off a ladder while running network cable for computers, breaking a tibia and requiring surgery.

On May 13, 2015, at approximately 12:00 midnight, an employee suffered a concussion and was hospitalized after being struck by a 1.5- to 2-inch flex steel hose. The employee was working in the cellar while a rig hand worked on the rig floor 30 feet above. The rig hand disconnected the hydraulic hose, which fell 30 feet and struck the employee in the head.
An employee partially amputated the left index and middle fingers while using a 24-inch hook to reach the drum de-boner auger.
A maintenance employee slipped from a railing 18 inches from the floor and fractured his elbow.

An employee was removing product from inside a ball valve. The spring mechanism delayed the closing of the ball valve; when it did close, it pinched and lacerated the employee's left pointer finger just below the nailbed.

An employee was working on a derrick about 10 feet off the ground and was being lifted to disconnect the elevator. A wire rope under tension snapped back striking the employee and throwing him in the air and then back down. The employee was wearing a safety harness and he only fell the length of his lanyard or about 4 feet. The employee injured his back and was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized with left-foot injuries that occurred while manually repositioning a dock-leveling plate.

An employee was installing light posts when the derrick truck swung the light post and contacted the power line behind them. The trailer holding the post became energized, and the employee received severe electrical burns.
Two temporary employees were in a altercation in the workplace and one was hospitalized overnight due to a head injury.
An employee was operating a power washer when the high-pressure water lacerated the employee's foot.
An employee was walking toward a washer with laundry, slipped on a broken tile, and fell breaking the right wrist.
Employees were cutting metal. A piece of cut metal fell and struck an employee on the back causing a laceration.

An employee was shoveling wet concrete in front of a paving machine when the employee's right leg/ankle got caught in the paving machine.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery on a broken right ankle.
An employee was working on a motor house belt system when her arm got caught between the belt and the metal beam of the conveyor system.
On March 10, 2016, an employee was walking behind a lift truck when the vehicle rolled backward and struck the employee. The employee suffered a fractured hip.
An employee was setting up a drilling rig when he fell approximately 14 feet off the substructure. He suffered damaged vertebrae and a cranium laceration, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working on the tear tape machine and was loosening bolts to the supporting bar when the bar fell and forced his right hand down and into the hot plate area. He suffered third-degree burns on the back of his right hand.
An employee was operating a forklift to gather merchandise. His right index finger got caught and amputated between the side of the forklift and the horizontal bracket.
An employee was climbing up a scaffold when the scaffold fell over. The employee sustained a broken leg.

An employee working in the prepared food area was rolling a cart loaded with food from a walk-in cooler when the cart tipped over and landed on her left leg fracturing it in multiple places. She was hospitalized for surgery to repair the injuries to her leg.

An employee was rolling up lines and a piece of material fell and struck the employee on the shoulder. The employee sustained bruising/hematoma to the left upper back area and compression fractures of three thoracic vertebrae.
An employee was walking to his car, tripped on a retaining wall, and fell breaking his left arm. It was dark at the time of the incident.
A temporary employee was operating a forklift while carrying a nylon sling outside of the cab. The sling got caught under the rear tire of the forklift resulting in a left arm amputation.
Two employees were moving a shelving unit. The unit slipped and fell onto the employee's right big toe fracturing it.
An employee choked on a piece of chicken while testing food for a new menu.
An employee suffered second degree burns to the left hand and side when hot chicken broth he was carrying spilled on him.

An employee was reaching into the back of a truck to move boxes when he felt a pop in his back. The pain got progressively worse throughout the day. He was later admitted to the hospital for numbness in the leg.
On or about August 31, 2016, an employee was disconnecting drill pipe joints in the rig and slipped and fell. The drill pipe joint came down and struck his right hand middle and index fingers.
An employee was using a chop saw to cut a 2" x 6" wedge when two left-hand fingers were amputated.
An employee slipped and fell on ice in the parking area, suffering a lower leg injury that required surgery.
An employee was descending from a stationary ladder when he missed a rung and fell about 6 feet, fracturing his left tibia. He required surgery.

An employee engaged in automobile wiring activities under a raised truck body was crushed when the air line supplying air to the air bags, which raise the truck body, released and caused the truck body to come down on the employee.
An employee fell through a skylight while roofing.
An employee was using his hand to push wood material when a saw pressure beam came down and amputated his left hand.
On or about 11/23/15, at approximately 10 p.m., an employee walking on the jobsite was struck in the chest by the arm and bucket of an excavator. The employee was hospitalized with a bruised heart.

An employee working as a bagger tried to obtain a cotton sample from the side of the cotton bale and was caught by the belt pushing him into the bagger. The employee suffered a broken rib and a punctured lung.

An employee was running film on a production line. While trying to remove excess plastic film from a rubber roller, the employee suffered an avulsion injury to the left palm. The machine was running at the time of the incident. The employee was hospitalized for a skin graft.
An employee working in the wheel polishing department suffered an injury, resulting in a left thumb amputation and a left middle finger fracture.
An employee fell and injured the right hip after being cut off by another skier while skiing with a patient.

On December 5, 2016, an employee fell down a flight of stairs at a patient's home, striking her head and losing consciousness. She suffered a head injury, detached retina, and fractured right arm, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was found passed out after cleaning with 409. The employee was hospitalized for an allergic reaction/respiratory irritation and breathing problems due to the chemical cleaner.
An employee was boring using an industrial auger when the auger locked up, pinning him against the bank. He suffered a fractured right leg and internal injuries.
An employee was pushing a cart with steel louvers on the cart. The steel louvers slipped off and crushed the big toe on his left foot.
An employee was hospitalized after he got his hand caught between the conveyor belt and the T-Plate.
An employee suffered a back injury when a hopper that was being lifted by a forklift fell on the employee.

An employee entered the room that reduces noise from the line saw to look at a vent. Her hand contacted the saw blade, cutting her right index, middle, and ring fingers. She was hospitalized and had surgery resulting in a partial amputation to the first knuckle of the right index finger.
An employee pinched two fingers between the cable and pulley of a portable belt conveyor resulting in an amputation injury.  The motor was not running at the time of the incident.
While straightening a piece of metal using the piranha press, an employee amputated part of a finger.
An employee was using an overhead crane to position pipe into a steel holding area. The employee's left hand was caught between the pipe and steel structure, amputating the left thumb tip.

An employee was moving a 1,300-pound steel skeleton off the plasma table with an overhead crane. The employee set the work piece down on the ground and was trying to manually push it toward the scrap pile. The material shifted and tipped over, striking and pinning the employee between the work piece and a stationary toolbox. The employee suffered fractured ribs and a fractured sternum, requiring hospitalization.
An employee who was troubleshooting a level transmitter was found unconscious within the vicinity of a suspected hydrocarbon (H2S) release.
An employee was working on a mast climber work platform cord when the machine turned on and the railing pulled in his hand, crushing his right forearm.

An employee was using a lift to reach items above the floor in a warehouse. As the lift was being lowered, a ring on the employee's right pinky finger was caught on an object outside the lift. The finger was amputated.
On or about February 20, 2015, an employee's middle two left-hand fingers were amputated just above the first knuckle when a stainless steel guard came down while working on the auger.
An employee was walking down a set of stairs when they missed a step and fell fracturing the right ankle.

An employee was placing the steel roof and ridge cap in place on a barn when he slipped and fell. He reached out and grabbed onto a piece of steel that lacerated four fingers and amputated his pinky fingertip.

On or about September 13, 2016, an employee was driving a side-by-side vehicle when the back swerved out and overturned landing on the employee's legs. He suffered a compound fracture and required surgery.

An employee was signaling a crane that was loading a forklift with steel beams. After the beams were placed on the lift, one fell and hit him on the head, breaking his neck. He was hospitalized overnight.

A rig crew was attempting to pull a drill rig through the mud using a company-owned winch truck.  While doing so, the winch line separated, striking the injured employee. The employee was hospitalized with a lacerated arm and injured spleen.

An employee was working on a vehicle being lifted off the ground.  He stepped off the back and fell approximately 4 feet to the ground below.  When the employee hit the ground, he fractured his wrist and was taken to Grady Memorial Hospital where he received surgery.
An employee was operating the sandwich wrapping machine and amputated the left ring fingertip.
An employee was driving a flat bed truck and pulled over to adjust and secure the load (bales of film). The bales of film rolled on top of the employee breaking his femur and dislocated his hip.

An employee was troubleshooting a press due to its unloader fingers not extending. He was standing on the press exit conveyor and platen edge. When he moved the wires on the unloader, the unloader moved in and down. The movement caused him to trip and fall down onto the platen, where he was pinned by the unloader and suffered burns.
An employee's fingertip was amputated after it got caught by the hold-downs on a shear.

An employee was helping with ground work when a strap holding an auger to a truck broke and the auger swung free, hitting the employee in the head. He was knocked unconscious and was hospitalized with a head laceration. The employee was wearing a hardhat at the time of the incident.
The employee was dumping material from a dump truck and was struck by the material (approximately one ton of soil) resulting in a compound fracture to the leg and a broken nose.
An employee was hospitalized with a head laceration after falling to the floor in the workplace.
A demolition saw kicked back on an employee who was cutting railroad tie. The saw hit his opposite shoulder and caused soft tissue damage (blood and nerve damage).

An employee was disconnecting an attachment from the boom of an excavator for a transmission crew. When the connecting pin was removed, the 100-pound auger motor he was working on fell and crushed the end of his left pinky finger. He suffered an amputation of the distal end/joint of that finger.
An employee was changing a pulley on the feed roller conveyor. The employee's right index fingertip was caught in the pulley and amputated.
An operator was in the process of unclogging a machine when his left ring finger was caught and amputated by the equipment.
On February 3, 2015, an employee's index finger (right) was crushed while clearing a jam within a bottle washing machine.

On July 25, 2016, an employee was sitting down at a computer station documenting information. When she got up from the station, her right foot became tangled on a cord beneath the desk. She tripped and fell on her left knee, fracturing her femur and requiring surgery.

An employee was helping to install a marine loading arm.  As he stood near the base of the loading arm, the weight shifted and struck him, causing his right-hand index finger to be caught and amputated between the base of the loading arm and a piece of pipe.
An employee lost control of a forklift, ran into the dock door rail protector, and smashed his left foot.

On July 21, 2015, at approximately 8:30 p.m., an employee was sweeping up sawdust and carrying a paint can at the ECG Crankshaft mill in Sharon, Pennsylvania. Conductors were sticking out of the metal conduit beneath a saw table at the time. The employee reached down to pick up the paint can, which then contacted the live conduit.  The can exploded, burning the employee's right forearm. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
A machine loader collided with a company truck, causing the truck to move and hit an employee's head. The employee was knocked unconscious and required hospitalization.
An employee was operating a standup forklift. When he exited the equipment, he was pinned between the dock door and the forklift, fracturing his left ankle.

An employee was sitting on the back of a pick-up truck throwing salt. When he dismounted the truck to retrieve something that had fallen, he lost his footing and fell, hitting the back of his head and requiring hospitalization.

An employee attempted to adjust the air pressure on the UBE machine while working on the packaging line. The employee's finger got caught in a chain and sprocket that was attached to the machine, amputating the right index fingertip.

On or about July 27, 2015 at approximately 9:15 p.m., a maintenance employee experienced shooting pain in the left arm, chest, and back, as well as heart palpitations, while installing a pump with two coworkers.  His left hand was seizing up and he couldn't move it. The employee was hospitalized for dehydration and heat stress.

On 9/24/15, at approximately 5:15 p.m., an employee was positioning a jack to a block bailer. He put his left hand on the side of the jack and his left middle finger got caught between the cradle and jack set. His left finger was crushed and had to be surgically amputated to the first knuckle.

An employee's left ring finger was amputated at the first knuckle on October 12, 2016. While the employee was loading a part on a CNC machine, his hand was caught between the casting and the clamp. The employee was not wearing gloves at the time.

An employee was clearing a jam in the shear when the machine activated via the foot pedal and amputated three right-hand fingers above the second joint. The machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee reached under the guard of the punch press to clear a bottle jam. The trimmer came down and cut his right thumb.
An employee was walking to his work trailer when he was struck by a work truck, breaking his left tibia and requiring hospitalization.

On November 16, 2016, an employee was retrieving parts from a new washer when his glove was caught in the chain conveyor and subsequently caught between the chain and a rotating shaft. His right middle fingertip was amputated. The chain and shaft were unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee's fingers got caught in a grease pump gearbox. The employee's right index fingertip was later amputated.
Two employees were shocked when the ladder they were holding contacted a powerline.
An employee was using an 8-foot ladder to remove a recessed "can" for lighting when he lost his balance and fell to the concrete floor, suffering a head injury.
An employee fell approximately 10-12 feet while descending the ladder from the top of the railcar.

An employee was replacing the bearing of a poultry elevator and separator using a hammer and wrench. When he hit the sprocket to gain access to the bearing, the sprocket came loose and caused the elevator to fall. The employee jumped back and the force from landing broke his right foot and lower right leg.
An employee fell from a single story when the employee's work belt was caught on the edge of a man basket.  The employee sustained a broken leg and arm.
While exiting a tugger, an employee did not clear the loader track and tripped over it, breaking the right ankle.
An employee was attempting to uncouple a railcar. The car rolled forward, trapping and crushing the employee's left ring finger. The employee required surgical amputation.
An employee was delivering mail to residence and was bitten by a dog resulting in the amputation of the right index fingertip.

An employee who was hitting the side of a feed bin in order to loosen feed fell approximately 15 feet from a catwalk.  The employee was hospitalized with broken ribs, a pelvic injury, and a broken arm.

On February 2, 2016, a maintenance employee was checking the photo eye on the panel saw. As he checked the eye, the program fence released and crushed his right ankle between the fence and a pressure beam. He was hospitalized.
An employee experienced an electrical shock while walking in the reformer section of the paper mill.
An employee caught the edge of a pallet with his right foot and dislocated his ankle.
Employee was about to get on a forklift when he fell and fractured leg.
An employee was welding structural steel. While descending a ladder, the employee fell to the ground and dislocated an ankle, requiring hospitalization.
While an employee was walking back to his work station, he slipped on a piece of potato that was on the walkway, fracturing his left leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was moving a kettle of molten metal when the molten metal spilled and burned the employee.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while cleaning a filler machine.
An employee was performing maintenance on the C-Spinning machine when his left hand got caught in the clamp, amputating his left thumb tip.
An employee was loading skylight panels onto a trailer when the employee's right pinky fingertip was caught and amputated between the panels and the trailer.
The employee was walking on the south side of the facility and slipped on slush and water and fell suffering a fractured hip.
An employee was called to provide assistance with controlling a patient. During the struggle, the employee suffered a heart attack.
An employee slipped and fell in a company parking lot resulting in a head injury.  The employee was hospitalized as a result of the injury.
An employee was loading a packaging machine when her pinky finger got pulled into the machine.

On January 22, 2015, an employee operating a rough terrain forklift on frozen ground felt a "pop" in his back. The employee reported the incident to management the following day, went to an emergency room on two occasions, visited a doctor, and had an MRI before being diagnosed with a spinal epidural hematoma and admitted into Geisinger Medical Center in Danville, Pennsylvania, on January 28, 2015.
An employee was walking on a platform and jumped two feet to the ground.  He lost his balance and fell fracturing the left hip and shoulder.

An employee was helping a coworker re-energize a fire pump. There was a very loud bang, and the employee was struck in the middle of his back by an electric charge from the casualty power biscuit for the fire pump, which was behind him. A hole was burned through his shirt and there was a 2.5- to 3-inch circular black mark on his bare skin.
An employee was hospitalized for a cut finger.

An employee was standing on a 16-foot A-frame ladder replacing an insulated glass unit (IGU) at a private home. He was standing about 10 feet up on the portable ladder when he was exposed to a gust of high wind. He lost his balance and fell to the ground, breaking two bones in his left leg. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was lowering an automobile garage door when the wind caught the door and pulled it loose. The garage door struck the employee on the head and shoulder. The employee was hospitalized for injuries.
An employee and a coworker were handling knives in the kitchen when the coworker accidently lacerated the employee's leg.

An employee was operating a dump truck in the orange grove. The truck was loaded with shell rock to be dumped to grade a road. Upon lifting the bed, contact was made with an overhead power line. Upon exiting the truck the employee was shocked and received electrical burns to the left arm and foot.  The employee was hospitalized.
As an employee was transitioning from a platform to a ladder, he lost his grip and fell backwards 6.5 feet. He fractured his left hip and left elbow.
An employee was accessing supplies in the tool crib using a three-step rolling ladder when she fell and struck her head on the floor. She was hospitalized on 1/25/2016.
An employee was performing a roof inspection. He was taking photos when he slipped on wet shingles and fell into an empty concrete pool below, breaking his left arm and left ankle.
The worker stepped on a floor joist and fell 10 feet. The worker sustained a broken leg and was hospitalized.
Employee was moving a 55-gallon barrel of frozen fruit juice off of a pallet and it landed on the instep of his left foot, fracturing his foot and requiring surgery to repair.
An employee was using a saw to cut vinyl extrusions and cut his right hand across the knuckles.

Employee was operating a product filling machine and the machine was leaking onto on the containers.  The employee opened up the safety guard and tried to wipe down the heat jaws with a cloth when the jaws closed on his hand, amputating three fingers.
An employee was walking, tripped on a shoe lace, and fell fracturing the right hip.
An employee fractured a femur while parachuting into a wild fire.
While delivering mail, an employee was stung by an insect and experienced an adverse reaction.
An employee was standing on a chair to change the sign in the window area. She fell, sustaining a facial laceration and tearing something in her right knee.
An employee was reaching for some keys on the wall in the shop area when his foot got caught in a cord and he fell breaking a hip.

A contract employee at a host employer worksite was changing a light bulb while positioned on a stepladder when his clothing got caught on a piece of metal on a rotating shaft, pulling the worker into the machine and fracturing both forearms.
An employee was washing out a tank with hot water that was about 130 to 140 degrees. The hot water scalded his back, resulting in third degree burns.

An employee was working with a perforating gun on a work bench. He turned the gun and it skipped off the roller wheels and fell on the edge of the table, amputating the index and middle fingertips on his right hand.
An employee was involved in a physical altercation with a coworker, suffering a fractured vertebra.

An employee suffered two broken ankles while hoisting a scale using an overhead crane. The scale had just been painted and was being lifted from a floor platform to be moved to an adjacent area for drying. The employee was raising the scale off the floor platform, taking up the slack of the rigging, when the scale slid off the platform and struck the employee's feet. Both ankles were broken from the impact.

An employee was finishing her morning medication administration cycle when she was called into an apartment by another worker to help move a resident from her bed to a wheelchair. The resident began to lose her balance, so the employee tried to help her to the ground, suffering acute severe lower back pain with disc protrusion in the process.
An employee was caught in the feeder portion of a structural steel vertical band saw (17 inches),  resulting in a fractured pelvis.
An employee tripped over a cord and fell on her left side fracturing her pelvis.

An employee was standing on an A-frame ladder while attempting to open a cover plate from a tea line. The tea product poured onto the employee, causing him to slip and fall off the ladder. He struck his head on the concrete floor, suffering contusions and an edema.
An employee was hospitalized from injuries received when his pickup truck flipped while on a lease road. The employee sustained broken ribs and a broken clavicle.
A temporary employee was cleaning out a running saw and amputated the right pinky finger.
On July 12, 2016, an employee was offloading a 2-yard dumpster when the employee's finger became caught between the truck and the container lock. The employee suffered a fingertip amputation.

An employee was working from a bucket truck and cutting a branch. The bucket had a winch attached to a branch that was cut. The branch slipped and flung the employee from a height of 50 feet. The employee suffered broken bones, contusions, cuts, and scrapes.
An employee was stacking lumber and amputated three fingers on the right hand in a chain and sprocket.

On or about May 3, 2015, an employee's right index fingertip was amputated when he tried to unclog an ice shaver with a plastic spoon and accidentally stepped on the control pedal, which engaged the blade.
The crew was erecting a scaffold. On his way up the scaffolding, an employee slipped and fell landing on the concrete floor below and inuring a leg.
An employee tripped and fell on a rug, breaking her hip
An employee was walking on a working surface when plywood fell over and struck his leg, breaking it.
An employee was attempting to clear a chocolate outlet tube when a rotating agitator inside the chocolate tube amputated her right middle finger above the top joint.
An employee was operating surveying equipment. A dirt clod rolled down a hill and struck the employee in the back knocking him to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with a back laceration.
An employee slipped while climbing down a ladder, hit his face, and was hospitalized.

An employee pushed a cart through a doorway out of a walk-in oven.  The employee had his hands on the outside of the cart.  As the employee came around a corner, the cart cut the corner and pinched the employee's finger between the cart and the door jam.  The employee sustained an amputation to the tip of the left pinky finger.
An employee was repairing a pallet jack. He lifted the pallet jack by hand. When he went to lower the pallet jack, the wheel mechanism severed his right index finger at the first joint.
On November 17, 2015, an employee suffered a de-gloving of their right hand while using the base fiber feeder on the 9214 mat line.

On 10/31/2016, an employee was delivering furniture to a client's house. He attempted to cross the road while holding a mattress and a speeding car hit him, injuring his nose and causing contusions to multiple body parts.
An employee's right hand and wrist got caught while helping a mechanic declog a piston.
An employee was backing a stand-up forklift off a vender-owned trailer. His left foot got caught between the forklift and the dock plate, breaking the foot.
An employee was cutting Plexiglass with a circular saw when the saw slipped out of his control and amputated the first digit of two fingers.
An employee was riding a golf cart at the dealership and fell out striking his head on the ground. The employee suffered a brain hemorrhage requiring surgery.
Employee was changing drill bits on a pocket boring machine. He set his hand down on the machine to look under it and his hand engaged with the drill bit.

An employee was staging a part on a coordinate measuring machine. The employee put the part onto the fixture. A hole in the casting into which the fixture pin is placed was not big enough. The employee placed the part on its side to deburr the hole out. The employee was repositioning the part onto the fixture when it slipped and crushed his finger between the part and the fixture, amputating his fingertip. The part weighed about 56 pounds.
On December 14, 2015, an employee was delivering mail. While moving the mail around in her vehicle, a package fell out and she tripped over it. She fell to the ground and broke her left wrist.
An employee injured his left thumb while he was sliding a reshore jack post into the closed position.
An employee fell 12 to 15 feet after his scissor lift was knocked over by falling duct work. He suffered a back injury from hitting the ground.
An employee suffered a head injury and was hospitalized.

An employee was on the second level of the roof with his harness on and was preparing anchors to start work. The employee fell 15-20 feet through a hole and suffered broken ribs, a torn right lung, a ruptured spleen, a broken pelvis and bleeding on the brain.
Employee caught his hand in a router.
An employee fell down the stairs injuring a leg and cutting an ear.

A worker was attempting to install a safety pin in the self climbing form work system. The platform came down on his hand before any safety pins were put in. The worker's hand was crushed resulting in finger amputations.

An employee was drilling a hole in a piece of aluminum about 12-inches by 3-inches wide using a pedestal drill press and amputated his left index finger at the first knuckle. The employee was wearing tight fitted grip gloves. The machine was not guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was hospitalized for an injury requiring surgery that occurred in the shipping department.  An employee attempted to fix a pop-out roller on the conveyor while it was still running and his finger was caught in the conveyor. The conveyor was not locked out or tagged out at the time.
Employee was caught by a machine when reaching for wire inside. Employee was hospitalized and required surgery.
The employee, walking across a muddy location, slipped and twisted his left ankle and broke his fibula near the ankle.

While manufacturing a shaft pin on a metal lathe, an employee in the Bldg. #304 Machine Shop was sanding the rotating pin with an emery cloth.  The cloth bound and pulled the employee into the rotating lathe machine, resulting in a left broken hand and lacerations on the right hand that required surgery and in-patient hospitalization.
An employee operating a Microtome machine sustained an amputation injury to her left index finger.
Employee fell approximately six feet from scaffolding while dismantling it and was hospitalized for cuts and a fractured arm.

An employee was reinstalling a cutting shoe on a direct push tube soil sampling rod. The dual tube rod slid out of the tensioner that was being used to hold it up and fell back down the bore hole, amputating the employee's right index finger below the first knuckle.

An employee was placing a 450 lb. part on a work table, using a 1-ton hoist and a hook, when the part came loose from the hook and partially fell onto the employee's hand. The employee suffered vascular damage to the left middle and ring fingers, requiring surgery.
An employee was operating a tube winder and amputated three fingers on the left hand.

An employee was working on a modular unit approximately 4 feet from the ground. While walking to retrieve a tool, the employee stepped into an unguarded opening and fell 3 feet, suffering a fractured rib and pelvis.
An employee was climbing a ladder when he lost his grip on the rung and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground below. He damaged his shoulder and fractured his pelvis, wrist, and elbow.
An employee was setting up the CNC machine when the cycle button was hit, causing the spindle to turn and throw parts out. The parts hit, shattered, and broke bones in the employee's upper arm.

An employee was repairing a seal on a valve operator. He placed the drum cover over the actuator piston using an overhead crane and was manipulating the drum while operating the crane controls. While attempting to lower the drum the final 2 inches, he inadvertently pushed the wrong button on the hoist control, causing the drum to move upward. As a result, his left thumb was pinched between the base plate and drum cover. There was no amputation.
An employee was replacing a belt on a compressor. The belt caught the employee's finger, causing a deep laceration. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was operating a lift on the back of a truck. When he reached for a chain that had fallen, the ramp came down on his hand and severed his right middle and ring fingers.
Employee was burned while unloading asphalt from a transportation vessel. The employee was in the process of cleaning the transfer lines from the vessel when he was burned on his face and arms.
An employee working on a barge tripped and fell 4.5' to a lower deck.
While delivering mail on her route, an employee began feeling faint and experienced pains in her chest. She was hospitalized due to possible heat stress.

An employee sustained a right arm injury requiring hospitalization while cleaning a conveyor belt in the raw processing area. The employee was crouched and cleaning the bottom area of the conveyor when he lost his balance and attempted to stop falling forward. His glove was caught in the moving conveyor belt and pulled his arm in and under the belt.

Two employees were offloading materials on the loading dock when a truck driver backed into and struck them. They were pinned between the loading dock and the lift gate of the truck, suffering compound fractures to their femurs.
On or about 4/11/2016, an employee was helping to guide and signal a backing truck when he was struck by the truck, eventually requiring hospitalization for a back injury.

On January 20, 2016, an employee was working in a tank with a coworker when he felt flu-like symptoms. He was hospitalized with respiratory failure after inhaling toxic chemicals, smoke, or fumes at the worksite.
An employee was helping to direct a trackhoe in placing 30-foot concrete barriers on a roadway when a barrier fell on his left foot, partially amputating his pinky toe.

An employee slipped as he was climbing down a scaffold ladder. He tried to catch himself by grabbing onto the ladder. His left arm hit the ladder clamp, which cut open his left arm (2 inches below his wrist to about 1 inch above his elbow). The cut was approximately 6 inches.
On February 9, 2016, an employee's left thumb was amputated to the first joint while the employee was operating a brake press to bend steel.
An employee reported difficulty breathing due to dust inhalation. He went to the hospital.

An employee was installing a 24V DC transformer inside a control panel with 480V wires.  During this process,  an arc flash occurred that caused second degree burns to the employee's hands and face.  The employee was hospitalized.
Two employees were assaulted by a fellow employee.

An employee was driving a golf cart on the course on 6/9/2015 at ~8:50 AM, when it is presumed that a wasp or bee flew into his face. The employee received a bite injury on his left cheek that initiated an allergic reaction requiring in-patient hospitalization.
An employee was struck by a truck while flagging in a work zone, breaking an arm and leg.
An employee who was running cable and preparing lights for a film set was hospitalized due to heat stress and dehydration.

An employee was watching the contractor crane up materials that had been taken from a truck when he noticed a tag line near the materials. He grabbed the tag line to move it to the side. As he grabbed it, the crane began the lift and the line became tangled in his hand, amputating his right index finger between the first and second digits.
An employee was performing maintenance on a crane when it fell on the employee.
Rotating shaft, caught-in hazard located in the bakery section. The hazard was located at the conveyors.

A band saw was locked out and the blade was replaced. Then the employee unlocked it, turned it on, and reached for the hose (to wash it down) with his left hand and his right index finger came in contact with the blade and was amputated.
An employee was performing maintenance on an electric breaker panel when an arc flash occurred, burning his face, arms, and hands.
An employee was operating a stack loader forklift to move product when his left foot got pinned between a light pole and the lift truck. He experienced left foot swelling.
An employee using a saw amputated his index fingertip.
An employee was doing a wheel alignment. He stepped out of the vehicle, fell to the ground, and lost consciousness.

An employee was checking the alignment on a blasting machine while it was locked out. The injured employee reached into the machine to check clearance when another employee rotated the wheel by hand. The injured employee suffered the amputation of 3/16 of the index finger.

An employee was using an electric impact wrench to tighten bolts used to secure the lifts frame. He was found unresponsive with his head caught between the frame of the lift and the frame of the building. He underwent surgery for head trauma.
An employee was struck by a car in a crosswalk while walking between buildings at the hospital. The employee sustained back and spine fractures.
An employee was working on a ladder removing screws from a wall when the ladder slipped and the employee fell to the ground.
On or about 6/15/15, an employee's hand got pinched between the forklift roll cage and a spider coil, resulting in a pinky fingertip amputation and severe injury to the ring finger of the right hand.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell injuring her head and lower back.
An employee fell 7-10 feet from a flatbed trailer while removing a tarp from a load of lumber and was hospitalized with a small fracture to the pelvis.
Employee leaned against break room space heater. His clothing caught fire and while attempting to disrobe, he burned his hands and back. Employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was getting up from a chair. Her legs got tangled up with a sweater and she fell on the floor fracturing the right hip.

Two employees were removing a roll up door from a truck for repair.  One employee had the right pinky finger at the distal joint pinched hard enough to cause an amputation.  The second employee received a laceration needing sutures and an open fracture.
An employee was injured by forklift extensions when lifting a load of sheet metal.
On 04/20/16, at approximately 12:24 a.m., an employee was cleaning a table with a rag when he tripped on the table leg and fell backwards. He was hospitalized with a fractured hip.

An employee noticed that a plastic bottle of shampoo had fallen over on the conveyor belt because it was missing the cap. The employee thought he had hit the stop button to shutdown the conveyor belt in order to grab the fallen shampoo bottle, but he didn't thereby his right index finger got caught between the chain and the sprocket. This resulted in the amputation of the fleshy tip of his right index finger.
An employee was lowering a cable tray into the basement at the worksite when his left hand was caught in the rope, amputating his long and ring fingertips.

An employee was attempting to move a tool, described as a tool to assemble/disassemble generators, from a storage shelf to the floor with the assistance of a second employee. While moving the tool, the employee's right thumb was caught in a movable bracket. The employee was wearing cut resistant gloves; however, when the bracket pinched his thumb he jerked his hand and tore skin from the end of the thumb. The employee's thumb tip and finger nail were amputated.

An employee was carrying new filter cartridges upstairs when he lost his balance and fell down the stairs, striking the right side of his face and left arm. His left arm broke in three places, his right eye socket broke, and his chin was lacerated.
An employee was operating a CNC machine. An aluminum piece from the CNC machine became a projectile and struck the employee's chest resulting in a laceration.
An employee overfilled a tank and corrosive liquid splashed onto the employee causing chemical burns.

On or about September 24, 2015, an employee was unloading a piece of glass from the conveyor to place it on a cart. The employee's right-hand middle finger struck the edge of the glass and was lacerated. The wound became infected and required overnight hospitalization.
The employee was lowering some rebar into a 24" hole/cage. His left ring finger got caught between the cage and rebar amputating the fingertip.
An employee was attacked by a dog while delivering a package and fell off the steps. The employee fractured the left arm and was hospitalized.

A welder was operating a horizontal band saw.  There was a hydraulic clamp for the material being cut.  The employee pushed the button for the clamp and his left thumb was caught in the clamp, cutting it open. The employee was admitted to the hospital for hand surgery.
An employee was operating a table saw when a piece of wood kicked back. The employee's fingertip was amputated.
An employee was found on the ground next to a milk tanker trailer after possibly falling from the trailer's ladder. The employee was hospitalized for multiple injuries.
A worker slipped on ice and fractured his ankle. The injury required surgery and admission to the hospital.
An employee was examining electrical boxes to investigate a partial power loss within the facility. An arc flash occurred, and the employee suffered burns to the face, throat, and hands.

A crew was removing a tree and had the tree cut down to 13 feet.  As they were removing the stump, the tree fell striking the employee's ankle.  The employee was transported to the hospital where he was admitted for surgery on his ankle.
An employee slipped on ice on the sidewalk and fell, suffering a fractured hip that required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and suffered a fractured hip.
While loading a ham cart onto a truck, the cart fell off the lift gate and struck the employee resulting in a broken leg.

An employee was helping attach a jib to a mobile crane by pushing on the jib. The jib was laying on the tip of the fork. The jib fell and hit the employee on the head and shoulder, and then landed on his foot, breaking three toes and two metatarsals in his left foot.
An employee was hospitalized with a broken jaw after getting into a physical fight with a coworker.
On October 4, 2016, while performing maintenance on a fan, an employee's gloved hand was pulled into a belt and pulley, amputating a fingertip.

An employee was picking up freight and on the dock. As he bent over to unlock his truck door, a cable broke on the raised roller door over head, causing the door to drop suddenly and strike the employee in the back. The employee was wedged between the roller door and the truck door, suffering a broken vertebra, a few broken ribs, and a bruised right ankle.
An employee fell from a stepladder to the ground while trying to grab an item off a shelf, injuring his elbow, back, and head.
An employee was standing on a step stool to refresh a kitchen display. After stepping off the step stool, he began walking, felt a pop in his right leg, and experienced leg pain. He was hospitalized.

An employee was standing on a ladder while trimming tree branches with a chain saw when a tree branch grabbed the saw. The employee removed a hand from the saw to try and catch the branch. The saw blade then lacerated the employee's left forearm, requiring overnight hospitalization and surgery.
An SSA Gulf employee was unloading cargo when his finger became caught between the cargo, amputating a portion of his left index finger.

Two employees were moving a welding positioner into place using an overhead crane. One was handling the base of the positioner as the other was operating the crane. The employee with his hands near the base moved his hand under the positioner as it was lowered, and his left index finger was smashed and partially amputated between the base and the ground.

An employee was working on the roof of a building when he noticed a crack in a concrete deck panel. As he attempted to remove the deck panel to patch it with wood, the panels he was standing on also broke. He fell almost 20 feet to the concrete floor below, cracking his L2 and L3 lumbar vertebrae. He was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee and a coworker were at servicing a truck. The employee was under the truck close to the fuel tanks when the coworker started the truck. The truck moved forward and the rear tandem caught the employee and drug him an unknown distance.
An employee was counting products when a forklift ran over his left foot, breaking toes.

An employee was replacing the thermostat on a pole hauler truck. He was accessing the engine from the passenger side fender using a step ladder. As he was transitioning from the ladder to the fender, the ladder became unstable and the employee fell resulting in a fractured right femur.

An employee was loading chickens from a chicken farm onto transportation trucks. The employee was pulling a full cart of chickens down the aisle inside the chicken house. As the cart rolled over a section of the steel grating floor, the section became dislodged and fell. The employee and cart fell approximately 10 feet through the hole to the ground.  The employee suffered a broken left hand and required surgery.
An employee was cleaning a screw auger when the employee's hand got caught in the machine amputating two fingers on his right hand.
An employee working on a roof experienced nausea and was hospitalized for heat-related illness.
On January 11, 2017, an employee slipped on ice/snow covered grass and fell sustaining broken ribs and punctured lung.
While dismounting a forklift, an employee misstepped and fell on his left hip, breaking it.
On December 23, 2016, an employee was walking from the break room to a material handler when he stepped on a nail that punctured his shoe. The employee was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was hand washing an aluminum casting at the "hand wash cabinet" (machine) using 3,700 psi water pressure to remove ceramic materials from the casting. The employee was wearing hand protection (double glove with inner neoprene and outer cut-resistant Kevlar with neoprene coating). The employee suffered a water injection injury to the right middle finger, requiring overnight hospitalization and surgery at Barnes St. Peters.
An employee was running a rolling press machine and his hand got caught in the in-running nip point.  When he removed his hand, a finger on his hand was torn requiring hospitalization.

On June 22, 2016, an employee had been performing maintenance on service equipment when he was found not fully responsive and slightly incoherent in his truck. He was hospitalized with heat exhaustion.

An employee was delivering auto parts to a customer location on July 9, 2015 where he was attacked by a dog and bitten on the hand. On July 13, 2015, he was hospitalized to receive vaccinations and to treat the infected wound.

An employee was using a table grinder to grind the end of a pipe. The wheel of the grinder grabbed the pipe, causing it to shift. The employee's hand was caught between the pipe and the disconnect on the grinder, amputating the pinky finger between the first and second knuckles and damaging the ring finger tendon.

The injured worker was driving a golf cart toward the body shop. Another employee was driving a customer's vehicle and they collided. The injured employee suffered a broken right arm, a fractured shoulder and a fractured to the mid foot.

An employee laid the dock plate down on a trailer bed to unload a trailer. A piece of wood was sticking out from the trailer wall, preventing the dock plate from laying all the way down.  The employee used his foot to kick the wood out of the way, which caused his foot to become stuck under the dock plate. His ankle broke and started bleeding.
An employee was moving an ice cream freezer. The freezer slipped and fell onto the employee's hands amputating a middle fingertip.

An employee was gluing a piece under a bathroom sink when the sink fell. The employee stood up and attempted to step over the broken pieces, which cut through his sneakers and cut the bottom of his foot.

Two employees were repairing a sofa. The injured employee's finger got caught between the springs and when the second employee pulled the springs the injured employee's left middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee was walking down a flight of stairs when he fell, rupturing the patellar tendons in both knees.

An employee was bending rebar and turned the switch to the program position so he could check the angle of the bar. The bending pin went to the left side of the bar. As he turned the equipment back on in the manual mode, the bending pin returned to the home position. The employee had already loaded a second bar.  When the bending pin was returning to the home position, it picked up the second bar. As the employee reached for the bar, his left index finger was caught between the pin and rebar, amputating the first digit.
An employee was adjusting a slip-sheet in a carton tub in the packing hall. When the loading mechanism cycled, the employee was pushed against the frame of the equipment, suffering broken ribs.
An employee was locking the utility chip box with a pin. The pin was not properly inserted and the box started to come down and crushed his right hand, amputating his right index finger.
An employee was injured when struck-by plastic pipes while unloading.  The worker was hospitalized.

An employee was unhooking her seatbelt while exiting a mail vehicle on a rural route when the shoulder strap fell and hooked onto her shoelace, causing her to fall to the ground and fracture her left hip.

On October 9, 2015, a shuttle driver fell out of a moving vehicle while attempting to rid the vehicle of a bug.  No seat belt was worn at the time.  The employee suffered a contusion to the right leg that required a medical procedure. The employee was hospitalized.
On 5/6/2016, an employee was sandblasting in the body shop. The sandblasting wand slipped and contacted the employee's left forearm causing a laceration. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was working with the conveyor chain and bag closer when his right-hand fourth fingertip was amputated.

Employees were installing a fiber optic cable along a rural roadway and were cleaning up the site at the end of the day when a vehicle approached the work site, left the road, and traveled through the ditch, striking two employees. The first employee suffered lacerations and contusions, while the other suffered a fractured leg. Both were hospitalized.

Four employees were dumping fixtures from the platform on a forklift into the dumpster. An employee climbed up the side steps of the dumpster to pull fixtures from the platform and fell to the ground fracturing both shoulders, a knee and the nose.
An employee was feeding the prefeeder when he stepped in a hole that was created by a missing roller. He suffered a swollen knee and was hospitalized.

On 6/27/16, at approximately 11 a.m., an employee was walking upstairs on the way to clean the bathroom when he passed out and hit his head on the concrete floor possibly due to overheating. He was hospitalized with a concussion.
An employee suffered the amputation of the right index fingertip when his finger was caught between the bumper of a truck and a jack.
An employee was struck in the face and suffered a broken jaw during an altercation with a coworker.

An employee was moving pallets with a forklift when it became stuck in the mud. Two coworkers attempted to pull the forklift out of the mud by tying two straps of fastener together with a clevis and attaching it to a truck that was pulling the forklift. The clevis then broke and swung back, striking and lacerating the employee's head.

An employee was guiding a metal grating, which was being lifted by an excavator bucket to its final location, when the rigging slipped from the excavator hook. The metal grating then fell, striking the employee in the left leg just below the knee. The impact fractured the employee's tibia and fibula, requiring surgery.
An employee was in the bucket getting ready to go up to do work on the powerline when he contacted the energized line, suffering third degree burns to both arms and second degree burns to his hands.
While moving an aerial lift, an employee came in close proximity to a powerline. The power line arc-flashed and the employee sustained an electrical shock, requiring hospitalization.
An employee tripped on a phone cord while walking into a meeting, hit her head, and was knocked unconscious.
An employee was decorating the church sanctuary for Easter. He was going up the steps to the platform when he tripped and fell backwards, breaking his hip.

An employee was standing in a basket attached to a forklift. The lift lowered the basket to the ground and the operator disconnected the basket straps. The employee in the basket was attached to the forklift not the basket. As the lift drove away, the employee was pulled and fell out of the basket hitting his head and shoulder.
An employee was cleaning inside a manhole when he was hit by a car. He suffered a broken left shoulder.
An employee was using a powered walk-behind forklift to move raw material when he was pinned between the forklift and a roll of metal, injuring his hip and liver.

An employee was trying to free a piece of material that was stuck in a conveyor when his right hand was pulled into the conveyor, resulting in a broken radius and ulna. He was hospitalized. The conveyor was moving at the time of the incident.

An employee was fabricating metal. He drew it over and was grinding off the weld when a tacked piece of metal used to clamp the weld shield came free and hit the grinder. The grinder fell over and cut his right forearm.
An employee fell off a portable three-step ladder that became unstable, breaking his right hip and requiring surgery.

An employee was loading sawdust onto a live bottom trailer using a small yard dog that he hooked to the trailer. The trailer got stuck in a hole and turned onto the left hand side, and the employee sustained an injury to his back, fractured ribs, an elbow wound that required surgery, and a concussion.
An employee was attempting to thread a machine and position the zipper when the machine's roller amputated her fingertip.
An employee was attempting to enter the garage. As he went over a chain that was across the bay door, his foot became tangled in the chain. He fractured both elbows.
An employee tripped and fell down a stairway and tore a tendon.

An employee was performing maintenance on a log-bucking saw and locked it out to replace a hydraulic valve. He then had to re-energize the valve to bleed out air from the hydraulic cylinder. When moving the cylinder in and out, his finger was pinched between the saw guard and saw structure. His left-hand middle finger was amputated at the first joint.

An employee was cutting wood for pallets with a chop saw when the wood kicked back, causing the employee's left hand to contact the moving blade. The employee's left thumb, index finger, and middle finger were severely cut.
An employee was pushing down on a table and injured their back.  While attempting to stretch it out the employee felt a pop.

An employee was moving 2x4's into a single-family home under construction when he fell into a floor hole in the middle of the floor, breaking ribs, puncturing a lung, and fracturing neck vertebrae. The floor hole was unguarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was attempting to move the test set power cable from a disconnect/receptacle to the service on the wall. After turning off the power supply, the employee unplugged the cable to plug it into the wall outlet. The employee inadvertently touched the cable capacitor, which still contained some residual voltage after it was unplugged from the test set, and was shocked on his left hand.
An employee was shoveling an excavation wall next to a roller when the roller slid down and pinned his leg, causing injuries.
Employee installing drywall suffered a broken leg when a slab of drywall fell. Employee was admitted to the hospital.
While plugging an extension cord into a vacuum, an employee was shocked by the cord, which was missing a ground prong. The employee experienced an irregular heartbeat.
