An employee was using a high pressure hose to wash a conveyor belt. His smock got caught in a sprocket on the machine resulting in an upper right arm fracture.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation.
An employee struck a double stack pallet of product while operating a pallet jack, breaking the left femur.

An employee was setting up his truck to be loaded. As he was stepping up to set up the first position on the tractor, his hand wrapped around a tied-down chain. When he stepped down from the truck, his right ring finger was caught between the chain and a prefabricated hole on the overhead truck ramp, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was scraping loose paint on a railcar door. The employee's hand was caught in the door when it closed unexpectedly. The employee sustained a fractured right wrist.
An employee was adjusting the belt and pulley on a lawn mower when his middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was helping unload a compressor from a pallet when the compressor tilted and pinned the employee between the compressor and the ground. The employee suffered a broken right arm and his right ankle was crushed. The employee was hospitalized.

On January 29, 2016, an employee was attempting to unjam the nailing machine when a coworker started the machine. The employee's hand was dragged through a chain and sprocket, amputating the right  middle, ring, and little fingers.
An employee was standing on a secured mat. When she turned to walk away, she tripped and fell breaking her pelvis.
An employee was assembling an amusement park ride when the component that was being installed fell and crushed his arm. He was hospitalized overnight with a fractured left forearm.
An employee tore the tendon in his left arm while replacing a hydraulic pump on a blow molding machine.
An employee slipped and fell into a 145-degree hot water pit, suffering second and third degree burns to the lower body.

A material handler on the motorized sheet lifter picked up a pack of material with the lifter and was moving the pack around when the pack struck a fixed object. The stack then shifted and caught the worker's fingers between the object and the stack injuring three fingers. The pinky finger was partially amputated from the tip to between the first and second joint.

Employee was pumping emulsified turkey meat up a tube to a dryer unit. The system became clogged. When he disconnected the tube from the pump, he found the tube clear and stuck his finger in the opening to the pump, which was still running, resulting in an amputation.
While cleaning a resident, an employee's leg got caught in a call light cord. The employee fell and fractured their shoulder.

On 1/21/15 at about 16:20 pm a worker was hit by the tongs on his right arm, chest, and leg.  He was transported to OU Medical Center where his right hand was amputated.  Immediately before the accident the drilling line was stuck.  The snub line connected to the tongs snapped causing the tongs to swing around and hit the worker.

An employee opened the shaver machine door and reached in to remove a Ford F-7 part from the clamp device. The part had not finished coasting down at the time.  The employee contacted the rotating part, which pulled flesh off of his right index fingertip.

An employee was lowering a folding trailer tongue with a coworker when they lost control of the towing arm. The arm caught the employee's hand, severing the right thumb and partially severing the right pinky finger.
On or about May 31, 2016, two employees were crossing the road in a golf cart when they were struck by a van in oncoming traffic. Both employees were admitted to the hospital.
An employee was attempting to remove the lock actuating pin and the lock bar shifted severing his left index fingertip.
An employee was helping to move a pane of glass when it fell on him and shattered, causing lacerations and fracturing bones.
An employee was installing an A/C duct panel when the component fell and lacerated his left forearm.
An employee's hand got caught between an unguarded conveyor chain and sprocket. The employee's thumb was amputated.
An employee suffered a partial index finger amputation while servicing a wiring harness machine.
Employee was adding a steel bar to the induction furnace when it flared up and splashed hot metal on the employee.  Employee was taken to Lehigh Valley Hospital.
An employee was climbing a ladder on the front side of a house when the ladder fell over. The employee suffered spine and neck injuries.

An employee was troubleshooting an assembly line in the needle assembly area. When he bent over to look at the bottom of the machine, he rested his hand on a guard on the belt assembly. His finger overlapped with the edge of the guard, tripping a motion sensor that activated the machine push bar. His right-hand middle finger got caught between the push bar and the machine.
An employee fell from a ladder.
An employee amputated the fingertips of the right thumb, index and middle fingers while cleaning the rollers on a printing press. The machine was running at the time of the incident.
An employee was using his finger to align the barrel of a gun while another employee applied pressure. The barrel slid into place, and the finger used to align the barrels was amputated.

An employee was performing preventive maintenance on the conveyor leading to the robot packer.  He removed the chain drive guard to lubricate the chain; the chain was running at the time.  While trying to replace the guard after finishing, he dropped a bolt near the sprocket. When he went to retrieve the bolt, the chain and sprocket caught the end of his right index finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee tripped over some wires under her desk and fell, fracturing her right hip and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was assisting another employee in hooking up a hose to a vacuum truck.   The manifold over pressured and exploded, and the valve connected to the tank truck sheared, releasing solvent. The explosion knocked the employee to the ground breaking his arm, injuring his left eye and rupturing his eardrum.
An employee was setting up a centerfire machine and smashed a fingertip in the machine. The tip was re-attached. There was no bone loss.
An employee's foot was caught in a transfer auger for a corn bin, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cleaning debris and moving ladders when the employee tripped and fell breaking a wrist and a hip or pelvis.
An employee's leg got caught between the pallet jack the employee was operating and the wall near the batter area.

While an employee and her partner were using a stair chair to move a patient down some stairs, the employee felt a pop in her back and was unable to move further. She was hospitalized with lower back pain.

An employee was operating a pallet dismantler when he dropped a pull bar onto the dismantler table. As he attempted to retrieve the bar, his left hand contacted the blade, amputating his middle finger. The machine was running at the time of the incident.
An employee fell from a lift at approximately 12 feet and incurred a fractured skull and face.

Two employees were attempting to clear a clog from a cellar with a water hose. As they moved the hose into the cellar, an obstruction came out and pushed the hose out.  The hose whipped around, striking both employees in the face, causing lacerations and facial bone fractures.

An employee was disassembling a wire-line tool when a section of the tooling fell onto the employee's hand. The employee sustained deep lacerations to four fingers and small fractures to two fingers, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was dragging tree limbs to a chipper via a winch system when his legs were struck by either the tree limbs or the winch system, resulting in one broken leg and a possible break to his other leg.

On August 18, 2015, an employee was hospitalized after tripping and falling onto a box of granulator blades that were awaiting sharpening. The employee sustained lacerations to the hands and arm and was hospitalized.

An employee placed her hand in a screw conveyor to remove a jam. The conveyor was still operational and amputated her fingertip below the fingernail. Two parts of the machine were shut off and a guard or two were removed at the time of the incident.
While transporting bags to a terminal, an employee walked between the bag carts and a motorized tug. While turning left, the employee suffered a broken left leg, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell 12 feet from a pitched roof before installing the anchor point, D ring system, and retractable lanyard.

An employee was working with a sewer jetter to clean a sewer line and the jetter became stuck. The employee attempted to remove it from the sewer line when the high-pressure dirty water shot into his right index finger, causing an infection.
An employee was wiring an exit sign when he received an electrical shock and suffered a severe burn to his finger.
An employee was walking through a truck stop parking lot and was run over by a car. The employee was hospitalized for bleeding on the brain.
An employee was walking in a patient's house and struck her right toe on an uneven threshold resulting in a laceration.
An employee was pulling a metal object out of a tire during repairs when the object flew out of the tire and hit the employee in the left eye. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after scrapping his arm on a metal stud wall at a job site.  The cut/scrape became infected.

Two employees were preparing to load luggage onto a plane with a belt loader. When one of the employees turned the loader on it malfunctioned. The loader jumped forward smashing the other employee between the loader and the plane resulting in fractured ribs and a jaw fracture in two places.
Employee lost his nail, skin, and flesh from the tip of his right ring finger while closing the cardboard bailer door.
An employee was setting up seine equipment to harvest fish from a pond when his hand was pulled into the chain and sprockets, injuring two fingers on his left hand.
An employee's wrist was cut by a metal stamped automobile part during a physical altercation with another employee.
An employee was cutting shrink wrap on a pallet when he tripped over an outrigger and fractured his hip. He was hospitalized.
While checking the air conditioning unit at a nursing home, an employee fell from a ladder, suffering head trauma, as well as a fractured rib, pelvis, and wrist.
An employee was moving a trailer when the tongue dropped and landed on his finger resulting in a partial amputation of the right ring finger.

An employee was walking between a cart and a skid that had boxes of trim on it when the boxes of trim rolled off onto his ankle and pinned him on the ground. He was hospitalized and had surgery for a broken left ankle.

An employee was rolling a door casing to form the door when his left hand got pinched between metal rollers, injuring his left index finger. He was hospitalized, and his finger was medically amputated.

An employee was unloading a steel plate from a truck when the plate struck a steel half cylinder, causing the cylinder to fall and strike the employee's lower left leg. The employee suffered a broken left tibia and fibula.
On or about November 12, 2015, an employee's arm was pulled into the spindle on a printing press when her glove got caught. She broke two bones in her right arm.
Employee's right index finger was partially amputated when it was caught between a ball and seat on a small lathe at the facility.
An employee was injured while conducting snow surveys. He was ejected from a snowmobile and sustained a back and neck injury.

An employee was tightening packing on a load pump with the truck pump drive shaft engaged. The employee's clothing became entangled in the drive shaft and pulled the employee's arms in resulting in multiple fractures to the left arm, skin abrasions on the left hand, and bruising to the right arm.
Employee fell during the performance of pick-off work at the facility.

An employee was assisting during the installation of a new washer/dryer in a private residence. After plugging in the appliance to an outlet, he touched the dryer and received an electric shock. He was hospitalized.

An employee was taking plastic bottles from a conveyor and placing them on a pallet. While walking between the stretch wrapping machine and the conveyor, the employee tripped over the stretch wrapping machine and fell to the ground, fracturing the lower back.

An employee was on an outdoor sign, installing a vinyl.  He was wearing a safety harness, and the lanyard was attached to a wooden part of the sign, which gave way.  He fell 15 to 18 feet to the ground below, injuring his head and torso.
An employee began experiencing dizziness, nausea, and cramping after returning to the office from a roofing jobsite. The employee was hospitalized for heat stress.

An employee was shimming a rotor assembly in a lathe to correct a run-out condition before turning the part in a CNC turning lathe. The tail stock foot pedal was actuated, closing the tail stock on and amputating her left index finger to the first knuckle.
An employee was burned by hot water.
A temporary employee was clearing a jam on a cotton swab machine and sustained a fingertip amputation to the left hand.

Employee was hospitalized after a cleaning hose came loose from the clean-in-place system.  The employee was sprayed in the face with cleaning solution. He was treated in a local ER and then transferred and admitted to Wellstar Cobb.

An employee was helping a forging hammer operator and was attempting to release a part lodged inside the hammer. The employee's hand tool became caught inside the point of operation and broke when the machine cycled. A piece of the hand tool ejected and struck the employee, breaking bones and lacerating the employee's leg. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was cleaning the batch mixer when the mixer pinched and amputated the fifth digit fingertip on the employee's left hand.
An employee was attempting to clear a jam in a blow molding machine that makes plastic bottles. The employee's right ring finger got caught in the machine and required medical amputation.
A driver was attempting to deliver packages to a private residence when he was attacked by two pit bulls. The driver sustained injuries to the arm and foot.

An employee was clearing a blockage in a pipeline and proceeded to blow the line with compressed air. There was a filter screen in the line. The lid on top of the filter screen blew off the filter striking the employee in the face. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured nose and other facial bones.

An employee was backing up a dump truck trailer to discharge the load of clay gravel fill when the truck tipped over on its side. He was slammed against the shift stick and steering wheel, breaking rib and back bones and hematomas on his legs. He required surgery.

An employee was cleaning the inside of tank with a pressure washer and contacted his left foot with the pressurized water blast. It cut through the top of his safety shoe and caused a one inch cut to the left foot behind the big toe area.  The employee was hospitalized.

An Ironworker was tying rebar 8 feet above ground. He hooked the rebar onto a wall with a hook and then leaned back and the wall hook slid off the rebar and the ironworker fell backwards approximately 8 feet to the crushed gravel ground injuring the right leg.
An employee used a step cart to get a box of gallon jugs from the top shelf for a customer. She lost her balance and came down awkwardly, fracturing her right leg and requiring surgery.
An employee was injured when a stack of steel beams fell and pinned him, striking him in the legs.
On or about May 23, 2016, an employee was moving a mail rack when her hand was smashed between the rack and a concrete column. Her right pinky fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee fell 10 feet to the ground from a scissor lift while working on a construction project. Upon impact, the employee broke his nose and other facial bones.
An employee fell from a ladder and was hospitalized.
While cutting a 2 x 4 piece of wood with a miter saw, an employee suffered amputations of the index to ring fingers.
An employee was repairing a check valve in a pipe and was burned by water that was 165-170 degrees Fahrenheit.
On October 19, 2016, approximately 7:30 AM, an employee fell approximately 5 feet while dismounting a front-end loader. The employee was hospitalized for a back injury.
An employee was splitting wood with a hydraulic splitter and got his right pinky finger caught between two pieces of wood amputating the fingertip.
An employee was shimming a hand (manual) header when his left hand was caught and crushed between the ram and the blocks.

On April 12, 2016, at about 7:05 p.m., an employee was trying to clean out pieces of fish from the 4-pound feed conveyor when the employee's fingers were caught by the machine's knife, amputating the right third and fourth fingertips.

On January 23, 2015, at approximately 6:30 p.m., a worker from the inside machine shop was training another employee on how to sand the face of a flange using a sanding disk mounted onto the tool rest of a lathe. The flange (part of a very long shaft) was on a lathe rotating at approximately 20 rpms. When the worker went to adjust the sanding disk, his left pinky at the first knuckle joint was amputated by one of the holes in the flange.
An employee was operating the mold machine and amputated his right thumb.
On Monday, April 4, 2016, an employee was hospitalized with a crushing injury to his right leg.
An employee was carrying plywood and suffered from heat exhaustion.

An employee used lacquer thinner to clean the lid of a glue pot over a barrel.  He then used a heated putty knife to clean the remaining glue from the lid. When the knife touched the lid, the fumes and thinner caused the lid and barrel to flash and catch on fire. The employee suffered first degree burns on his face and left hand.

An employee was helping to remove a belt from a pulley attached to a fan used in the ginning process. While moving the belt manually, his finger got pinched between the belt and pulley, partially amputating his right pinky fingertip.

An employee was using a pallet machine and was trying to clear a nail that was jammed in a nail bowl when the nailer came down and amputated the employee's left pinky fingertip. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time.
An employee slipped and fell striking the back of his head.
An employee was using a load device to move a metal ring for a manhole cover when he turned and fell backwards. The metal ring fell onto his ankle, fracturing it and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was replacing a bearing in a space heater when his leather glove was caught at the edge of the separator bar (the rotating mechanism inside of the heater) as it turned. His right thumb was caught between the separator bar and the outer shroud (the heater's fan with a filtration system) and was amputated from the first joint.
While cutting material using a table saw, an employee's fingers contacted the blade, resulting in a finger amputation on 3/1/16.
An employee was hospitalized due to injuries sustained when she fell to the floor at her desk.

An employee was standing in a box basket being lifted by a forklift, attempting to hang tarp, when the box basket tipped over. The employee fell from the forklift and fractured both knees, requiring hospitalization.
An employee amputated the right middle fingertip while using the die machine.
An employee was unloading a truck using a pallet jack. The employee's foot was caught between the pallet he was moving and a stationary pallet resulting in a broken left ankle.
On 6/16/15, an employee was injured when he slipped off the forks of a forklift and fell 5 to 6 feet. The employee was hospitalized with cracked ribs and a groin injury.
An employee suffered severe cuts to the left arm while cleaning a saw. The saw was not locked out at the time of the incident.
While descending from a roof, an employee fell 8 feet to the ground and injured his left lower leg.
An employee slipped on a wet floor and received knee injuries.
An employee fell down while walking, fracturing his left tibia and fibula.
Two employees were hospitalized after being struck by a third party vehicle in a construction zone at or around 2:45AM the morning of May 7, 2016.

An employee was helping coworkers trying to undo tension on a 1.5 ton come-a-long. The injured employee struck the angle brace that the come-a-long was attached to. The hook of the come-a-long broke free, striking the employee in the lower jaw/face.
An employee was operating a bulldozer to conduct site preparation work. Coworkers found him unconscious on the ground near the bulldozer with neck and arm injuries. He was hospitalized.

On October 10, 2016, at approximately 11:15 a.m., an employee was attempting to remove a load bar that had fallen off the ranks into the STC tank. While exiting the STC tank, the employee slipped and fell into the STC up to the waist, suffering heat and chemical burns to the lower body.
An employee was cutting metal when the outer steel fell, amputating the third finger on his right hand.

An employee was working with replacement belts when the belts tightened around his right-hand middle finger, partially amputating his fingertip. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
On September 9, 2015, at 8:50 a.m., an employee's bare hand made contact with an energized heating coil in a rooftop unit, resulting in second and third degree hand burns.

An employee removed a blow out preventer (BOP) from a well head. The BOP was suspended by the rig.  While suspended, the BOP started rotating catching the employee's left ring fingertip between the BOP and the stationary well head resulting in amputation.
A maintenance employee used their finger to unjam an ice cream carton filling machine. The equipment cycled and caught the employee's finger, causing a partial amputation of the left middle finger.
On February 10, 2017, at approximately 5:10 p.m., an employee was attempting to move a nitrogen tank when his fingers were smashed.
An employee was cleaning a guest room and got a splinter in her left thumb. She was later hospitalized for an infection.
On 1/14/15, an employee on his mail route accidentally swallowed a pen cap. The pen cap traveled to the employee's lung. The employee was hospitalized.
On 4/15/2015, at 11:15 a.m., an employee working on a pad mount transformer came in contact with the 7200V underground cable live wire. The employee sustained a first degree burn on the left hand.
The employee observed a broken rubber conveyor band and attempted to remove it. He reached into the conveyor power roller and amputated the right index finger and lacerated the middle finger.
An employee making a delivery fell off the lift gate on the back of his truck, struck the ground below, and broke his lower right arm.

An employee was operating a debarker at a lumber yard.  A limb got stuck and the employee attempted to remove it by wrapping the chain around the limb and using the hoist. The limb came free and hit the deck where the employee was standing and then hit the employee in the foot.

An employee was using an Oxy/Acetylene torch to cut steel to fix a machine in the fabrication shop. The acetylene line burst and caught the employee's jacket on fire. The employee was hospitalized with second degree burns to his right forearm.
An employee was on top of a shopping cart trying to reach a tote of lettuce on an upper shelf. The employee then fell and injured the left leg.
An employee was cleaning the fryer, passed out and struck their head on part of the fry station resulting in a bump on the back of the head.
An employee tripped on an uneven floor surface and suffered a broken hip.
An employee was pushing a food tray cart when it fell on top of her. She was hospitalized overnight with an injured pelvis.
An employee's finger was crushed by the t-pusher of the monorail system during maintenance.
An employee was making adjustments to a machine when the roller mechanism came down and struck his thumb fracturing it.
While removing a clog in a coffee bean vacuum, an employee's right index finger came into contact with rotating parts, partially amputating it.

An employee was performing quality assurance/control on a stacker unit when the unit jammed. As the employee attempted to clear the jam, the stacker unit energized and the employee's right leg was caught and fractured between the roller and the kick-out.
On November 8, 2016, an employee slipped and fell while walking in the parking lot, suffering a fractured neck.
An employee's fingertip was amputated in a machine.

An employee had just finished nailing a fence panel using a nail gun. As he extended his arm down into a resting/hanging position with his finger still on the trigger, another employee walked behind him and was struck in the lower leg with the nail gun, which actuated and drove a nail into his leg. The injured employee was hospitalized overnight.

An employee tried to prevent a turkey neck from going through the peeler. The employee's glove got caught in the peeler rollers, which crushed the left middle fingertip. The fingertip was amputated below the fingernail.
An employee's right index finger and knuckle were fractured after his glove got caught in a conveyor.
An employee was loading metal stock into a CNC machine when his right thumb struck against the machine and was lacerated. He was hospitalized when the laceration became infected.
An employee fell off a 10 foot ladder while coming down from the roof after performing maintenance.
An employee grabbed a metal frame from the floor and cut his right thumb. The employee was hospitalized for surgery on the thumb's tendon.

An employee was moving a toolbox on wheels to set up for his shift. It struck a stationary toolbox and the two handles were close enough in height that the employee's left middle finger was pinched off between the two handles. As part of the surgical repair the distal phalange was removed in order to accommodate the formation of a dermal flap.
An employee fell in the hallway after losing her balance, breaking her left arm.

An employee was standing on a ladder plugging in the garage door opener motor. He began to fall and grabbed the metal frame that holds the motor to the ceiling. When his hand contacted the metal, he sustained a laceration to the first knuckle of his left ring finger and his pinky finger was amputated.
An employee was injured in a motor vehicle accident while performing work related duties.
An employee was slicing a tomato using the meat/cheese slicer and amputated the right index fingertip.

An employee was preparing to offload a compressor from a delivery truck and slipped on snow that had accumulated on the lift gate.  The employee fell into the bed of the truck and the compressor landed on and fractured his ankle.

On September 7, 2015, at about 04:00 PM, an employee fell from a 4- to 5-foot scaffold while cutting an aluminum structure beam with a chain saw. The saw kicked back, causing the employee to lose his balance and fall to the concrete floor. He sustained a head laceration and was hospitalized.

An employee was operating an overhead crane with the right hand and supporting the part being lifted with the left hand. The employee's left ring fingertip was pinched between the part and the crane while hoisting resulting in the amputation of the fingertip.
An employee attempted to retrieve a piece of ceramic material that broke off into the tape laminator machine he was using. His right index and middle fingertips were amputated by the machinery.
Employees were staging materials.  An employee was struck in the back by a column that fell off of the forks of a skid steer resulting in a fractured hip.
An employee injured his/her back while stocking kitchen materials on a shelf.

An employee got out of a garbage truck to loosen a turnbuckle on the back of the truck. Another truck exiting the dump stopped to talk. As the exiting truck began to move again, the turnbuckle popped. The employee stepped backwards (towards exiting truck) to regain balance. The employee's foot was run over by the rear axle of the exiting truck.
An employee was on his security rounds at a customer's site when he stubbed his toe on a metal plate. His toe broke and required overnight hospitalization.

An employee was installing a new shear in the shop. He had removed the fuses from the bottom of the disconnect and began wiring the new shear into the box when an arc flash occurred, causing an electrical burn to his left forearm. The box was not locked out from its energy source at the time of the incident.
An employee was checking a collection box and lost his balance as he stood up. As he attempted to jump the front of the collection box ditch, the impact of the landing fractured his lower left leg.
While working at the cash register, an employee tripped on a guest, fell to the floor, and suffered a laceration above his left eyebrow.
An employee was unhanging wood scraps from an edger when his left hand got caught in a belt and sprocket, amputating his left ring finger and causing other injuries to his left hand.

An employee was stacking boxes of documents on a pallet when he fell 16 feet through an opening in an adjacent guardrail to the concrete floor below. He fractured his right patella, left elbow, left wrist and humerus, facial bones, and left femur. He also suffered head lacerations.
An employee tripped and fell in the concrete parking lot, fracturing a hip.
On or about August 8, 2016, an employee was exposed to excessive heat while tearing off a flat roof and was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.
An employee was attempting to light a pilot light on a gas oven when a flash fire occurred. The employee sustained first degree burns to the hands and face.
After checking a package, an employee turned around and started walking. A forklift stopped short near her, and she tripped over the forks or lost her balance and fell, injuring her knee.
An employee was walking down the hall, lost her balance, and fell breaking her humerus.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and broke her wrist.
An employee amputated the tip of a thumb on a meat slicer when the handle broke.

Four employees were moving a large galvanized steel gate from inside the shop to the outside. One employee went and moved a cart with an auger out of the way.  The cart had been sitting on a 1-foot-wide by 6-feet-long piece of chain link mesh, which became elevated off the ground after the cart was moved. The employee tripped over the piece of chain link mesh, falling and breaking the fibula and tibia bones in his leg.
On January 12, 2017, an employee's left hand contacted the blade of a miter saw during work activities. His hand was lacerated, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was servicing a forklift and the left index finger was caught in a moving pulley resulting in surgical amputation of the fingertip.
On April 23, 2015, at 6:45 a.m., an employee became pinned between a truss gantry and a table, causing a compression injury to his lower torso. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's hands were caught in a Stephan mixing machine used for mixing dough and amputated his right-hand index and middle fingers.

At approximately 3:45 AM on April 1, 2015, at the Interbake Foods LLC bakery in North Sioux City, South Dakota, the injured employee was helping other employees move a rotary molder machine by hand. While moving the machine, his right index fingertip was amputated halfway down his fingernail by the hinge on a 2' x 2' control panel box attached to the rotary machine.
An employee was sitting on a chair when she slipped out of the chair, fell forward onto her knees, and then landed on her left arm. She broke her left humerus, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee became nauseous and began vomiting. He was hospitalized overnight for heat exhaustion.
An employee's right hand was caught while removing a mold jam causing his right hand to be severely pinched. The resulting injury required surgery.
An employee was on ski patrol on a run and struck a rock under the snow fracturing the right leg.
Employee slipped on ice resulting in a broken nose and a back injury. Employee has been hospitalized since January 18, 2015.
On January 4, 2017, an employee was replacing a paper roll on a mill polisher machine when his left thumb was caught in a pinch point on the machine. His left thumb tip was surgically amputated.

A project superintendent was walking on a mezzanine made of a series of steel joists with sheets of plywood used for decking.  The employee fell through an unguarded area of the mezzanine, through the mezzanine floor and into an office below, where he hit his head on a desk.  The employee was transported to an area hospital where he was admitted.

An employee was unloading material from the truck at a customer's location when he fell out of the truck approximately 4-5 feet. The employee sustained a broken sternum and ribs and internal bleeding around the lungs.

An employee was changing out a part on a forklift mast. When a coworker pushed the shift lever, the mast shifted over two fingers on his left hand, jamming them against the mast resulting in amputation.
An employee was running a band saw in automatic mode when the clamp closed on his thumb tip as he attempted to grab a part. When he pulled his thumb tip out, the skin and nail were amputated.

An employee was exiting the chip box of a bucket truck. When he moved his left foot off of the tailgate, his right foot slipped due to the weight shifting and he lost control of his footing. He fell and suffered internal bleeding near the kidney.

An employee was delivering a pallet of roof shingles to a low-sloped roof using a boom truck with a fork attachment. The pallet of roof shingles slipped off of the forks and crashed through the roof to the interior of the home. The employee was knocked/dragged into the hole along with the pallet. He fell approximately 20 feet to the lower surface and was hospitalized with two broken ribs.
An employee was changing a valve on a trailer when the valve popped, causing the hose to disconnect and swing. The employee was exposed to propylene, requiring hospitalization for chemical burns.
An employee stepped off the bottom step of a fixed ladder at the crossover to a four-foot high conveyor and onto a piece of wood scrap. The employee suffered a twisted right ankle.

A temporary employee suffered a partial amputation of the distal phalanx (fingertip bone) on her right hand. The employee's finger was caught between the metal spindle of a fabric roller and the "pay-out cradle" when she was loading an 87 pound canvas roll into the cutting machine. The cause of the amputation was not related to the fabric cutting mechanism. The amputation was a result of her finger being pinched between the end of the fabric spindle that extends through the shaft of the fabric roll and the cradle which holds that spindle in place.
On February 4, 2015, a letter carrier delivering mail slipped on a block of ice as they were walking down the stairs from a residential home.
An employee was cleaning a window frame with alcohol when sparks from a nearby grinder ignited the alcohol, burning the employee.
A cow carcass fell from the shackle striking the employee on the right leg and fracturing it.
An employee was involved in an accident that resulted in the partial amputation of the left pinky finger.
An employee was loading a semi trailer with product using a pallet rider. She got pinned between the pallet rider and the wall of the semi resulting in a fractured pelvis.
An employee suffered a right index fingertip amputation while closing a parking gate.

An employee had stopped at a rest area and was walking around the front of his vehicle when he was struck by the front/passenger area of his vehicle as it rolled forward and turned to the right. He was pinned between his truck and an adjacent trailer, breaking his pelvis, rupturing his spleen, and injuring his knee.
An employee fainted during farming operations possibly due to heat stress and was hospitalized.
While performing trash pickup, an employee slipped/fell from the rear of the truck. The employee suffered a road rash to the arm and leg, as well as a swollen ankle.

An employee was fixing a hunting tree stand on the business owner's property. He was standing on a ladder tightening a strap with a ratcheting tool. The strap broke as he was tightening it, causing him to lose his balance and fall approximately 6 feet to the ground. He was hospitalized with fractured vertebrae.

An employee finished installing switches. While cleaning up and removing the rubber cover up used to protect from inadvertent contact, he touched the wire with more than 50 volts, resulting in 1st, 2nd, and 3rd degree burns to both arms.
An employee was removing a forklift's brakes as part of periodic maintenance when the brake's drum (weighing 150 pounds) fell down, amputating the employee's right index finger without bone loss.
On July 10, 2015, an employee scratched his left ring finger while placing the door back on an HVAC unit he was servicing. The finger became infected and required hospitalization.
During a fall protection training session, an employee was choked unconscious from the fall protection system.

A crew of employees was performing workover services. The crew was attempting to break out a crossover sub, on top of the casing scraper, using tongs. The employee was using a 36-inch wrench on top of the tongs. The tong operator engaged the tong before the employee removed his hand. The tong pinched the employee's finger between the tong and the wrench. The employee lost the fingertip of his right middle finger.
An employee utilizing the pace roll groover received a crushing injury to the right index finger that resulted in a partial amputation.
An employee was cutting wood with a notching machine when the machine's saw blade amputated the employee's left middle finger.
An employee was walking across the floor when she tripped on her shoe and fell. She suffered a contusion and fracture to her forearm.

An employee was helping to load a trailer in the loading bay and was standing at the rear end of the trailer on the driver's side. He was using a piece of wood on the edge of the trailer bed to help locate the center and took a step forward. He then fell into the four-step stairway and fractured four ribs.

An employee was setting the axle into the axle bracket. The employee used his hands to unjam the axle from the axle bracket. When the axle came free, the employee's middle fingertip was amputated between the axle and the axle bracket.
An employee fell approximately 4 feet while descending a 6 foot portable ladder stand. The employee got a leg caught during the fall and fractured it, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
A maintenance employee was cutting 36-inch pipe with a cutting torch when his right hand was crushed between the pipe flange and the cutting table. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was driving a pallet jack when he pressed the wrong direction on the machine and caught his fingers in between the pallet jack and a rack.
An employee climbed a tree and then fell 40 feet to the ground. The employee sustained a fractured pelvis, broken heel, broken ankles, a concussion and fractured vertebrae.
An employee fractured an arm in two places while working on a product line and was hospitalized.

An employee was walking across the cafeteria when she tripped on the edge of a fixed metal floor ramp used to move salad carts into the cooler. She fell on the floor, breaking her left hip. She was hospitalized for surgery.

Employees were installing wood trusses on the interior 4th floor level of a newly constructed multi-family dwelling when one employee fell approximately 9 feet to lower level. The injured employee's head struck a nail gun that he was operating when he hit the floor. The injury occurred on January 9, 2015, at approximately 1 p.m.

An employee was hospitalized after sustaining an injury to his right ring finger in the coil bay.  The employee caught his right ring finger between a C-hook and a coil while operating an overhead crane remotely.
An employee's hand was injured while using a porta power hand held hydraulic press to change bushings on a truck. The employee's hand was pinched between the porta power and the truck frame.

An employee was attempting to enter the attic area of a home to conduct an inspection. The employee's ladder slipped from position, causing him to fall 10 to 12 feet to the ground, injuring his vertebra and left heel.

An employee was helping to set up a trellis from a man basket being lifted by forklift. The basket sat directly on top of the forks, approximately 14-to 16-feet-high. When the employee moved to the end of the basket, the basket tipped and he fell out. The basket then landed on top of him. He broke teeth, fractured multiple ribs, broke his back, and suffered internal stomach bleeding. The basket was not secured at the time of the incident.

An employee was using propane to heat up a solenoid on a diesel pump when the underground pump turned on, resulting in diesel making contact with the propane heater. The diesel and propane ignited, burning the employee's arms.

An employee was moving a pallet with a manual pallet jack when a forklift operator struck the employee while making a U-turn. The employee fell to the ground and suffered a possible hip fracture, requiring surgery.
Employee tripped, fell over a pallet, and broke femur. Employee was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was operating a boring mill machine while his right hand rested on top of a metal beam on the shuttle. The beam moved during the operation of the machine and pinched his right middle fingertip between it and another metal beam. His fingertip was amputated.
Employees were taking down a scaffold and the scaffold collapsed. An employee suffered a broken left ankle and wrist and a fractured right knee.

An employee was driving a tractor pulling a stainless steel trailer containing a chemical solution when he felt an explosion from the trailer. He exited the tractor and was engulfed in fumes, causing loss of eyesight, difficulty speaking, and chest and throat irritation. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning out excess meat from a meat grinder and amputated two fingers on the right hand.
An employee received electrical burns from an arc blast at a well site while working on pump service.
An employee was discovered sitting in his car just after break. The employee was unresponsive and diagnosed with severe dehydration possibly due to overheating.

An employee was getting ready to leave for the day after fixing the rear axle of a vehicle outside when his legs started to spasm. He began sweating profusely and got dizzy. Paramedics gave him IV fluids and the employee felt better, however, he was hospitalized overnight for observation of dehydration.
An employee was operating a forklift. While turning into an aisle, the employee lost control of the forklift and put his left hand out catching his left thumb between the forklift and the racking.
An employee suffered a right thumb amputation while working on a horizontal lathe.

On December 10, 2015, at approximately 1:50 AM, a Southern Foods Group, LLC, employee was hospitalized with 2nd degree burns to his left arm, upper chest, and right shoulder after being splashed by hot water from a disconnected hot water line that he thought was empty while he was checking lines and switching circuits.
An employee was recording the serial numbers located on the side of wooden crates containing parts. One or more of the wooden crates fell on the employee, breaking the employee's ankle and hip.

On September 3, 2015, at 3:30 p.m., an employee's left pinky finger got caught in the lift chain of a forklift. The bottom third of his pinky finger was amputated, requiring overnight hospitalization.
On 12/13/16, an employee was cutting a piece of wood on a table saw when the wood jumped and the employee's thumb was pulled into the blade. His left thumb was severely lacerated.

An employee was taping drywall while standing on a baker scaffold approximately 5 feet above ground level when he fell to the floor below. He fell on his head, suffering a fractured skull and several broken ribs. He was hospitalized.
One employee was hospitalized when he fell from a roof during a home inspection and fractured his skull.
An employee was removing a piece of pipe when he lost his balance and fell approximately 12 feet to the ground. He bruised his lung and broke his wrist and ribs.
An employee slipped on a wet floor and fractured her lower leg.

An employee was cleaning the chain on a motorcycle with a rag when the rag was caught in the chain. The employee's fingers were then pulled into the chain, amputating the right middle and pointer fingertips. The motorcycle wheel was spinning at the time.
An employee was hand grinding a flat piece of metal that was held in place by a vice. The piece of metal slipped out of the vice striking the employee and cutting the right side of his neck.
While an employee was grinding metal materials with a side grinder, the wheel of the grinder kicked back and lacerated his left arm.
An employee fell to the floor while helping an inpatient get into a bed, injuring a knee and requiring hospitalization.

On October 4, 2016, at approximately 10:00 AM, an employee was operating a small full-revolution clutch mechanical power bench press, forming and punching recliner hardware.  The press was equipped with two palm buttons, light curtains, and two mechanical side guards. Unexpectedly, the top ram came down and pinned the employee's left hand against the bottom half of the die.  She suffered broken fingers and was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was sorting papers on the floor of her cubicle.  She went to the copier and when she returned, she stepped on a pile of the papers and slipped and fell, fracturing her left ankle.
An employee was picking up a socket from the floor when a box from the upper shelf of the overstock wall fell and struck the employee's lower back causing a fracture to the lower back.
An employee was injured and hospitalized while assisting a resident from a wheelchair to the bed. The employee fell and fractured the left shoulder.

On or about 3/23/2016, an employee was unloading a truck when a coworker operating a PIV backed into him, pinning him between the PIV and another PIV. He suffered a crushing injury to the left knee and leg.
On June 15, 2016, at 0945, an employee contacted high voltage while replacing a switchgear, suffering second and third degree burns to the hand.
An employee was using an overhead crane to move a piece of equipment into place when the piece fell and struck the employee's lower leg. The injury required surgery to repair.
Employee suffered an amputation injury to his right hand pinky finger while performing maintenance work on the Ferris Wheel located at the theme park.

An employee was working in the rod basket of a well-servicing rig when the operator raised the block into the rig derrick. The block bumped the basket, and the employee grabbed the side. His left middle finger got caught between the basket and the derrick, pinching off the end of his finger. The end of his left middle finger was surgically amputated (including bone).
On May 6, 2015, an employee directing traffic in the receiving area was struck by a vehicle operated by another employee driving in the wrong direction down a one-way street.
An employee slipped inside the walk-in freezer, breaking the right hip.
An employee and a coworker were rolling tubes with flanges on the ends when the employee's pinky finger was crushed and amputated under the flange.
While taking the trash out, an employee slipped and fell on the concrete and received abrasions on her arm. She later started coughing up blood and was hospitalized.

A housekeeping employee was cleaning up a Formalin spill. The Formalin was covered with a spill-X absorbent to soak up the chemical.  As the employee was scooping up the absorbent her head started hurting, she felt dizzy, and she passed out.
Two employees were struck by amine and suffered burns, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized after a sliver from a wire brush punctured his finger and the wound became infected and needed surgery.
While installing fascia and soffit, an employee slipped on a roof tile and fell from the roof, fracturing a leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee's left index finger was amputated between the first and second knuckle by the cutting head on the DCM sleeve cut machine.

An employee was using a circular saw to cut 2x4 pieces of wood when the saw kicked back and struck the employee's left hand, amputating the ring finger at the middle joint and the middle finger just below the fingernail. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was helping coworkers move a canoe rack when it dropped on his right ring finger, partially amputating his fingertip.

On or about August 2, 2016, at approximately 3:30 p.m., an employee was helping to install roofing underlayment when he stepped on wet membrane material and slid off the roof, falling more than 12 feet to the ground below and lacerating his head and tongue.
An employee was opening a tablet of Metamucil to give to a resident and suffered a severe allergic reaction resulting in anaphylaxis and hospitalization.
An employee suffered an allergic reaction to latex gloves.

Three employees attempted to repair a fill slide on the lower part of a die, which would not actuate during production. The lower die was mostly disassembled; it is air-powered when installed. They used air pressure to manually troubleshoot the issue. They further disassembled the die. The injured employee placed his hand on the die shoe, which activated the die, crushing his left-hand pinky and ring finger.
On August 4, 2016, an employee tripped over a projector's flexible cord, fell into a door, and struck their head, requiring hospitalization for head trauma.

An employee was melting butter in 4 to 5 quart pot on a gas stove when the pot caught on fire. A co-worker used a fire extinguisher to put out the fire. The injured employee took the pot with hot butter and while walking towards the door leading to a hallway and outside the building, she fell on the kitchen floor. The hot butter burned her right arm and thigh. She was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was checking the sensor of a valve. As he was closing the lid, he lost control of it. When he attempted to grab the lid so it did not slam, it crushed and partially amputated his right third fingernail.
An employee was working on a CNC machine. The employee stepped back and tripped on the CNC subframe resulting in injury to the lower left leg and hospitalization.

An employee was operating a shear to cut metal when the shear's control activated while the employee's hand was in the point of contact. The employee's right middle finger was amputated (half an inch) by the blade.
An employee was coming down from their workstation, missed the last step and fractured their leg.

An employee was on the ground helping a front-end loader recover a disabled vehicle (semi/tractor). The operator of the front-end loader did not see the employee and dropped the bucket, which struck the employee and caused back and lung injuries.

Employee sustained a foot injury on 1/14/15 when he stepped on a staple. Employee continued to report pain in the foot.  Employee visited the emergency room on 1/24/15. Employee reported to work on 1/26/15 with continued pain in the foot and was sent to the doctor. The employee was subsequently hospitalized for treatment of cellulitis.
On 1/20/2016 at approximately noon, an employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell, striking her head. The employee was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was holding the corner of a piece of 3/8" steel plate as it was being cut by a shear. The blade failed to cut but caused the plate to tip, applying pressure to the plate corner, which amputated the employee's right middle fingertip.

An employee sustained an injury to his left pinky finger as he was polishing a coil with a CNC lathe. The door safety interlocks were disengaged allowing the employee to polish parts of the coil as the machine was running.

An employee working at a conveyor line was trying to remove a can from underneath a pallet. A forklift driver did not see her and delivered the next pallet, which pushed the pallet that was staged on the conveyor. The employee's ankle was pinned between the pallets and a support beam on the conveyor, and she suffered compound fractures to her tibia and fibula.

An employee was helping a coworker move a guide cart. The employee was pulling the cart while the coworker was pushing it. After the cart came over a hump, it had to be pulled and pushed through four metal beams. The cart struck one of the beams, causing it to come to an abrupt stop. The guide shifted, pinching and fracturing the employee's right ring fingertip.
An employee was trying to grab a small piece a wood that was being cut with a circular saw when his left hand contacted the blade, lacerating his index finger.

Two employees were at Blackpoint Marina to repair a fuel leak on a customer's boat. The employees identified a corroded fuel valve (pickup) and replaced it. They were checking for additional leaks when a small explosion occurred in the bilge area. The ignition source may have been static electricity from a cell phone. Both employees received burns to their hands and faces and were hospitalized.
The employee was walking back from a patient's room by the nursing station, tripped and struck her left arm on the nursing desk fracturing it.
An employee was delivering mail to a residential home and cut their finger on a mailbox resulting in amputation of the finger.

The employee was working with another employee to set up a new operator valve system. While observing the operation of the valve system, one of the employees placed his hand into the opening of the plates and the plates closed onto his fingers.  The employee's index and middle fingers were amputated. There was no guard on the machine at the time.
An employee was loading baggage into a tractor's passenger side when the tractor operator began to drive and ran over the employee's foot, injuring her right ankle.
An employee was trying to close the back door, which was not closing properly. When she forced it closed, it slammed on her left little finger and amputated the fingertip.
An employee's leg was amputated after being caught in an auger.

An employee was working on a crane that was out of service. He went and got a ladder and put the ladder on the spreader bar of the crane. He climbed about 8 to 10 feet up the ladder when it slipped out from under him. He fell and broke his right shoulder.
An employee was working from a 6-foot step ladder when the ground gave way. The employee fell off of the ladder and hit a concrete window well, breaking four ribs on his right side.
An employee was attacked while on duty. The employee was hospitalized with a broken hip.
While working on a piece of equipment, an employee fell through a second-story hole in the floor to the concrete below, suffering a skull/facial fracture.
Employee was struck by an excavator while compacting soil with a Wacker Packer vibratory plate.  The employee's ankle was dislocated. He was admitted to the hospital and underwent surgery.
While cutting boards of wood on an up-cut saw, an employee's right thumb and part of his index finger were amputated by the saw blade.

On 8/30/16, an employee was delivering product to the store and suffered serious injury to his left thumb when backing up a powered pallet jack into the freezer and striking his thumb on the locking mechanism on the door.
An employee became dehydrated while working at a construction site. The employee began to cramp and was taken to the hospital where he was administered IV fluids and kept overnight.
An employee was descending a 3 foot ladder in a retail store when she missed a step and fell to the ground. She was hospitalized overnight with a possible knee fracture.
An employee was moving a beam with an overhead crane when the beam fell on his right leg, breaking it. He was hospitalized.

An employee fell while descending a ladder. The ladder slipped, causing the employee to fall to the hard ground surface below. The ladder also landed on top of the employee after the initial fall. The employee sustained fractures to the femur, as well as a knee injury, and required surgery.

An employee was using a pressure washer to clean the floor. He stopped to talk to his supervisor and placed the nozzle on his right foot. He accidentally squeezed the trigger on his foot, releasing 250-degree Fahrenheit water onto his foot.
An employee was working on a new recycler, when a piece of the recycler fell on and partially amputated the employee's middle finger.
An employee's index finger was lacerated and partially amputated while adjusting a timing belt on a bagging machine. The machine was not locked out at the time.
An employee was cutting a beam with a torch. When the beam was cut, it rolled and fell on and crushed both of the employee's feet.
An employee stepped into a hole and fell 14 feet while welding on an I-beam, fracturing the right shoulder and tailbone.

An employee was using a skid steer with an auger attachment to drill holes in the ground. The auger came off the skid steer and the employee jumped out of the way into a 4-foot deep trench. The auger fell on top of the employee causing bruises.

An employee was hooking a winch cable from a truck to a crane while standing between them. The truck was positioned up hill from the crane. As the employee was connecting the winch line, the truck slid down the icy hill and pinned the employee against the crane. The employee suffered soft tissue damage in the left shoulder.
An employee degloved his thumb and amputated a finger on the left hand while operating a clamper machine.

While the employees were picking up tubing, a worker grabbed the bell and pulled it back.  The elevator slipped and caught his finger between the horn's elevator and the bottom of the bell.  His middle finger was amputated from the finger nail to the first knuckle of the finger.  He was taken to the hospital, treated and released.
An employee was surveying an area for future work while standing on an 8-foot A-frame ladder. He fell from the ladder, breaking his ribs and puncturing his lung.

On or about March 9, 2016, an employee was working with an internal combustion machine in the basement of a new construction residential house when he collapsed. The employee was overexposed to carbon monoxide and hospitalized.
An employee was operating a pasting machine when he began feeling ill. He went to the break room and experience a rapid heart beat. He was hospitalized overnight for heat exhaustion.
An employee was washing windows while standing on a 4-foot stepladder. When she stepped back off of the ladder, she twisted and broke her left ankle, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
Employer reported that at about 10:15 a.m. on Friday, January 23rd, an employee was leaving a patient's room and tripped and fell, breaking the bones at the shoulder joint.

An employee was helping to adjust equipment. She tripped as she was walking around the equipment. When she reached out to catch her fall, her right hand entered the point of operation. The equipment activated, pinching and amputating her right pinky finger between the stockholder tab and discharge table.

On or about July 7, 2016, at 5:00 p.m., an employee fell down the marble staircase as she was leaving for the day. She was hospitalized with a lacerated bottom lip, loose teeth, dislocated right elbow, fractured right ulna and radius, concussion, and multiple bruises.

An employee was moving product from the back of one trailer to another trailer when the vehicle began to move. The employee attempted to move from the stationary trailer to the moving trailer but fell off, fracturing his right tibia/fibula.

The employee went to a 5-drawer office cabinet and pulled the top drawer open. The two drawers on the bottom came out at the same time the top drawer was open and the entire cabinet fell over and landed on the employee. The employee injured her hip and sustained lacerations to her legs and upper body.
While cleaning up in the saw area, an employee attempted to remove scrap from a scrap conveyor. His hand was caught by the belt and pulley, and his radius and ulna were fractured.

On 5/31/16, a worker sustained the amputation of several fingers from his left hand while attempting to clean fluff material from the side of a doffer roll on a carding line while the machine was running.
An employee was cleaning the vertical mixing shaft on Mixer #3 and got his hair caught in the mixer shaft. The employee was scalped.

An employee was delivering mail when he slipped on ice and fell striking his head and shoulder on the pavement.  The employee was disoriented and could not answer basic questions. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was moving 55 gallon drums and smashed a finger between a drum and the barrel picker. The fingertip was amputated below the thumb nail.
An employee was lifting sheet metal to put in the dumpster when he felt a bubble-like substance, resulting in a hernia.

An employee was cutting and grinding metal on a building column to prepare it for painting. A backhoe nearby lurched and pinned the employee between the backhoe bucket and the building column, injuring (hematoma) the employee's left thigh requiring surgery.

An employee was guiding a palm tree that a front-end loader was loading onto a work vehicle when the strap holding the tree slipped, causing the tree to shift and strike the employee. The employee suffered a head contusion.

An employee was working on the second step of a six-foot ladder in the backroom sorting through hardware bins. The employee began to come down the ladder and missed the last rung. The employee fell and broke the left hip.
An employee fell on slick floors that were being mopped.
An employee ingested Tilex cleaning solution.
Employee was cleaning a room. When she bent down to clean an area inside the door frame, the door swung shut, and severed the employee's right pinky finger at the second joint.

On 7/7/15, an employee helped a coworker load a flatbed truck. The load already on the truck shifted, and the stacked material dislodged. The galvanized material fell and struck the employee's hard hat and his ribs. He was hospitalized for observation and testing.

An employee had just finished lifting a shale bin using two loaders (one with a stinger, chain, and lifting equipment) in order to place matting underneath. Once the matting was in place, the employee directed the loader to lower the bin until there was enough slack in the lifting chain to remove it. As the employee grabbed the eye of the lifting chain to unhook it, the operator of the loader bumped the controls with his knee, causing the chain to tighten and pinch the employee's right middle finger between the bin and the chain. The employee's right middle finger was amputated between the middle and upper joint, and the employee was hospitalized.

An employee was driving a golf cart into the storage area to park it for the day. He attempted to prevent the door from closing using his foot. His foot and leg got pinned between the golf cart and the door.
An employee was engaged in sanitation of the meat blender in the blend room and amputated the right thumb.

An employee was helping a coworker place a forklift battery into a forklift when the battery fell over on its side and smashed two of the employee's left-hand fingers (3rd and 4th finger) between the battery and the concrete floor.
An employee was using a portable bandsaw to cut a metal I-beam when the saw blade amputated the employee's left index finger.
An employee's left index finger was partially amputated to the first knuckle while he was using a panel saw to cut the edge off of a board.

An employee was helping another employee line up two heating plates that weighed approximately 2,000 pounds. The second employee signaled the forklift operator to set the plate down. When the forklift operator lowered the plate too quickly, the injured employee could not get his left thumb out of the way, causing the tip of his thumb to be amputated between the plates.

An employee was guiding a hydraulic cylinder ram into its storage rack while it was supported by a small jib crane. As he was guiding the cylinder, the ram slowly retracted. The head of the ram then pinched the employee's finger against the bolt and the frame, crushing and partially amputating his right index finger.

An employee was driving a utility vehicle out of the north side of the large transfer building when he turned and struck a parked roll-off truck. The employee struck the roll-off truck with his chest and was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a partial amputation at the planer mill.
An employee was unloading pipe racks when a rack fell on and broke the employee's leg.
An employee was cleaning a H2S (hydrogen sulfide) tower using a H2O2 (hydrogen peroxide) chemical when a chemical explosion occurred. The employee suffered burns to an ear and leg.
An employee was dumping a tray of water when her right hand struck the side of a machine. She suffered a contusion that required surgery. The machine was unguarded at the time.

An employee bent down to check an in-ground water meter when something punctured his knee. He kept working and washed it off later. Over the ensuing weekend it became swollen with a red line down his leg. He was later admitted for an infection.
An employee was putting metal bands into a trash can when his left index finger was caught between the steel cans, partially amputating the finger at the nail.

An employee was installing a sign for a newly constructed gas station and was using a 14-foot extension ladder along with some hand tools. When he began to descend the ladder, it slid to the side. He then fell 12 feet to the ground below and injured his back, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was trying to remove material that was stuck in the trimming machine when the blade came down and partially amputated his left index finger without bone loss.
An employee was slicing a bone-in NY strip steak when the bone caught his thumb and pulled it into the saw blade.
While moving a table, an employee slipped and fell to the floor, fracturing his right hip.
An employee working at a powerhouse was splashed with a caustic solution made up of water and drain cleaner, suffering chemical burns.
Employee hospitalized due to second degree burns from contact with hot product/stock.
An employee suffered a lower back injury while leaning over and attempting to lift a patient's legs, which were hanging over the bed.

On April 16, 2015, at about 3 pm, an employee was standing on a step ladder placing boxes on a shelf. He fell to the floor and experienced a cut on the head, a fractured right wrist, back pain, and a concussion. He was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was packaging lunch meat containers on a conveyor line when one of the container lids became dislodged. When she tried to retrieve the lid, her fingers were caught in the middle of the two adjoining conveyer lines. Her right ring and middle fingers were severely lacerated, and her ring finger had to be medically amputated.

An employee was dismantling scaffolding when a board became jammed. When the employee attempted to unjam the board, he lost his footing and fell through the space between the edge of the scaffold board and the wall of the building and struck the ground below. He broke two wrists and his hip.
An employee fell while walking into an office.
An employee was getting equipment out of the shed located behind the main building. He slipped and fell, fracturing his ankle.

An employee was installing a new fertilizer pump and hoisting it up with a chain when a link on the chain broke. The pump fell and struck the employee in the left leg causing a severe laceration and breaking the lower leg.
An employee was standing on a chair to unplug something and fell injuring their ankle, requiring surgery.
An employee was hospitalized after he was shot in the leg.  The employee was in the parking lot after getting off shift.  The gun was in his backpack that dropped on the floor, setting the gun off.
While carrying a machine with a cutting edge guard, an employee tripped and the guard of the machine crushed the employee's four fingers.

An employee had greased a chain drive on a label machine. He was cleaning excess lubricant with a paper towel when the towel got caught in the sprocket and pulled his finger in, amputating his fingertip.
An employee's right hand got crushed when caught in the nip point between two rollers on a paper winder. The employee's middle and ring fingers were involved.

An employee was sitting down at the Service Operations Desk when he began to feel dizzy and light headed. When he got up he fell to the floor of the service drive. After being assisted by the other associates he was transported to the hospital and diagnosed with heat exhaustion. The temperature at the time of the incident was 86 degrees with the previous 6 hours being between 89 and 91 degrees.

An employee was injured when picking up some steel plates from a pallet. When one piece of steel started to slip, he tried to catch it with the other hand.  His middle finger became pinched between two pieces of steel. He required surgery.
An employee was walking to the front of the chicken house when he was hit from behind by a forklift. He suffered four fractured ribs, a fractured pelvis, a punctured lung, and a lacerated liver.
An employee was running the pneumatic press when the part that he was working shifted.  The space bar that he was using struck him in the head.
An employee was walking to assist a coworker on another machine when he tripped over a pallet strap that was on the floor and fell to the ground, breaking his femur and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a jack to elevate a truck and change a spring. The jack slipped from under the truck and hit the employee's hand.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet when a series of unbraced roof trusses he was working on collapsed. The employee's legs were pinned in the debris pile of the collapsed trusses.
An employee's index finger was cut by a conveyor belt. The belt was unguarded at the time.
An employee was descending a ladder after loading a high ceiling when he fell from the third rung to the floor, fracturing his vertebrae.

Two employees were moving a concrete pipe. They were on either side of the pipe. The first employee was moving the jeeper. The injured employee saw the first employee move the jeeper and went to roll the pipe onto the jeeper as well. He then ended up on the ground and received an electrical shock to his entire body.
An employee was repairing an axle hub when a bolt from the hub came out of the air gun and struck the employee's left index finger. The finger was fractured.

At approximately 09:00 a.m., an employee entered the attic area of the building to look for extra ceiling panels. He was making his way through the attic when he came across a surface that appeared to be concrete (this was actually the backside of the sheetrock that served as a ceiling to the area below). When he placed his foot on the surface, the sheetrock collapsed, and he fell from the 18-foot ceiling to the concrete below. He struck an automotive training aid tire with his left wrist as he fell on his back. He fractured his back, requiring surgery, and bruised his wrist.
An employee was using a two-step step stool to reach a high shelf when she fell and struck her knee on the stool. She broke her left knee and was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was cutting the aitch bone out of a hog carcass when the boning knife slipped and lacerated/punctured his top right rib area.
An employee was mopping a staircase with multiple sections and landings when he misstepped and fell onto the corner edge of the lower level step.

While attempting to retrieve a piece of plastic from a conveyor, a machine that was dumping  a mushroom bin onto the conveyor hit the employee. The employee got caught between the guardrails and the dumper, puncturing the employee's lungs and breaking an arm and two ribs.
An employee was stocking beer bottles. He dropped a bottle which shattered and a piece of glass went into his left eye. The employee was hospitalized.

On or about January 21, 2016, an employee was installing a fixture onto a machine. As the employee attempted to adjust a locking pin that was not in place, a transfer arm moved and amputated the employee's left small finger.
While walking, an employee slipped on a mat, falling on and fracturing his right hip.
An employee's powered buggy spun out of control after being accelerated, and the employee fell and injured his left hip. He required hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was helping a forklift operator by watching the operator as he pushed a batch of green wood into a dry kiln. The wood was on a metal crate on rail wheels. The employee had the forklift operator stop to check the wood and a 4 x 6 board fell from the top of the stack, which was about 10 to 15 feet in the air, and hit the employee in the head. The employee was wearing a hardhat at the time of the incident.
An employee was loading a pallet onto a jack when the jack moved backwards, pinning the employee's right leg against a rack. The employee sustained a leg laceration.
While exiting a vehicle, an employee slipped off the vehicle step, hit her forehead on the step, and fell to the ground, hitting her head.
On 11/28/2015 at 5:00 pm, an employee was walking up to the door to deliver the pizza when he slipped and fell on the ice near the garage. During the fall, he hit his head and fractured his ankle.
An employee was performing roofing work when his aluminum ladder came in contact with overhead power lines. The employee was shocked.

An employee was loading pipe into a fusion machine when the pipe became crooked. The employee tried to remove the pipe by lifting it with a coworker. His right pinky and ring fingers got caught between the pipe, amputating his fingertips.

An employee was on the first floor when he was called down to the basement level to assist with a repair. Coworkers had drained water from a boiler into a sump pit, which was approximately 3 feet deep and 2 feet in diameter. There was no cover on the pit, and the sump pump had trouble keeping up with the volume of water being added and quickly filled up. When the employee came down from the first floor to help, he fell into the sump pit and suffered second and third degree burns on his lower torso, legs, and hands. He was hospitalized.

An employee at a remote Marathon Oil jobsite was pressure testing pipe when he was struck-by 9500psi of water when bolts broke on the flange connecting two pipes causing the high pressure water to strike the employee and one other sub-contractor's employee who were standing approximately 15 feet away.
An employee was running a conduit when a byproduct of the plant fell off a conveyor belt into a hot water tank. The water splattered onto the employee, causing skin burns.
On or about June 5, 2015, an employee working with waste cement drums felt light-headed and was hospitalized.

An employee was testing A/C equipment, reading the voltage of the compositor by placing the alligator clamps on the A/C. The employee was shocked by the A/C unit, which was not locked out at the time, and he passed out on top of the bus bar. He received a third degree burn on his left cheek and left hands.
An employee's hands came in contact with a chainsaw operated by another employee while swamping brush for a sawyer. The employee damaged two fingertips on left hand and was hospitalized.
An employee operating a gang saw attempted to clear a jam.  His right hand got crushed between two pieces of wood.

Two employees of 4 Swift Service passed out in a tank that was being cleaned.  Employees proceeded into a tank which had been closed, but was opened by an employee.  Employees went inside to clean, but were supposed to clean the outside of the tank only. Both employees were transported to the hospital, but only one employee was admitted.
An employee fell off a roof when a gust of wind knocked him off balance. His harness was disconnected at the time.
An employee fell approximately 13 feet after stepping out onto a 2x4 while pulling wire. He sustained fractures to his left ankle and right leg.
While vacuuming paint chips from a curb, an employee was struck by a bus and pinned against the curb, suffering a left calf injury.
When an employee opened a trailer door, the freight (a metal excavating bucket) fell out of the trailer onto his right foot, breaking several bones.

Two employees were carrying a sheet of metal decking. When they went to put the sheet down, one employee's finger was caught between the cement wall and the sheet of metal decking, amputating the left index fingertip.

On or about 14 April 2015, at approximately 1612 hours, a Troy Vines, Inc. employee was replacing the tire on a Redimix truck on Tradewind and Duval Street. He lowered the vehicle to reposition the jack and was caught between the road surface and the truck's structure. The compression caused a hip dislocation and a fracture in his hip area. He was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to unhook an aircraft tow bar from an aircraft tug when a coworker put the tug in neutral. The tug lurched slightly and the mechanism that secured the tow bar closed onto the employee's right thumb, requiring hospitalization.

An employee activated a gate with his left hand while his right hand was still on product. His right thumb then became caught between the gate and the product. When he pulled his hand back, his right thumb tip was amputated.

An employee was performing preventative maintenance on piece of conveyor. He reached across and lifted up on the belt.  His back elbow crossed the photo eye, activating the belt.  His finger was caught between the end of the conveyor and the end guard.  When he pulled his hand back, he degloved the right ring finger resulting in medical amputation.
An employee was standing on top of the mast of a forklift when a hydraulic pump shot up and struck his ankle. He fell and broke his left ankle.

An employee was holding a wall on a new house with five other employees. The bottom top plate broke adding weight to the wall. Everyone let go of the wall except the injured employee. The wall fell on him causing a fracture to his sacrum.
A temporary employee was attempting to lift a rack of steel weld parts using a hoist when the parts shifted and fell on his left forearm, lacerating and fracturing it.
