An employee was adjusting the position of a paper-roll stand when a nearby hoist came close to the roll stand and caught the employee's right hand, fracturing/lacerating a finger.

An employee was separating a crane that weighed approximately 1 ton and was about 15 feet long from a carriage. The carriage fell on the employee after it was unbolted, resulting in fractures and other injuries.

An employee was preparing a Toyota trailer for transportation by placing placards on the trailer.  A coworker was in the tractor cab waiting for the employee to finish preparing the trailer for transport.  The parking brake on the tractor truck was not set.  The tractor truck rolled back and pinned the employee between the trailer and tractor truck.  The injured employee was facing away from the tractor truck at the time of the incident.  The injured employee suffered crushing injuries to the midsection, ribs, and kidneys.

An employee was scraping loose asphalt off the apron of a dump truck containing hot asphalt. The excavator shovel was laying in the bed of the dump truck when the dump truck started to move forward. The dump truck pulled the excavator forward, causing a blade on the excavator to strike the employee, who then fell onto the hot asphalt. The employee suffered severe burns on both forearms, a chipped left ankle bone, and broken bones in the right ankle/foot.

An employee was preparing to mix batter in a commercial mixer. When the machine started, the bowl started to move out of the frame. The employee attempted to catch the bowl and his hand was caught between the frame and the bowl, pinching and amputating a finger.
On February 11, 2017, at about 6:15 PM, an employee was descending stairs with trash bags in both hands when he slipped and fell. He struck the back of his head and neck and was hospitalized.
An employee tripped over a door threshold and fell on his face, breaking his neck and lacerating his face.
An employee was working on a ladder installing lights and fell resulting in a broken wrist and sternum and a collapsed lung.
An employee contacted a capped wire while installing radiation panels. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was loading boxes onto a pallet and was struck on the ankles by another pallet jack.
On Friday, November 13, 2015, an employee was moving a wooden pallet when he got a splinter in the palm of his right hand. He was later hospitalized when the splinter became infected.
An employee amputated his fingertip when it became caught under the clamp on the cutting machine.
An employee was riding in an elevator that ascended at a rapid pace when her head hit the ceiling. She was hospitalized with head injuries.
An employee  was installing cable system at an apartment complex and was overcome by heat.
An employee was helping to work on a paper machine when his left hand was pulled into the machine, removing flesh on two fingers.
An employee was carrying a door frame and door when it slipped and fell, bending the employee's right index finger backward and dislocating it. The employee required surgery.
An employee amputated a fingertip while attaching a tandem trailer dolly to the first trailer's pintle hook.

On June 8, 2016, at approximately 2:30 p.m., an employee was opening the door on the back of a delivery truck when another truck rolled backwards and pinned him between the two vehicles. He suffered broken vertebrae.
An employee was repairing a leaking site glass containing caustic acid when the glass ruptured. The employee suffered thermal burns from the wrist to the shoulder.
Employee fell from a ladder and was hospitalized.
An employee was salting an icy area when he slipped and fell forward, hitting his forehead on the asphalt. He fractured his skull and suffered a brain hemorrhage.
An employee suffered a heat related illness while working at or near a furnace.
An employee was working on a paper machine and smashed his middle finger in the machine, resulting in surgical amputation.

An employee unlatched a trailer ramp to let water drain from the trailer after washing it. When the employee attempted to put the ramp back into position to latch it back up, the ramp fell on the employee's arm and fractured it.
An employee collided with a cart of empty plastic bottles that was being pushed by a coworker, suffering a head injury.

An employee was setting up a powdered metal press for production. While he was attempting to check if the inner punch was firing, his left-hand middle finger was struck by the tooling, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was hospitalized when his truck rolled over while hauling produce water to a disposal site due to soft road conditions on 60th Street NW, Williston, ND.
An employee bent over to pick up a tourniquet and felt a pop in her back and sharp pain down her left leg.

An employee was installing a fan belt while another mechanic was rotating the sheave by hand to walk the belt on. The injured employee's glove became caught between the belt and the motor sheave, and the employee's fingertip was pulled between the belt and sheave, amputating it to the first joint.
An employee suffered a smashed right index finger while operating a tube-bending machine, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was reaching into the cab of the truck to obtain a flashlight. The truck began to move and hit a parked trailer causing the truck door to close on the employee's legs fracturing the left leg.

The shoe in the powdered metal press was hanging up so the employee who is a set-up trainee went to trouble shoot it.  The employee unplugged the plant airline to the moving part (shoe). The employee then plugged in the cleaning airline to the shoe. The cleaning airline has much less pressure than the plant airline. The shoe did not move as it should.  The employee tried to maneuver the shoe with her hand and it would not move. The shoe then moved forward and caught her fingertip between the shoe and the die resulting in the amputation of the left middle fingertip.

An employee working as a loader at the warehouse and was cleaning the bottle rack located outdoors when a venomous snake, believed to be a Copperhead, bit the employee's right index finger. The employee was admitted to the hospital for treatment.
The employee slipped on the snow on the sidewalk while leaving work. The employee was hospitalized with a back injury.
While a boom was being unlatched at a well site, the boom snapped and threw the pipe off, hitting an employee on the ground.
An employee was using a saw to cut notches on a slab when the saw kicked up and lacerated the front of his throat.
An employee was operating a forklift and moving pallets. The employee's foot got pinched between the forklift and warehouse racking, breaking bones that required surgery.
At approximately 9:50 a.m., an employee slipped on icy steps and fractured the right ankle while delivering mail.

An employee attempted to hurdle a cart return stall in the parking lot and fell fracturing the lower left arm and sustaining facial lacerations. The employee was admitted to the hospital to set the fracture and is scheduled to have rods placed in the arm.
An employee exiting a crane was walking on the tracks and slipped and fell two feet off the tracks breaking the right leg.
An employee was standing on a trailer inside of a tank spraying foam insulation when he slipped and fell 2 feet. He landed awkwardly and fractured his right femur.
An employee was standing to the back, left side of a forklift that was moving totes. The forklift operator backed up and ran over the employee's right foot, breaking his fibula.
An employee was attempting to lower a concrete piece of manhole onto another section when it fell and landed on the employee. He suffered a broken left clavicle, broken left ribs, and a broken hip.
An employee was dismantling a scaffold while unaware that he was tied off onto it. He fell from the scaffold, approximately 7 feet to the ground below.

On or about October 17, 2015, an employee walking the plant was struck on the hard hat by a hose that was dropped by another subcontractor. The injured employee was admitted to the hospital for back pain.

An employee was moving a part (about 12"x18"x1" thick) by hand from a pallet to a work table. His right thumb was inside a hole in the part. As he pulled the part, the hole closed, amputating his right thumb tip.

OSHA Review - see AR.

On February 25, 2015, at approximately 10:00 AM, the injured employee was working near racking aisle 600.  A stacker truck bumped into the employee's right foot, which caused the employee to fall on his left side and fracture his left pelvis.

A rural mail carrier had an accident when she ran into a tree while driving down the driveway of a residence after delivering a package. The employee was reported as having a seizure that caused the accident. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured jaw with loss of teeth and a fractured right collar bone.
An employee was securing a flatbed semi-trailer on top of another semi-trailer using cargo chains and load binders when he rolled his ankle, breaking it.
A safe door closed on an employee's right thumb, severing the tip.
An employee was admitted to the hospital for heat-related issues after performing roofing activities.

On or about December 30, 2015, an employee's finger was caught between the die and the die bed as the employee was rotating the die in a brake press.  The right middle finger was pinched, removing the flesh part of the finger.

On December 10, 2015, at approximately 12:05 PM, an employee attempted to clear scrap material from the operating envelope of a die cutting machine.  The machine, which was still energized at the time, cycled and crushed his hand. He required surgery for multiple hand fractures.
An employee was walking into a residential setting to repair a furnace when he slipped and fell on the icy pavement, hitting his head and fracturing his skull.
While walking, an employee slipped off a curb and injured his right calf muscle. He was admitted to the hospital for treatment.
An employee was standing in front of a forklift . A tote that was sitting on the forks came off and hit the employee, breaking his lower right leg.

An employee was standing at the entrance door of the valet parking office with his left hand resting on the hydraulic door cylinder while he was talking to co-workers. His left ring fingertip was pinched and amputated by the hydraulic cylinder arms when another employee opened the door to enter the office.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while stretching a cable.

An employee performing preventative maintenance was checking a roof vent. She removed the vent top and shut off the vent. Before the vent belt had stopped moving, her finger got pulled in between the pulley and belt. Her left pointer finger was amputated below the nail.
An employee was using a rubber tub to pour water out of a double hung window when the top section of the window slipped and amputated the employee's left index fingertip.
An employee was trying to remove a piece of rubber from the cutter of a machine. His finger contacted the blade, amputating his fingertip.

On December 8, 2015, an employee working in the First building on line 6 at the fixed extrusion machine smashed his finger between a flange and a pneumatic plunger resulting in the partial amputation of the employee's left index finger.

On January 26, 2015, at approximately 10 AM, an employee slipped and fell on snow-covered ice on the sidewalk.  The employee was taken to the hospital for treatment with multiple breaks in her right ankle.
An employee fell three stories down an elevator shaft at a construction project.
An employee was installing a control display on a commercial oven in the Kroger deli when he was shocked by an unknown voltage; he was hospitalized.

An employee was drilling holes in square tubing using a drill. He had finished drilling 77 holes and went to move the drill. He put his left hand on the chuck just above the cutter (drill bit), while his right hand was near the back of the drill. When he tried to moved the drill, it was still magnetized. He was going to use his right hand to demagnetize the drill, but the start button was accidentally activated. The material of his glove between his left pointer finger and thumb became caught in the shaft of the drill, twisting his left thumb and causing a compound fracture.
An employee was performing carpentry work from a 10-foot A-frame ladder. As he reached for something above him, the ladder wobbled and he fell off. He was hospitalized with a broken shoulder bone.
After handling materials in the environmental heat, an employee started experiencing heat-related illness symptoms, including cramping and nausea. The employee was hospitalized.
Employee was burned from his knees up to his lower abdomen after removing the strainer for maintenance on the Scott Unit.
An employee was climbing a ladder and fell approximately 4 feet fracturing an ankle that required surgery and hospitalization.

An HVAC maintenance employee was descending five flights of stairs when he slipped and/or lost his footing and fell. The employee sustained fractured ribs and was hospitalized. The employer stated that snow and ice were contributing factors.

An employee was operating a conveyor that moves wood products. The employee attempted to remove a board from the moving conveyor and struck his right fingers against the angle iron on the frame of the conveyor resulting in a fracture to the right index finger and an ablation to the right ring finger that required the tip to be medically amputated.
Pipeline was being cleaned using a pig. The pig shot out of the pipeline and struck the employee, causing injuries to the lower part of his body.
An employee and a coworker were arguing over a personal issue when the coworker bit and stabbed (with a metal thermometer) the injured employee. The employee was hospitalized with a punctured lung.
While exiting a security vehicle, an employee slipped on ice and hit the right knee and arm on the pavement. The employee suffered abdominal pain, vomiting, and a headache.

An employee was standing/kneeling on top of a flatbed trailer when a forklift operator sat a 500-pound A-frame onto the trailer. The A-frame fell onto the employee, pinning him underneath and breaking five vertebrae.

An employee had been working on a lower-sloped porch roof and was preparing to get off the roof to have lunch when he noticed a four-foot level was getting close to the edge of the roof. The employee reached for the level and slipped on snow or ice or some other moisture and then fell off the roof approximately ten feet to the ground. The employee was hospitalized for a head injury.

On 10/21/2015, an employee was operating a folding machine when her left pinky fingertip was caught in the folding bar. An emergency stop was employed by a coworker. As the employee removed her finger from the machine, her fingertip was severed.
An employee fell eight feet from a roof.

On or about March 15, 2016, an employee was climbing a ladder attached to a trailer to disconnect a hose when he fell to the ground, suffering cuts, bruises, and injuries to his head, as well as a concussion. He was hospitalized.
On or about May 10, 2016, at approximately 2:15 p.m., an employee was walking by the fax machine when she stumbled and fell, fracturing her left hip. She was hospitalized.
An employee fell on a bed alarm cord after adjusting a bed on 3/31/15. The employee was later hospitalized with a fractured hip and required surgery.
Two employees got into a verbal altercation.  One employee packed up his gear and was leaving the vessel. The employee punched a steel I-beam on his way out, fracturing his right hand.
An employee was using a table saw and cut the tip of his finger.
An employee was standing on top of a stack of feed bunks, untying a bundle, when the bunks shifted and he fell off. The bunks then fell onto his leg, breaking his right femur.
An employee fell from a scissor lift loading platform.

An employee was mowing along a steep, sloped edge when the mower started to slide. He dismounted from the mower and it followed him downhill, pinning his left foot underneath. He sustained multiple fractures to the left foot.

Shortly after midnight, two suspects attempted to gain access into the store. The suspects tried the front door and drive through, but those access points were locked. The suspects fired through the glass into the store striking an employee in the back under the arm. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was re-stacking corrugated sheets on a conveyor storage line when their left foot was caught between two sections of the conveyor resulting in a laceration/de-gloving injury.
An employee's right hand middle finger (glove) got caught and was partially amputated by a conveyor when the employee reached to remove a piece of rotten fruit.

An employee working on an oil-and-gas service rig suffered partial amputations of the right middle and right ring fingers after his hand was caught between the tong plate and the pin that secures the tongs.

An employee was operating a forklift to unload equipment when he accidentally disabled the parking brake while getting out of the forklift to readjust the load. The forklift started rolling toward him.  In the process of getting out of the way of the forklift, his thigh got cut on the deck of the forklift.  He was hospitalized and received stitches.
While descending the scaffold ladder, an employee lost his footing and fell 12 to 15 feet to the ground breaking his left leg, right heel and left wrist.
An employee was sizing a 15" piece of reinforced concrete pipe with a cut off saw when the saw kicked back, striking and lacerating the employee's upper left arm. The employee was hospitalized.
On 2/19/15 at approximately 5:30 PM, an employee slipped on black ice in the parking lot, injuring her tail bone and requiring overnight hospitalization.
The worker was using a chop box and amputated his left thumb.
On February 14, 2017, at 12:45 p.m., an employee's right foot became caught on his desk, causing him to fall to the floor. He broke his left hip and was hospitalized.
An employee received second degree burns when pouring water into a dryer that contained hot oil.

As an employee was removing a tube from a box while standing on a stair ladder, the box came off the shelf, causing the stair ladder and employee to fall 9.5 feet to the lower level. The employee landed on a box and broke his left hip, left wrist, and several left-side ribs; cut his spleen; and fractured his back vertebrae.
An employee was pushing a four wheeled dolly and pinched his finger between the dolly and a door frame resulting in a left hand ring finger amputation.
An employee was cutting wood with a circular saw and amputated two fingers on the left hand.

On or about August 6, 2016, an employee was using a vehicle-mounted winch when the holding mechanism malfunctioned and the wire cable kept unwinding. The employee could not pull their right hand back in time and it was pulled into the first "sheave" that was about 6 feet away from the winch, amputating three fingers.
While cleaning a sensor, an employee's right thumb was caught in a drive chain and amputated.

An employee was preparing to make a batch when the pressure inside a plugged pipe caused the area around the pipe flange to fail. The chemical (acrylic acid) inside the pipe then splashed the employee's face, burning it.

Site Safety Manager reported that this VPP Facility had an incident in which an employee was cut while adjusting a belt with an Allen wrench. This resulted in surgery and amputation of the employee's right index finger up to the first knuckle.
The employee slipped on the job while wearing shoe coverings and fell breaking her wrist.
While walking across a concrete barrier, an employee lost his footing and struck his forehead on the concrete barrier, suffering a forehead laceration.

An employee was unloading a mail shipment off a delivery truck at the processing center loading dock. A general purpose mail container fell off a scissor lift and struck her, fracturing her left forearm.
An employee was admitting a patient to the hospital when the employee had a severe reaction to cat dander on the patient's clothing.

An employee was troubleshooting a sheave (the mechanism that lowers and raises an elevator) when the sheave rotated. His right middle finger was then caught and amputated between the sheave and the elevator cable.

On September 25, 2015, at approximately 11:00 to 11:30 a.m., an employee was working from a ladder and reached for a nail gun. The ladder slid down the wall approximately 15 feet to the ground. The employee broke his left arm and left leg.

An employee was fumigating a ship's hold when he placed his hand near the edge of a hatch opening. A coworker closed the hatch cover, which amputated the employee's right thumb. He was hospitalized for hand surgery.

An employee was clearing a plugged ammonia transmitter when the vat line on the transmitter blew. The employee was sprayed with ammonia and suffered 2nd degree burns on approximately 5% of the body. The employee was admitted to Baton Rouge General Burn Unit for treatment.

Employee was taking out a 10-inch hose to get water ready for the frac operation when he was struck by the hose on his ankle.  The employee flipped and fell on his head.  He bled from the left ear and suffered a closed fracture behind his left ear and internal bleeding on the brain.
An employee was pulling a portion of a tunnel section out of a shaft when he fell from an elevation onto a piece of broken slab and broke his jaw.

An employee was walking up the staircase at the worksite, ran into a coworker and fell. The employee reached out to brace for impact and suffered a triceps tendon avulsion in the left arm that required surgery.

A maintenance employee was cleaning out a pump and attempted to flick out a piece of meat. His hand became stuck, and he sustained a partial amputation of his right index finger when he pulled out his hand. The pump was not locked out at the time.
While cleaning a food slicer, an employee amputated the ring finger on her right hand.

An employee was on top of crates, helping to rig them to a boom lift, when he stepped into a hollow area in a crate that was covered by plastic wrapping and fell approximately 10 feet to the ground. He suffered multiple right-heel fractures.
An employee was cutting a board with a metric (powered hand saw) saw that is secured to a table when his hand contacted the saw blade, amputating his left index finger.

An employee had just emptied a dumpster with a front-load dump truck and was trying to make sure the dumpster went all the way back into its metal housing enclosure. While his left hand was on the top edge of the dumpster, his left thumb became pinched between the metal housing and the dumpster underneath it. About a quarter-inch of his thumb tip and part of his fingernail was amputated.
An employee was moving a signal arm at a toll booth gate when a nylon sling failed, causing the arm to swing down and strike the employee's chest. He fell to the ground and struck his head.
An employee was coming down a ladder, slipped, and fell fracturing an ankle.
While retrieving an item from a trailer, an employee fell through a gap between the dock plate and trailer. One leg fell through first, and she broke her pelvis.
An employee was cleaning the windshield of his semi truck when he fell from the rig and fractured his hip. He was hospitalized for treatment.

A 14-foot deep trench caved in while an employee was operating a track hoe nearby causing the track hoe to tilt. When he attempted to exit the machine, his foot was caught between the door and the ground, fracturing his left ankle.

An employee was hooking a crane hook onto bundles of rebar in a ship's cargo hold. Two bundles of rebar got stuck together, so the employee lowered the bundles and cut them from each other using bolt cutters. There was still some tension on one of the pieces of rebar; when the employee cut the bundle strap it swung, hitting and breaking his lower leg.
An employee fell while exiting a truck. The employee suffered a head injury and was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was installing an attachment on a forklift when the attachment fell striking the employee on the head and causing a head injury. The employee was hospitalized.

On October 4, 2016, an employee was positioning a mold that was to be lifted by a gantry. The employee's hand was on one of the chains attached to the mold. When the chain was tightened, the employee's left thumb was caught and partially amputated by the chain (tissue and nail loss; no bone loss).
Employee was walking into work in the parking lot and slipped on ice and fell striking the head.
An employee was using a miter saw. As he pulled the miter saw blade down to make a cut, his thumb was in the path of the blade and was amputated below the first joint.
While delivering mail at a private residence, an employee slipped on black ice and fell on the stairs.  The employee injured the left ankle and was hospitalized overnight, requiring surgery.
An employee was using a hammer to clean accumulated material from rollers on a conveyor. The hammer slipped and his arm was caught between the rollers. His arm broke and required surgery.

An employee was helping the driver of a winch truck back up and hook up to a tank.  When the driver was close enough to the tank to hook up, the employee told him to stop and set the brakes.  The driver did stop and set the brakes, but the truck was still in gear and jerked backwards when his foot came off of the clutch. The employee had moved between the truck and the tank to connect the winch line and was struck causing a fracture of the right femur.

An employee was helping a forklift operator load a non-working truck into a cargo shipping container. The truck was being placed into the shipping container facing outward when the tires slipped off of the lip of the container and the truck bounced. The employee's left ring finger was caught and pinched in the hood, amputating his fingertip.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet while attempting to descend from the top of an office (mezzanine) that is located inside an aircraft hangar. He was hospitalized with two broken wrists.

An employee placed a sheet metal pipe for an HVAC duct into a roll former.  His left index finger was caught between the sheet metal pipe and the die when the roller's foot pedal was actuated. The employee's left index fingertip was partially amputated.
An employee was operating a forklift when their foot became caught between the forklift and an I-beam. The operator's foot was broken.

An employee was blowing chips off parts and fixtures with compressed air in preparation for the next machine set up when he tripped and fell over a tooling post, injuring his hip and requiring surgery.

A temporary employee was cleaning the mill grinder floor when he fell approximately 20 to 40 feet through a hole in the floor and struck the floor below, breaking his right arm, pelvis, and right cheekbone.
An employee sustained a finger injury when it was caught in a chain hoist.
An employee was preparing a vehicle and opened the generator door. She tripped and slammed her left index finger in the door, requiring surgery.
An employee was unloading freight from the back of the trailer with a two wheeled dolly when he slipped on the lip of the trailer, fell to the ground, and fractured his left elbow.
An employee was applying a belt dressing to an aggregate conveyor when his arm was caught by the conveyor. He suffered arm and pinky finger fractures, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was digging a ditch underneath a digger derrick that was lifting a transformer onto a pole. The rope holding the transformer broke and the transformer fell, hitting and fracturing the employee's arm, leg, and heel.
While moving a pole with a bar, an employee experienced back pain.
Employee using a Milwaukee Magna drill had his right index finger amputated at the second joint.
An employee engaged in bead building activities had their right ring fingertip amputated when it was caught in a pinch point on the bead wire spool.

An employee was using elevators to latch pipe. While pulling the elevators back to latch another joint of pipe from the trailer, his fingertip got caught between the horn and bale. He sustained a right index fingertip avulsion.
An employee was delivering aluminum to a customer. While he unstrapped the aluminum from the wall of the trailer, the pallet fell on his right foot, causing  a fracture.
An employee was working near a boring tunneling pit when he experienced dizziness and fell through railing, breaking his pelvis and two ribs.
An employee slipped on ice and fell while lowering the flags outside the building injuring ribs and the side of the body.

An employee was helping a coworker upright a 55-gallon drum full of liquid with the forks of a powered industrial truck. The drum fell, and the employee's hand got caught underneath it. He was hospitalized and had his left middle fingertip amputated.

On 7/4/15, at about 9:40 p.m., an employee was walking beside a push back vehicle while pushing back an aircraft. While the employee disconnected aircraft from the push back vehicle, the tow bar fell and peeled the skin back on the employee's left ring finger. The employee was hospitalized for a fracture and required surgical reconstruction of the fingertip.

An employee was tasked with cleaning and sanitizing the chilling machines and the floor. The employee fell into the chiller machine while it was in operation, sustaining a leg amputation and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was getting out of a vehicle and slipped on ice injuring his left hip.
An employee was walking from the kitchen to the dining area when he missed a 6-inch high unmarked step. He sustained torn knee ligaments and a head injury.
An employee was walking down an aisle in the warehouse when he tripped over a shelving unit's end cap and fell to the floor, breaking his right elbow.

An employee was breaking up wooden furniture on a raised loading dock and then throwing pieces into a 30-yard dumpster positioned along the dock. While attempting to throw a wooden drawer into the dumpster, the employee's right foot entered the gap between the loading dock and dumpster. He then tripped over the dumpster lip, fell forward into the dumpster, and struck his chest on the debris inside. He broke two ribs and suffered internal bleeding, requiring hospitalization.
An employee received a transphalangeal amputation of his left pinky finger while offloading a compactor at the customer's location.
An employee fell 12 to 15 feet off of a fiberglass ladder while climbing to the emergency room roof to install roofing.
An employee tripped over a rolling apparel rack and struck the floor, breaking her femur.
An employee was hooking a trailer when he felt something pop in his back. He experienced numbness and paralysis from the chest down, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

On 04/21/16, at approximately 3:00 p.m., an employee was cutting a concrete pipe with a cut-off saw. The blade became stuck, and the guard that covers the blade struck the left side of the employee's face, fracturing the orbital bone and causing lacerations.
An employee was dropping muffins onto a muffin depositor tray and used her finger to wipe excess batter by hand.  The employee's middle fingertip got caught in the tray and was amputated.
An employee was drying the exterior of a car and amputated the left index finger when she closed the door on her finger. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was working in an oil pit when he became dehydrated, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from a flatbed trailer while attempting to secure the load, injuring his back.

An employee was working on top of a conveyor cover, 3 feet above the ground, when his right foot was caught in a gap between a piece of fire suppression pipe and the conveyor top. He lost his balance and fell while his right foot was still hung in the gap. He suffered a compound fracture of the right lower leg and was hospitalized.
A temporary employee was operating an electric pallet jack and suffered a foot injury when stepping off the pallet jack before it had come to a complete stop.
An employee exited the rear of a flatbed semi-trailer onto an unpaved county road, and fractured his left tibia and was hospitalized.
An employee stepped through a cardboard box display and tripped and fell to the ground. The employee injured the right hip and was hospitalized with a possible hip fracture.
An employee was operating a core pusher machine when her left index finger got caught between a hydraulic ram head and the machine itself, resulting in a partial finger amputation.
While climbing down a ladder, an employee was struck by a fan blade, suffering facial and forehead lacerations.
An employee was walking towards the truck yard when he tripped on an uneven surface (1/4-inch rise). He broke several ribs and hit his chin.

While cleaning a conveyor, an employee's right arm was caught between the conveyor frame and the end pulley. He broke his right forearm and suffered minor lacerations. The conveyor was still running at the time of the incident.
An employee was performing maintenance on a horizontal press. The employee tripped and struck his head on a metal die causing a fracture to the 5th vertebrae.
An employee was working in an aisle when a forklift operator driving down the aisle pushed a pallet into her, striking her left ankle.
An employee was seriously burned while using a torch to cut scrap.

An employee slipped while retrieving a part that had fallen off a suspended conveyor in the parts washing area. The employee's right foot was submerged into a phosphoric acid cleaning solution resulting in burns to his right ankle and 1/2 way up his calf.

An employee and a coworker were lifting a trash cart to empty its contents inside a dumpster when the employee's left middle finger was caught between the metal dumpster and the trash cart. The employee's fingertip was amputated up to the nail bed.
A technician was discussing the job with a customer and was bitten by the customer's dog causing lacerations to the right forearm and muscle damage.
An employee was washing down his truck with the tag trailer down when the truck moved forward and pinned him underneath the wheels of the tag trailer. His lower body and pelvis were crushed.

An employee was operating the pallet machine, which prepares pallets of rice for transport. A bag of rice fell off the pallet while being transported via rollers to where the pallets are wrapped in plastic. The employee went to grab the bag and his right glove was caught between the rollers, amputating his right index finger pad.

After cleaning a process kettle with methanol and water, an employee emptied the tank and filled it with phenol.  The employee then began to remove the plug and was splashed with phenol, suffering chemical burns to the right thigh, stomach, and face.
An employee was prefabricating rebar pile cages on horses when his leg was struck by a rolling pile cage, fracturing his knee and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was injured after they climbed on top of a forklift and inadvertently kicked it into gear. The employee became pinned between the roll bar and the mast, suffering a cracked sternum.
An employee was struck by a mule pallet jack while attempting to get past it. His ankle got caught between the mule and a bollard. He fractured his ankle.
An employee was opening a vehicle door with his left hand when the passenger side of a shuttle bus caught and amputated his left pinky finger.
An employee was carving a carcass with a knife when he suffered a laceration to his right knee.

An employee arrived at a worksite, opened the lease gate, drove the vehicle through the gate, and exited the vehicle to close the gate when the wind caught it. The employee tried to block the gate from hitting the company vehicle. The gate caught his thumb between it and the vehicle door, amputating flesh on his left thumb tip.

The injured worker was leaving the engine room and going up the ship's ladder carrying a small Shop-Vac.  He was six to eight rungs above the deck when he fell (approximately 6 feet).  While falling, he caught his finger between the vacuum and some metal part of the ship. He sustained a right middle finger avulsion (amputation) injury from the first knuckle through the nail, as well as a right index finger 90% avulsion (amputation) injury (estimated first knuckle).
A temporary employee was operating an electric pallet jack and struck a rack system support. The employee was hospitalized.

On October 12, 2016, at 3:10 p.m., two employees were setting up to cut the main 8" gas pipe to install a new pipeline when the pipe coupling failed and the pipe exploded. Debris struck the employees, who suffered facial lacerations and fractures. Both employees were hospitalized.
An employee began vomiting after performing die-casting on a machine. He was hospitalized with severe dehydration.
An employee was picking orders in a warehouse area while riding a powered pallet jack. His left foot was run over by the pallet jack when he stepped off. He was hospitalized.

An employee was cutting pieces of plate using a band saw. The employee's glove got caught by the saw causing the amputation of a portion of his left thumb. The employee was taken to the hospital for treatment.

An employee was delivering cargo to a construction site. As he pulled the cargo to the back of the truck with a pallet jack, he felt a sharp pain on his abdomen.  The employee was hospitalized and diagnosed with a hernia.

An employee operating a standup powered industrial vehicle (PIV) was backing out of an aisle into the main aisle. He struck a pole at the end of the storage rack, and his left leg got crushed between the lift truck and the pole.
An employee was lifting equipment (flat top for grill) during cleaning activities. The equipment was placed down on his finger, cutting his fingertip.
An employee slipped and fell on the wet marble floor near the entrance to the facility resulting in a hamstring tear and lower back pain due to bruising and contusions.
The employee was holding a microphone when a football player collided with her. The employee suffered a broken leg.
On May 17, 2016, an employee was burned by hydrofluoric acid.
On or about August 4, 2015, an employee was moving a glass panel from one location to another when the panel slipped and landed on his legs.  He was hospitalized.
On January 12, 2017, an employee was loading a box of water into a company vehicle. When he bent over to pick up the water, he injured his lower back.

An employee was setting up tools on a CNC machine. He had commanded a tool change when he noticed the coolant line was in the path of the tool changer. When he attempted to move the coolant line, the tool changer went into motion. His right index fingertip was then amputated between the tool and the changer (no bone loss).
An employee suffered from heat exhaustion and dehydration while stacking 50 lb. bags of carbon black, requiring hospitalization.
On 6/8/16, an employee's right foot was caught on a turning strap on a patient's bed. She lost her balance and fell to the floor, fracturing her left hip.
An employee was on a ladder, trimming trees and bushes at a customer's residence, when the ladder slipped and fell over. The employee fell to the ground, suffering a back injury.

An employee was riding a Polaris Ranger vehicle gathering cattle on a ranch when it hit a bump. The rifle that he was carrying felt off the vehicle, hit the ground, and accidently discharged striking the employee in the leg.
An employee was using a 7 1/4 inch circular saw to cut the ocean's flooring when the blade lacerated his right thigh, requiring stitches.
An employee was pulling products to fill an order when a passing forklift ran over and broke his foot.

Two large metal doors that swing inward/outward were being closed to perform high-pressure tests on the SB-BOP. The injured employee's left index finger's distal phalanx got pinched/stuck between the doors while closing them. The employee jerked the hand away and sustained an amputation (no bone removal) to the finger.
An employee was handling material (metal skin) on top of a table when the table tilted. The material fell on his left leg, causing multiple fractures.
While climbing into construction equipment, an employee slipped and fell onto an operating handle, suffering a broken left rib and punctured lung.

An employee was grabbing 2-inch by 20-foot lengths of copper pipe from the back of a tractor trailer. The employee put the pipe on their shoulder while standing on the lift gate at ground level, then tripped on the lift gate handle and fell to the ground. The employee sustained a head laceration and broken leg.

An employee lifted a rare earth magnet from a materials hopper. He handed the magnet to a second employee.  The second employee took the magnet and began to set the magnet down on an adjacent piece of equipment.  As the second employee set the magnet down, the magnet pulled itself to the piece of equipment that he was going to place it on. His left-hand ring finger was crushed between the magnet and the equipment and had to be surgically amputated at the first knuckle.
An employee was standing in the gymnasium bouncing a basketball. When the employee turned to walk away, he dislocated his hip and fell to the floor fracturing his hip.
A chef was working when he started to feel fatigued. He was admitted to the hospital for dehydration.
While rethreading a wire former, employee suffered a severe left hand injury to all four fingers, resulting in employee hospitalization.
An employee was removing a fence from a ditch near an excavator when the excavator backed over the employee's leg, breaking it.

During moving activities, three employees unsecured and then lost control of the end piece of a gantry crane. The piece rolled out from under them and struck the injured employee's foot, amputating his right big toe and requiring hospitalization.
Employee fell approximately 7 feet off a highway retaining wall while lowering a jackhammer.
An employee was operating a motorized pallet jack and fell off fracturing her pelvis.
An employee was flagging traffic when he was struck by a vehicle. He suffered cuts to his head, fractured vertebra in his neck, a broken collarbone, and a broken left leg.

On November 30, 2015, an employee was adjusting the throttle cable on his work golf cart. The employee was pulling on the throttle cable and the cart started and moved backwards. He fell to the ground and abraded his left knee. He was seen by the company physician who dressed the wound and the employee returned to work. He was later admitted to the local hospital for treatment of an infection.
An employee was making an adjustment to the stretch-wrap machine when his finger was caught between the drive wheel and the machine frame, severely lacerating his left first fingertip.
An employee operating a dump truck was emptying a load of dirt. The dump truck tipped over, and the employee suffered broken ribs, blood clotting, and lung issues.
An employee working in the store's back room twisted her ankle while pulling a cable from a two-way radio. She fractured her right ankle and was hospitalized.

Employee was working on a sorting platform approximately 8 feet off of the concrete/ground. As employee descended a fixed ladder, he lost his grip and fell to the ground in a standing position, fracturing his right leg.

An employee of Hebron Inc. delivered scrap cars to a salvage yard.  While unstrapping the restraints, at least two car logs dislodged from the scrap pile and rolled/slid, pinning the employee between the trailer and the car logs. The employee was hospitalized for injuries that included internal bleeding.

An employee was changing a link in a chain on a set of rollers when a pallet of finished product was pushed onto the roller set being worked on. This caused the sprocket to move on the chain, pulling the employee's left index finger in and amputating it to the middle knuckle.
An employee was assembling calendar pages using a commercial paper cutter when the machine cut the employee's left-hand middle and ring fingers. The fingers were amputated.

An employee was cutting plywood with a skill saw. He was holding the plywood with his left hand. The saw kicked back, and the lower exposed blade amputated part of his left pinky fingertip and lacerated his ring finger.
The worker's left ring finger was amputated when it was caught in the conveyor belt while unloading packages in the loading dock area.

An employee was shutting down a riser pipe to a fire sprinkler system in a section of a building. After performing the shutdown, he went through a set of double doors and onto a small walkway that led to the mechanical room of the elevator. The elevator's floor had been removed as a result of a construction project, and the employee fell approximately 80 feet down the shaft. He suffered spinal fractures, leg fractures, and a broken arm.
An employee was cutting rolls of metal on a machine. The employee was on the stairs checking on the rollers when his right leg became caught in the roller and amputated at the ankle.

An employee finished up on a rig cap on a new roof he helped install. He unhooked from the crane lift and reached over to hook his D-ring to the beam when he slipped and fell approximately 12 feet to the ground below. He dislocated his shoulder, fractured a rib, and suffered facial abrasions.
An employee was adjusting a plate using a shim. The side planer was activated and the employee's right index fingertip was amputated.

On January 3, 2016, an employee was using a manual pallet jack. The forks were not completely under the pallet being towed. When the employee tugged on the pallet jack, the brakes went on and the employee fell to the ground. She suffered a contusion to her right hip and was hospitalized.
An employee was riding an ATV to set fire markers. While making a left turn, the employee lost control of the ATV and fell on the road, suffering an injury.
On or about September 28, 2015, an employee felt a pop in their back while driving a forklift. The employee was hospitalized for a back injury.
An employee slipped in the vehicle parking lot while walking to a tow truck and fractured the right femur.
An employee was reaching under a machine bed to fix a motor when a pin on the actuator broke and the bed fell on the employee's hand, fracturing it.

An employee was cleaning the rollers on the printer machine while a coworker was moving the rollers forward inch by inch by tapping the jotting button. The employee's right pointer and middle fingers were pinched between the rollers, amputating the fingertips without bone loss.
An employee stood up to go to the restroom and fell down. She broke her leg.

During a work break at 9:20 AM on February 13, 2015, an employee was walking behind the building to his car in the parking lot and slipped on an ice patch. The employee sustained compressed fractures of the T2 and T5 cervical discs.

An employee picked up a case of jelly from one pallet and walked over to another pallet to place the case of product. Once the employee got to the second pallet, he tripped and fell in a lunge position, striking his right knee on the ground and fracturing his right femur.
An employee was exposed to falls in excess of four feet while working from a ladder to install a communications cable. The ladder slipped, resulting in the employee suffering a fractured tibia.
An employee's fingers were crushed while reaching into a hamburger patty machine.
An employee was training on a new piece of equipment (stretcher). When she lifted one end of it, she hurt her back falling to the ground and passing out. She was hospitalized with a back injury.

An employee was loading his pickup truck. While waiting for an inspector, he decided to clean some trash out of the bed of his truck. A gust of wind then came along and blew the employee off the tailgate of the truck. He lost his balance and fell to the ground, fracturing his left leg and requiring hospitalization.
An employee suffered burns from a flashover fire.
An employee fell while standing on the raised forks of a fork truck injuring his hand and leg.
An employee was loading tools into company vehicles when he tripped and fell on asphalt, breaking his left elbow and wrist.

On February 6, 2016, at approximately 12:30 PM, an employee sustained an amputation of the left middle finger to the first joint. The employee was preparing to dump a dumpster elevated by a forklift when the dumpster rolled back onto the employee's hand.

An employee was working to replace a lightning arrester( electrical distribution work). When the tool he was using came in proximity to an energized jumper coming from the top of the lightning arrester, an arc flash occurred.
An employee experienced heat stress and was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning a slab drag when a coworker stepped on the foot pedal. The remaining air then activated the machine, which lacerated the employee's right arm.
An employee was trying to lift a granite countertop out of a pick-up truck bed when he twisted and injured his lower back.

An employee suffered a right index finger amputation. The employee's finger was injured by a thigh deboning machine. The finger was still attached at the time of the incident and was later amputated at the hospital.
An employee lost three right-hand fingertips in a pants press, which operates by foot pedal and closes on the pant leg.
An employee was descending a portable extension ladder when he slipped and fell to the ground below, breaking bones. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was pulling metal pipes from a bundle of six. He was breaking the metal bands that were holding the bundle together to retrieve two of the six. As he was cutting the final band, two of the metal pipes fell from the bundle and struck his right leg, breaking it.
An employee was on a jammed conveyor line, attempting to clear a carton jam. His foot slipped on the rollers and he rolled his right ankle, fracturing it. He was hospitalized.

An employee who was driving an unloaded stand-up forklift turned down an aisle. To avoid hitting an unoccupied forklift, he quickly turned the forklift and placed his right hand out to brace himself. His right hand struck the non-moving, unoccupied forklift, fracturing his wrist and the area between his index finger and thumb. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning a bathtub when she slipped and fell, fracturing her hip. She was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was cleaning out a mixer when his right thumb tip was amputated. The mixer was not turned off at the time.

On March 18, 2016, at approximately 6:15 a.m., an employee was operating a stand-up forklift and traveling toward the battery changing area when his left hand made contact with the overhead racking system, amputating his left pinky finger near the knuckle.
On Thursday, July 30, 2015, an employee suffered a left-hand index fingertip amputation while using a 130-ton hydraulic press brake with another operator.
An employee was loading insulation into an insulation blower machine. The employee's left arm was injured when it got caught in the equipment's metal bars.
An employee fell 12.5 feet from a stair landing to the ground and was hospitalized with multiple fractures.
An employee scratched her right leg at work on September 23, 2015.  The scratch became infected and the leg was later amputated.

On January 23, 2015, an employee received a severe injury to his left index finger (partially amputated) when a beam fell from a rack that was not secured, making contact with the employee's back and pinching his left hand between the upright and the support bar.
An employee was putting air in a tire when the tire exploded resulting in a left wrist fracture.
An employee was unloading fiberglass camper shells from a curtain sided semi trailer using a forklift when he fell and struck his head on the pavement.
An employee was operating an electric pallet jack to store products. He fell off the pallet jack and injured his hip.
An employee fell from a step stool. The employee sustained multiple fractured ribs and a punctured lung. The employee was admitted to the hospital for treatment.
An employee fell to the floor while walking down a hallway, fracturing their right knee, wrist, and shoulder.
On 3/7/16, an employee using the mobile vet clinic was hospitalized with an infection after being bitten by a cat.
An employee was using a 24" chainsaw to trim oversized logs. During use, the chainsaw dropped and cut the employee's foot. The employee was hospitalized for surgery on his foot.
An employee amputated his right index finger when he was fixing the polarizer machine.
An employee slipped on wet leaves in the parking lot while getting out of her car and fell. Her ankle was broken in three places.

An employee was moving product with a forklift. When he exited the vehicle, the forklift began to roll. He attempted to re-enter the lift and was struck by the front tire, suffering an open fracture to his left knee. The parking brake was not set at the time of the incident.
Employee fell and hit his head in the parking lot as he was coming to work. The employee had a bleeding wound to the head and was admitted to Reading Hospital.

On 1/20/2015, at about 6:30 p.m., an employee helped a second employee at the Townsend Skinner machine, which separates pig fat from pig skin. The employee reached into the conveyor belt, which has serrated teeth, and his right little finger was caught. He was transported to BSA Hospital in Amarillo, Texas, and his right little finger was amputated.
On 4/16/2015 at about 1:45 p.m., an employee was assembling a skid. When he went to step over the skid, he fell backwards and activated the nail gun shooting a nail into his upper leg.
Employee was walking out front entrance of retail store when he slipped on a patch of ice and injured his ankle.  Afterwards, he was hospitalized.
An employee pinched a nerve in his back while pulling pallets and moving boxes. He was hospitalized.
Three employees were replacing a gasket on a liquid fertilizer tank.  While attempting to install the gasket, the injured employee's finger got caught in a pipe, amputating his right index fingertip.

Employee was walking in the very center of 10-feet tall racking on plywood and then stepped down to the next level on a piece of plywood that had no center support. It collapsed and he fell 6 feet to the next level.  

He was disassembling the racking system just before he fell
An employee was using a circular saw to cut wood when the saw jumped and amputated two of the employee's fingers.
An employee was hospitalized when his right hand was caught in a dryer belt.
On December 21, 2015 at 1:30am an employee was operating the nut welder and amputated her right index finger.

An employee was coming down from an attic after delivering blown insulation materials using a 12-foot extension ladder. The employee fell approximately 9'10" from the ladder to the concrete floor and fractured his back. The ladder did not have anti-slip feet.
On or about February 26, 2016, an employee was feeding material into a shear when the employee's fingers entered the shear point. The employee's finger was amputated.

An employee in a drilling rig had drilled a shaft for a new sewer tunnel. The employee was changing the bit on the drilling rig when the seat broke on the operator's station, causing the employee to fall off and into the drilled hole (14 feet). The employee suffered a head laceration and concussion.

An employee was performing preventative maintenance on a sterilization machine. As the employee was removing the housing/base of the machine's filter assembly, white mist came out of the inside of the filter. The employee inhaled hydrogen peroxide vapors, requiring hospitalization.
When an employee arrived at the feed yard, the cattle rushed on the gate and ran over the employee, fracturing the employee's right elbow and left thumb.

An employee was assisting in remediation work to include asbestos removal and duct work. The employee was on the roof of a gymnasium when the roof vent on which he was standing/sitting collapsed. The employee fell approximately 15 feet to the lower level. The employee broke his right ankle and right arm as a result of the fall.
On March 24, 2016, an employee was helping a warehouse worker pull an order when a stack of insulation products fell and struck the employee, fracturing the left fibula.
An employee was hospitalized after being bitten by a cat while cleaning cat cates.

An employee was showing another employee how to weld frames and the trainee accidentally contacted the trainer's arm with the hot welding rod. The trainer was wearing an approved welding sleeve. The resulting injury became infected and the employee was hospitalized for treatment.

While loading items into the cab of a delivery truck, an employee came in contact with liquid disinfectant cleaner, suffering chemical burns to both hands and the nose, as well as whitening of the fingertips.
An employee was placing a hatch cover on a barge when it landed on and amputated the end of the employee's right pinky finger.
While lifting milk products in the back of a vehicle, an employee felt a pop and was hospitalized with a sprain.
An employee went to empty the trash at a gas pump. When the employee lifted the trash lid, a stray cat jumped out of the trash can and scratched and bit the employee, requiring hospitalization.
An employee's right pinky finger was caught and amputated in the closing mechanism of a door as he pulled it shut.
An employee was fine grading a stone with a shovel when an excavator backed up and pinned the employee's legs. One of his legs was amputated and the other suffered broken bones.
An employee fell through the guard rails of a 10-foot platform and broke his tail bone and vertebrae.

An employee, operating a pallet jack, was walking with the jack and exiting a room. While exiting, the employee's hand was pinched between the wall and the handle of the pallet jack, amputating the tip of his left pinky finger.
An employee felt ill at work while delivering mail on a walking/driving route. He was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.
An employee suffered a right middle fingertip amputation while cleaning a roller.

An employee was ringing out a customer at the cash register when she walked around the shopping cart to scan a product. As she was returning to the register, she struck the corner of the cart and tripped and fell, fracturing her left hip.
On January 9, 2017, an employee slipped on the sidewalk/parking lot while picking up a car to go on an assignment. He lost consciousness, fractured his skull, and suffered a hemorrhagic contusion.
An employee was walking in the parking lot when she slipped on ice and broke her ankle, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was injured while assisting to load a beam onto a flatbed truck. The beam tipped on its side and struck the injured employee.
An employee slipped on ice and snow in the parking lot and fell, fracturing the left hip.
An employee had been working outside at a jobsite in downtown Atlanta, Georgia. He was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.
An employee was testing a valve with a finger when the valve closed, amputating the left index finger to the first knuckle.
An inmate was slicing onions with a vegetable slicing machine when he amputated his left middle fingertip and lacerated the side of his left index finger.
Employee was walking from the showroom to the parking lot to deliver a car when he slipped on ice and fractured his right leg.
After doing touch-up painting work on the outside of a condominium, an employee became ill and was hospitalized for possible heat-related injuries.
An employee fell down a stairwell, suffering facial fractures, broken and loosened teeth, shoulder pain, back pain, and buttock pain. She was hospitalized.
On January 26, 2015, an employee fell approximately 17 feet from a steel grating platform to the ground.
An employee was hydro-blasting the inside of a tank when the hose ruptured, sending high-velocity water over his foot. The water lacerated his ankle, requiring surgery.
An employee was sawing wood when his hand was pulled into the guarded saw blade amputating his left pointer finger at the middle knuckle.

An employee was inspecting a pump house frame when he discovered the back board box was installed upside down. He enlisted a coworker to help remove and reinstall the box. His left hand was inside the box and his right hand was underneath it as it moved a few inches. When it cleared the framework, the box fell and pinched the employee's finger between it and a piece of angle iron below. His right middle fingertip was partially amputated.
An employee was repairing a flow pipe when he tripped and fell backward with the flow pipe on his body. He fractured his left ankle.

An employee was adjusting the valve of a condensate line and attempting to "sewer" the hot water through a hose. The hose failed and hot water (200 degrees) caused second and third degree burns to the employee's arms, abdomen and legs (35% of the body).

An employee was framing the corner area of an apartment complex on the fourth floor when he fell approximately 30 feet from the edge to the dirt surface below. He broke his left wrist and a bone in his back, requiring hospitalization. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee stepped on a spray nozzle and fell onto a concrete floor, fracturing and dislocating her ankle and requiring hospitalization.
An employee slipped and fell to the same level, breaking a tibia, fibula, and ankle.
An employee was unclogging material from a flour hopper when a pneumatic gate fractured his right thumb. The gate was not locked out at the time of the incident.

Employees were using an overhead crane to lift steel plates from the bed of a truck.  An employee attempted to attach chains to offload the steel plates from the truck. As he was lowering the steel plate onto the floor, the plate began to move. His right hand was on the plate and his middle finger was caught between the lip of the plate and the hook, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was operating the T-nut machine. She put a piece of stock in the machine and was going to install a T-nut into the end of the stock. She activated the machine for the T-nut installation, but the T-nut did not go into the stock properly. As she attempted to remove the T-nut from between the stock and the ram, her hand hit the limit switch. The ram then plunged forward, pinching her right middle finger between the ram and stock. Her fingertip was amputated. The guard was in place at the time.

An employee was exiting his semi-truck when he noticed a puddle of water outside the driver's side door. To avoid getting his feet wet, he stepped between the cab of the truck and the trailer to get to the passenger side.  He dismounted the truck from the passenger side and landed in an awkward position, breaking his right leg between the hip and the knee.
An employee was hospitalized on 12/1/16 after she tripped over a student's backpack and fell into a bookcase. She received a laceration to her chin and a concussion.
An employee was trying to move a piece of wood that was stuck in the chain when the wood jammed his hand into the steel railing, amputating his right middle finger and breaking a bone.

An employee was trimming a tree limb with a chainsaw while working off of an extension ladder. The ladder fell and the employee fell approximately 10-12 feet with the ladder landing on the ground in a standing position. He broke his right leg in three places and suffered an open fracture to his lower right leg requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was standing in the lay down yard when a 12 inch pipe shifted and pinned his left leg between two pipes. The employee was admitted to the hospital with a broken tibia.

On June 29, 2015, an employee was speaking with a supervisor in the packaging area. Following the conversation, she started to return to her work area at the ovens. She crossed through the transparent curtain adjacent to the packaging area. She crossed into the walkway where it intersects a forklift route. 

A forklift driver was also approaching the intersection. He reported that he slowed and used his horn as he approached the intersection. He did not see her due to an obstructed view. T
he forklift driver continued driving through the intersection. The employee was struck by the forklift and fell to the floor. She suffered a compound fracture to her left ankle and lacerations to her forehead. Her foot/leg was amputated 5-6" below the knee.
An employee was bitten by a spider. Two to three days later the bite swelled up and the employee was admitted to the hospital for IV antibiotics.

An employee was helping to rig a spanner beam to a form so the gantry crane could lift it. One side of the beam was unshackled. The crane operator reeled in the crane, and the un-shackled side of the spanner beam became dislodged from the form's lifting lug. The beam then flipped off the form and fell on the nearby employee's foot and ankle, breaking them.
An employee suffered serious injuries after being caught in a machine that was in motion. Surgery was required.
A temporary employee was working on a scaffold approximately three feet above the ground when he fell off the side and broke his the radius and ulna on the right arm and the radius on the left arm.
An employee was using a hold-down clamp to position material to be sheared. While adjusting the hold-down clamp, the machine cycled, crushing and amputating the tip of his right-hand middle finger.
On Monday, January 5, 2014, an employee slipped on ice while walking to his work truck at a job site.  The employee sustained an injury to his neck and was admitted to the hospital that day.
An employee caught a falling diamond shape glass placard with her hand and suffered a deep laceration on her hand caused by the edges of the placard. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.
An employee was hospitalized after falling into a stairwell while installing insulation in a new residential building.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while operating a miter saw.
Employee was assaulted near the main entrance door by a customer. Employee was hospitalized with a laceration to the face, requiring stiches.
An employee was caulking holes on a wall while standing on a 6-foot ladder when the employee fell to the ground, breaking ribs and puncturing a lung.
An employee was climbing a ladder and fell resulting in a fractured leg.

On August 17, 2016, at approximately 12:15 a.m., an employee was moving bundles of paper into a strapping machine by hand using a motor-driven roller line. While attempting to remove a paper from the line, the employee's right hand and arm were pulled into the live rollers. He was hospitalized with a fractured right arm.
An employee was servicing a cross-cut box when he began to feel pain in his head and shoulders.  He fell to the ground and became disoriented, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cutting a piece of flat bar stock using an ironworker machine. The machine's hold down jaws caught and amputated the employee's left middle fingertip.
Employee was attempting to cut banding with a pocket knife.  The knife slipped and struck the employee in the calf, hitting an artery. Employee was hospitalized.

A helper began raising the powered dock plate. While the dock plate was in motion, the injured employee walked onto it and shut the trailer door. He slipped, and got his legs stuck between the dock plate and the back of trailer. While he pulled up on the plate to get if off his legs, he told the helper to pull the truck out to free him.  When the truck was pulled forward, the plate snapped downward and severed the ends of the helper's left index and middle fingers.
An employee's right index finger was amputated while attempting to remove a plastic bottle from a drive chain.

An employee was drilling holes in a part using a Bridgeport mill.  The part moved in the vice and the employee reached in to re-secure the part while the machine was running.  A burr or the drill bit snagged his glove pulling his thumb into the drill bit and causing a partial amputation of the left thumb.
An employee was making cheesecake at a cheesecake press machine when the machine severely cut her thumb, requiring overnight hospitalization and surgery. The machine was guarded at the time.
An employee was closing off a pressure release valve when hot water sprayed his left arm and stomach.
An employee was cleaning a jammed outlet pipe on the spin dryer and amputated a fingertip.
An employee was hospitalized overnight for heat exhaustion/dehydration.
An employee preparing to perform concrete work on a building climbed up an extension ladder, lost his footing, and fell from the fourth rung fracturing his left knee cap.

An employee was standing and building HV fans by hand. He was bolting parts onto the fan with a wrench. Around 9 a.m., he started throwing up and felt ill. He was hospitalized due to possible heat stress.
An employee slipped and fell approximately 10 feet while climbing down a ladder installed on a fixed light pole.

On or about April 11, 2016, an employee was operating a spiral winder when the bobbin ran out of wire. While he worked on the bobbin, the machine activated and pinched the employee's right index finger, partially amputating the fingertip.
An employee attempted to remove a box that was stuck in a machine when it dislodged and fell on the employee's right forearm.
An employee was injecting a vaccine into chickens on a poultry farm along a conveying system and stuck the back of his left index finger with the injection apparatus.
An employee was nailing 2x4's together with a nail gun. He had several lined up on a table and was ailing them to make 4x4's when he shot a nail through his right middle finger.
An employee suffered a right finger amputation while attempting to remove food products from the jammed motor blades of a vacuum tortilla oven.
An employee was servicing an oven. As he was leaving after the service was completed, he felt pain and pressure due to a hernia.

Employee was working on a load former unit.  Employee hit the cycle button to retract the stripper plate while placing his hand on the cover plate.  The stripper plate returned to the extended position and employees middle finger was caught by the machine, removing the tip of the finger and part of the finger nail.
An employee was delivering mail and caught their right pinky finger in the vehicle door resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee flagging traffic was overcome by dehydration and lost consciousness. The employee was hospitalized.
While the company was installing Google Fiber Optic cable on the public road, a vehicle ran through the traffic cones and struck an employee. The employee was hospitalized with a broken leg.
An employee was operating a stand-up forklift when his foot was caught between the lift and a column, fracturing his left ankle and heel.
An employee was attempting to weld a piece of sheet metal to another assembly. The tack weld broke and the sheet metal fell onto the employee possibly fracturing the right knee, left ankle and heel.
An employee offloading rebar from a flatbed truck lost his balance and fell off the truck, breaking both bones in his leg and requiring surgery.
An employee was climbing a ladder when a bracket came loose and the ladder fell to the side. The employee suffered a compound fracture of the lower leg.
An employee was hospitalized with a leg fracture after falling on a staircase.
An employee was working on forms for a concrete pour and fell seven feet to the deck below fracturing their pelvis and shoulder. The employee was not tied off at the time of the incident.
An employee was cleaning the construction site when a concrete company's cage broke.  The concrete forms inside the cage then fell on the employee, who was hospitalized.

An employee was performing routine maintenance on a wind tower when the wind picked up and caused the motor to start turning. The employee's glove was caught in the motor, and his middle finger was pulled in and lacerated. The finger had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was operating a walker stacker when the stacker reversed over the employee's foot. The employee was hospitalized with a foot injury.

An employee 
was doing maintenance on a piece of equipment that was shut down. He grabbed the motor's damper/pulley belt and pulled the belt toward himself. This caused the damper/pulley to rotate, pinning his right-hand thumb between the damper/pulley and the belt. As a result, the top part of his right-hand thumb (approximately 1/8" to 3/16") was amputated.
Employee was burned while working on a motor.
An employee's hand became caught in a drill press and was seriously injured.
An employee was hospitalized after falling.

A maintenance employee was troubleshooting a water heater in the ceiling when he lost his balance. He grabbed onto a wire that supports the ceiling, and the sharp wire cut his left-hand middle finger and tore a tendon.
An employee was cleaning the chute on a ready-mix truck. As he extended the chute, two of his right-hand fingers were caught/pinched between two chute sections.
On 07/05/16, at 9:00 p.m., an employee was riding on the forks of a sit-down forklift when he fell from the forks and was run over by the forklift resulting in two fractures to the right foot.
An employee fell 18 feet from a ladder to the ground while working on a roof.
An employee was cleaning off an 8' by 4' concrete form when it tipped over, striking his leg and fracturing his femur.

An employee was ascending a steel fixed ladder.  The employee fell approximately 7 to 9 feet to the ground below. The total elevation change was 9 1/2 feet high.  The employee suffered a head laceration and broken bones and was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after being struck by soil/dirt while working within a sloped trench that was approximately 9-feet deep. The employee injured the right leg.
An employee was cutting beef and lacerating his left arm requiring stiches and surgery.
An employee was walking across the parking lot, fell, and broke their hip.
An employee was operating a manual tabletop paper cutter and amputated a fingertip. The paper cutter was unguarded at the time of the incident.

An employee entered a trench that was properly shored with a steel trench box and access ladder. The employee was using a cut off saw to cut through an abandoned water main. The section of main was isolated/shut off and restrained from the live portion of the main the prior day. The employee successfully cut through the main and turned around to place the cut off saw on 
the ground. As he did, the water main valve from the live portion of the 
main failed and separated from the pipe striking his knee. Water from the main began to fill the trench. As the employee began to exit the trench box his hard hat fell off. The employee fell and his head hit the spreader bar. The employee suffered a left knee fracture and a head contusion.
An employee was shutting a safe and got her finger caught in the door. Her fingertip was severed, requiring hospitalization and reattachment surgery.

A lead person was adjusting the edge grinder. An employee walked to the back of the machine and placed his hand on the end of an adjustment rod sticking out of a pneumatic cylinder. The lead did not realize the employee's hand was on the rod, so he actuated the machine to test his adjustments. The employee's left index finger was then  pinched and amputated between the cylinder housing and the rod end stop.
An employee was flipping on the circuit breaker to the AC unit and received a flash burn to the left hand.
A crew was preparing to pave a road. While warming up, the rear of the paving machine caught on fire and burned the employee sitting in the seat.

While diagnosing a vacuum system, an employee removed an exhaust filter to access a vacuum port with his right thumb. The ball valve actuated while his thumb was in the port, amputating his thumb tip.
An employee fell down the concrete stairs, fracturing her ribs and puncturing her lung.
An employee was working on a pump when material that was 45% potassium hydroxide sprayed out and contacted his face.
Employee slipped on a patch of ice on the sidewalk while walking from his car to the building after arriving in the morning.
An employee crushed their left middle and index fingertips in a patty machine.
An employee caught his left arm in the puller as he was feeding parts into the machine. The employee's fingers were dislocated.
On 9/12/2016, at 4:30 PM, an employee was driving a powered industrial truck down an aisle. As he turned left, he crashed into a rack and suffered a left thumb amputation.
An employee fell off a ladder and broke two ribs.
While standing on a 6- to 8-foot ladder and pulling electrical wires through a conduit, an employee fell to the ground.

An employee was in the process of isolating voltage to the live front transformer in an ice storm.  He was attempting to install a load break device to dump the load and the insulated stick he was using arced from the switch attachment to the fiberglass stick.  The employee was shocked and admitted to the hospital.

On 03/24/15 at 3:05 a.m., an employee was driving a yard truck with a container attached. While maneuvering, the container flipped over and disconnected from the yard truck. The truck bounced, and the employee suffered head trauma, tooth loss, and an ankle fracture.
An employee was closing a semi-truck trailer door when the cable to the door broke; the trailer door slammed onto his foot.
An employee slipped on the sidewalk and struck her head on the concrete surface, resulting in a concussion and hospitalization.
An employee was operating the elevators and tongs to run pipe out of the hole when the drilling line broke. The block fell and struck his foot.

An employee was using a crane to load steel for a furnace. When the employee unhooked the lifting device from the steel, the hook on the chain caught on the steel. Before the employee could stop the crane, the hook, under tension, came free and struck the employee's jaw, fracturing it.
An employee amputated his right second and third fingertips with a rope.
An employee was testing out a bicycle after repairing/assembling it, hit a patch of ice on the north side of the store, and fell off the bicycle fracturing the left hip.

An employee was helping to operate a scrap saw and was ensuring plastic would feed through it when a coworker activated the saw, severely cutting the employee's right arm. He required surgery. The saw was guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee's hand was on the edge of a gang box when a coworker closed the box on the employee's finger, partially amputating it.
