An employee was fixing a water line at the sawmill near the kettle burners and was digging around the line with a shovel when he experienced leg and hand cramps. He was hospitalized for dehydration and heat trauma.
An employee was hospitalized for a hip fracture after breaking up an altercation between two hospital visitors.

An employee was directing a powered industrial truck (PIT) operator on how to load onto a tractor trailer when the PIT operator reversed and pinned the employee between the PIT and the tractor trailer. The employee suffered a right lower leg injury.

An employee was operating a press to remove a cylinder rod from a piston when a spring released its tension, causing the employee's finger to be caught between the piston and the press. The employee's right index finger was amputated up to the first knuckle.
Employee received multiple burns to the body due to a clamp on a hot water line failing.
A worker was operating wood machinery and suffered an amputation of the left pinky fingertip.

An employee was in the cleanup/pump room delivering tools and helping to change belts on a pump. While helping to remove an old guard from a machine to put on a new one, he amputated his right-hand middle and ring fingertips.
An employee was loading trailers on a semi-trailer for shipment. While climbing off the trailer, the employee's wedding ring got caught, de-gloving the finger.
An employee was walking to the building when he tripped on the uneven surface and fell to the ground, injuring his back.

An employee was assisting the truck driver to clear small amounts of cement left in the vehicle when the rear  chute came down on the employee's left middle finger amputating the tip.  The employee was taken to hospital and the fingertip was reattached.

An employee was monitoring a palletizer machine. The employee climbed up onto the machine to clear a jam at which time the machine completed its cycle. The employee suffered an injury to her right ankle and was admitted to the hospital for treatment and surgery.
An employee was standing on an A-frame ladder preparing to install a heating unit within a garage and fell, fracturing an ankle that required hospitalization.
Employee suffered a partial amputation of the thumb while working with a band saw.
An employee was walking through the yard to the employee parking lot and was struck by a yard horse resulting in a fractured wrist and ribs.
An employee was driving a work vehicle when it caught on fire, burning the employee.
An employee was working on the cam lock for a heat treating table when he suffered an electrical shock.

An employee was using a handheld band saw to cut an old thread pipe. He held the pipe with his left hand while cutting with the right. When he cut through the pipe, he also cut his left index fingertip.
An employee started the pressure washer in order to wash a concrete wall when he lost control of the pressure washer wand resulting in a laceration to his neck. He was hospitalized.
The employee was cutting a tree limb with a chain saw when the tree limb contacted the saw and the saw contacted the employee's arm causing injury to the left arm.

An employee was cutting pork on a meat cutting bandsaw in the meat department of the store. While he was cutting the pork, he looked up and cut his right ring fingertip and fractured his middle finger. The bandsaw had a guard in place at the time of the incident.
An employee was installing two segments of a concrete chute when it closed on his right hand, crushing his fingers and requiring surgery.
An employee amputated the tips of the long finger and ring finger while operating a shaper saw.
While an employee was exiting the excavator, he missed a step and fell about 35 to 40 inches, fracturing his left femur.
An employee fell to the ground while climbing out of his truck, fracturing his lower back.
An employee working on a concrete form slipped and fell on top of a bolt. The employee reinjured a stomach hernia and was hospitalized.
An employee tripped over debris on the floor, fell, and fractured her knee.
An employee suffered an amputation while working on a hydraulic cylinder.

An electrical maintenance technician was trouble shooting an electrical fault on a horizontal machine center (HMC).  The maintenance tech turned the HMC off; however, he did not lockout the HMC.  The maintenance tech went to the back of the HMC and removed a panel to work on the machine and clear the electrical fault.  The maintenance tech cleared the fault.  The setup technician noticed that the fault was cleared from the HMC control panel; and the setup tech pushed the home button to bring the carriage to the starting position.  The maintenance tech was still working on the HMC at the back of machine.  When the setup tech pushed the home button the carriage moved back to the starting position and pinned the maintenance tech's right arm between the carriage and the HMC frame.  The maintenance tech's right arm was broken in two different locations below the elbow.
Employee fell approximately 16 feet through a skylight to the ground inside the building.

Two temporary employees were working to stand up paperboard tubes 18 inches in diameter, 240 inches in length, and 105 pounds in weight.  As one employee turned to walk away, one of the tubes fell and struck the first employee in the head, knocking him to the floor.  This employee sustained a fracture to the second vertebra in his neck, which required surgery and hospitalization.

An employee tripped and fell to the ground.  The employee landed on his knees in a pile of hot petroleum coke.  The employee sustained burns on both legs from the coke, and possibly the hot steam.  The employee was taken by ambulance to Christiana Hospital, and later transferred to Crozer-Chester Medical Center in Chester, Pennsylvania.  The employee sustained 2nd degree burns on his legs, and 3rd degree burns on his ankles.
An employee was taking orders at the drive-thru window when she tripped and fell to the tile floor, fracturing her right ankle.
An employee fell 3' 11'' and dislocated the right shoulder.
An employee was cleaning a condenser coil. Kleen Coil (yellow) spilled into his boots burning his foot.

On December 2, 2015, at approximately 8:45 AM, an employee was changing out propane tanks on a forklift when another forklift operator backed into him, pinning him between the two lifts and fracturing his pelvis.
An employee was dressing a wash pipe when the chain came loose and broke the employee's leg.

A crew was pulling tubing out of a hole. As elevators were coming down, an employee grabbed the tubing elevators by the handles and was unable to push them back far enough to latch them onto tubing. The elevators hit the top of the tubing collar, causing it to shift and pinch his right index finger between the elevators and tubing bail. His finger was lacerated and fractured.

On 02/12/15 employee reported he scraped his left knee during a fall in the workplace. On 02/19/15 employee reported infection on the left knee. On 02/22/15 employee reported he was going to the hospital due to the infection.
Employee was putting a lock on the trailer door in the parking lot and slipped on ice, fell and broke the right ankle.
An employee preparing meals at a residential home slipped and fell on the floor, fracturing a hip.

An employee was injured when he lost control of the ATV he was driving and crashed into a tree while transporting trash to its disposal. The employee sustained a fractured left rib and punctured left lung.

A maintenance employee was repairing a tapping machine. He was working underneath the machine. To access the conveyor belt, he was moving a product tray out of the way by pushing it. The tray came off the guides and tilted, and his finger was caught between the tray and the machine, amputating his left middle fingertip.
An employee was sitting on a skid of 2x4's being transported on a forklift driven by a coworker. The employee fell off of the skid and was run over by the forklift, fracturing/crushing his arm.

An employee was using a pneumatic grease gun to grease a trailer chassis when the gun began to malfunction. As he lifted the unit attached to the grease drum to troubleshoot the problem, his left hand slid. The moving piston then amputated his pinky fingertip between the first and second knuckle.
An employee fell from a rack in the warehouse.

On April 30, at 9:15 a.m., an employee fell from a ladder while dismantling a scaffold inside a tank.  The fall was less than 20 feet. The dimensions of the scaffold were 10x10x33. The employee fractured both heels and sustained a small skull fracture that required stitches. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a reach forklift truck when he struck a steel column while turning. His left foot was pinned between the reach truck and the steel column, and he fractured his lower left leg.

An employee was attempting to break loose a pipe connection with a pipe wrench when his thumb was caught between the pipe and the wrench when the pipe string was lifted. He suffered a soft tissue amputation to the tip of the thumb.

At approximately 7:30 a.m., an employee was working around a flower bed, pulling weeds at a recreation center, when he was bitten by a snake (copperhead) on his right hand/ring finger. He was hospitalized overnight due to severe swelling.
An employee was struck by a forklift transporting materials while controlling traffic at a construction site. The employee suffered fractures to lower extremities.
An employee completed painting activities and started getting cramps. The employee rode the bike to the water station to take a break. The cramping worsened, and the employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell while installing solar panels on a residential roof and required hospitalization.
An employee suffered an amputation injury to the left thumb while using a chop saw.
An employee was using the band saw when his left hand slipped into the blade, cutting a finger. His finger had to be partially amputated.
While exiting a van, an employee stepped and slipped on a patch of ice in the parking lot. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured ankle.
An employee climbed onto shelving and fell, breaking bones in his back.
An employee was delivering packages on his route when he began to feel nauseous and experienced cramping due to heat stress.
An employee was performing steel erection connector activities when the installed bolts and/or nuts on the end of the steel I-beam failed, causing the employee to fall approximately 30 feet.
An employee fell in the ladies restroom fracturing the femur in seven places. She was hospitalized as a result.
An employee was lifting black pipe. A sharp edge of the pipe cut through the employee's gloves causing lacerations.

An employee was preparing a trailer to load a roller that was on a slope. A coworker was in control of the roller and left it unattended. The coworker set the emergency brake, but the emergency brake was not working properly. The roller then began to roll slowly and struck the employee, who suffered a leg/hip dislocation.

An employee was pulling on a pry bar to loosen a track on a skid steer piece of equipment. The pry bar slipped, causing the employee to fall backwards and strike the loader bucket. The employee suffered three broken ribs on the right side.

An employee using a 10-foot A-frame ladder was knocked over when another employee opened a manual overhead door they were working on. The employee fell off the ladder and sustained multiple bone fractures on both forearms and wrists.
A Border Patrol Agent was bitten by a tick and eventually required hospitalization.
An employee was using a carpet grabber to pull up the carpet. The machine slipped/kicked out, which caused employee to fall and fracture his right hip.
An employee was bitten on the right index finger by a poisonous snake and hospitalized.

On January 13, 2015, at approximately 3:00 PM, Employee #1 was using a vacuum hose inside a tank when the vacuum caught his hand and pulled his arm in.  The vacuum was caught on Employee #1's arm for approximately 15 seconds before he alerted Employee #2, the attendant operating the equipment, who turned the vacuum off.  Approximately one hour later, Employee #1's arm began to swell.  He was taken to the hospital, and the swelling continued.  Incisions were made into the arm to relieve pressure, and the employee was admitted overnight.

An employee was cleaning a clogged airlock system that had rotating blades in the airlock. The employee's left index finger made contact with the rotating blade, amputating his fingertip between the top of the finger and the first knuckle/joint.
Employee was pulling copper out of the copper shear when he felt pressure on his left thumb finger. His fingertip was cut when he tried to pull his thumb out.
An employee suffered the partial amputation of the right ring fingertip.

Employee was operating a powered pallet jack in a congested area with racks.  When the employee pushed down the handle on the pallet jack, to engage the device, the tip of his left index finger was caught between the rack edge and the handle resulting in an amputation injury.
Ski instructor fell while avoiding a minor student, resulting in a broken hip.
An employee's index finger was caught in the chain of a conveyor belt, amputating it at the first knuckle.
An employee received crushing injuries to his left ankle when a 600 pound coil of steel fell while positioning the coil onto a forklift.
While carrying a load of pallets on a forklift, an employee struck a column pole, suffering severe head injuries.

An employee was preparing a bundle of rebar for transport when a banding wire broke and pinned the employee's arm between the bundle and a stack of rebar, causing a right arm fracture that required surgery.
On 3/9/16, at 8:06 p.m., an employee injured his right hand while breaking up a fight between inmates. The employee's hand became caught in an inmate's mouth during the altercation.
An employee was descending on a manlift at the first level. As he stepped onto the floor, he fell into the pit of the manlift.
Employee using a table saw amputated his right index finger and his right middle finger.

An employee was working from a 6-foot, A-frame ladder with two associates to remove approximately 16 sheets of melamine (thin particle board) from where they were secured to a permanent fixture in the back room. The employee cut the strap, releasing the boards. The associates were unable to prevent the boards from hitting the ladder, causing it to buck and the employee to fall. The employee suffered a double fracture to the left leg bones just above the ankle, requiring surgery.

An employee was loosening a bolt from a cylinder in the plastic injection molding machine. When he attempted to grab a hand jack, the plate came down because the bolt was loosened, and the employee's right hand was pinched between two metal plates. When he pulled his hand out, his pinky finger got lacerated and required surgery.
An employee was outside on the ground level cleaning up when a coworker on the fifth floor threw trash out the window, which struck the employee in the head.
An 8-inch pipe weighing approximately 500 lbs. rolled and landed on an employee's right leg resulting in a broken tibia and fibula.
While starting a pumping unit at a well site, an employee felt ill and asked for assistance. The employee was hospitalized for heat stroke.
An employee stepped out onto the damp porch, slipped, and fell injuring her left knee.
An employee was installing an air conditioner when he fell approximately 30 feet, suffering a fracture.
An employee fell off a flatbed trailer while loading material onto it.  The employee fractured his clavicle and ribs and displaced his scapula.
An employee was struck by a PIV and admitted to the hospital.
An employee was injured after tripping over a fence.
An employee was moving a large piece of glass. The glass shifted and fell back into him, cutting his arm. He was hospitalized.
An employee was getting ready to start the kettle motor on the tar kettle. The pipe was not hooked up yet, causing hot tar to burn his face, neck, and arms.
An employee was machining a shaft and using sandpaper at a lathe when his right glove got caught in the machine, amputating his right middle and ring fingers at the knuckle.

The employee was tramming a sonic grip (drilling). He was operating the drill from an enclosed cab.  A radiator from an engine next to the cab failed and blew out hot radiator fluid.  The fluid came through the open cab open window causing second degree burns to the employee's face and head.
An employee slipped on the ice in the parking lot and is hospitalized for a possible broken tailbone.
An employee tasted what he thought was a sauce reduction on the stove that turned out to be a pot of chemical from the grease trap and burned his throat.
An employee was moving rolling scaffold when the scaffold ran over a hose and tipped. A worker was on the scaffold at the time.

An employee was attempting to move a trailer with a yard jockey style truck. The employee backed the yard jockey up to the trailer and missed the kingpin. He then attempted to exit the yard jockey and attach the trailer lines. After exiting the yard jockey, he walked to the rear of the truck and placed his body between the yard jockey and the trailer. At the time, the yard jockey was left in reverse and the parking brake was not engaged. The yard jockey moved, and the employee was then caught between the yard jockey and the trailer. He was hospitalized with upper and lower body injuries, including strains, sprains, and severe bruising to the leg and torso.

On June 13, 2015, an employee was operating a stand-up mower. While going up an incline, he lost his balance and slipped off of the mower. He grabbed onto the handle, which made the mower go backwards, and his ankle went under the deck and was cut. He was hospitalized overnight and received ankle stitches.
While testing a circuit card in a thermal test chamber, an employee attempted to adjust the fiber optic cable connection and received an electric shock.
An employee was attempting to rig a solid web rafter beam when the beam leaned toward the employee and fractured the employee's right foot.

An employee was moving a sheet of steel (300 lbs.) with an overhead hoist. The employee was using a magnet to move the metal from the grinding area to the finished stack. When the sheet was over the finished pile of sheets, the magnet released; the sheet fell on his hand, crushing the left middle and ring fingers. He was hospitalized.
On  11/9/15, an employee was pushing a cart while cleaning her work area in the store when she tripped, fell, and broke her right elbow.
Employee's leg was caught between a cable and a stable bar when moving an anchor buoy in the Shinecock Inlet.
An employee had three fingers crushed/amputated while he was loading a part into a CNC machine with another employee.
An employee was decontaminating or sanitizing the chiller area with a hose when a sprocket hit his hand, requiring hospitalization.
On February 27, 2017, at approximately 12:40 PM, an employee was assembling a scaffold and fell from the scaffold. The employee was hospitalized for a herniated disc.
An employee's right hand was injured while attempting to break a jam (conveyor bottle neck) on a conveyor.
An employee was moving a resident's care bed. Her left pinky finger got caught in a pinch point between a closet door and the bed, crushing her fingertip. The fingertip was surgically amputated.
An employee was delivering a postal package at a residence and slipped on snow/ice, breaking an ankle.
An employee's middle fingertip was amputated when a pool table fell on top of the employee's finger.
An employee was welding a trailer fender.  The tire burst and debris struck the welding mask causing a facial laceration and temporary vision impairment. The injured employee was hospitalized.

An employee lost his grip on a dolly and file cabinet he was moving up a flight of stairs. The cabinet fell down the stairs, hitting the employee below and breaking his leg. The injured employee was hospitalized.
An employee was removing product from a shipping stack when her foot got tangled in the string that holds the stack together causing her to fall and fracture the right hip.

An employee was changing a silicone drum attached to a pump. A raised piston on the pump fell 6 inches and pinched the employee's thumb between the base of the piston and the plate resulting in the amputation of the side of the employee's thumb.

An employee was repairing a conveyor that was jammed with product. The employee's fingers were caught in the conveyor pulley when it started back up, amputating the pinky finger and fracturing the right ring finger.
On March 2, 2015, an employee entering his office from outdoors fell and fractured his hip.  The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working at the de-palletizer and reached with their right hand to retrieve a slip sheet from the top of the empty cans. The sweeper arm on the de-palletizer, which is located above the cans and pushes the cans off of the pallet and onto a conveyor belt, came down and caught her right hand resulting in a fractured right forearm.
While walking to deliver mail at a residential home, an employee tripped and fell on the side of a walkway, suffering a right wrist fracture.
An employee's wrist was severely lacerated by a running miter saw.
An employee slipped and fell on the ice while walking into work and was hospitalized with a broken lower left leg.
While cleaning snow off of a roof, the employee fell through a skylight.

On Sunday, September 20, 2015 at approximately 11:15 AM, an employee was walking down the cooking galley carrying a 10 pound bag of bacon.  He slipped and fell, landing on his buttocks. During his fall he reached out and grabbed a hot fryer full of hot grease to try and break/prevent his fall.  The hot grease caused second degree burns to his left hand and arm.
A crane maintenance employee doing a cable inspection slipped and fell approximately 40 feet. The employee was not wearing PFAS.

An employee was working on the buffering lines running a cable. The jacket came off while he was trying to restring the machine. He pulled the yarn and the dance arm became loose pulling the yarn and causing it to tighten. The yarn tightened around his right middle finger causing an above the bone amputation.

An employee was guiding a car into the tire and lube bay while a coworker drove it. The coworker's foot slipped off of the brake and engaged the accelerator. The vehicle struck the injured employee and pushed him into a tire machine and the wall. He sustained a puncture wound above his knee and fractured his leg.
An employee was standing on a column guiding a forklift operator when the forklift struck the column, causing the employee to fall. The employee suffered bruises and possible internal damage.

An employee was placing cardboard into the cardboard compactor chute while standing on a work platform with railings. The employee stepped through the railings to step on the cardboard and push it down further into the chute. The compactor was engaged at the time. The employee's leg got caught and became entangled in the moving cardboard. The employee suffered a broken leg and required hospitalization for surgery. The leg had to be amputated at the knee.
An employee slipped on wet pavement and broke the right fibula and ankle requiring surgery.
An employee was restocking a unit when the employee stepped onto the conveyer. A roller was missing and the employee's left foot went through the conveyor resulting in a broken ankle.
An employee was placing an epoxy mixture in a hole.  Because of vibration, the employee was struck by the epoxy grout under his right arm and side.
Employee was driving an electric pallet jack straight down on a ramp when she lost control and pinned her left leg between the mid-rail and the pallet jack, resulting in a fracture.
An employee suffered a back injury and required hospitalization after the employee's chair broke.

An employee was cleaning a card machine's rollers. When the employee removed the roller belt, the rollers moved and pulled the employee's left arm between two rollers. The employee suffered a left forearm avulsion and partial amputation of the left pinky and forefinger.
On 2/25/2015, an employee's left index finger was caught in a conveyor belt that was being used to move shingles to a rooftop and crushed but not severed.
An employee was struck on the right ankle and toes by a passing forklift and hospitalized.
An employee was working on a parcel sorting machine when the employee's hand was caught between the open track and dragged under the carriage, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

On December 9, 2016, an employee was processing clean dishes and putting them on a cart when she tripped and fell over a four-wheel dolly that was stored beneath a counter and protruded slightly beyond the edge of the counter. She fractured her right hip and right shoulder.

On March 8, 2015, at approximately 8:08 p.m., an employee disconnected a hose from a cylinder of allyl alcohol. He carried the hose to an area and began cleaning the hose with toluene when he experienced shortness of breath. An air evacuation was requested and the employee was air lifted to the hospital and hospitalized for chest pains.
An employee was testing tractor brake air springs by holding the air springs under water and looking for leaks. An air spring exploded and the employee sustained facial fractures.
An employee began stacking rice on pallets at 6:00 a.m. At 8:30 a.m., he experienced stomach and leg cramps. He was hospitalized overnight for dehydration.
An employee fell while moving boxes and injured his left hip.
An employee fell from a 15-foot-high ladder.
An employee was placing a part in a bending machine when it cycled, amputating the employee's left-hand middle finger.

An employee fell 18 feet through an open hole on a 1/4 x 12 pitch roof while monitoring employees installing a standing seam metal roof. The employee sustained head lacerations and fractures to the skull and face.
An employee was carrying breadsticks out of the walk-in freezer when a piece of metal on the freezer door sliced his foot open.

An employee was using the table saw in the maintenance shop when the saw kicked back and cut his fingers. He suffered a right thumb laceration and amputation of skin from his first and second fingers. The saw was not guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was attempting to place a tarp over the load of gypsum he was going to transport. The employee fell from the top of the load and sustained three broken ribs, a mild concussion and a fractured right orbital. A personal fall arrest system was not used at the time.
An employee was working at a sub-station when he experienced cramps and fatigue from hot weather conditions. He was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was helping unload a semi truck from behind the semi. As he opened the doors of the semi, the semi backed up which startled the employee. He started feeling chest pains and went to his manager's office to explain he wasn't feeling well. The employee was hospitalized where it was determined that the employee had a minor stroke.

An employee was adjusting a 100-ton jack so that it could push pins that held a gantry tube in position. When the jack was in position and pressure was starting to be applied to the pins, something slipped and caused the employee's fingers to get pinched off. About 1.5 inches of his left ring and middle fingers were amputated.

An employee dropped a piece of ice on the ground while removing a cap from a combo.  He tried to move the piece of ice out of the walkway with his foot, lost his balance and fell to the ground. He fractured the tibia and dislocated the ankle.

Two operators were attempting to clear a "down bottle error" on the blow molding machine. They opened an interlock door and were looking into the bed area. One employee leaned on a metal plate that guides the bottles. The pressure from the leaning employee released a metal flap that caught the employee's right middle finger.
An employee fell off a scissor lift that was approximately 12 feet high, breaking both heels and a vertebra.
An employee got out of his truck to unhook the trailer. His shoelace got caught on a piece of metal and he fell on the ground, injuring his forehead and breaking his arm.

An employee was servicing a conveyor belt system to free a jammed shirt. He was using a knife to cut away the shirt and free the jammed system when his shirt was caught by the conveyor belt. The belt then pulled his left hand between the roller, the belt, and the frame, causing burns to the back of his left hand from his knuckles to his wrist and lacerations to the underside of his left thumb.
An employee was sanitizing a chocolate enrober. As he attempted to unjam the chocolate pump, the pump started and amputated his left index fingertip.
An employee was cleaning a mixer in the sink while still plugged into an electrical outlet.  The mixer was turned on and the tip of her right index finger was severed when it was caught in the shaft.
An employee's left hand was caught between a pontoon and a rigging chain, amputating the left-hand index finger at the first digit.
An employee was operating a punch press when the die came down on his left thumb and amputated the tip.

An employee was performing work at a transformer.  The line the employee was going to work on was de-energized and grounded. The employee came into contact with the energized line, which resulted in burns to both hands.

At approximately 3:45 a.m., on 9/27/2015, an employee working on a bottling line was preparing to do some cleaning. The employee filled a hand sprayer with cleaning product and pumped the sprayer up. The sprayer exploded, causing a severe injury to his hand, as well as minor lacerations to his face and legs. The hand injury required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee fell approximately 21 feet when a guardrail failed, suffering a broken right arm.

An employee pulled Printing Section # 1 out of the Martin Machine and opened the interlocked cover on the ink rollers. He then took a pair of vise-grips, depressed the jog button, and clamped the button to the housing in the depressed position causing the rollers to rotate slowly. The employee then used a hose to spray water on the partially submerged  ink rollers to clean them. The inside of the container in which the rollers were partially submerged was painted black. The color of the ink was also black. The employee reached his  right hand into the liquid to see if it was clear, and his hand was pulled into the nip points of the rollers resulting in the amputation of the middle and ring fingers and one half of the index finger on his right hand.
While unloading laundry bins from the back of a delivery truck, an employee's foot was caught under the hydraulic lift at the back of the truck, amputating his toes.

An operator was unloading pipe from a truck using an excavator. A sling was attached to the pipe. When the operator picked up the pipe, it turned 180 degrees and struck the injured employee, fracturing his pelvis.
An employee's right index fingertip was pinched by a hydraulic cylinder and amputated while performing maintenance work on a press.
An employee was removing old power lines with another employee. The power line tilted and struck the employee's left leg.
An employee was moving two refrigerators with a pallet jack when the top refrigerator tipped over and landed on the employee. The employee suffered bruises and broken vertebrae.
An employee was unchocking a piece of equipment when his right hand was caught by the machine belt amputating the fourth finger at the first knuckle.
On February 15, 2017, an employee was working cables for dry dock spray curtains with a capstan. His left index finger was caught in the cable where it meets the drum, amputating his fingertip.
An employee's left hand received an electrical shock when it grabbed an electrical conduit wiring as he climbed down a ladder.
An employee was trying to fix a belt on the corrugated paper cutting machine when the belt engaged and pulled his hand through the belt and pulley, amputating his right middle finger.

The heat treat/batch furnace operator had latched the batch furnace carriage with a bar and was moving the carriage to the furnace. The carriage jumped on the track and the latch came loose pushing the bar towards the operator pinning the left hand pinky finger between the bar and the nearby handrail.
An employee was pulling clots when he felt a pain. He went to the hospital for a hernia.
An employee was trimming a tree when a branch fell, bounced up and struck him in the chest, resulting in two fractured ribs and a bruised lung.
Employees were installing H beams when one employee felt a static shock through his leather gloves. He was hospitalized with atrial fibrillation.
An employee was sprayed in the face with general purpose cleaner as he was mixing the chemicals. He suffered an allergic reaction to the medication he was given.

An employee was leveling the railcar prior to setting, positioning, and tack welding the roof onto the railcar when he injured his left thumb that required surgical repair. The injury resulted in a partial fingertip amputation with exposed tip of the distal phalanx.
The employee was attempting to connect a hydraulic hose and had hydraulic fluid injected under the skin on his left thumb when the line became charged.
An employee's left leg was fractured when he tried to prevent his reach truck from striking a fixed guardrail.

On August 16, 2016, at approximately 10:59 p.m., an employee was attempting to fix a sensor inside the enclosure of a laser weld cell. While the employee was inside the enclosure, a carrier that moved parts into the welding machine moved and struck the employee in the left leg, puncturing the left thigh.
An employee was attempting to repair a cable from a ladder. As he descended, the ladder moved and he fell. He got caught between the steps and broke his right leg.
An employee installing gutters fell off an 8 foot step ladder onto the ground (concrete pavers) below.  The employee suffered a fractured hip, which resulted in an overnight stay in the hospital.

An employee and a coworker were standing on a shelving unit when the support beam was knocked out beneath them. The employee lost his balance and fell approximately 15 feet to the concrete below, breaking his left wrist and requiring hospitalization.
An employee working at the alignment hoist was checking the vehicle suspension.  The hoist dropped down, pinning the employee's left forearm between the car and the hoist.

The employee was loading film/packaging materials at the start of his shift when the material jammed in the machine.  When he manually removed the jam, the machine restarted and the blade amputated his left index fingertip.
An employee got tangled in a computer cord at her desk and then fell to the ground, fracturing her left arm and requiring major surgery; she also bruised her left ankle and foot.
An employee amputated his left-hand ring and middle fingertips when his hand contacted a running fan belt.

On June 30, 2016, a work crew was preparing to offload an electric utility pole from a trailer to install it into the ground. As they attempted to roll the pole off the trailer, a hook-shaped copper ground on the pole caught and wrapped up the safety vest of the injured employee, causing him to be pulled toward the rolling pole. He tried to free himself, but the pole landed on his lower right leg, breaking his fibula and dislocating his ankle.
The employee was walking on the property when he tripped over a concrete parking stop and injured his right knee.
While operating a mail-processing machine, an employee's head became trapped between the equipment and a guard, fracturing the skull, breaking ribs, severing ears, and damaging vertebrae.

An employee was injured and required hospitalization after she fell in the dining area of the facility.  Mats had been stacked in an area and the employee tripped over the mats while carrying a tray of food.

On 10/21/2015, a roofing employee was performing a roofing tear off of dead wood. During the replacement of dead wood the worker ran out of replacement wood. The worker covered an opening in the roof with felt paper. The employee lost his balance and jumped from the roof of a single story mobile home instead of falling through the felt covering. Both heels were injured.
An employee was carrying a piece of hydraulic shoring on his shoulder and it slipped. He grabbed it and pinched his finger, amputating the tip.
An employee was exiting a forklift when his ankle was crushed between the vehicle and a raised dock plate. He suffered a broken ankle.
A hydraulic cylinder fell, landing on the employee's right thumb, resulting in the amputation of the right thumb fingertip.
An employee fell off the back of a truck/loading dock while working.
An employee was struck by a large 4  ft. X 2 ft. piston while cleaning a dough machine resulting in trauma to the forearm.
On 12/9/2015, at 12:15 a.m., an employee was cleaning a conveyor belt when his left hand got caught under the belt. His left ring finger was amputated just above the lowest/first knuckle.
A slide gate closed on and severely cut an employee's left wrist, resulting in a left hand amputation.
An employee was gassing up his company vehicle at the private fueling station on company property when the company owner drove by and struck the employee causing a broken leg.

An employee brushing walls with a masonry brush near the northwest corner stairway attempted to step from a step ladder onto a scaffold resulting in a fall.  The employee was admitted into the hospital with a collapsed lung.
An employee was walking in the warehouse when he stepped on an extension cord and lost his balance, falling to the ground and fracturing his right hip.
Two of an employee's fingers were amputated.

An employee was operating an injection molding press machine. The injured employee pulled a part out of the press through the door. The door jammed when the injured employee tried to close it, so the employee reached inside the machine to clear the jam. The employee's hand got caught by a machine part; the employee's thumb tip, including part of the thumbnail, was amputated.
While working on the 1st floor mezzanine installing structural steel, an employee was struck in the head by a steel beam and required hospitalization.

An employee was attempting to close the spray booth door when the suction of the spray booth ventilation caused the door to close suddenly and pinch the employee's left middle finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee fell down stairs in section 322 of the TD Bank North Garden suffering a broken tailbone.

An employee was operating a fastener tool. While checking the tightness of bolts, he lost balance and pinched his right hand pinky finger between the fastener tool and the wall. Employee suffered an open fracture of the right hand pinky finger and was hospitalized.

Employee was polishing stem using two feet of polishing cloth when the cloth and the employee's glove got caught in the rotating stem. The employee's left hand was pulled into the stem, resulting in a left thumb amputation.

Employees were going to remove an aeration pipe (18 inch in diameter and 10 feet long) that had potatoes on it with a 3/8" chain & a skid steer with forks.  The chain was secured around the pipe and around both forks on the skid steer.  After the pipe was free of the potatoes, the skid steer driver began to back up, while another employee guided the pipe.  While backing up, one of the skid steer forks hit one of the bulkhead tubes (75-80#) that was sitting in its slot. The tube came out of its slot and fell roughly 7'8" striking the employee on the head.  He fell backwards into the potato pile and suffered a head laceration.
An employee was attempting to remove hamburger meat around the impact area of a hamburger patty press when his right middle fingertip was amputated by the press point.

A worker was in the process of moving a large round plate off of the top of the fixture when the plate became stuck on one of the mounting bolts. The plate then shifted, swung around the fixture, toppled over, and struck the worker in the left foot.
While conducting an inventory check in preparation for an inspection, an employee was climbing a fixed ladder and fell approximately 12 feet. He was hospitalized.

An employee was unscrewing a 90 foot vertical pipe weighing 1000 lbs. from the rigging. The pipe came loose and fell onto the employee's right foot. The employee was hospitalized for treatment and the right little toe was amputated.

An employee was drilling into a pipe in the hydrogen process unit when the line flashed. He was hospitalized with second degree burns on his hands, neck, and chest and third degree burns on his fingertips.
An employee was helping to move a stretch roller with the motor jack. The stretch roller fell over and landed on his right foot/lower leg, breaking three bones.
An employee was installing tape to hold the paper protector on a metal roller. The employee's right finger got caught and crushed in the drive gear located next to the roller.
An employee was starting up a production line and putting film into two nip rollers. The film caught and pulled a finger into the nip rollers resulting in an amputation injury.
An employee was using a ladder on a tile floor with plastic sheeting when the ladder slipped out, causing the employee to fall and break their pelvis.
The employee was driving a forklift and pinched their right hand on the warehouse rack resulting in an amputation injury to the right middle finger.
An employee experienced heat stress symptoms after engaging in production work, requiring hospitalization.
An employee walked into a unit while walking and talking with a coworker; his right leg collapsed/fractured.
An employee dislocated their left-hand pinky finger. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery to repair torn tendons.
An employee was re-setting the car wash and slipped and fell fracturing a knee.
An employee was painting on the roof when he slipped and fell to the ground breaking his pelvis, injuring his back, and bruising a lung.

Workers were breaking up concrete to install gas lines and were placing the concrete chunks on a flatbed truck. The injured employee was operating a backhoe. The flatbed operator tilted the bed of the flatbed truck slightly to make it easy to move concrete into the bucket of the backhoe. The injured employee then climbed up onto the tilted flatbed and began moving the smaller pieces of concrete into the bucket of the backhoe by hand when a large piece of concrete slid and pinned his ankle between the bucket of the backhoe and that large piece of concrete. His ankle was crushed.

An employee who had climbed a ladder to service communication equipment on a pole 18' above the ground was attacked by wasps. During his rapid descent down the ladder, he lost his footing and fell to the ground, resulting in a broken leg and hospitalization.
A temporary employee was cleaning the mixer with salt and fell into the mixer. The mixer actuated and the employee was injured.
An employee was leaning against a wooden handrail when it broke, causing him to fall to the ground. He broke his upper right arm and required surgery.
An employee was cleaning out the dishwasher when he suddenly fell to the ground and hit his head, becoming unconscious due to dehydration.

An employee was guiding a forklift to set a roll of conveyor belting onto a stand on a table.  The stand collapsed when the roll was set, and the employee was catapulted up and off of the table, landing 12 feet away on a concrete floor in a sitting position. He injured his right hip and buttocks and was hospitalized, and later had surgery to correct hip fractures.
An employee received an arm injury from a wire stripper machine.
An employee amputated three fingers on his left hand while working with a plate roller machine in the Sheet Metal Department.
An employee was picking up trash at the site. At the end of the day, he started having cramps and not feeling well. He was hospitalized overnight for dehydration.
An employee was helping to move a transformer when his left index finger was pinched and fractured between the transformer and metal strapping on the wall.
An employee's finger was bitten by a venomous snake while attempting to search for a welding pipe. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was placing material inside a drill press when the press came down and caught his right glove. The distal half of his right thumb was amputated at the middle joint. He was hospitalized and received treatment.
An employee was cutting "signature" material on the trimmer. The blade of the trimmer came down on the employee's finger resulting in a right index fingertip amputation.
An employee was doing a machine die rotation on a brake press when the die slipped out of place and fell onto the employee's left middle finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was extending a scaffold being used by employees to lay bricks for a school wall. As the employee was bolting down the scaffold towers, his wrench slipped off the bolt. This caused the employee to fall over the front of the scaffold and over the brick wall being built. The employee suffered a possible hip fracture and a dislocated shoulder.
An employee was unstrapping packs from an A-frame railcar when a pack of five railroad ties fell from the railcar and struck the employee's leg.
After working in the hot kitchen area, an employee became sick with nausea and stomach pains. She was hospitalized for dehydration and heat stress.
On August 12, 2016, an employee attaching toters to a truck began to feel lightheaded and dizzy due to a heat-related illness in the late afternoon.
An employee was cleaning up water that had leaked from the dishwasher. She slipped and fell breaking her knee cap.

An employee was helping to set dies when his left hand got struck by the die as it was being lowered into the parallel. His left-hand middle finger was injured and had to be amputated to the second knuckle.
An employee passed out due to dehydration while shuttling newly manufactured automobiles to the PIO area for finishing in high temperatures.
An employee's finger was scraped on a cart that was being moved and became infected.
An employee slipped on grating, which resulted in leg fracture.
An employee was on a 5-foot fixed ladder, descending a work platform, when he missed a ladder rung and slid down the ladder to the floor. He fractured his right foot and required surgery.
An employee was operating a punch press and amputated four fingers on the left hand.
An employee was on a standup forklift when his left foot became pinned between the equipment and a guardrail, fracturing it.
An employee was moving a tree log with a remote mechanical grapple when the log came loose and rolled onto his left lower leg. He was hospitalized for a leg fracture.
An employee was replacing a pyrite gate on a pulverizer when the gate slipped and struck the end of the employee's left index finger, resulting in a partial amputation.
An employee was driving a golf cart through a gate and used her left arm to push the gate open. Her arm became caught between the golf cart bar and the gate, breaking it.
On June 1, 2016, an employee was hospitalized and treated for heat exhaustion while collecting solid waste.
A temporary employee was working on a machine used to split pillar cores when a piece of log broke off into the machine. As he attempted to retrieve the piece, the machine amputated his thumb tip.

An employee was making a delivery at Case Western Reserve. After unloading his truck, he began to lower the bay door. As the door lowered, his right middle finger got pinched in the door panel, partially amputating the finger.
Employee was hospitalized after a slip and fall that resulted in a broken hip.
An employee was using a tool to clean equipment when the tool snapped back and caught his left ring finger, amputating the fingertip.
On or about October 20, 2015, an employee was cutting a piece of wood with a circular saw when the saw kicked back and cut his upper right leg. He was hospitalized.

An employee was pulling a welder up to the catwalk with a rope when the left side of the catwalk railing broke, causing him to fall 25 feet to the ground below. His head hit a toolbox, and his back hit the platform railing. He was hospitalized with an L1 lumbar fracture and required staples for his head injury.

A grounds maintenance employee was using a ladder to cut a large tree branch with a chainsaw.  The tree branch broke loose, striking the ladder and causing the employee to fall.  The employee was hospitalized and treated for a laceration to the right forearm (involving 40 stitches), a punctured lung, and a fractured pelvis.

An employee was manually feeding tubes into the tube straightener in the warehouse area with two other employees. The employee was feeding a square tube when his left thumb tip was caught between the tube and a roller.
An employee was testing de-energized conductors at a solar farm construction site when an arc flash/fire occurred, burning the employee's hands, face, and neck. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was delivering mail and fell fracturing a hip that required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was delivering a package to a residence.  When the employee walked up the driveway, she encountered a slick spot due to ice.  The employee fell and broke her left leg in two places.
An employee slipped in a pool of water approximately 3 inches in diameter and fell to the floor, breaking her right femur and requiring surgery.

An employee was on a 5-foot ladder cutting a pipe used to carry nitrogen. As the employee was cutting the pipeline, the pipe (which was filled with carbon dioxide) ruptured. The employee suffered a concussion, fractured orbital bones, a skull fracture, and neck injury.

A carpenter employee received multiple fractures to his leg when he was struck by and pinned by a section of concrete form.  The employee was climbing down from the top of a stack of concrete forms when he stepped on an L bracket on one of the forms causing the form to move and strike the employee.

An employee was attaching hooks to an upright storage tank when the tank moved, causing the employee to fall approximately 7 feet from the ladder to the concrete below. The employee suffered a fractured wrist and damaged heel.

An employee was assisting in moving a monorail frame steel structure by rigging the frame to a winch and roust about. The steel cable carrying a 1,800 pound steel beam snapped and the steel beam fell to the floor, bounced, and struck the employee on the upper left leg and breaking the femur bone.
An employee was struck and trapped by a tire he was removing. He was hospitalized.
An employee sprained her right ankle while chasing after a student.
On or about July 28, 2015, employees were moving 20-foot tall racking when a section fell, striking an employee on the head and resulting in serious injuries and hospitalization.
An employee was dismounting the cab of a tractor. His foot became stuck on the step and he fell, dislocating his hip.

An employee received a minor burn on the arm while performing hot work in a CHT septic tank. Later, the employee developed a severe infection in the arm and received treatments including drainage and antibiotics.

An employee was flagging to help a tractor-trailer driver park when a gust of wind sent a temporary job fence in the air. The fence struck the employee who sustained neck and back compressions and a fractured sternum.
The employee was conducting preventive maintenance on a sit down lift truck. As he was removing a side panel, the battery rolled out and struck his left knee cap fracturing it.

An employee operating the resaw was changing the thickness and making adjustments to the line bar. The machine was accidentally started, and his left foot got caught in the chain and sprocket, breaking a bone in the big toe of his left foot.
The cover of a splice box closed on an employee's hand, amputating the ring and middle finger down to the middle knuckle and a small portion of the pinky.
An employee was using a saw to cut an 8-inch PVC fire-waster line pipe when the pipe moved, causing the saw to kick back and lacerate the left side of the employee's chest.
An employee performing baton training received a rotator cuff tear and was admitted to the hospital.

An employee took the cover off a chain and tried to grease a bearing. The PTO was engaged and the chain was moving at the time. When the employee put one pump in, the chain caught his glove, sending his fingers in through the sprocket and chain. His left thumb was partially amputated, and his index, middle, and ring fingers were lacerated and crushed.

An employee was operating a t6 roll-threading machine. He placed a bar into the machine; the machine cycled and caught his hand between the bar and the machine.  His right middle finger was partially amputated.
An employee was working in a field environment and stepped near a hole where a rattlesnake contacted the employee on the lower leg.

An employee was emptying trash into an outside dumpster. He climbed a ladder to stomp down the trash. While he was getting back onto the ladder from the dumpster, he lost his footing and fell to the ground below, injuring his back and head.
An employee injured his right ankle following a four foot fall from a straight ladder.

An employee was extinguishing a fire beneath a combine. The combine driver did not know the employee was beneath the combine and ran over the employee, who suffered internal bleeding in the right leg and a spinal injury.
An employee was injured in Plant B at the 3-2 straightener during a guide change.  The employee was struck by a 1000 pound guide and then fell down the slide/chute into the scale pit.
An employee was removing material from the attic of the church and fell approximately eight feet through a section of the ceiling landing on the floor.
An employee attempted to remove a jammed piece of wood from a running saw. When the jam was relieved, the 12" diameter saw started rotating and deeply lacerated the palm of his right hand.

On 2/5/16 at approximately 9:00 a.m., an employee was loading four-inch black pipe onto a truck rack. The employee was securing the pipe into straps and a pipe rolled back onto his hands. The employee was wearing leather work gloves. The pipe crushed his right middle finger on his right hand resulting in a hairline fracture and laceration requiring sutures. The employee was later hospitalized for treatment of an infection.
An employee was removing dirty iron from a bull ladle when he was spattered by the hot iron and suffered second and third degree burns on his face, neck, shoulders, and arms.
An employee was hospitalized with a broken right hip after exiting elevator bank 3 on the first floor of the J. Edgar Hoover Building.

An employee was operating an overhead crane to move steel coils. While raising the crane to remove the lifting chain, the employee had his right hand on the lifting chain. The end of the chain got stuck and started to pull the coil towards an adjacent coil. The employee's right ring and middle fingers were pinched between the coil and lifting chain. The employee required surgery.
An employee was walking into a resident's room when she tripped over a dog cage and fell fracturing a hip. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was unloading coils from a truck using an overhead crane and was injured when his finger was crushed between the rigging coil tongs and the coils that were being picked up by the rigging.
An employee in an aerial lift was installing sandwiches between precast panels when the panels collapsed and fell on top of the lift. He suffered a broken leg and wrist.

On February 16, 2015, an employee was unloading a truck. He fell off the back of the truck when the material he was unloading shifted and pushed him off. The employee broke his right ankle in the fall.

Employees were installing a pump at the facility. During the process, the pump shifted and caught one of the employees fingers, smashing it against the pedestal wall of the pump. Employee was transported to the Memorial Herman Hospital where they determined that the finger had a fracture.

Two employees were unloading equipment with a truck-mounted spooling crane cable. They attempted to untangle the cable by spooling it out. The first employee's hand was on the spool when the second employee engaged it. The cable then amputated the first employee's thumb.
An employee was struck by a fork truck as it backed up resulting in a head and foot injury.

An employee was draining a chiller while standing on a platform to push back poultry. The paddle of the chiller struck the employee's elbow and pushed it into a guard, lacerating it and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using a hardwood pole to clean a furnace's tap channel when molten metal slag suddenly released from the furnace, burning the employee's hands, head, face, left ear, lips, and mouth.

On 11/5/15 a worker delivering foodservice items at a restaurant began to feel back pain while stacking boxes on a hand cart.


On 11/6/15 a worker climbing out of a semi trailer missed a ladder rung on the side of the trailer and fell fracturing ribs and the collar bone. 

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer.  These events are captured as one report.
The employee, operating a company vehicle, was involved in a two car accident at an intersection.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was unloading his trailer on a snowy dock surface. When he went to lift the dock plate, he lost his balance and fell onto his right hip, fracturing it and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working the drive-thru window when a coworker poured water into the chili-warmer and created steam. The employee experienced breathing difficulties from steam exposure and was hospitalized.
An employee drove a forklift into a freezer trailer. The forks got caught on a floor plate, jarring the forklift. The employee's neck was injured.
An employee working with a grout pump got his hand caught in the pump resulting in the amputation of his right hand.
An employee rolled her ankle getting out of her car in the parking lot upon arriving to work fracturing it.

An employee was at a residence to assemble some furniture. When he was walking to the house, he tripped on the concrete curb and hit his head/face. The employee lost some teeth and suffered contusions to face/head.
While attempting to put the chain back on a cartoner machine, an employee's fingertip became caught in the chain and sprocket and was amputated.
An employee was unclamping a steel beam when the beam fell over and struck the employee. The employee was hospitalized with injuries to the right hand and both lower legs.
An employee slipped on a patch of ice in front of the entrance to the building and fell breaking a leg.
An employee slipped on ice and fell injuring his left ankle.
An employee was carrying some product from the cooler to the sales floor. The employee slipped on a piece of garbage on the floor, fell to the floor, and suffered a broken kneecap on her left leg.
While working, an employee tripped over a PVC pipe, striking her head and face on the concrete floor and breaking her left arm.
An employee was hospitalized after falling from the bed of the truck while performing roofing work.

A maintenance technician was preparing to work on a maturation tank valve. When he opened the valve a caustic chemical splashed him in the face.  The employee suffered burns to his eyes and the left side of his face and neck.

An employee was changing a lamp in a light fixture when he lost his balance and fell off an 8-foot ladder. He struck the concrete below and suffered a broken back bone, fractured skull, and brain trauma.
An employee was building a pallet and was bent over putting in the last nail. As he stood up, the nail gun trigger was still depressed and shot a nail into his ankle.
An employee was moving a fluid pump into the maintenance bay when a work platform fell and struck the employee's right arm, fracturing it.
An employee was repairing a winch with a ratchet wrench. Tension on the winch caused it and the wrench to spin. The spinning wrench struck the employee's right lower arm and fractured it.
An employee sustained an amputation of the left ring fingertip while operating a drill press.
At 2:30 AM on 7/9/2015, an employee's right arm was crushed by a pizza bread-making conveyor while she was cleaning the conveyor rollers. She required hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was moving a 55-gallon drum of hydrofluoric acid onto a pallet on a forklift. The employee pushed the drum with his hands and knee. Approximately 1 hour later, he noticed his pant leg was wet and recognized the acid odor. He suffered 2nd degree burns to his knee cap and was hospitalized.
After climbing over a 3-foot joist, an employee stepped on a loose angle iron and fell on his right side, suffering internal injuries.
On 11/13/15, at 10:45 p.m., an employee was struck by a semi-truck in the parking lot. The employee suffered a broken pelvis.

On 09/25/2015, at approximately 4:28 p.m., a maintenance employee was injured while working on a drive chain and sprocket. The employee's right hand became caught in the equipment, fracturing the right index, middle, and ring fingers.
An employee fell from the back of a truck while loading materials, suffering a fractured leg.
An employee was impaled by copper tubing while walking between two machines on the copper tubing line.
An employee walking at the job site slipped on ice and suffered a spiral fracture of the right femur.
An employee was walking into work when she slipped on ice and fell in the parking lot fracturing the right ankle.

An employee was working with a rotomill machine on the ground checking asphalt depth. The employee used his foot instead of the air wand to remove excess. He caught his foot in the rotomill track injuring the right big toe. A physician amputated bone to close the wound.

On August 4, 2015, at approximately 7:45 a.m., an employee was starting to descend from a crane. As he bent down to grab the hand rail, he flexed his knee and his knee popped. He then called for help to get down from the crane.
An employee was cleaning a mixing bowl when the bowl motor was actuated. The employee suffered skull fractures, lacerations and soft tissue damage and was hospitalized.
An employee was lubricating a drive chain on a conveyer when his rag and hand were drawn into the chain and sprocket, partially amputating his finger.
Employee sustained an amputation of the right pinky fingertip while loading a wooden reel onto a pack line. His right little finger was crushed between the flange and the reel.
An employee was clearing a jam in a machine used to extrude rubber when the employee's right middle finger came in contact with the "wipe" and was partially amputated.
An employee was setting up a core machine and became caught in the machine.

On 1-15-15 at 11:30AM an employee walking down stairway 2 from the third to the second floor fell. The worker has a fractured thoracic spine, a fractured middle finger, a bump on the head, and is having tests on her hip and thigh.

An employee was walking from the dock area into a trailer across the dock plate/bumper when he misstepped and lost his footing. His right foot and leg went off the dock plate/bumper, leading his left leg to bend abnormally and his left femur to break above the knee.
An employee was inspecting a high-pressure hydraulic hose that had a pinhole leak when it injected hydraulic fluid into the employee's left middle finger.
An employee was walking around a customer's establishment looking for a floor mat that was to be cleaned when the employee tripped over a duffel bag and fell to the floor, suffering a fractured hip.

Employees were cleaning up the warehouse area when a bundle of boards fell onto an employee striking their head. Two hours later the injured employee suffered stroke-like symptoms and was hospitalized.
An employee fell from a sawhorse while working at a height of two feet. The employee suffered a broken tailbone and fractured vertebrae.

An employee was loading equipment and tools onto a truck to prepare to leave a well site. The employee was standing on a lubricator rack/catwalk where he was releasing the straps on the crane when the catwalk collapsed. The employee fell approximately 5 feet to the truck below and hit his head. He was hospitalized.
An employee was moving a refrigerator when it fell onto the employee's forearm, breaking it. The employee was hospitalized.

On or about October 14, 2015, at 5:15 am the employee opened the back of the truck and mis-stepped into the six-inch gap between the loading dock and the back of the truck. His left leg plunged into the gap up to his thigh. He was hospitalized for observation and care of a deep left thigh contusion.
An employee misstepped while climbing an extension ladder and fell approximately 10 feet, suffering facial fractures to the eye socket area.
An employee was spotting for a crane when the employee's fingers got caught in the winch line.
An employee was struck by a forklift that was backing up, suffering compound fractures to his left leg.
While closing two oven doors, an employee's fingers went through the door handles and were pinched between the doors, amputating two fingertips.
An employee was loading wood onto a stack when lumber fell off the stack and struck his right leg, fracturing his femur.

An employee was attempting to hook the tongue of a baggage cart to the hook on a tug vehicle when the tug driver's foot slipped off the brake pedal and onto the gas pedal. The tug was in reverse and moved backwards, hitting the employee and pinning him between the vehicle and the baggage cart. He suffered a severe fracture to his left leg that required hospitalization.
On June 6, 2015, an employee accessing paper goods caught her foot on a pallet. She lost her balance and fell, fracturing her hip.
An employee was helping to set elevators and was also taking trash outside when he became dizzy and nauseated. He was hospitalized for dehydration from heat stress.

An employee was repairing the stacker portion of a door machine that had been elevated and supported with a forklift. When he removed the forklift and then removed a bolt, the stacker fell on him, crushing his pelvis and breaking ribs.

An employee was attempting to free up some stuck boxes along the conveyor line.  The employee was pulling on some stuck boxes when his hands slipped off the box he was lifting. He fell to the side and stopped his fall with his right hand. During that process, his right hand was caught between two rollers. In freeing his hand, he pulled the skin off the top of his hand.  He was hospitalized.
An employee was closing the door to the rapid enforcement lane booth when a gust of wind caused the door to slam shut on his right hand, amputating his fourth fingertip.

Employees were lifting a BOP using a forklift to work on the bottom of the BOP. While the BOP was suspended by the forklift, the injured employee placed his hand on the forks. The BOP rolled backwards, catching and amputating his left pinky fingertip between the heavy equipment and the fork.
Employee slipped on ice in a customer's parking lot and fell resulting in two broken ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee was raising the safety rail on the conveyor and holding onto the vertical support rail. His left middle finger was caught in the hinge amputating the fingertip.
An employee collapsed at the fuel pumps for unknown reasons.
An employee slipped and fell injuring her hip that required hospitalization.

An employee struck a tree and broke her right ankle while driving between scheduled delivery points. The employee lost control of her vehicle while attempting to avoid a dog. The brakes locked, causing the vehicle to slide across a grassy area and into a tree. The employee was hospitalized and received surgery.
An employee was changing a projector bulb when the bulb shattered, the glass caused a facial injury that required hospitalization.
An employee was operating a table saw when the tip of his right thumb was severed by the blade.
An employee was injured when aluminum siding he was pulling fell and severed a tendon in the right arm.
An employee was bitten on the leg by a rattlesnake and hospitalized.
An employee was up in a tree trying to install a meat-hanging pole. The employee fell to the ground, suffering a fractured arm and spine.
An employee was moving materials when his finger was caught between a forklift and a glass recycle container, amputating his fingertip.
On Saturday April 4, 2015 an employee's hand got caught in a de-palletizer, requiring hospitalization.
Employee was struck by a PVC pipe while installing an underground television cable.
An employee was setting up a lathe. A part fell and his hand was caught between the part and the chuck lathe severely lacerating the middle and ring fingers on the right hand.

On or about April 30, 2015, an employee was helping a second employee position a fallen log so that the grapple of the front-end loader could pick the log up from the ground. The second employee struck the log with such force that the log moved horizontally in a right-to-left sweeping motion, striking the first employee in the leg area and resulting in two breaks to the left leg and a broken right ankle.
An employee was cleaning out the grain bin while the auger was running. The employee was caught by the auger and suffered a right leg injury that will need surgery.
An employee was setting windows on the first floor when he lost his balance, fell backward, and struck his head on a concrete parking block.

The injured employee was standing at the edge of an excavation when an excavator hit a natural gas line while digging resulting in a fire. The injured employee suffered first degree burns to the lower right arm and thigh.
An employee was performing maintenance on a customer propane dispenser when he suffered liquid propane burns to his hands.

At approximately 2:30 p.m., on 1/25/16, an employee operating a metal polishing machine lifted a curtain to wipe down the feed rollers on the machine. The employee's left-hand little finger was caught between the feed roller and the metal plate and had to be surgically amputated at the second knuckle.
An employee slipped and fell in the parking lot and was hospitalized with a fractured femur.
An employee operating a forklift struck the back of another forklift, breaking his left leg and injuring both feet.

An employee was cutting wood using a chop saw when the guard became stuck in the up position. As the saw was powering down, the employee's jacket was caught on the blade, which then pulled the employee's left forearm into the machine, lacerating it.
An employee was operating an unguarded table saw and amputated three fingertips on the left hand.

An employee was attempting to light a handheld propane torch when an explosion occurred. The employee received second degree burns to the face, hand, and other body parts. A second employee also suffered injuries.
An employee was maintaining an irrigation system and fainted due to heat-related illness.
On August 2, 2016, an employee was manually molding with a 20-pound ladle of aluminum when he began to experience muscle spasms. He was hospitalized with heat exhaustion.

On 3/18/2016, two employees were changing a 1-3/4 inch screw for a mill support. While the first employee manually adjusted the nut on the screw, the second employee proceeded to adjust the screw with a pneumatic drill, injuring the first employee by crushing his right hand thumb between the nut and the mill support surface.

An employee was operating a machine that cuts penne pasta when strands of pasta became jammed in the machine. He attempted to clear the jam and removed the flexible plastic tubing. He saw that the pasta was jammed in the cone and tried to push the dough out of the bottom of the cone. The moving blade then amputated his index fingertip. The machine was not locked or tagged out at the time.
A door closed on an employee's right pinky tip, severing it.

On May 7, 2015, at approximately 11:00 a.m., an employee received first and second degree burns to his face, hands, left arm, and left leg, resulting in hospitalization.  The employee was troubleshooting an existing switchgear. The employee de-energized the equipment and thought it was safe to perform the work. The buss was still energized with 13,800 volts and an arc flash occurred.

An employee was working from a 6-foot step ladder while using a screw gun to install a panel cover. He lost his footing, knocked the ladder from beneath himself, and fell to the ground, landing on top of the ladder. He suffered a head laceration and wrist injury, requiring hospitalization.
An employee cleaning a conveyor line came into contact with a chain and sprocket, amputating a fingertip.
An employee's left hand was caught and crushed in a conveyor belt, amputating his ring finger.
An employee lost consciousness and fell on the same level onto a concrete floor, injuring his head. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was discharging water from a truck drum when he slipped while standing at the exterior control. He fell and struck his jaw on a truck fender, breaking it and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was using a hydraulic vise to secure an "I" beam to the band saw table. The power switch on the vise was triggered, causing the loss of his left-hand middle finger. The employee was hospitalized.
Two employees who were operating pallet jacks collided with each other. One employee was hospitalized overnight with back pain.

An employee was polishing a main drive shaft on the South Bend lathe.  He was wearing gloves and an apron, and his glove got caught in the lathe. It started to wrap him up and pull him in, breaking his left arm.  He pulled himself free from the machine.
An employee was on the pool deck demonstrating a move for students during a water aerobics class when she slipped on the tile floor and fell fracturing her right hip.
An employee's left index fingertip was amputated when he was removing a clamp from a part in the mill. The finger was pinched between the clamp and a bolt.
An employee was unloading instruments on the top shelf of the dock storage rack. As he was climbing down the rack, he fell to the ground level below, fracturing his skull, clavicle, and vertebrae.
An employee was manually moving steel plates and caught a finger in a hole in the steel plate resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was hospitalized for possible carbon monoxide poisoning while batching garbanzo beans.
While adjusting two rolls of steel to be welded together, an employee's arm was caught between the two pieces of steel. The employee suffered a broken right arm with tendon damage.
A maintenance employee slipped on ice while applying salt to ice on the ground in the fenced-in yard of the facility.  He slipped and broke his left fibula and dislocated his left ankle.
An employee was using a coin press when it crushed and amputated her middle fingertip. The press guard was in place at the time.

An employee was using a handheld circular saw to rip cut a short piece of wood stock. The injured employee was positioned close behind the circular saw, helping to hold the short 2 X 6 wood stock.  The blade became bound, causing the circular saw to kick back. The blade struck and amputated the injured employee's left-hand thumb, requiring surgery.
An employee was putting cardboard into the baler.  His hand was caught in the baler door while closing it. The employee's left hand was dislocated, fractured, and lacerated.

An employee was grading lumber in the planer mill (dry end) when a lumber plank "crossed-up" and slowed/stopped production. When the employee tried to clear the "crossed-up" lumber plank, his left hand was crushed by the plank and a u-shaped piece of steel lacerated his left hand between the wrist, thumb, and first finger. He suffered a partial de-gloving and a broken bone in the thumb.

An employee was using the manually operated (non-powered) plate bender to bend a plate when a part of the plate bender that he was holding (~20 inches long) slipped out of his hand and fell onto his left index finger causing a fingertip amputation.
An employee was starting a new run of fiber. As she went to pull the fiber from the oven, her right hand and arm got caught in an adjustable conveyor. Her hand and arm were severely burned.
On April 14, 2015, an employee fell down some stairs in the detail shop and was hospitalized.

An employee was retrieving a box of clothing from the mezzanine above the maintenance area when she stumbled and fell down the last 3-4 stairs of the wooden stairway. The employee's left ankle was broken in two places.
An employee was performing maintenance work on an MRI machine. He had to cross electrical points, and received a discharge burn on his right hand and arm.
An employee was performing maintenance on a conveyor when his hand was caught between the conveyor and the sprocket, amputating his left thumb.

On 3/1/2016, an employee was performing maintenance on a pin-setting machine when his hand slipped and was caught in the pin-setting equipment while it was in operation. The machine caught the ring on the employee's left finger and amputated it.

An employee suffered an amputation to the 3rd and 4th fingertips on his left hand. He was operating a jib crane to raise the door of a blowout preventer when an approximately 150 piston slid out of it striking his hand.

The injured employee was installing line skirting. He placed his left hand in the hinge side of a watertight door when another employee inside the tug shut the door amputating approximately one inch of the employee's left middle finger.

An employee was cleaning the fryer machine located in a Tyson Food poultry plant and partially amputated his left ring finger. The machine was not locked or tagged out when the employee removed the guard and was cleaning the machine.
An employee had just finished cleaning up a resident's room and was exiting when she tripped and struck her head, suffering head injuries and a concussion.
An employee was clearing a jam on a machine and amputated the left index fingertip.
An employee's left middle fingertip was amputated when it was pinched between two rack legs that were being bolted together.
An employee was using a sliding table saw to cut wood when the wood kicked back, causing the saw blade to amputate the employee's left index finger.
An employee was moving stock using a pallet jack when the jack backed onto his foot, fracturing it.
Employee on the roof was checking a stand pipe and slipped and fell breaking a hip.
