An employee was "locating" cotton bales (scanning bar codes) weighing 480 pounds when the bale(s) fell and struck him. He lost consciousness and sustained a broken leg, back injury, and laceration on top of his head from ear to ear. He required surgery.
An employee was nailing siding to the wall when he fell 12 feet between the pump jack scaffold and the wall. He broke his femur and was hospitalized.

On April 13, 2015, at approximately 1:30 p.m., an employee was shot in the left hand. Prior to the incident, a well tender found an issue at a well site. The well tender contacted a roustabout crew to repair and clean the area. The injured employee responded to the job to oversee the work, take pictures, and complete an incident report. After completing his work, he was driving away from the site and was stopped by a suspect dressed in camouflage, standing in the road. The suspect stood on the passenger side of the truck, played a recording that said "stop drilling," and pointed a gun at the employee's head. The employee grabbed the gun and shoved it away from his head; the gun fired into his left hand.  The employee drove off and was hospitalized.

An employee took a left turn to retrieve a product and briefly lost control of his forklift and collided with a supporting column in the warehouse. His left wrist got caught between the column and the forklift resulting in a fracture to his left wrist.
An employee was injured when she tripped over a loose cord laying across her work space and fell breaking right femur.

Two employees were delivering furniture to a private residence. One of the employees was inside the residence while the other stayed in the truck. The employee inside the truck slipped on a piece of plastic while moving a dresser, and the dresser fell on and fractured his right ankle.
An employee was setting up a machine when it was activated via the foot pedal and amputated his right middle fingertip.

An employee was operating a roller compacting the dirt around a bridge when the roller tipped over on its side and pinned the employee from the waist down under the roller. The employee was transported to a hospital and treated for a broken pelvis.

The injured employee was training another employee on how to operate the side puller machine. The injured employee noticed that a hide was not clamped properly and went to adjust it on the clamp. At the same time, other employees pressed the buttons to start the machine. The clamp caught the injured employee's right middle finger, which had to be surgically amputated from the tip to the first knuckle.
An employee was adding oil to the extruder. The auger, which was still turning, caught and amputated the employee's thumb tip. The extruder was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee fell off of a garbage dumpster while trying to fix material that was sticking out of the top.
While operating a truck, an employee struck a parking lot light post resulting in hospitalization for a cut to the forehead and neck trauma.
An employee was retrieving items from a car when the door closed on his left index finger, amputating it below the nail.
An employee was carrying items from his car to truck when he slipped on ice, breaking his hip and pelvis.

An employee was trying to change over the robot settings on a pneumatic welding machine when a coworker pressed the wrong button and a plate came down and partially amputated the employee's right ring fingertip.
An employee slipped and fell while delivering mail.
An employee fell and broke an ankle while going down the 12th floor staircase, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was delivering a linen cart and got the first two toes on his right foot caught in the dock leveler and crushed when the linen cart was placed on it.

An employee suffered an amputation to the right-hand index finger and an injury to the left-hand middle finger when a light curtain failed to protect the point of operation from a press in the manufacturing operation.
An employee slipped and fell on the left side of his back while shoveling snow from the loading dock. He fractured three ribs and suffered bruising.
An employee was standing on a garage truss when a load was placed next to him, causing the truss to collapse. He fell and required hospitalization.

An employee was doing decking work at an apartment complex being constructed. The employee stepped onto an unsecured truss and fell approximately 14 feet. The employee suffered head injuries and was admitted to the hospital for treatment.
An employee fell from a pole while connecting wires, suffering a broken right arm.

An employee was moving a bundle of steel straps 2 inches wide by 21 feet long off of a delivery truck. The employee was holding onto them when the bundle shifted and the employee's right index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was standing on the third rung of a ladder while conducting lifting operations with a crane when a part came loose and hit him on his right shoulder area. He fell about 3 feet to the ground and fractured his pelvis and left wrist.

The employee was performing maintenance on a piece of machinery next to a bag machine where film was being pulled. The bag machine started malfunctioning. The employee began to re-route the film on the bag machine while the equipment was energized. The employee got his left hand caught in the rollers of the bag machine, which pulled his hand into the gears and belt.

An employee was putting bags on a 16-inch by 20-foot ductile iron pipe that was resting on the forks of a skid steer. The employee was standing in front of the open forks when the pipe rolled off and landed on and broke the employee's left leg and foot.
An employee was clearing a jam on the tack machine and fractured the right thumb.
An employee was working on a mount machine when the employee's left-hand ring finger was amputated, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was driving a standup forklift in the finished good aisle when he was pinned between the lift and racking, breaking his left forearm and fracturing his left ribs.
An employee received a deep laceration on his thumb while using a circular saw to cut wood.
An employee was installing a cable on a telephone pole, working from a 28-foot ladder. The employee fell approximately 18 feet while descending the ladder.

An employee was loading a pile of limbs from the curb side into the back of a garbage truck. The employee's glove was caught in the hydraulic packing blade of the truck, injuring three fingers and requiring surgery.
An employee was struck by a forklift truck that was moving a tote of fertilizer on a wooden pallet resulting in a left leg fracture.
While working on his route, an employee felt intense pain in his back, going down to the back of his legs. He was hospitalized with a pinched nerve in his back.

An employee was pressing an air valve on a shaft to let air out. When the air was released, the roll moved on the shaft and the employee's right index fingertip was caught and amputated between the indentation on the shaft and roll core.
An employee amputated his left index finger while using a band saw to cut beef shank in the fabrication department.
An employee's right pinky finger got caught between the door and frame of the bathroom stall.
An employee operating a reach truck was struck on the head and shoulders by two boxed toilets that fell 35-40 feet from the storage rack.  The employee was subsequently hospitalized.

An employee was using a table saw to rip small pieces of 2x4 for a form when his left index finger contacted the running blade, amputating the first knuckle. The saw was guarded at the time of the incident.

On February 3, 2016, at approximately 4:30pm, an employee was injured while attempting to restrain a patient who became irate and physically aggressive.  The security officer was hospitalized for a concussion.

An employee was rebuilding an intensifier on a high-pressure pump when the machine became energized by a remote operator. The piston on the pump extended on a hydraulic cylinder while the employee's hands were in the machine, pinching and amputating a finger between the cylinder and machine.
An employee was spraying flammable liquid while refinishing cabinets close to a stove when the flame shot back and burned him.

An employee sustained an amputation injury to the tip of the middle finger on his left hand while clearing a jam on a Global Partition Slotter, which makes slots in corrugated cardboard. The employee reached into an area 3x4" wide, 2' long while the equipment was running. The equipment was not guarded at the time, nor was it shut down or locked out.
An employee walking between buildings tripped and fell, breaking her right ankle.
An employee was experiencing chest pains while running electrical conduit and was taken to the hospital 09/28/2016.

An employee was guiding clients on an ice climb when he was hit by falling ice, which caused him to fall. His fall was arrested by his climbing equipment, but he struck against the ice and sustained broken ribs, which punctured a lung.
An employee was performing maintenance on a piece of machinery when the machine became energized and amputated his right index finger.
An employee fell 15 feet out of a tree while clearing branches. He was hospitalized with a fractured spine.
An employee fell 20 feet from a roof resulting in broken ribs, a bruised kidney, and fluid in the lungs.

An employee fell 15 feet to the ground from an extension ladder while moving a drop line on a residential structure. He sustained multiple injuries to his right arm, right leg, and pelvis and was hospitalized.

On December 19, 2016, at approximately 2:55 p.m., an employee opened the 600 amp of an electrical air switch using the handle on the outside of the switch cabinet. He opened the door on the compartment containing the switch, which has a fiberglass barrier hanging vertically in the compartment. He raised the bottom of this barrier to slide it into a slot designated to hold it in place between the two electrical contacts on the air switch. As the barrier was being slid into place, an arc flash occurred, causing second degree burns to his face that required hospitalization.
While closing a gate to an animal pen, an employee's right ring finger got caught in the gate and was amputated.

A maintenance employee was trying to reset the limit switch on an overhead crane after the operator tripped it. The employee was working near moving gears that caught his pant leg and pulled his leg in. His leg was partially amputated.

On 3/18/2016, an employee was connecting two sheet metal sheets to finish an enclosure. While he was sliding the sheet into the interlocking system, a chain came loose and caught his left ring finger with the sheet metal. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee fell from a wet ladder while installing awning, requiring stitches.

On April 23, 2016, at 1:00 a.m., an employee was setting a dock board to the back of a trailer. The trailer was not aligned properly with the loading dock bay. As the employee set the dock board, it began to slip. The employee descended from the sliding dock board to the pavement below the loading dock, suffering a compound fracture to his right leg that required hospitalization.
On or about August 1, 2016, an employee was helping to remove a piece of equipment from the wellhead using a crane. The piece of equipment fell and struck the employee's left leg, fracturing it.
The employee was installing a fence when he slipped and fell. He grabbed the fence and cut his right middle finger on the fence.
An employee was installing solar panels using a ladder. The ladder slid on the icy floor and the employee fell 10 feet and suffered multiple fractures.
On or about August 1, 2016, an employee's left hand was smashed while setting a die into a tilt pour machine, crushing four fingers.

An employee was attempting to walk down a wooden bleacher/seating area that was adjacent to the main stairs. When he was on the fourth seating level, he fell down the remaining levels to the concrete floor below, requiring hospitalization.

A maintenance employee reached into the back of an evisceration machine and was injured when his fingers contacted the blade. His right ring finger was partially amputated. The machine was still on at the time.
An employee was cleaning a scraper on a moving belt conveyor when the tail pulley severely lacerated the employee's left calf muscle. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was hospitalized after he fell from a ladder while painting a building. The employee fell backwards off the ladder, which was up against a parking bumper for stability, and onto the bumper. The employee received bruises to his head and back, a broken pelvis, and two broken heels.
Employee may have been exposed to methanol and experienced symptoms consistent with methanol poisoning.
An employee was operating a router and crushed three fingers in the machine. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was taking trash to the dumpster and suffered a laceration to the right index finger resulting in hospitalization and surgery.

A temporary employee became upset and threw a broom and a shovel through an open dispatch window, then charged into the office and struck an employee in the back of her head with the broom handle. The temporary employee then struck her in the face with his fists, breaking the employee's jaw and causing cuts to her hands and face.

An employee was troubleshooting a machine. The hydraulic clamps were not functioning properly. When the employee placed his hand on the side of the heater, the clamp closed, pinching and amputating his left middle finger.

An employee was operating an overhead crane to move a 1100-pound steel structure from saw horses onto the floor. While moving the structure, the load shifted and hit the employee on the head. He fell backward and hit his head on the concrete floor. He was hospitalized with a skull fracture.
An employee was walking along the roof, conducting an inspection for roof replacement. The employee fell through the roof to the concrete floor, breaking ribs and a wrist.

On April 22, 2016, at approximately 7:15 a.m., an employee was operating a notch saw. While the employee was placing a 4-foot piece of vinyl in the saw, the saw was activated by the foot pedal. The saw amputated the employee's left index finger below the nail bed.
The employee was putting sticks onto a conveyor belt when his right hand and arm got caught in the conveyor resulting in three broken fingers, a fractured wrist and abrasions on the arm.

An employee was attempting to move a jammed machinery part. He moved the controls, but the part did not move. While troubleshooting, he leaned on the part, which then moved and pushed him backwards. He tripped and fell, landing on and fracturing his right hip.

An employee was using a chop saw to cut an 8-inch, old clay pipe to replace it with a PVC sewer pipe. The saw kicked back and the blade went through the employee's face shield, lacerating his skin from his right chin to his right ear. He was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to free the arm piece of a pneumatically operated shear line machine. The machine's arm became free and caught the employee's right index finger between the arm and the frame of the machine, amputating it.
On July 23, 2015, an employee suffered a finger amputation while grinding a casting on a stand grinder.
An employee was disassembling equipment when his hand contacted a running belt and was drawn into a pinch point, amputating his fingertip.

Employee was setting a column form with an overhead hoist, when his finger became caught between a metal bracket and a two by four. The bracket lacerated the tip of the employee's finger and shaved a small portion of the bone. Employee was taken to OccuCare Medical clinic, where he was then referred to a specialist at Memorial Herman Hospital.
Employer reported that an employee showed symptoms of heat illness (or kidney function illness) and was evaluated and hospitalized with IV fluids.

An employee slipped on the plastic backing/laminate of a peel and stick underlayment near the roof edge and fell 23 feet off the roof resulting in broken ribs. The employees were evacuating the roof due to a storm.
An employee was moving high chairs while walking backwards when she slipped, fell, and broke her pelvis. She was hospitalized.

An employee was assisting another employee in moving a large plastic spool. As the employee was pushing the spool, a trackhoe that was compacting the dirt backed over the employee's left foot resulting in injury to the left knee.
An employee was on an 8-foot tripod ladder, painting a wall with a hand brush. The employee slipped and fell, fracturing the left-side scapula and one rib.

Maintenance employees were using a forklift to lift a pallet jack to check the wheels. While the pallet jack was being lifted, the battery fell out and struck one of the employee's in the right leg fracturing it.
An employee tripped on a computer cord and fell fracturing the right hip.
An employee was using a lathe while wearing cut resistant gloves.  A glove became entangled in the lathe and the employee's hand was degloved when he tried to remove it.

On August 20, 2015, an employee was rethreading the extruded tube product into the belted puller. The rollers caught his glove and pulled his left thumb into the nip point, crushing it. He was hospitalized for a left thumb contusion.
An employee fell off a ladder.
An employee suffered a broken right foot when a battery fell off a battery lift and onto his foot.

An employee was sweeping next to the wash pad rail system around 7:40 a.m. An aerial lift (enclosed with tarp) used for abrasive blasting stopped to drive a short distance to a new area. The employee grabbed the tarp to move it out of the way, and the employee's foot got caught and was struck, requiring hospitalization.

An employee attempted to unload an irregular package from a trailer. The other packages in the trailer shifted and caused the employee to fall. The irregular package then fell onto the employee, who suffered a fractured left leg.
While working with the farm owner, the employee moved behind the backhoe into a blind spot and was knocked down. His legs were run over by the backhoe.

An employee was using a stand-on, 36-inch Stander Lawn Mower Machine. As he was operating the machine, he dismounted it and the machine ran over one of his feet. Several of his toes were amputated. The employee was wearing steel-toed shoes at the time.
An employee broke his left foot while operating a forklift.

A temporary employee was using a torqueing tool to torque a brake disc when his left index finger was caught between the tool's reaction arm and the bolt pack. His finger broke and was lacerated, requiring hospitalization.
An employee suffered burns from a flash fire that was created by a trash pump unit powered by a gas generator. It is used to pump oil and water from an open top tank at the well site.
An employee tripped and fell. His leg was then run over by a forklift breaking it.
An employee at the receiving department was hit in the head when palletized TV's felt over. The palletized TV's were being pulled down using a walkie stacker.

An employee lost control of an electric pallet jack when unloading products from a trailer.  The pallet jack hit the dock plate and the handle struck the employee in the stomach, pinning him against the wall of the trailer.

An employee was moving a large rolling tote full of paper for shredding when the employee either tripped and fell or the tote fell on the employee. The employee suffered a broken left leg and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee tripped while operating a glue machine, and the employee's right thumb was caught in the machine rollers. The thumb tip had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was on top of a weaving machine to view a counter. The employee slipped and fell. As the employee fell, the employee's right hand contacted an unguarded chain and sprocket.  The employee's right pinky finger was severely lacerated and amputated at the hospital.
An employee was opening the garage door to the warehouse to pick up materials.  The employee tripped over the rope to the garage door and fell.  He was hospitalized with a concussion.
An employee involved in an automobile accident suffered a broken wrist and leg.

An employee was draining hot cooking oil from three deep fryers. When the hot oil was placed into a 6-gallon pot, it reacted and overflowed, contacting and burning the employee's right hand and forearm.

An employee was attempting to lift a large heavy die using a crow bar when the die fell on the employee's fingers. The employee's right index finger was partially amputated and the thumb was seriously injured.
An employee suffered frostbite to the hands and fingers while cleaning racks in the freezer, requiring a finger amputation.
An employee was unloading baggage tubs from a cart when he lost his balance and fell over, striking his leg on the baggage conveyor and fracturing his right femur.

An employee was in the SkyTrak personnel basket cutting tree limbs. The operator was repositioning the machine when it hit a mound of dirt and caused the SkyTrak to tip over. The employee jumped out of the basket and suffered a concussion and a broken right ankle.
An employee was using an electric pulley to raise materials up a scaffold when the employee's finger became stuck in the pulley casing, resulting in a partial finger amputation.

Employee was in airplane performing an audit and went to enter the flight deck/cockpit 
and was turning to the left. She fell due to an approximately 6" step down into 
the flight deck/cockpit. Since she was turning to the left before she fell, her 
body twisted and her back struck the center console.
Employee walking back from pump house slipped and fell on ice and fractured ankle.
An employee was loading molding into a machine. The employee's gloved hand was caught in the machine as the blade was coming to a stop. The right middle fingertip was amputated with bone loss.

A worker was pressure washing concrete slab. The hose became kinked. During the process of un-kinking the hose the spray wand slipped and made contact with the worker's hand just enough to actuate the water spray. The nozzle which was very close to the worker's right leg sprayed high-pressure water into the worker's calf. The action caused a pin-prick sized hole that was quickly filled with water and air. The laborer was admitted to the local hospital.

The employee was in a personnel lift and the crane it was attached to was lifting it to another area of the ship. As it was moving, the employee put his hand out to move the basket from the ship and his finger was caught.
An employee was removing 3 feet of cut-up log from the sawmill floor when two fingers on his left hand were pinched and broken by the logs.
An employee was powering up a compressor and noticed a leaky hose. When he turned around, the hose popped off and sprayed him in the back, causing second and third degree burns.
An employee was removing a die when another employee started the machine.
On or about May 26, 2015, an employee was hospitalized when struck-by steel angle iron material on a crane.

An employee was operating a gas power chop saw cutting concrete. When the gas cap came off, the chop saw caught on fire. Gas splashed onto the employee and the employee suffered second and third degree burns to his legs, back, stomach, and arms.
An employee was stung by a wasp while inspecting scaffolding and had an allergic reaction, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was in the meat department emptying water into a sink from a tub that is used to soak meat trays when he slipped and fell backwards. The store manager found the employee on the floor and helped him up. He was later hospitalized with a cracked rib and punctured lung.
An employee was hospitalized for burns.
While troubleshooting electrical problems in the main control panels, an employee made contact with a phase from the bus and was shocked, suffering arm burns.
An employee was performing work on the conveyer system of the "butterfly" machine. The employee's left-hand ring finger was caught in the chain drive, amputating the fingertip.

An employee hoisted the lubricator up off a well head using a winch and was inspecting the tool stream. The winch malfunctioned and continued to raise the lubricator up which was 8 feet long. It was raised approximately 15 feet off the ground. The cable snapped and the lubricator fell striking the employee and causing a laceration to his chest approximately 6-8 inches long and 1 1/2 inches deep.
An employee was injured after stepping out of a jobsite trailer that had no stairs. The employee was admitted to the hospital with a fractured right leg.
An employee working at the register tripped over a gator cord and fell breaking the left knee.
While an employee was clearing the area, a copperhead snake jumped out of the brush and bit his left pinky finger.
An employee was using a bandsaw to cut fittings when a fitting jumped and the bandsaw partially amputated his left thumb tip.
An employee was cleaning the slicer and amputated the tip of the third finger on the right hand.
An employee was anodizing parts on a polishing machine when the part jerked, breaking the employee's left thumb and pinky finger.
An employee was loading a semi trailer when his right middle finger was caught on an E-track inside the trailer, amputating his distal phalanx.
An employee was walking by as a coworker was replacing a pallet jack wheel and hitting a safety pin with a hammer. A metal piece of the pin then hit the employee's eye, resulting in an eye loss.

During a sales blitz activity, an employee participated in one of the 'minute to win it' games. The game involves a small Kleenex box with balls in it and a ribbon that goes around the waist, and the player has to twist their waist to get the balls to come out. As the employee twisted her waist, she injured her knee.

An employee was repairing a gas leak when a dead tree fell and struck a nearby excavator. A piece of the tree then struck the employee in the head. The employee suffered fractures to the neck vertebrae, back vertebrae, and ribs.
The employee was emptying chocolate from a melting tank and got his right hand caught between the agitator and the wall of the tank amputating his right ring fingertip.

An employee was removing a hand temper (compaction for dirt) out of a dump truck by lifting it with a backhoe bucket. His left ring finger was pinched between the tailgate of the dump truck and the hand temper when he grabbed the hand temper as it slipped and fell off the bucket. The employee suffered some bone loss (no amputation) and incurred 100 stiches.
An employee received an amputation of the right hand while operating a mechanical power press.
An employee lifted a dog onto a table and suffered a possible hernia.

On or about August 20, 2015 at approximately 4:40 p.m., an employee received a hand injury while working on the pepper production line. The employee was feeling dizzy and went to sit on a small roller conveyor. As he sat down, he put his hand on a moving chain conveyor, which pulled his finger into the sprocket and partially amputated it.
An employee's right middle fingertip was amputated while the employee attempted to unjam a blanker die and block machine.
An employee was exposed to meth lab chemicals while responding to a meth lab explosion.
On January 7, 2017, an employee slipped and fell while leaving the breakroom, fracturing her right femur.
An employee fell off an extension ladder while cleaning fascia. He fell an unknown height and sustained fractured ribs and lacerations.
A truck driver slipped on the concrete floor and fractured an elbow.

Employee 1 was in front of an electric pallet jack picking groceries from shelving.  Employee 2 was in front of Employee 1 with a pallet jack doing the same.  Employee 1 thought Employee 2 was going to move forward, but Employee 2 didn't. Employee 1 kept moving forward with his pallet jack and got wedged between the two pallet jacks breaking his ankle.
An employee was working on a ladder when another employee pushed the trash cart filled with drywall into the ladder thereby causing the employee on the ladder to fall and shatter his knee.
An employee was cutting vegetables with a knife when his left index fingertip was amputated at the fingernail.

On or about August 13, 2015, an employee was painting an elevator door. She got the door key to open the door. As she pushed the heavy door, it opened, and she fell 20 to 25 feet to the bottom of the elevator shaft, suffering sprains and strains. No fall protection or lockout protection was used at the time.
An employee lost grip of the grab bar while entering the cab of a truck and fell to the asphalt pavement. The employee suffered a hairline fracture in the right hip and multiple left wrist fractures.
An employee tripped over a concrete bumper and fell in the parking lot while walking to her vehicle at the end of day. Her left kneecap was fractured.

An employee was working in a crawl space above the ceiling cleaning out debris during roof repairs. The employee fell 18 feet through a hatch door to the concrete ground below breaking both ankles and sustaining a head laceration.
On or about February 6, 2016, an employee amputated the right ring fingertip while operating a grinder. The employee was hospitalized.

Employee was at a company site attempting to gain access to the roof ladder via a fixed ladder .  The height of the platform from the ground was 10 ft, 7 in. The employee slipped and fell to the interior concrete floor. The employee broke his wrist, and bone was exposed.

An employee was setting up a lift with a beam clamp on a beam with a chain attached. The clamp had a hammerlock that connected the chain and beam lock. The employee's left index finger was between the chain and hammerlock when he hoisted the load. His left index finger was pinched and amputated between the hammerlock and chain when the chain tightened.

An employee was placing a steel coil that weighed approximately 5000 lbs. back into the coil rack when the banding caught on another coil, causing it to twist and strike the employee in the chest. The employee suffered a bruised liver, bruised kidneys, and internal bleeding.
An employee was filling up a propane tank when a splitter valve became unscrewed and liquid propane leaked out, burning the employee's right hand.

An employee was packing product into boxes. She grabbed a piece of packing tape hanging from the conveyor for the box line printer. Her arm was fractured when it was pulled between the roller and the belt.

An employee was using a vertical meat cutting bandsaw to cut short ribs. The employee's glove became caught in the working section of the sawblade, resulting in the amputation of the left ring and little fingertips.
An employee was exiting the forklift truck when he slipped and fell to the ground. The operator suffered a broken femur and was admitted to the local hospital.
An employee fell from the pallet jack he was operating when the pallet jack struck a guardrail. The back of his head struck the ground and was lacerated.

An employee was operating a sand blaster when the sand blaster whip hose fell. The blast media penetrated the employee's sand blast suit and lacerated the employee's forearm, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was attempting to help a coworker free a jammed/stuck part on a mold press machine when his finger was caught in a defective clamp, which pinched/amputated his left ring fingertip.
An employee experienced heat stress while working on a tempering line for glass production, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was troubleshooting the basket return system on the pasteurizer machine. His left forearm got caught between the shaft and the chain and the employee suffered a possible fracture.
An employee was operating a forklift when he hit a pole. His right foot was smashed between the forklift and the pole, fracturing it.
An employee was unloading light poles when a pole slipped from his hands. He tried to stop the pole from falling with his leg and suffered a right upper thigh injury that required hospitalization.

An employee was blowing shot dust from a shot blast machine. When the employee tilted the machine, it became unhooked and hit the employee in the back and shoulder. He fractured his back and was hospitalized.
An employee was shoveling dirt around a gas main pipe in a trench approximately 5' x 8' x 5'6" deep. A section of the trench caved-in breaking the employee's left ankle.
An employee was walking through a metal door when it closed on the employee's right pinky fingertip, amputating it.
An employee was attempting to reinstall a chain on a drive sprocket when his right thumb was pinched as the chain rolled the chain sprocket, amputating his thumb below the knuckle.
A maintenance employee injured his hand while checking for leaks on the high pressure hydraulic injection on a press. Hydraulic fluid was injected into his left hand, requiring surgery.

An employee was positioning metal next to hydraulic clamps to prepare the metal for tack welding. The clamp actuated while the employee's finger was between the metal and the clamp, crushing the employee's fingertip. The fingertip had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was measuring a parapet wall on the front portico of a hotel building when he lost his balance and fell approximately 18 feet, breaking both legs, his knee, and his ankle. He was hospitalized.
An employee was installing the frame of an atrium and fell from a plank between two extension ladders fracturing an elbow.
An employee was attempting to give medication to a patient when the patient became agitated and bit the employee's left thumb. The employee was hospitalized.

On June 27, 2016, at approximately 8:00 a.m., an employee was unpinning traveling blocks from a top drive when the blocks shifted and his right hand was caught in a pinch point, amputating his ring fingertip.

An employee was attempting to reach and adjust a chain that was holding up one of the very large bags in the baghouse. The employee crawled on top of the bags, which are held in place by angle irons 11 inches apart. While crawling toward the bag, the employee lost his grip and fell through the 11-inch gap. He fell 37 feet to the ground, breaking a foot and fracturing a vertebra.

An employee was unloading boxes inside a trailer. A 35 lb. box of batteries fell and struck the employee in the head. The employee suffered a muscle strain in the neck and possible cracked or broken vertebrae.

An employee was terminating a ground wire onto a mechanical lug on the lower half of a 480-volt, 200-amp disconnect. When he loosened the mechanical ground lug, the ground wire came into contact with an energized A-phase, which was not fully insulated, at the top of the disconnect. An arc flash then occurred and burned the employee's face and left hand.
An employee on a ladder was applying flashing to a roof that was 17 feet high when the flashing ignited. The employee dismounted from the ladder and fell to the ground, fracturing the tailbone.
An employee was hospitalized after falling from an elevated surface and sustaining injuries to his head, collar bone, and ribs.
While he was operating a forklift, an employee's left leg was caught between a guardrail and the forklift, fracturing his left foot.
An employee was using a knife to cut a band from a stack of trusses and cut his left wrist.

An employee climbed up a 35' X 5' X 5' rebar column to attach the forms.  He cut loose two supports.  The column began to slowly roll and fell catching the employee's foot. The employee was admitted to the hospital for a contusion on the right foot.
An employee was stacking pallets at the end of a production line when she tripped over stretch wrap and fell, fracturing her left hip.

An employee was removing a baffle plate to set in the support arm with cable come a-longs. The employee's finger got pinched between the baffle plate and support arm, resulting in an amputation to the right ring fingertip.
During the cleaning process, an employee's hand came in contact with a moving piston located near the bottom of the bakery depositor machine, amputating her left middle fingertip.
An employee's left pinky finger contacted an unguarded fan in equipment resulting in a partial amputation.

An employee was on a pump jack scaffold installing siding on a residential home using a nail gun. A nail from the gun bounced off the wall and hit the employee in the eye. The nail got stuck in his eye, and he was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee working onboard the U.S.S. Eisenhower at Portsmouth Naval Shipyard contacted a piece of energized wire that was encased in a steel pipe conduit.
An employee on his mail delivery route was showing signs of dehydration and was taken to the hospital. The employee was admitted for further evaluation.

A maintenance mechanic was adjusting the safety switch on a bread cooler when a shaft became loose and struck an employee in the abdomen/chest area, breaking three ribs. The shaft came out approximately 12 inches.
An employee was walking toward a stainless steel table in the room when she tripped and fell over a hose containing product, breaking her hip.

An employee suffered a puncture wound on his left hand when attempting to retrieve uprights from an elevator shaft that had taken on water. The wound became infected and the employee was admitted to the hospital for treatment.
While loading milk into a tanker truck, an employee's right middle fingertip was pinched and partially amputated between a valve and the tanker truck wall.
A steel sheet struck an employee's left heel while he was unloading material from a truck. He suffered a soft tissue laceration.
An employee was cutting pieces of wood using a table saw. A piece of wood slipped and his right hand contacted the blade, cutting three fingers.

On July 22, 2015, an employee was working inside a trench box, attempting to place dunnage under one side of the trench box to protect utility lines. The excavator bucket was used to lift one end of the trench box so dunnage could be placed underneath that section. The bucket unexpectedly released from the boom of the excavator as it raised a portion of the trench box. The bucket fell into the trench box, striking and crushing the employee who was hospitalized and had several surgeries.
An employee was cleaning product off the floor when a pallet fell from storage and struck the employee, fracturing the employee's leg and causing back pain.
An employee skiing on the Larry Fale Trail was struck by another skier. As a result, the employee suffered suspected rib fractures and other potential injuries to the shoulder and torso areas.

An employee severely injured his right-hand pinky finger while changing brakes on a truck tractor.  The tool used to hold tension on the brake components slipped, and the components crushed the finger.
While an employee operated a motorized pallet jack, his right pinky finger got caught and severed between the handle of the pallet jack and a metal machine.
An employee was preparing to move a 55-gallon oil drum when he suffered an abdominal hernia.
While unwrapping a shrink-wrapped produce pallet, an employee became tangled in plastic wrap. He lost his footing, fell, and broke his left hip.
An employee was running cable from a residence to a terminal when his cable line was snagged by a box truck. He was pulled off of his ladder and fell approximately 28 feet, injuring his back.

An employee was setting culverts along a highway. After a culvert was in place, the employee slipped on the embankment. The employee grabbed the rim of the culvert to catch his fall and lacerated three fingers on the left hand.
An employee was getting a cup of coffee when she tripped over a mat in the lunchroom and broke her left femur. She was hospitalized.
An employee experienced heat exhaustion/heat stress while performing welding activities in an enclosed area in a 97-degree environment. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee got off the forklift to open the warehouse door. The forklift rolled and the employee was pinned between the forklift and a transformer box injuring his left hip and knee.
An employee was exiting the belt loader. His foot slipped and he fell, suffering broken ribs and a possible lacerated lung.
An employee suffered a right ring finger amputation while operating a lathe in the manufacturing department.
An employee descending a staircase tripped and fell approximately 5 steps, landing on her left side and suffering a head injury and fractures.
An employee stood up from a chair, lost balance and/or stumbled on the carpet, and then fell.
An employee was entering the plant through the door when it hit and pushed him. He lost his balance and fell to the ground, breaking his right hip.
An employee's leg was punctured by the nail from a nail gun the employee was using to hang fascia.
An excavator backed over an employee's left foot, resulting in surgical amputation.
An employee was shuttling vehicles at the distribution center.  The employee fell and struck their head while entering or exiting a vehicle, suffering a traumatic brain injury.
An employee was cleaning an auger when it was activated. The auger blades partially amputated the employee's left index finger, requiring hospitalization.
On September 27, 2016, an employee was using a forklift to load products on a truck. He either fell off the forklift or the truck and suffered a head injury, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was delivering mail and was bitten by a dog causing the employee to fall and fracture the femur bone.

An employee used a wooden ladder and leaned it up against a handrail while attempting to work on an overhead light. The ladder slipped down and the employee fell onto the handrail resulting in an injury to his chest and abdomen area.
An employee was clearing a jam on the vertical bagging machine. When the employee hit the reset button, the bottom metal bar that seals the bag closed amputated the employee's left middle fingertip.
An employee was working on building trusses when he fell 12 to 14 feet from the truss. He suffered a brain injury and broke his neck and ribs.
An employee was walking when he slipped and fell, fracturing his left arm and dislocating his left elbow.

An employee was unloading/hoisting structural steel members/composite joists from a flatbed trailer truck when the load shifted. The employee dismounted from the truck and landed on a bucket of bolts on the ground. He rolled and broke his ankle.

An employee was helping to run wire cable onto the boom of a crawler crane when the loose part of his safety harness lanyard got caught in the rotating drum. The drum then pulled him into a pinch point. He was hospitalized.
An employee cleaning up roofing material fell 7 feet off the edge of a roof.
While using a high-pressure power washer, an employee's right foot was impaled by the power washer.

At 2:30pm on 07/06/2015, an employee was working on the Pines Bender making metal parts. He loaded a part into the pressure die and held onto the part with his left hand so it wouldn't "whip out" as the pressure die closed. The part was not positioned against the locate, and his pinky finger was pinched between the part and the pressure die as the pressure die closed amputating the fingertip.
An employee fell to the ground as he was transitioning from a ladder to the roof, breaking ribs, fracturing vertebrae, and lacerating his head.
An employee was spotting for a forklift driver who was moving a crate. The forklift hit a stack of crates, which shifted and caused a second crate to fall on the employee, cutting him on the head.
An employee was sanitizing a hospital room after a patient was discharged.  The employee slipped on cleaning solvent and landed on her left knee, breaking the knee cap.

An employee was hauling metal roof panels on a flat roof when he fell 20 feet through the roof to the building's floor, shattering his pelvis and fracturing his jaw, right elbow, right wrist, and left femur. He was hospitalized.
An employee injured her left middle finger after tripping over temporary water removal equipment in the parking lot.
An employee was cleaning electrical contacts when an arc flash occurred, burning the employee's arm.

Two employees were pulling wire from one panel to another panel. One panel was energized; the other panel was not. The employee who was working at the energized panel came in contact with the live wires and suffered electrical burns to his hand (277 volt).
An employee partially amputated two fingertips while cleaning a deli slicer. PPE was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee fell and broke her hip while walking to her car in the parking lot.
An employee working from a 5 foot rolling safety ladder fell and suffered a head injury.
An employee had been installing electrical wiring and was descending a ladder when the ladder collapsed. The employee fell and contacted the floor, suffering a contusion and bruised tailbone.
An employee was standing on a three-step step ladder attempting to remove a radiator from the shelf and lost his balance falling to the floor fracturing a lower lumbar disc.
An employee caught his hand in a conveyor on the labeling line amputating the tip of a finger, breaking another finger and injuring several others.
An employee slipped on the icy covered sidewalk leading to her car and broke her hip.
An employee tripped in the testing department while walking from one area to another.  He fell to the concrete floor and landed on his left hip.
An employee was removing a fiberglass ring on a 70'' (5ft 8.33in) platform ladder with a coworker on a fixed ladder. The platform ladder tipped over, and the employee fell and broke his right femur.
An employee was using a winch to rehang beef that had fallen off the hook when his finger got caught between the trolley and the rail, amputating the fingertip.
On 1/22/2016 at 12:00 PM, an employee fell through the roof of a building after stepping onto one of the skylights.
An employee was hospitalized after falling from a roof on 12/22/2016.
An employee was working at the diaphragm crimper when his finger was caught in the point of operation. His right middle fingertip was pinched and had to be amputated.
An employee jumped from the back of an F-450 truck because the pulley hoist tipped over, resulting in injuries.
On 3/8/2016, an employee was folding a box when she sustained a paper cut on her left wrist. The cut later became infected and required hospitalization.

An employee was exiting the property's roadway while driving an Isuzu NPR Spray rig when he hit the two concrete walls and came to rest on an oak tree. This resulted in two broken legs, a broken left arm and wrist, a broken jaw and multiple cuts to the head and face. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee opened the gate to inspect a part of the Tangent deep draw hydraulic press. Lock out/tag out wasn't used. A co-worker provided additional light and crossed the light curtain in front of the press activating it. The injured employee suffered cuts to both arms, burns to the left hand and a compression injury to both arms.
An employee was moving the couplings from a pressurized line. The line flew back, hitting and injuring the employee's eye. The employee was wearing safety glasses at the time.
An aerial artist fell 40 feet while rehearsing an aerial act.  She was hospitalized with head/neck/shoulder injuries.

On or about December 30, 2015, the employee was working on the plastic extruder on the production floor. The employee's right index finger was amputated after being caught in the machine while flushing the extruder. The guard was not in place at the time.
An employee tripped and fell while carrying material. The employee fractured the right wrist and injured the right knee, requiring wrist surgery.
An employee was cleaning the rollers of a vane machine when his right index finger became caught in the rollers, amputating it to the first knuckle.

An employee was working on a blowout preventer. When he went to remove the valve removal plug, pressure (approximately 300 PSI) released and struck him, blowing him 20 to 30 feet away. He was hospitalized.
An employee was washing a ready mix truck when the left middle finger was caught in the flip chute lock resulting in a fractured finger.

Employees were removing sections of side panels from an open ended cooler that was approximately eight feet above the lower surface. As employees carried a disconnected side panel across an unbolted belly panel, the belly panel collapsed. The employees fell through the opening and the side panel they had been carrying fell with them. Employee 1 suffered a fractured left tibia and fibula and a fractured right femur. Employee 2 suffered a fractured left ankle, a dislocated left patella, and a back injury. Both employees were hospitalized.
An employee amputated the tip of his finger when it was caught between a conveyer and door. The employee was pressing doors in a pneumatic press when the injury occurred.
An employee was hospitalized after she slipped and fell on a plastic dough container while pushing a rolling cart.
An employee using the restroom slipped and tore her ACL.

An employee was attempting to clear a product jam from a piece of processing equipment. When the product became free, the employee's hand struck a gear in the equipment resulting in a fracture to the index and little finger. The employee was hospitalized due to a surgical procedure that required the partial amputation of the little fingertip.
An employee fell from a Segway and injured her right leg while preparing to leave the office to start her work day.
An employee was inside a customer location checking a phone line when he fell off a 6-foot ladder and hit his head, suffering a concussion.
An employee disconnected a pipe during a sanitation wash cycle and was burned below the waist by hot water.
On February 17, 2017, an employee slipped on the bathroom floor that was just mopped and suffered a knee injury.  The employee was hospitalized.
A reversing forklift struck an employee and ran over his right foot.

On Friday, October 30, at approximately 11:20 pm, an employee was working on a lathe.  The employee had baskets of unfinished product to her right and baskets of finished product to her left.  A group of baskets containing finished product, weighing approximately 25 pounds each, fell on to the employee's right knee.  The employee was hospitalized.

A wire became jammed in the wire brush manufacturing machine. The employee unjammed the wire and used his left middle finger to check if the feed tube was free of debris. The machine toggled and amputated his left middle fingertip.  The machine was not locked out at the time.
Two employees were in rehearsal using motorcycles. The motorcycle tires touched, causing a crash. One of the employees was hospitalized with a broken jaw.
An employee was unloading a drill. The auger was still spinning. His clothing became caught on a bolt and he was caught up in the auger, suffering three fractured left ribs and bruises.
A City Carrier in Nashville was delivering mail when she slipped on ice and fell breaking her ankle. She was hospitalized and underwent surgery to repair her ankle.

An employee on a ladder was moving a box of meat from a storage rack when he twisted and reinjured his back. He fell approximately 2 feet and was admitted to the hospital for back treatment/possible surgery.

An employee had connected a flux car for unloading. The previous car that unloaded into this line had oil with some residual water. When the flux (a tar-like substance) made contact with the water, it expanded and contacted the employee as he exited the railcar, causing first and second degree thermal burns.
While performing sawmill operations for the pallet mill, an employee went to unjam a wood board from a saw. His left thumb was then amputated in a chain and sprocket pinch point.

On or about April 15, 2016, an employee was setting trusses on a post frame agriculture building. While coming down from the trusses, the employee fell approximately 11 feet to the ground, sustaining upper and lower back contusions and requiring hospitalization.
An employee slipped and fell on a wet floor in the kitchen area of a fast food restaurant, hitting his head and dislocating his left knee.

An employee was using a safety tool designed to unstop a paint sprayer (spray gun) when the gun blew paint out the front or side and injected it into the employee's fingertip. He underwent surgery to remove the paint/debris.
An employee slipped and fell and hit their head resulting in hospitalization for a concussion and head trauma.

An employee was preparing to help clean deli equipment using a chemical degreaser. The container  of concentrated degreasing chemical fell, causing the chemical to spill out and contact the employee's leg.  The employee suffered severe skin irritation.
An employee was trimming hedges and lacerated the ring, middle and pinky fingers of the right hand.
An employee was preparing to offload materials at a laydown yard. He was reaching for a cable attached to a load when his leg gave out, causing him to fall from the truck and fracture his left leg.

Employee 1 and employee 2 were operating a welding robot in the fabrication department.  Employee 1 was loading a fin bank into the welding cell and was walking backwards into the welding cell while operating an overhead crane. Employee 1 stepped backwards into an open pit and fell approximately 8 feet. Employee 1 sustained the following injuries: fractured pelvis at both hip sockets, fractured ribs, fractured right elbow, fractured right shoulder.  Employee 1 is hospitalized at University Hospital in Columbia, Missouri.
An employee was running in the production area, slipped, and struck their right upper arm against a thin 3 inch piece of metal on the side of the conveyor resulting in a laceration.
Employee fell on ice while delivering mail, resulting in a broken leg and displaced ankle joint.
An employee was hit by a car in the parking lot while walking into work.

Employees were setting a canopy in place using a lull.  The injured employee used a fiberglass extension ladder to climb to the top of the 9'-high canopy to remove a sling. He fell from the ladder and fractured both wrists and two ribs.
An employee was attempting to fix air conditioning vents on a trolley when the fan blades inside the air conditioning unit amputated his fingertip.

On June 15, 2015, at approximately 4:40 PM, an employee cut off his left middle fingertip and cut the tendons in his left hand while using a band saw to cut pork. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was struck in the head by materials being lifted by an overhead hoist.
An employee was cleaning the LMC machine's (glue machine) rollers and caught his right index finger in the chain and sprocket apparatus. His finger was amputated at the first digit.

An employee was attempting to remove a stainless steel window sill segment from the drive-thru window system using a cordless drill. The screw he was removing reversed quickly, causing his left thumb tip to become pinched between the stainless steel section and the drill he was operating, resulting in a partial amputation.
An employee was preparing to unjam a machine when the machine cycled and amputated the employee's right index fingertip.

On June 13, 2016, an employee was working on a barge (on land), performing paint spraying operations. The employee attempted to clean out a paint gun when a small foreign object embedded into the fourth digit of his right hand. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee delivered a load to a customer and was unloading the cargo when he was struck in the head with the forks of a forklift. The employee was wearing a hard hat. The employee sustained multiple skull fractures, five staples in the face, and short-term memory loss.

An employee was operating a foam-cutting machine. After completing the cuts on the foam material, the employee was moving away from the machine and was electrically shocked by it, suffering right hand and arm injuries that required hospitalization.
A temporary worker was sweeping the warehouse floor and was bitten by a rattle snake on the right index finger.

An employee was attempting to rivet two pieces of metal by hand with a rivet squeezer. The employee was holding the metal with his right hand and was operating the rivet squeezer with lift hand. The employee's right middle finger was caught between the rivet squeezer and the metal resulting in a fingertip amputation.
While working around a cardboard baler, an employee tripped over plastic that was wrapped around a pallet prepared for the baler and fell fracturing the pelvic bone.
An employee was setting aluminum shoring for excavation using a hydraulic shoring machine when his finger was pinched inside the shoring. His right-hand middle fingertip was amputated.

On or about July 29, a temporary employee assigned to demo a commercial building was standing on a six foot ladder pulling speaker and telephone wire when he fell 4-6 feet to the concrete floor breaking his arm and cutting his shoulder.
An employee's pinky fingertip on the right hand was removed while troubleshooting a problem with the aeration system in a grain bin.
An employee was pushing a merchandise cart and collapsed or lost his balance and fell to the ground breaking the right ankle.
An employee tried to intervene during a fight in the parking lot and was stabbed in the rib cage.
On June 27, 2016, at approximately 10:30 AM, an employee was helping to install a boom extension when it suddenly fell and hit the employee, fracturing his pelvis bone.

An employee on a scissor lift that had a manually extendible boom was replacing a furnace door. As he was maneuvering the door, he placed his left hand on the lift's top rail assembly, which consisted of a square tubing channel and a U-shaped channel. When he pushed the door against the lift, his left pinky was caught and amputated (above the knuckle) between the two channels.
An employee was looking for parts while walking and talking on the radio.  The employee tripped on a safety barrier and broke the left leg above the ankle.

An employee was changing the bearings in a ventilation system motor. After the motor was put back together, the employee reached behind the motor with his left hand to check the belt tension. While the employee was checking the belt tension, the wind blew through the air duct and caused the ventilation fan pulley to turn. The employee's left pinky and index fingers were pinched between the pulley and belt and amputated.
An employee was loading a box when it fell back, causing the employee to lose balance and fall. The employee suffered a broken rib and punctured lung.

An employee was working on the chain and sprocket to a tape machine. As he used a tool to tighten the chain, his hand slipped and his right index finger contacted the moving chain. His right index finger was partially amputated (approximately 2-2.5 cm). The machine was running and was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.

An employee climbed up a vertical fixed ladder to verify lengths of material in the loft and as the employee was coming down the ladder, he missed a step and fell approximately seven feet to the ground, injuring his hip. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a cat head on the drilling rig and amputated fingertips.
An employee was using an emery cloth to hand polishing a part being rotated by a manual horizontal lathe. The cloth was caught by the rotating part which pulled the employee's arm into the machine.
An employee was reaching overhead to remove a metal spacer when an aluminum log fell on the employee's leg, breaking it.

On January 8, 2015 at 10:15pm, an employee was cleaning/unclogging an automatic in-line cement powder sampler.  He used his finger to verify there was no longer a clog and the sampler actuated amputating the tip of the third finger on the employee's left hand.
An employee was operating a press welder when two of his fingers got caught in the press. His right-hand index and middle fingers were amputated at the first joint.
An employee was removing lagging from the inside of a building. While up in the air, he brushed up against the overhead crane bus bar and received an electrical shock. He was hospitalized.
An employee was performing cleaning operations outside near the gas pump, when a vehicle pulled up to the pump and ran over him.
An employee was performing furnace maintenance when he began feeling overheated. He was hospitalized for a heat-related illness.
Around 7:30 PM, an employee tripped over a rope and fell on his right arm. The employee complained about pain on his right elbow and was hospitalized.
An employee was mauled by a Staffordshire Bull Terrier that was kept in the office unsecured resulting in injuries to both arms that required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was loading a dolly when the dolly slipped, amputating the employee's left index finger before the first knuckle.
On February 20, 2015, an employee was injured when a Genie man lift rolled over. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee missed a step while descending a step stool, spraining the left ankle and requiring surgery.
On 12/17/16, an employee was adjusting a frozen mirror when the mirror snapped and lacerated the employee's right hand, requiring surgery.

An employee was inside a vinegar vat for maintenance purposes. He was standing on a ladder, entering the space, and wearing a respirator when he was overcome and fell from the ladder into the vat. He was hospitalized for chemical burns to his lungs.
On July 25, 2016, at 11:30 a.m., an employee was hospitalized with a compound leg fracture after a steel drainage grate that he was carrying fell on his leg as he tripped.

On 10/11/2016 at 7:00 p.m., an employee was standing on the top level of an auto hauler trailer when he lost his balance and fell off.  There were no railings on that part of the trailer and he fell 10-11 ft. to the ground.  The employee was hospitalized with a fractured skull, fractured collar bone, 2 fractured ribs, and bleeding in the brain.
An employee injured a leg while climbing a vault's fixed ladder.
Employee had his left fifth (pinky) fingertip amputated when his hand was pinched between a high-torque wrench and a bolt head.

An employee was performing maintenance on a compressor fan and suffered an amputation to the tip of the fourth digit (ring finger) of the left hand when the finger came into contact with the fan blade.
An employee was walking and tripped over forklift forks that were on the ground. She fell and fractured the left hip.
An employee sustained lacerations to his foot while operating a lawn mower.

On or about July 12, 2016, an employee was hospitalized after receiving a severe laceration to the left armpit from a dragon saw. As the employee went to set the dragon saw onto the ground with one hand, the saw was activated and jumped striking the employee under  the arm.
On May 24, 2016, an employee was helping to place sections of concrete barrier with a track hoe. One piece shifted and fell on the employee's leg, fracturing it and requiring surgery.
An employee was cleaning the hopper on a combine with an air hose when the employee's right leg was caught in the combine auger, amputating it mid-calf.
An employee was moving a strapper machine after making boxes. The machine amputated his left pinky fingertip when he moved it back into position.

On or about 7/6/16, at 17:45 hours, an employee had been working outside at several oilfield locations in high heat conditions when he began feeling ill and collapsed. He was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.

On February 17, 2015, at approximately 5:30pm, an arc flash occurred while an employee rolled in a 4kv breaker to the Coal Yard Area. The employee received small first and second degree burns to his right and left hands.
While inspecting a construction activity, an employee fell approximately 20 feet to a lower level and suffered a broken leg.
An employee fell approximately 10 to 12 feet off a mixing tank platform while adding polymer from bags into the tank, fracturing his ribs.
An employee got up on a conveyor he was placing. The conveyor came over him, breaking both of his arms.
An employee was unloading a three-foot I beam onto a work table. The I beam slipped out of the employee's hands and the employee's right middle finger was caught between two I beams.

An employee and a coworker opened the hood of a dump truck to diagnose why the fan of the radiator was not engaging. The injured employee was on the passenger side while the coworker was on the driver side. The coworker entered the cab and started the engine. The injured employee contacted the radiator's belt and pulley at that moment, which amputated the end joint of the employee's right index finger.
An employee was installing a new belt and pulley when the belt and pulley rotated, amputating the employee's left little fingertip.
An employee fell 30 feet from the edge of an apartment complex roof while engaged in roofing work. The employee was hospitalized with a broken femur, wrist, and ribs.
An employee was coming down from a shoring scaffold that he was erecting when he lost his footing and fell 10.5 feet to the ground. He was hospitalized with a fractured back.
An employee was standing between an RCD pipe and a loader with forks on it when the pipe rolled and pinned the employee to the loader, crushing and fracturing his leg.
An employee was seriously injured after hitting the third digit on his right hand with a hammer. The employee suffered soft tissue trauma.
A worker was standing beside a milling machine. His right foot got too close to the milling head and the machine ran over it causing severe lacerations.

An employee was lifting the end section of pipe to help clear an I-beam of a pipe rack. As the crew moved the pipe forward, the employee's left thumb was caught and amputated between the pipe and an I-beam support member.
Employee was euthanizing a sick dog. The dog lunged unexpectedly and bit the employee on the hand/lower arm.
An employee was struck by a powered industrial vehicle.

The employee helped finish installing deep foundation and began disassembling equipment at the site. While dismantling the crane, the employee used a hammer to knock a pin from a boom to disassemble it. The boom fell on the employee, resulting in an in-patient hospitalization and injuries to the wrist, both ankles, and the leg, as well as a possible back injury.
An employee was changing a belt on equipment using a bar and got a finger caught between the belt and pulley amputating the fingertip.

On May 29, 2015, an employee was working inside a sulpha treat reactor vessel using a high pressure (5000 PSI) water sprayer gun to cut off the congealed catalyst material inside. The employee slipped and fell; the high-pressure water sprayer hit the employee's right foot and punctured a hole through the rubber boot. The employee sustained a puncture open wound on the right foot, second toe. The employee was hospitalized and received treatment.

On 8/17/16, an employee was helping to remove swabbing tools from an oil well when the swab lubricator pipe fell onto his hands, amputating his right thumb and injuring his left thumb and pinky finger.
An employee was pumping a sewer truck into a below-ground holding tank when he fell into the tank, fracturing his hand and suffering a friction burn to his fingers.
An employee was repairing a tire and lacerated his thumb on a protruding nail in the tire.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fractured his hip.
An employee was selecting packages from the back of a delivery truck when he started feeling sick.  He was hospitalized for dehydration.

An employee was moving a catwalk (a long piece of equipment that helps move tube) against a rig to perform an inspection when his right ring finger was caught and fractured between the catwalk skate and a pin. He was hospitalized.
An employee struck his leg on a car tire and opened up a previous wound, which would not stop bleeding and required hospitalization.
An employee was pinched between an aerial lift and walkway. While attempting to come down, the lift acted abnormally. It instead went up and pinched the employee between the lift and walkway.

A temporary employee on a catwalk was cleaning the incandescent lighting covers above fertilizer blenders when he fell 7 to 8 feet off the catwalk and onto the concrete floor, injuring his back. He was hospitalized.

On 7/1/16, at approximately 6:30 PM, an employee was helping to pull tubing from a derrick rig. The employee climbed the derrick structure to attach the necessary rigging. As he descended to the working level, his climb assist became caught/wrapped in the gooseneck assembly. He was then pulled into the derrick board, breaking his tibia and dislocating his ankle.

An employee was inspecting products being removed from a truck. The truck started to roll away while he was standing with one foot on the truck and the other on the loading dock. He fell and fractured both legs.

An employee was moving an aerial articulating boom lift when his head brushed against high-power electrical lines. He was shocked several times before falling unconscious to the basket of the lift, suffering second and third degree burns and internal injuries. He was hospitalized.

An employee was helping a coworker remove a forklift that was lodged in the mud. The employee bent over to place boards for traction under the front wheels of the forklift. The coworker used another forklift to lift the lodged forklift out of the mud when the fork slipped off of the wheel frame and struck the employee above the left eye.
An employee suffered a left hand fingertip amputation when cleaning the hopper of a straw machine.

An employee was walking toward the medication room when her foot got stuck on the floor, causing her to lose her balance. She fell forward and injured head and face on the doorway. She also fractured her left arm.
An employee was showing a patio door to a customer. The door was on display in a metal frame when it fell off the hinge and onto the employee. The employee suffered a broken pelvis.

Two employees installed a new mud press belt. The employees were in the process of installing the mud wash box. In the process of removing the bolts from the bearing pillow block on the redirect roller, the remaining tension on the new belt and residual in air bag belt tensioning system pulled and twisted the redirect roller forward into the water flush line union. The force and motion of the redirect roller bearing pillow block pushed the employee's hand between the adjustable wrench (crescent wrench) and the water flush line union. The employee immediately removed his hand from the leather glove and noticed the pinky finger was smashed and suffered a partial skin amputation.
An employee was cleaning up chub bags in a freezer due to a malfunction in the packaging machine when he slipped on the slick floor and fell on his back, breaking ribs and suffering bruising.
An employee was connecting a trailer to the ball of a truck. His finger was in the coupling when the trailer came down and amputated his fingertip.

An employee was installing an arch pipe in a driveway. After the employee released the mechanism on the hoisting apparatus that held the pipe, the pipe fell on the employee's finger, pinching it between the pipe and the concrete driveway. The employee's right ring finger was amputated at the first joint.
An employee was working next to a pile of steel beams when the beams rolled on top of him, breaking his right leg.
A horse kicked an employee in the torso with both back legs.

An employee was preparing a no-bake sand mold. When the molten metal was poured into the mold, the aluminum ran through the lifting hole and entered the employee's right shoe, burning his foot and requiring surgery. He also suffered burns on both hands while attempting to remove his shoe.
Employee discharged a nail gun. A nail became lodged in the left lower leg, requiring surgery to remove.
An employee was leaving the elevator, tripped and fell breaking the left femur.
An employee was burned on the leg while cutting rebar.
An employee was putting a metal piece into the die area of the stamping machine when the machine cycled and crushed her left hand. The press guard was in place at the time.
An employee was using a jib crane to pick up a return pig. When using the pendant to lift the pig, his finger got stuck between two chain links, amputating his fourth left-hand finger's first pad.

On February 19, 2016, an employee was cutting a steel beam with a grinder when the grinder jumped out of the cut and contacted the employee above the knee. He was hospitalized overnight with a right leg laceration.

While working on a sorting line, an employee was sprayed by a flammable chemical when the bottle that it was in got stuck on the conveyor. The ignition source was a portable heater that was being used to keep the employee warm. The employee received 1st and 2nd degree burns to the right hand and right leg.
On 6/15/16, an employee was removing chicken feet from a shackle machine when his left thumb tip was amputated.
An employee was feeding rebar into a radius machine when his glove became caught on the guard. His right hand was then pulled into the point of operation, crushing and breaking it.
An employee slipped and broke their patella.
An employee operating a stand-up forklift had just put a pile of empty pallets under a rack at floor level. While backing away, he hit the rack behind him, injuring his left hip.
An employee fell and sustained a hip injury.

On 3/3/15, an employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell.  The employee was immediately taken for medical treatment where X-rays showed a broken right arm or humerus.  The employee was scheduled to see an Orthopedist on 3/4/15.  Following the appointment with the Orthopedist, the employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery on her broken humerus.
An employee was stacking covers on the outside deck of a barge when a cover-stacking spreader bar slid down the barge cover and struck him on the right forearm, fracturing it.

On 10/07/2016, at approximately 8:45 a.m., two employees suffered electrical shock. An employee was shocked while using a concrete saw. Another employee attempted to move the first employee out of the water and was also injured. The employees were hospitalized.
While walking into a refrigerated cooler, an employee slipped on the condensation on the floor, falling and breaking her left hip.

On July 20, 2015, an employee was loading steel beams onto a truck when the beams fell. The employee tried to prevent the beams from falling with his arm, which got caught between two beans. His arm broke.
An employee was using a backhoe to lay down a steel beam when the beam broke through the backhoe's glass window and struck his left kneecap. He was hospitalized with a broken left kneecap.
On July 8, 2015, at approximately 6:00 p.m., an employee was struck in the face by a high-pressure hose. The employee suffered multiple facial fractures and was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning crumbs/crust from a catwalk and got her right hand caught in an unguarded chain and sprocket conveyor.  Her right hand was amputated during surgery.
While climbing down an attached, caged ladder from a boiler unit, the employee slipped and fell roughly 15-20 feet breaking his right femur and dislocating the left knee.
An employee was lowering a fire hose off of the side of a ship using a rope when the rope became tangled around his index finger, amputating it at the first knuckle. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee suffered an allergic reaction to a wasp sting and was hospitalized.
An employee was using a grinding wheel when it broke and pieces struck his left bicep. He required surgery and overnight hospitalization.
An employee had just dropped off a co-worker at the main gate and was returning back to the office when he suffered a seizure and lost control of the company pickup and struck a tree.
An employee slipped on ice and fell on the sidewalk while walking into work, fracturing his leg.
While lifting a patient in the bathroom, an employee fractured her back.
The employee was positioning metal into a hydraulic press brake and amputated the tip of the second digit on his left hand.
An employee was assaulted by a shoplifter and was knocked unconscious, suffering a head injury.
An employee's left thumb was cut deeply while operating a meat band saw.
Employee was helping to troubleshoot an air valve.  While trying to isolate the valve, the valve closed, resulting in partial amputation of his left middle finger.
An employee operating a hand brake on a railcar fell due to an off-balance load. The employee was hospitalized with crushed ribs and chest and spine fractures.

An employee was adjusting the chains on a piece of equipment, preparing it to be lifted by an overhead crane. The coworker operating the crane let go of the control button for lowering the chains. The injured employee thought the crane had already come to a complete stop, so he attempted to adjust the chains. His left hand was on one of the chains and while adjusting the other chain with his right hand, the chain tightened and slapped against his left hand, amputating his left middle fingertip.
An employee was installing gas pipes when his arm was caught between two pipes, resulting in vascular injuries.
Two employees in a lift were installing a window when they fell approximately 11 feet to the ground. They were not tied off at the time.

An employee was operating a table saw to cut a piece of wood when the wood became bound in the saw blade and kicked back, causing the employee's left thumb to contact the blade. The thumb tip was amputated with some bone loss.
An employee was lowering a dock plate when it became stuck. As he used a pole to lift the dock plate, the plate became dislodged and fell on his foot, severely cutting one toe.

An employee was injured when the brakes on a seven-car string of loaded boxcars let loose. The cars rolled into a four-car string of empty boxcars.  The impact knocked an employee off the four-car string and he fell on the ground. The employee was hospitalized for lacerations.

Two employees were hospitalized due to injuries sustained during maintenance operations on a workover rig in the maintenance shop. One employee suffered a crushing injury when a derrick floor fell on his chest, breaking ribs and causing a collapsed lung.  A second employee suffered a broken elbow due to a fall sustained while attempting to hold the falling rig floor.
A temporary employee's hand was caught and mangled in a conveyor roller.

An employee was filling candle forms with hot wax. Hot wax leaked onto the floor. The employee slipped on the hot wax and fell on the wax suffering third degree burns to the right calf and first degree burns to other parts of the body.
