An employee was running a compound liner machine when she saw a cover that she thought she had to align. She placed her hand on the machine, which was running, and her right hand/glove was pinched between the stacker plate. She pulled her hand out of the glove and her middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee cutting a tree branch fell and sustained a head injury.
An employee was operating a table saw when he cut his left thumb and was hospitalized.
An employee was grinding the joint of a pipe when another joint of pipe rolled and struck the employee on the right side of the head, fracturing the skull.
An employee operating a saw on a wing line suffered a left index fingertip amputation.
An employee was changing a polished rod when the employee's hand was caught between a well head and a block, crushing the ring and pinky fingers.

While operating a pallet jack to collect freight, an employee lost control and was thrown from the equipment. The employee was caught between the pallet jack and a rack's cross beam, breaking ribs on the left side.
While mixing concrete with a mixer drill, and employee's left index finger was caught in the blades, partially amputating the fingertip.

An employee was troubleshooting a manufacturing process in the facility when he stepped on an anti-fatigue mat and it slipped out from under him. The employee fell to the tile floor breaking the right femur.

An employee was attempting to align the hydraulic mast tilt cylinder on a forklift so he could insert the locking pin. His finger was in the pin hole while he instructed the forklift operator to lower the hydraulic mast so the pin hole would line up and the pin could be inserted. He suffered a partial amputation of his left index finger.

An employee was loading/unloading a truck when the vehicle rolled off the road and down a hill. The employee's legs were pinned underneath the truck. The parking brake and wheel chocks were not used at the time of the incident.

The employee was on the second step from the floor of an A-frame ladder when she lost her balance while hanging decorations in the racetrack area. She was admitted to the hospital for surgery on her broken right ankle.
An employee was taking down a crane when he slipped and fell 14 feet off the crane to the ground, suffering facial scratches and fracturing both hands and his left elbow.
At 7:00 a.m., on 7/27/2016, an employee was tripping decking forms when he fell off the 5-foot step ladder, breaking ribs and his wrist. He was hospitalized.
An employee was inspecting the seal of a container on a truck when the truck pulled away/forward. The employee was struck by the truck chassis and run over by the wheels, fracturing his pelvis.
An employee was working in a tank on a drilling rig when he tripped on a beam and fell, resulting in a broken ankle.
The employee was walking and tripped on a curb dislocating both elbows.
An employee was installing a tongue and groove wooden ceiling from a scaffold when he fell off, fracturing his arm and wrist and requiring surgery.
An employee was bitten by a spider while cleaning a piece of equipment.
An employee was carrying a 4x6-feet wooden beam when he lost his footing and slipped and fell, pinching his right index finger between a beam corner and the 4x6 beam.
An employee was emptying the truck of salt. The employee tried to clear a jam in the auger when their glove got caught and their left hand was pulled into the auger resulting in a fractured hand.
An employee was manipulating a piece of wood on a conveyor when his finger became caught between the conveyor and the piece of wood, causing a partial finger amputation.
An employee was changing a die on a press brake when the brake came down and caught his left middle finger. His finger broke and required surgery.
An employee was transported to the hospital after suffering stomach cramping and was hospitalized for dehydration.

Four employees were preparing to change a head saw blade.  One employee shut the head saw down and while the blade was still rotating another employee opened a door on the backside of the head saw.  That employee reached inside the door with his right hand and his arm was struck by the saw blade amputating the lower arm.

A roll was being lowered into the furnace. The bottom edge of the roll caught the inside of the donut ring, causing the roll to turn out of the rigging shoe. An employee reached for the roll to clean off a refractory that had fallen down, unaware that the roll was out of the rigging. The roll fell through the donut and crushed the employee's hand. The employee suffered an amputation to the first knuckle of the right index finger; the right-hand middle finger was also fractured.

Two employees were moving sheets of plywood on the dock. At the same time, a poultry pan was being lowered onto the dock. The injured employee moved under the pan as it was being lowered and was struck by the pan. The employee suffered a broken hip and right metacarpal and a hematoma on the forehead.

Employees were stripping a tile floor in preparation to wax it. One of the employees slipped and fell on the wet floor striking his head and sustaining a small laceration. The employee was hospitalized due to a possible head injury.
An employee performing roofing work fell approximately 12 feet.  He was laying down substrate at the time of the accident in preparation for the placement of roof shingles.
An employee collapsed after telling his co-workers he was not feeling well.
An employee was standing on an eight foot ladder and fell resulting in a skull fracture above the left eye, a broken left wrist, and a broken nose.
While setting a gearbox in the motor for a tank mixer, an employee's hand got caught between the gearbox and mounting plate. The employee's left hand was crushed.
On December 31, 2015, an employee working as a produce clerk slipped on a piece of fruit and fell to the ground, resulting in a hospitalization for a compound fracture to the right knee.

An employee fell off the back of a golf cart while trying to get raccoons out of a dumpster. The employee was standing on the back of the golf cart while a coworker was in the driver's seat. The coworker moved the golf cart forward, causing the employee to fall to the ground and sustain an iliac crest fracture. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell 3 feet off a stage while setting it up for a show, sustaining a broken right arm and requiring hospitalization.

On or about 8:15 a.m. on October 27, 2015, an employee was operating a com cutter machine when he incurred an amputation to the tip of his left ring finger.  The machine rotates, smooths and cuts commutators that are a component of DC motors.

An employee was on the stabbing board to hang the tong line. He unhooked the derrick climber from his harness and when he let go of it he was hit in the mouth, lost his footing, and fell even though his lanyard was attached. His face hit the standpipe of the derrick and the 3 foot fall injured his back.

An employee's foot was caught in a pinch point between the shell of the melting furnace and the casting floor mezzanine while attempting to unlatch a hook related to the safety bin chute. Three toes on the employee's left foot were amputated.

An employee was working on the pipeline. A pipe came off of the trough and coiled on the floor. The employee tried to straighten out the coiled pipe. His feet became tangled in the pipe, causing him to fall to the floor. He fractured his hip.
An employee fell from a ladder resulting in injury to the right side of his head.
An employee was changing the tracks on a John Deere bobcat. As he turned the wheel, his finger got caught in the wrong place, snipping off the end of the left index finger.

On October 19, 2015, at about 11:00 a.m., an employee was on a step ladder installing drywall with a drill driver. He fell off the ladder to the concrete floor and broke his right arm. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was operating a pallet jack when the equipment backed over her left leg, breaking the tibia and ankle.
On December 16, 2016, an employee was mopping the floor when she twisted her torso and injured her back, requiring hospitalization.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fractured his left leg, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was de-catering an aircraft at when he fell approximately 10 feet from the platform of his high-lift catering truck. He suffered a contusion to his cervical cord, sternum, and right leg.
An employee was testing electrical voltage when an electrical arc flash occurred. The employee suffered electrical burns to the arms and was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell on a wet floor while bringing dirty dishes to the dish tank area, injuring the left leg and hip.
An employee was operating a chain saw cutting an 8x8 timber when the saw kicked back and hit him in the left side of his chest. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was walking by an unguarded conveyor belt and amputated the right thumb tip.
Employee fell from ladder when coming down the roof and broke his hands and neck.

An employee and his crew were loading steel coils onto a barge for shipment. As a coil was being lowered onto the saddle-shaped dunnage, the employee used his right foot to adjust the position of the dunnage board. He missed the board and the coil came down on top of the steel-toed cap of his boot, which collapsed onto his right toes. His big-toe nailbed was crushed and his second toe was fractured. His third and fourth toes were surgically amputated just below the nailbed.

The worker was performing a demonstration event. She walked over to the produce section to get grapes for her demonstration. She was in front of the grapes, reached for an item, turned to go back to her demo cart and fell onto her right side, fracturing her right hip.
An employee was delivering mail to a resident's home when a dog attacked him, causing an amputation injury to his left index finger.
An employee tripped over a pallet and fell fracturing the left knee.

An employee was attempting to close a dock door while sitting on a forklift. He had backed his forklift so that the rear right wheel was on a loading dock leveler that was still attached to a trailer approved for release. When the trailer was moved, the forklift fell over and the employee's hand was pinned between the ground and upper overhead carriage. He suffered broken bones in the thumb and palm area.

An employee was washing down sodium hydroxide that was leaking off a pump. During the washing process, caustic material soaked into the employee's steel toe boots through the laces, causing second and third degree burns to the tops of the employee's feet.
An employee was going down the stairs when he fell and was found at the bottom floor. He was hospitalized with a hip injury.
An employee was on an extension ladder resting on the truck's flat bed. The ladder slipped under him; he fell, broke his nose, and was hospitalized.
An employee was attempting to remove a piece of chicken trim from a machine when his left hand/arm entered the machine's moving parts.

An employee was clearing a jam on the Standun Bodymaker #34.  The machine was running at the time. The safety interlock malfunctioned and the horizontal press made a full revolution crushing the employees left pinky finger that was later removed at the hospital.

On February 10, 2017, an employee was using a torch to cut an automotive die when a line ruptured, spraying the employee's legs with hot hydraulic fluid. The employee sustained serious burn injuries to both legs and was hospitalized.
On March 9, 2016, around 2:00 p.m., an employee slipped and fell on grease in the kitchen, breaking her left wrist. She was hospitalized.
While walking downstairs, an employee fell and fractured the right ankle.
An employee was lifting a man-hole cover with his hand when it fell and struck his right index finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee turned on a core drilling machine. The machine was stuck, resulting in him being knocked to the ground. The drill base kept spinning and went over his hand, amputating his left ring fingertip.

On 10/15/2015, at about 10:00 p.m., an employee was taking a sample from a petroleum unit of the refinery. During the sampling process, the glass bottle ruptured and broke. The glass debris injured the employee's face and left eye.
While getting off a forklift, an employee slipped and fell 2 feet to the asphalt, breaking a hip.
While stepping off of a crane platform onto a ladder, an employee lost his balance and fell 66.5 inches, injuring his left leg. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was unloading items from a pallet when she tripped on the shrink wrap, fell, and broke her hip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cutting wood using a table saw when a part of his thumb was amputated.
The employee was cutting a piece of ductile 8" iron pipe with a hot saw or quickie saw. The weight caused the pipe to pinch the blade and the pipe kicked up and struck the employee in the face.
Three employees suffered burn injuries in a flash fire on a boat. One employee was hospitalized.
An employee sustained a broken wrist when struck by metal cable.

An employee and two coworkers were removing counterweights from a tractor. The employee used a pipe to balance the counterweight, but the counterweight shifted, causing the pipe to strike the employee. He fell on the cement floor and suffered chest, wrist, and head injuries.
One mile south of Black Creek Reservoir,  a smoke jumper was participating in his annual certification jump when he had a hard landing, breaking his right arm and dislocating his right shoulder.
An employee was helping to remove a door when the door fell onto the employee injuring their neck.

On Friday, October 16, an employee was preparing to lower the drill bar from the rest of the drilling machine. The bar separated from the tool that was holding it and fell on the employee. He sustained four fractured ribs and a blow to the right side of his face and left shoulder.
While walking around the cash register, an employee tripped over a hand basket on the floor and suffered a left hip fracture.
An employee was walking around to stretch his legs between shuttle runs. His left leg gave out and he fell to the ground, fracturing his left hip.
An employee lost consciousness while operating light construction equipment due to heat illness and was hospitalized.
An employee fell from a stationary piece of equipment while changing a conveyor's pulley belt.  The fall was about 8 feet. The employee was hospitalized with a broken leg.

An employee was attempting to change the buffing blades on an automatic tire buffing machine. While he was using a wrench to remove the blade head, the machine turned on. The wrench became entangled in his clothing and pulled him into the machine, breaking his right wrist and lacerating his right forearm, bicep, and leg. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
On January 21, 2015, at approximately 9:34 AM, an employee in the meat department suffered a partial amputation of a finger with a small amount of bone loss.

On September 29, 2016, at approximately 10:15 AM, an employee walking through the facility was struck by a powered industrial vehicle. The employee then fell and suffered a broken left elbow, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was operating a tenderizer machine and amputated the left index fingertip while removing a jam.
An employee was struck by a motor vehicle and was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning up underneath a conveyor and got sawdust in his eyes. He also struck his head when reacting to the sawdust. He required overnight hospitalization.

An employee was reconnecting a 20-pound cooling fan located 8 inches above the floor when the fan slipped and pinched the employee's right index finger between the blade and the floor. The finger was amputated.
An employee had finished repairing a strobe light on the back of a forklift and began to climb down when he fell to the concrete. He fractured his right hip socket and required surgery.
An employee's hand was crushed by a cocoa press. The employee was hospitalized.

Employee was injured in the fish preparation area when he placed his hands on the chain puller to unload racks from the precookers. The second and third fingers on his left hand were caught in the chain, and his fingers were crushed.
An employee was insulating ductwork over an air handler when he slipped and fell approximately 6-9 ft. to the ground below. The employee sustained head trauma and fractured facial bones.
An employee was caulking the exterior of a boat while standing on a ladder or scaffold. The employee fell 6 feet from the scaffold or ladder, breaking a vertebra.
An employee was cut by glass due to an over pressurization event.
An employee was installing asphalt shingles when he accidently shot himself in the foot with his nail gun.

On April 28, 2016, at 1:20 PM, an employee was using a router table to notch several small pieces of wood. The employee was moving the pieces of wood from left to right. The wood kicked back, allowing the employee's fingers to enter the bit.
An employee was trying to unattach the hook from a lifting "eye" on the top of a compressor after it was moved when his pinky fingertip was caught and amputated between the hook and the "eye."
An employee was using a drill when his glove contacted the drill and/or drill bit and amputated his right second digit.
A stone fell from a scaffold and hit an employee who was walking under it, causing head injuries.

An employee was in a skid steer with a bucket attachment, and was shoveling up cardboard.  The operator picked up a load and began backing up; he noticed that a piece of plastic was attached to the bucket. The employee decided to detach the plastic from the bucket. In the process of doing this, the employee stood up without disengaging the controls, placed his right hand on the right front post of the skid steer, then reached with his left hand for the plastic. When he reached with his left hand, his chest came in contact with the controls, lowering the bucket. As the bucket lowered, the right arm of the skid steer came in contact with the employee's right index finger and crushed it.
An employee pulling wire felt a strange pain in his belly. He was hospitalized to determine the source of the severe pain.

An employee was returning to her work area carrying a case of water bottles on her right shoulder.  She was walking down a catwalk and came to a 4-step elevation change. As she walked down the steps, her left foot became entangled in some air hose, causing her to lose her balance.  As she stepped down with her right foot to regain her balance, she stepped on more air hose, which caused her ankle to roll. When she brought her left foot back up, all of her weight went onto her right ankle. She dislocated her ankle and fractured her tibia and fibula.

An employee was lifting a pipe into place with a hoist. The pipe came loose and caught his right hand between the pipe and a fusion machine. The pipe was rigged with a choker but not shackled.  The employee's right little finger was crushed and he was hospitalized.

An employee was delivering residential appliances. Upon completion of one job, the employee threw the empty dolly into the back of the delivery truck. A burr on the dolly handle caught on the employee's glove, fracturing and lacerating the left ring finger.

An employee was cutting an overhead steel member with a cutting torch when molten slag fell onto his clothing and ignited it. He suffered 1st and 2nd degree burns to his back and additional burns on his hand.

Two employees got on a jet ski to rescue a guest that had capsized. During the rescue operation, a wave capsized the jet ski and caused it to break down. One of the employees suffered hypothermia after being immersed in the 55-degree water for several hours.
An employee suffered a serious leg injury from a power pole while moving a stack of power poles using a Gradall forklift at or near 83rd and 64th in Stanley, North Dakota.

The injured employee was lifting an oversized package that weighed approximately 98 lbs. with another employee. When the employee lowered the package his finger was severed by a piece of metal on the package.
An employee was pulling a king pin to release a trailer and slipped and fell fracturing his right ankle.  Employee was hospitalized.

An employee was capping an 8 inch PVC water line. Backpressure built up in the line from a leaking valve and blew the cap off resulting in amputation of the employee's left pinky finger and a partial amputation of the left ring finger.

An employee was found near a night watch station located close to knife room #1. He was walking disoriented and was unable to speak or hear.  The accident occurred around 1:50 p.m.  He was hospitalized with swelling on the right side of his head.
An employee was loading and unloading a truck when he began to feel ill. He was hospitalized for dehydration.

Prior to a welding job, an employee was unscrewing the cap on the acetylene tank and turning on the valve to check if any fuel was left when it ignited resulting in burns to his right hand and forearm. He was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was removing a clog from the acrylic acid line. When he cut the line, he reached up for the pipe to pull it down and acrylic acid leaked and burned his leg. He was hospitalized.
An employee tripped over the leg of a coworker who was kneeling down and fell to the ground, breaking her pelvis.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell breaking the left ankle.
An employee was signaling a load into the terminal when his foot got caught in the chain rigging as it moved.  The employee suffered multiple foot fractures.
At 10:45 AM on February 17, 2015, an employee's left leg was struck-by a pipe while unloading a truck causing a deep thigh bruise. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
On January 6, 2015, a worker sustained a fracture to the right ankle after slipping on ice at a construction site located at 17400 N. 84th Street, Lincoln, NE  68517.
An employee was running to help a coworker when he tripped and fell to the cement on his knees, fracturing both kneecaps.
An employee was climbing the ladder on a ready mix truck, slipped and fell to the ground fracturing the lower right leg.

On October 9, 2016, an employee was mounting a tractor when it lurched and threw him to the ground in front of a rear wheel. The tractor then struck him, and he suffered bruises and a pelvic injury that required surgery.

An employee on a second-level platform was opening a slide gate at a height of approximately 14 feet to place a pallet on the deck. The slide gate was 4 ft H x 12 ft W on the exterior wall, attached by a sliding mechanism. The employee fell to the ground along with the gate, suffering multiple fractures to the femur, pelvis, ribs, right leg, and arm.
An employee fell from a deck through a gap in the railing.
An employee was cutting pork loin using a band saw. He amputated two fingertips (middle and ring finger) on his right hand.

On March 25, 2016, an employee was moving a casting with a magnet when the magnet was turned off and the casting fell onto the employee's right foot resulting in amputation of the toes on the right foot.

An employee was parked in a residential incline driveway. The customer asked if the employee could move his truck. While backing up the vehicle, the right side of the vehicle was off the driveway in the grass. The employee exited the vehicle to look. The vehicle was still in reverse at the time. As the employee exited, the vehicle continued to reverse, and the driver's door struck and knocked him to the ground. The left front tire then ran over the employee, injuring his ribs and chest and possibly collapsing his lung.

An employee was working on the bar straightening machine when the straightener jammed and was shut down. The bar went back and forth, then came back and crushed the employee's finger, resulting in amputation.

An employee was walking into the dock leveler pit when his foot became tangled in the chain used to raise and lower the dock overhead door. He tripped, falling to the ground and fracturing his right ankle.
An employee was fixing damage to a custom trailer door using a pry bar and block of wood when the door shifted at the top and amputated the employee's right finger.

An employee amputated a fingertip while operating a filling machine. The employee was operating the tube filler machine to fill empty tubes with paint. The machine's trimming blade jammed. The employee tried to clear the jam and while a finger was in the nip point, the machine cycled, amputating the tip of his finger.
An employee suffered hand lacerations and fractures while cleaning cheese-making equipment.

At about 4:30 PM on 09/06/2016, an employee operating an overhead gantry crane was using a handheld remote and a C-hook to remove a specific coil of slit steel from among other coils in storage. He became caught between the loaded C-hook and another fixed coil in storage, fracturing his left clavicle (collarbone) and two ribs.

An employee was moving pallets with an electric pallet jack. While backing up the pallet jack, his leg got caught in the wheel well of a forklift. The forklift operator began to move the forklift forward, causing the employee's leg to be pulled farther into the wheel well. He suffered broken bones in his right foot and a fractured right elbow, requiring hospitalization.

On October 22, 2015, at about 12:30PM, an employee lacerated the fourth finger on the right hand while removing a piece of concrete that had just been cut. The cut piece measured approximately 60 inches x 18.5 inches by 12 inches thick. When removing the piece, the employee's finger was pinched between the cut piece and the wall.

On 10/07/15 at approximately 10:10 pm, a Goodman employee was returning from break when he slipped on some oil on the floor in the coil department and fell. The employee has been admitted to the hospital for evaluation.
An employee's hand got caught and severed in a shear machine while cutting fence posts.
On August 5, 2016, at 1:15 PM, an employee's finger was caught in the pinch point of a press brake, amputating his left ring fingertip.
Employee slipped on the ice leaving a client's home and broke her left ankle.

On or about 11 April 2015, at approximately 0830 hours, a Brazos Rock Energy employee received burns on his wrist and face when flammable gasses that accumulated during a pipeline hot tap ignited. The employee was helping a welder weld the pipe sections together when two pin-sized holes on a section of pipe 10 feet from the operation leaked flammable gasses into the pipe and surrounding area. The gasses accumulated to a level sufficient enough to cause a flash fire, which burned the employee.

An employee was walking across the job site gathering tools when a six inch metal flange fell from above onto the employee and striking his hard hat. The employee sustained a broken collarbone and broken vertebrae.
A door hinge closed on an employee's left ring finger, amputating the fingertip to the first knuckle.
An employee operating the Unit 26 tooth molding press partially amputated his left hand.
An employee sustained an amputation on his left hand while operating a metal servicing machine.
An employee slipped and fell while getting out of a vehicle, suffering a bruised spleen.

An employee was cleaning a moving conveyor with a spray hose. The employee stopped the conveyor to access a particular area that needed cleaning. The conveyor started back up and the employee's arm was caught in the conveyor causing a fracture and laceration.
An employee was conducting stucco work while on the third buck of a scaffold when he fell 18 feet to the ground resulting in facial and skull fractures. He was admitted to the hospital.

An employee collapsed while pushing a shopping cart inside of the store.  The employee's head struck the ground causing bleeding and damage to the back of his skull.  Surgery was performed to relieve swelling.
On September 2, 2015, an employee was setting up garage door headers using a hand trowel when he began to experience cramping. He was hospitalized overnight due to heat exhaustion and dehydration.

On October 23, 2015, at approximately 1:00pm, a an employee was hospitalized after suffering a compression fracture to his back and laceration to his head.  The employee was driving an extendible boom manlift across a designated railroad crossing.  The machine malfunctioned and stopped with the bucket portion of the lift above the railroad tracks.  As a train arrived, the employee untied his harness and jumped from the bucket approximately 10' out and 6' down landing on a gravel surface.
An employee tripped on a shelving unit and broke her pelvis.
The employee was troubleshooting a piece of equipment. The cylinder closed and amputated his fingertip.
An employee was walking on a rail car and fell off, breaking a knee cap and an elbow.

On or about 4/12/2016, at 8:45 a.m., an employee was picking up a 40-pound box of apples while stepping on the pallet that held the box. The board of the pallet broke and the employee lost his footing, falling to the floor and hitting his back and head.
An employee was servicing a sprocket and chain on a conveyor belt when the employee's right thumb was caught between the sprocket and chain, amputating the thumb tip.

On August 21, 2016, an employee was sorting boxes on a mezzanine. The employee leaned against the gate in the loading area and fell approximately 8.5 feet to the warehouse floor. The employee was admitted to the hospital as a result of the fall for a concussion and seizures.

An employee was unloading a tractor trailer using a PIV when the trailer moved approximately 2 feet. The employee in the PIV dropped about 8 to 10 inches due to the movement of the tractor trailer, causing a back injury.

An employee was working on the elevated surface of a scaffold. As he turned the corner from one scaffold to another, he fell approximately 15 feet to an elevated roof deck below, lacerating the back of his head and suffering other scrapes and bruises. He required hospitalization.

An employee was attempting to push product packaging into the cellophane film wrapper when the crimper shaft that cuts, heats, and seals the cellophane film amputated her left middle fingertip. The machine was guarded at the time.
An employee amputated the left middle fingertip while using hedge trimmers.
An employee was removing the cutter head of an auger when his left arm got caught between the auger and the casing. His left arm was amputated.

On Monday, March 2, 2015, at approximately 7:00 pm, an employee was operating a blow molding machine. The employee reached past the guard, and the machine cycled and smashed four fingers on the employee's right hand. The employee sustained an amputation of the fourth digit, partial amputation of the fifth digit, and a full thickness burn to the right middle finger. The employee was admitted to the hospital.

An employee climbed a ladder to assess the next level of a metal roof. He stepped on a shingle and fell 8 feet through the roof to the ground, breaking his right index finger, left middle finger, right hip, and back.

During rigging down of a drilling rig, two employees attempted to lift/move an I-beam by hand. The I-beam shifted and crushed one of the employee's right middle finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip/print pad.
On November 10, 2016, an employee tripped and fell over a pallet while assisting a vocational rehab member. The employee suffered a broken right elbow.
While walking from one patient's duplex to another, an employee slipped and fell on a grassy area that was covered in ice. The employee fractured their tibia.
An employee fell from the back of a flat bed truck as he was unloading beams and ruptured his spleen.
On 12/3/16, an employee fell off a residential roof and suffered head trauma, requiring hospitalization.
A crane was lowering a steel beam when the beam dropped unexpectedly and struck an employee. The employee suffered broken fingers, a hand laceration, and back pain.
An employee was installing a new blade on a lathe when he stumbled and his right wrist made contact with the blade edge, resulting in a severe laceration.

An employee was inspecting a tooling knife on a slitting machine. The employee fell into the machine when it was jogged forward. His left foot was degloved up to the ankle, and he broke numerous bones. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

On 11/23/15, at about 2:30 a.m., an employee was operating a forklift to empty a hopper of garbage into a dumpster. He placed his hand on top of the fork while pushing up on the hopper tilt release lever. When the hopper tilted forward, the employee's finger was pinched between the top of the fork and the bottom of the dumpster. His left index fingertip was surgically amputated.
An employee was power washing a van when the employee was overcome by carbon monoxide poisoning from the power washer.
On 11/14/2015, at 7:40 AM, an employee fell from the dock and was pinned between the dock and a truck that was backing up at the same time. He was hospitalized with a broken back and knee.

After cutting 2 x 4s with the saw, the employee was breaking wood using his foot in a stomping motion to break the remaining halves. The half with nails sticking out swung upwards and struck the employee in the leg, lodging two nails into the employee's knee.
An employee fell to the ground while putting a cover over a greenhouse roof striking their head and breaking their wrist.
On or about May 31, 2016, an employee was hospitalized due to a heat-related illness while engaging in physical fitness training.

An employee delivering and removing skids was injured while unloading 12-inch clamps from the flatbed of the truck. The clamps got caught on the employee's clothing and pulled him off of the truck, injuring his lower back.
An employee fell and broke her hip while descending from a ladder.
The employee was sleeping in the designated bunk area and had an allergic reaction to the linen.
An employee's left pinky finger was amputated.
On December 20, 2015, at approximately 3:30 pm, an employee was performing operation duties inside the CFB unit when Boiler #2 failed, releasing hot steam and burning the employee.
On or about October 20, 2015, an employee's hand got caught in an auger while servicing it.
An employee tried to stop a load from sliding off the forks of a forklift and was pinned between the building and the load. The employee suffered crushing injuries.
An employee was unloading pallets from his forklift when a coworker ran over his left foot and ankle with another forklift.
An employee was stepping off of the tailgate of a truck when he slipped and fell, breaking his lower tibia.
An employee was emptying a hopper at 6:40 AM when the hopper flipped back and hit the employee's wrist and forearm, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was cutting a 4' x 8' x 1/2" piece of gatorboard into 5" strips using a table saw when three of his left-hand fingertips were amputated, requiring surgery.
Employee was cutting an avocado when the knife slipped and cutoff the tip of the left ring finger.
An employee operating an assembly press reached into the press to adjust a flange; his finger was pinched in the press.
An employee went to move stacked interlocking metal baskets. The baskets were not fully interlocked and the interlock came down and pinched the employee's left index finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was attempting to clean the focus eye lens in a trough that wood passes through on the lay-up assembly line. The machine started while the employee's right ring finger was in the strike area and a piece of wood crushed the finger, breaking it and causing the fingertip to burst.

An employee was installing a torque arm onto a wind turbine gearbox on the ground. While he was attempting to insert the pin into the bushing, the pin dislodged and allowed the 50-pound torque arm to drop. The employee attempted to catch the torque arm, and his right thumb tip was caught in the pinhole as the arm fell to the ground, amputating thumb flesh (no bone).
The employee was feeding trays on a conveyor system when her right hand got caught in the rollers, causing a partial amputation of the right ring finger.
An employee was on the scene of an ambulance call when a bee stung her arm and leg. She suffered an allergic reaction and was hospitalized.
As an employee was walking away from the rig floor, he tripped and fell, hitting his shoulder on the drill line that was on the rig floor. His right shoulder blade suffered a hairline fracture.

On 2/9/15, an employee who works for National L.S. Inc. was at a HEB Distribution Center in Houston, Texas.  The employee was about to begin his shift (6:30 am) to unload a truck for the distribution center.  At the time of the accident, the employee  was standing at the side of a Barrett double pallet jack trying to move the machine.  The machine was on and struck the employee, pinning him between the Barrett double pallet jack and another pallet jack next to the area.  The employee sustained a fractured pelvis.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was working with a palletizer to restock pallets of milk crates when his foot was caught and crushed between the pallet and a catwalk.
An employee's foot was run over by a pickup truck resulting in a broken foot and hospitalization.
An employee's right foot was run over by a construction vehicle, fracturing the right ankle.
An employee was operating a Towmotor and backed into a wall. His foot got stuck between the Towmotor and the wall and required surgery.
An employee was handling glass panes when the glass shifted and fell on the employee resulting in injury that required hospitalization.

An employee was operating a pipe coating machine, ensuring that the product (steel pipe) was being carried through the machine as close together as possible. When he attempted to adjust a pipe, his shirt sleeve was caught between the pipe and a passive tire, pulling his right arm into the machine. His right forearm was fractured and had internal bleeding, requiring surgery. The machine was not guarded or locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was moving and pulling packages from the conveyor when his right hand was caught in the conveyor. His right ring fingertip was degloved.
An employee was covering a manhole with a manhole cover. The manhole cover flipped up on top of the employee's right foot, breaking four bones.
An employee was working aloft in the bucket truck. While moving the bucket into position, the truck tipped over. The employee sustained broken ribs and internal injuries.
An employee was operating a forklift when his foot was caught between the two pedals. While trying to get his foot out from between the pedals, he drove into a guardrail and broke his left femur.
An employee was struck in the hand by a fitting which separated from a finished unit during a pressure test. The employee was hospitalized with a broken hand/fingers.
An employee tripped and fell while climbing over a conveyor, striking the wall and suffering a shoulder injury.
An employee tripped over a resident's wheelchair and fell, fracturing the right hip and right wrist.
An employee was on a loader step to take out a ticket from the loader operator. He lost his balance when he was stepping down and hit the frame of the loader, injuring his neck.
An employee was injured when he fell from a ladder. He was hospitalized with a ruptured spleen.
An employee tripped and fell over a cord while walking to the rear of a deli slicer, fracturing the right tibia and fibula and requiring hospitalization.
While loading a mail truck, an employee slipped on a slick, icy parking lot, breaking an ankle.

An employee was weighing fourteen cattle one at a time. Two cows tried to get on the scale at same time. The employee tried to back one cow off the scale and the other cow ran away. The employee was either knocked unconscious or stepped on by the cattle causing injury. There were no witnesses to the incident.

An employee was on a ladder installing a recessed light when the ladder (which was nailed into the wall) came away from the wall. The employee fell with the ladder, breaking the right femur and left leg below the knee.

An employee was installing exterior walls to a back patio storage unit. He was nailing the top sill plate with a nail gun when the gun bounced and swung down, hitting his left leg. His finger was still on the trigger, and the gun fired a nail into his leg.
On Friday, December 4, 2015, around 8:30 a.m., an employee got out of his vehicle and slipped and fell on ice while walking in the parking lot. He had surgery for a dislocated/fractured left ankle.

While swabbing operating equipment, an employee's sleeve was caught in the conveyor, pulling the employee's left arm into the machine. The employee's arm suffered a compound fracture and skin removal.
An employee slipped and fell on ice in the parking lot, suffering a broken ankle.

An employee was transferring beads from a larger hopper that was being held in place by a forklift to a smaller one. The employee fell off the hopper and fractured his leg in multiple places resulting in hospitalization.

An employee was operating a powered industrial truck (PIT) and removing a stack of pallets from a trailer. While exiting the trailer, the rear of the trailer dipped increasing the distance between the dock plate and the trailer floor.  This caused the PIT to land in the dock pit and the employee was thrown from the PIT. The employee suffered three broken ribs and a bruised liver.
An employee was working on a piece of exercise equipment when a portion of the machine slipped off of the track and amputated his thumb tip.
An employee was struck by a forklift resulting in a broken hip and lower leg and hospitalization.
An employee's finger was pinched between the housing and saw blade while setting up a band saw. The employee's fingertip was cut off, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was trying to pull down a guard on a miter saw when he had his left thumb amputated.

An employee was heating a bag of soup. As she pulled the bag of soup from the kettle containing hot water, the bag of soup broke, causing first and second degree burns on her torso and left arm.  She was hospitalized.
An employee washing her hands in the bakery department tripped and fell, sustaining a broken hip. She was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was hit in the head by pipe while pulling it up. The employee's skull was fractured.
An employee slipped on ice when walking to the employee parking lot, injuring an ankle and resulting in hospitalization.

On or about January 20, 2015, at approximately 3:10 PM, an employee suffered an amputation of the left-hand ring finger, just above the first knuckle. The employee was attempting to stop heavy gauge from falling off the top of a cart.
An employee was shaking out steel member when the steel member struck the employee's lower leg causing a fracture.

An employee was in the process of positioning/flattening a blue polymer strip in a Schneider Senator machine which cuts the strip to the required dimensions.  Both of the employee's hands were in the machine at the time. The employee activated the foot pedal which caused the positioning clamp to come down on the employee's left middle finger resulting in a crushing injury and later amputation of the fingertip.
While an employee was wiping debris from a plastic compression mold press, the vertical injector plate came down and partially amputated the employee's left middle and index fingertips.

An employee was standing near a truck while another employee was loading the truck using an electric pallet jack. As the employee was driving the electric pallet jack off of the truck and onto the dock, one of its wheels hit some moisture which caused it to skid and strike the other employee's lower right leg fracturing it in two places.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after suffering from low sodium symptoms.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet through the roof to the ground while performing roofing work.

While cleaning the blade on a slicer, an employee's hand slipped and got caught on a heating element. The employee was unable to free his hand from the heating element before the blade rotated, amputating a finger.
On 06-09-2015, an employee was hospitalized after being found unconscious near the work station. Possibly heat related.
An employee's right middle fingertip was amputated to the first knuckle while the employee was cleaning the rotating blade of a bagel slicer. The slicer was unguarded at the time.
An employee fell while walking in the medical clinic area, breaking the left elbow and requiring hospitalization.
An employee slipped on a wet floor in the breakroom and fell sustaining a head injury and was hospitalized on 2/10/2015.
An employee was using a power tool to install a support bracket. The screw went through the bracket and cut his finger. The cut became infected and the employee was hospitalized.
An employee replaced a belt on a vacuum pump. When the employee was checking the belt alignment, his left hand ring finger was caught in a nip point causing a fingertip amputation.
An employee was working on a pressurized tank trailer when a bolt broke on a lid. The lid flew off and struck the employee in the head, fracturing their skull.
An employee fell approximately 3.5 to 4 feet from the bed of a shingle delivery truck to the ground and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee slipped while walking up the stairs on a train car. He fell approximately 24 inches and landed on his right elbow, requiring elbow surgery.
An employee was ascending a ladder, supporting himself with a grounding L-bracket, when he fell. He struck the concrete floor and suffered cuts and abrasions, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was attaching clamps to a hide at the side puller station on the kill side of the plant when his left thumb got caught in the clamp. He sustained a left thumb avulsion.

An employee was walking into the truck when another team member raised the manual dock plate. The employee walking tripped and fell into it, causing him to fall on his hand. The employee's hand got caught in the dock plate, severing the middle, ring, and pinky fingertips on his left hand.
An employee was cutting a 2x8 board with a power saw when his left ring fingertip was amputated by the saw blade.
An employee was conducting an intervention with a client (patient). The client pushed her, causing her to fall and dislocate/fracture her right wrist.
A patient struck an employee in the abdomen, causing blunt abdominal trauma.
An employee operating a 250-ton model press experienced a left pinky fingertip amputation above the knuckle.
An employee was working in the GI Lab cleaning equipment with Cidex-OPA Solution.  The employee had an asthma attack triggered by the cleansing solution and was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was using an oxygen acetylene torch to cut a metal side plate/panel, that had been removed from a machine.  As the employee was cutting the metal, a part of the plate broke free from the cutting operation and fell onto the employee's left lower leg fracturing it. The employee was hospitalized for surgery on the lower left leg as a result of the incident.
An employee had cleaned a room and was exiting when the room door slammed on her right middle finger, amputating the fingertip.
On 9/14/15 an employee was operating a ham skinner machine when his right hand came in contact with the blade. The employee suffered a complex laceration of three fingers.

An employee was cutting one single roofing paver that was not fitting properly at a doorway. He was using a handheld electric saw and the saw slipped and caught the employee's work glove cutting his thumb.
An employee broke his left ankle when his ladder collapsed as he was painting the side of a house.

An employee was setting up the site to begin work on a scaffold. When the employee got on the scaffold, the scaffold began to roll. It hit a hole in the floor and fell over. The employee also fell and the scaffold landed on top of him breaking the left leg.
An employee fell approximately 35 feet in a ship cargo hold tank. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was disposing of 12-gauge shotgun shells with a single-shot, 12-gauge shotgun and had disposed of several shells. After a period of disposal, the gun barrel split, causing metal pieces of the gun barrel to strike the employee 's right shoulder.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery to remove the pieces of metal.

An employee was watching the railing to determine the height that the railing needed to be raised when he slipped and fell back. His left foot was then caught between the staging and the transferring railing, causing a foot injury.
An employee was working at a folding machine when his fingers were caught in the machine's metal fingers. He was hospitalized.
An employee was lifting a stretcher with a person on it and injured her back.
While moving equipment in a surgical suite, an employee's left elbow was cut by a suction machine. The employee was hospitalized when the cut became infected.

An employee was securing the load with chains and cables onto the back of a wrecker when his foot got caught between the straps and chains causing him to fall off the wrecker. He was admitted to the hospital for treatment of a fractured hip and wrist.
While crawling through and greasing a loader, an employee's head struck the edge of the loader's bucket, fracturing the skull.
An employee fell approximately 5 feet off a crane while checking fluid levels and fractured his leg.
An employee was bolting up a 10 inch pipe. He put his hand under the valve and the valve and pipe rolled over his right hand and crushed it.

On Friday, January 13, 2017, at approximately 8:20 AM, an employee was moving rebar on the third floor when he stepped out onto unsupported plywood and fell approximately 10 feet onto the second floor stairway. The guardrail had been removed the previous evening to allow removal of formwork and was not reinstalled. The employee suffered a compression fracture of the T11 vertebrae.
An employee was sweeping off the roof, slipped on ice and fell 13 feet to a lower level. The employee sustained broken ankles and a broken wrist.
An employee's left thumb was caught between a hydraulic clamp and the copper tube that was in the clamp. The thumb was surgically amputated at the last knuckle.
An employee's right hand was bitten by a dog while delivering mail to a resident's door, requiring hospitalization.
On or about 5/23/16, an employee sustained serious injuries while cleaning inside a tank. He was hospitalized with a laceration on/near his abdomen, a left-side puncture, and bruising.
An employee on the ground level was struck by a temporary wooden barrier that fell from four stories above. The employee suffered fractures and internal bleeding.

An employee was changing the tire on a loader. He placed blocking under the loader after jacking it up. The jack shifted, causing the loader to fall down onto the blocking. The impact of the loader broke the employee's hip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee walking backwards in a semi trailer fell out of the trailer and hit the ground. The employee suffered a concussion and was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized following a head injury sustained from a fall from a two foot high platform to the concrete floor below.

Two shop employees were in the process of tearing down a 1250 Ton Slip Type Elevator (STE) and were pulling the carriers and slips out of the STE.  While removing one of the carriers from the slip, utilizing the overhead crane, the entire slip assembly (carrier, slip, and slip hanger) began to rise out of the tool.  As the slip hanger rose the IP reached in to remove it when the slip suddenly released from the carrier pushing the slip hanger back into position.  The IP's finger was caught between the slip hanger and the timing ring of the STE amputating the tip of his left index finger midway up the fingernail.
An employee was operating the shape mill when his left arm got caught between two rolls.  He sustained a broken wrist and forearm, requiring surgery.

The employee was working in the assembly line on the day of the incident. The employee notified his immediate supervisor that his hands were cramping. The employee was drinking water throughout the time that he was working, but the cramps began to get worse and he notified his supervisor. The employee was admitted to the hospital for dehydration and renal failure.
Two forklifts were backing up and collided.  One employee was taken to the ER with a back injury and was admitted.
An employee was felling a tree when the cut tree fell, rebounded, and struck the employee in the left leg, causing a leg contusion.

On November 19, 2015, at about 8:00am two employees received electrical burns when they removed a grounding strap from 220Kv lines.  They were working from a personnel platform suspended by a crane on a barge in the San Francisco Bay.
An employee was operating a bucket truck when the hydraulic line hit a tree and damaged it. When the employee moved the bucket it dropped and struck an employee injuring his arm.
An employee was hospitalized for a fractured C2 vertebrae when he fell from the bottom step of a front-end loader.

An employee was helping to move a generator with fold-out handles off the back of a truck. His index finger was caught in the pinch point between the handle and frame of the generator, amputating the distal end of his finger. He was wearing gloves at the time.

An employee was attempting to locate an underground conduit by using a fiberglass duct rod with an attached copper wire. The rod came into contact with a ground bar inside a switch gear, causing an electric shock that burned the employee's shoulder and both feet.

An employee was taking HVAC equipment to the dumpster and was helping to slide the ducts off the forklift forks. His hand got caught when the duct work slid backwards on the forks, amputating his right thumb tip.

An employee was clearing the bottom of an underpinning excavation when the ceiling collapsed and he became pinned under a large granite rock from the old foundation they were underpinning.  The employee was hospitalized and received surgery to repair broken bones in his back.
An employee was walking across the kitchen floor, slipped, and stepped into a hot oil filter sustaining second and third degree burns to the foot.
An employee was operating the manual press. She was changing parts in the machine and activated the foot pedal crushing her right hand in the machine.
An employee slipped and fell while walking into the lobby and was injured.
An employee was working at the grinding machine and making an adjustment/alignment. The employee's finger got crushed between two moving parts.

An employee was working on a rig floor. A casing basket fell into the tongs of a nearby rig, and the tongs would not release. Both retaining chains to the tongs released and the tong movement lever activated. The tongs swung and hit an employee, pinning him between the tongs and a derrick mast. He suffered one broken rib and one bruised lung.
An employee working on electrical service started having cramps and was eventually hospitalized.
An employee received burn and crush injuries while engaging in maintenance/repair work.
An employee was cutting meat with a band saw when the saw amputated his right index fingertip.
An employee was installing a security camera at a commercial building while on top of a 6-foot ladder when he lost his balance and fell to the ground, breaking bones.
An employee was performing pipe maintenance work while exposed to high temperatures. He suffered heat exhaustion and was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a large farm tractor outdoors when he experienced blurred vision, slurred speech, a queasy stomach, and unsteadiness. He was hospitalized with heat-related illness.
On Monday, December 21, 2015, at approximately 2:30 p.m., an employee slipped and fell down the stairs after delivering mail.  The employee was hospitalized with four broken ribs.
On or about July 1, 2015, an employee slipped in the parking lot and twisted her ankle.
An employee was working at a coil winder, winding reactor coil and got their left hand caught in the machine between the plate and feed wire.
On 6/9/16, a maintenance employee was troubleshooting an overhead door when his right index finger was caught in a sprocket, partially amputating the right index finger tip.

On October 12, 2015, at approximately 1:30am, an employee suffered the amputation of his left arm (up to the shoulder) after it became caught in the bridle roller, a power unit that moves the strip of metal at 300 feet per minute, while the employee was troubleshooting it.  A guard was removed and the line lock procedure was not used.
An employee fell from a ladder or the top of a truck to the ground, suffering broken ribs, a punctured lung, and head lacerations.
An employee tripped while pumping waste water. His left hand landed on the belt of the leachate pump, which pulled his glove and amputated his middle finger.
An employee was using a meat-cutting saw and amputated her left middle fingertip.
An employee was working at approximately six feet in height when he fell from an A-frame ladder.  The employee suffered a head injury requiring in-patient hospitalization.
An employee was rinsing empty trailers and was bumped on the left hip and pushed into the trailer tire stomach first by a forklift.
An employee was threading material onto a foaming drum on line four when his glove was caught pulling his right hand between the forming drums and injuring his fingers.
An employee was injured when her hand got caught in the cardboard recycle machine.
An employee was gathering roofing debris in a wheel barrow when he tripped and fell on roofing material, breaking his right ankle and requiring hospitalization.
A worker suffered chest pain and increased blood pressure due to physical exertion from training exercises, resulting in hospitalization.
On or about September 13, 2016, an employee's right hand became caught in a tag line that was attached to the butt of a 40-foot pole. The employee suffered a broken right arm and femur.
Two employees sustained injuries to the right hands while changing the tires of a snow blower machine.

An employee's glove got stuck when loading a part into Shear # 3.  When the employee used his left hand to pull his right hand out, he kicked the foot pedal and cycled the machine, pinching the end of the middle finger on his right hand between the part and the machine.
While trying to clear a jam in a screw conveyor, an employee's gloved right hand was pulled into the conveyor. The employee was hospitalized with a lacerated right hand.

An employee was performing maintenance on an air handler unit.  The equipment was shut down, but the belt was still moving.  The employee shined a flashlight on the belt to inspect it and the flashlight contacted the belt, causing her glove to be pulled into the moving belt.  She sustained a partial amputation to her right ring finger.
An employee was clearing a line vessel when a hose came loose and struck the employee's left arm. The employee was hospitalized with a left bicep tear requiring surgery.
An employee was troubleshooting a malfunction on the walking floor near the baler and amputated the left thumb when the door closed on his hand.
An employee was outside training on a Meggar and started sweating profusely.  The employee was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee slipped and fell on ice in the parking lot, suffering a fractured hip.
An employee was troweling concrete and fell 8 feet off the edge of the foundation wall resulting in back and head injuries.
An employee was about to load his truck when a coworker deployed an outrigger that hit the employee's foot.

An employee was spotting for another employee who was loading a tile installation plow onto a trailer. The spotter was struck by the back filler brace when it broke off and fell from the plow. The spotter suffered a skull fracture and upper back injury.
An employee was injured in a natural gas explosion.

An employee fell approximately three feet from a step ladder that was in the closed position and leaning against the water tank and struck a containment basin. The employee sustained broken ribs and was hospitalized.

A crew member was attempting to remove a blockage in a 2" discharge line on mud pump #2 when it released, striking him in the right calf and knocking him to the ground.  The crew member was taken to the hospital for medical evaluation and treatment and then transferred to another hospital for surgery and further treatment.

On January 6, 2016, an employee was operating a cold header machine when a mobile welding cart became entangled with the coil wire being fed into the machine. The employee accidentally grabbed the wire, which began to advance in speed, and the employee's hand was pulled into the draw box. The employee's right ring finger was amputated.
An employee was sent to the hospital after experiencing heat stress symptoms.
An employee was taking a bumper off of a spotter tractor and the employee's finger got caught between the bumper and the vehicle body causing a fingertip amputation.

An employee was driving a forklift when the tie strap behind his seat began falling off. As he grabbed the strap, the end of it became caught in the tire, causing the strap to cinch and lacerate his right pinky, ring, and middle fingers.

An employee was dumping bags of dry phosphoric acid into a mixer from an elevated platform that was 8-feet, 9-inches high off the ground. A forklift had a pallet of the dry phosphoric acid.  The portion calls for 40 bags to be dumped. The pallet was airborne, not sitting on the platform.  The employee finished dumping the bags, turned to look for something, and fell between the pallet and the platform. The opening between the pallet and platform was 35 inches. The employee was unconscious and required hospitalization.
An employee fell approximately 12 feet from a pruning ladder while pruning a shrub. He was hospitalized for a fractured collarbone and three fractured ribs on his left side.
An employee's hand was caught in a chain drive while the employee attempted to clear a jam, amputating the pinky finger.
An employee was interacting with a table saw when the employee's hand became entangled. Multiple fingers were amputated.
An employee was going to brush meat off of the boudin grinder when he got his finger caught in the extruder blades, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was using a table saw to cut wood when his left thumb made contact with the saw blade, causing a partial amputation.
Employee was loading plastic pipes onto a utility trailer.  He jumped off the trailer and broke his ankle.
On June 10, 2015, an employee was operating a UTV on the range when the UTV hit a patch of soft sand and flipped. The employee fell out of the UTV, landed on an ammunition can, and injured his back.
An employee was hospitalized with a broken left arm after being struck by a forklift.

An employee was injured while unloading a grain truck delivering corn to the facility. The employee slipped on loose grain and fell backwards. His left foot made contact with an unguarded belt conveyor resulting in a broken ankle that required surgery to repair.
An employee was hooking his lanyard to his harness while standing on a ladder.  His foot slipped and he fell 20 feet. His left ankle was shattered.

An employee was cleaning out the air actuator. The employee called out to a second employee who did not hear him correctly and the second employee closed a valve amputating the employee's right middle finger above the finger nail.
On March 4, 2015, an employee was hospitalized due to an electrical shock.
At an HEB in McAllen, an employee lifted a case of product, which consisted of six 3-Liter bottles, and strained his back.

On 06/15/2016, an employee was helping to relocate the forks on a powered industrial truck. The employee's left-hand ring finger was caught between the forks, resulting in an open fracture and partial amputation of the fingertip below the fingernail.
An employee attempted to walk an angry customer out of the store and was assaulted and stabbed by the customer. The employee was hospitalized with a stab wound to the chest and a lacerated heart.

Employee was cleaning out a pre-breaker feed and reached into a rotating auger to remove debris. The auger caught his right index finger. This caused a laceration and an amputation to the tip of his right index finger's first knuckle.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet and suffered broken vertebrae.
An employee's left middle fingertip was amputated in the chute of an electric grinder while he was grinding beef.

An employee was trying to prevent multiple rollers from coming out of the conveyor. Another employee went to point at the area of concern when a roller came out and pinched a finger resulting in the amputation of the right hand index fingertip.

The employee was walking into work from the parking lot when a customer was driving their vehicle away from pump #9 and the hood of their vehicle struck the employee. The employee suffered a broken leg and torso injuries.

An employee was repairing a forklift used in the facility. While the employee's hands were inside the forklift making repairs, the forklift shifted, amputating the employee's left index finger and lacerating his other fingers.
An employee fell off the roof at a jobsite at New River Marine Corps Station, hitting his head and hurting his back.  He was hospitalized.
An employee's right thumb was amputated while using a table saw to cut aluminum for stadium seating.
An employee slipped and fell 8 feet to the ground while installing a roof on a mini storage shed, sustaining a broken femur.

An employee was operating a jointer to make parts for two window sills just prior to glue up. The employee's glove came into contact with the jointer spindle, pulling his left hand in. Three left-hand fingers were amputated.

Employee was driving a standard roll-off truck for picking up containers of spent material from various metalworking companies in the area.  He was on-site to pick up a metal box type container from a customer.  The employee hooked the truck's wire rope cable and winch up to the box and engaged the winch briefly.  The box was moved close to the bed of the truck and raised a few inches off the ground.  The winch was disengaged.  He then placed a tarp over the box.  As the employee was placing the tarp, he stepped onto the chassis rail on the back of the truck.  At this time, the hydraulic winch pulled the wire rope slightly.  The employee's left foot was caught between the box and the back of the truck.  Medical services were called.  He was taken to a hospital.  Several bones were broken in the left foot. The employee underwent surgery, and the employee was hospitalized.
An employee was removing a mail container from her vehicle. When she stepped back, her ankle buckled and she fell to the ground, fracturing her left hip.

An employee was standing outside on a wooden walkway next to an entrance door. It had been raining and the wooden walkway was wet.  The employee opened the door for a student. The student walked into the building. The door was about to slam shut so the employee twisted to grab the door and slipped on the wet walkway falling to the ground and breaking his tibia.

The employee was working with another coworker in the process of charging a furnace (place scrap metal into the furnace). The injured worker's coworker was on a PIV that had a hopper on the lifts. In the hopper were briquetted radiators (compressed radiators in bales). As the hopper was being moved on the PIV, the hopper latching mechanism malfunctioned causing the hopper to tip and the  briquetted radiators to fall out and roll into the injured employee's leg.

An employee was operating a backhoe to lift a pipe. He got off the backhoe to remove a plug from the pipe and the backhoe rolled and pinned the employee between the pipe and the backhoe causing a right femur fracture.
An employee being trained on pallet-jack operation crashed against pallets.
An employee was helping a sign hanger unbuckle a sign from a crane truck when the sign fell off and hit the employee on the head, causing head trauma.
An employee fell while carrying boxes down a flight of stairs, suffering contusions.
An employee was using their right leg as a work rest while cutting tubing with a razor blade. The employee sustained a severe right leg laceration and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was standing next to a pallet containing a box of yarn. The employee fell after twisting while unloading the box and broke his hip, requiring hospitalization.
A letter carrier fell on an icy driveway at a customer's residence resulting in a broken left ankle that required an in-patient hospitalization and surgical procedure.
The employee was operating a Hydro T machine that produces copper plumbing fittings. The employee was clearing a jam and amputated the left middle finger and lacerated the left ring finger.
An employee sustained an amputation to the right middle finger while performing work on a press brake.
An employee was loading product from a cherry picker onto a rack when the lift malfunctioned and the platform fell to the ground. The employee fell with the platform and fractured an ankle.
An employee was stepping down from a 6-foot baker scaffold when he fell 3 feet, injuring his shoulder.

An employee was supervising the parking garage at 3:00 AM when a customer attempting to exit the parking garage in their vehicle struck the employee. The employee suffered head injuries and a fractured leg.
An employee was helping a coworker who was using a sledgehammer when the sledgehammer ricocheted and hit the employee's face. The employee was hospitalized with head trauma.
On 03/31/2016, at approximately 4:00 pm, an employee tripped on a tarp and fell while loading/unloading material. The employee suffered a fracture of the right femur.

The injured employee was about to inspect a docked vessel and was accessing the vessel through a gangplank. While on the gangplank, an employee of the docked vessel opened the hatch door which pushed the gangplank off the vessel. The injured employee fell 40 feet into the Mississippi River and suffered multiple injuries to her body.
An employee fell from a ladder and broke a leg.
An employee stumbled and fell while standing up from a chair. The employee fell to the concrete ground and fractured the left hip, requiring surgery.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet while setting straps on a storage tank and landed on his feet. He suffered injuries to both feet and a broken right ankle.
An employee was operating a grinder to sharpen a 6-inch blade when his left thumb got caught in the running grinder. The top of the thumb, including bone, was amputated.

An employee was placing plastic on an inclined feed conveyor when the metal detector identified metal contaminants and automatically stopped the conveyor. The employee walked up the conveyor belt to extract the metal material from the plastic and then began to descend. While walking down the conveyor, the employee slipped and fell, striking his rib cage against the metal conveyor wall. He was hospitalized with fractured ribs.
Employee fell from a utility lift in Bay 3, Hanger 710, and struck his head on the concrete floor, causing a skull fracture and serious brain injury.
While installing a manure pond garage door, an employee fell off a ladder and broke four ribs, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was moving a part with a forklift when he struck a storage rack. A brake drum fell from the storage rack and struck his right ankle, breaking it. He was hospitalized.
An employee was walking beside a forklift that was carrying a load of material. The forklift tire rolled onto the employee's right foot, causing him to fall and break his right leg.
An employee was exiting a patient's room when her shoe was caught in the carpeting. She fell, striking her head twice on the floor. She suffered a concussion and was hospitalized.
Employee fell and received lacerations to the ear and cheek while attempting to place a temporary cap over a well-water casing. The well casing is at ground level.
An employee was unhooking a flatbed trailer from a truck. The trailer dropped abruptly and pinned the employee's hand between the truck bed and the trailer.
An employee cleaning a meat cutting table received an electrical shock on the right hand from a wire that was hanging from a thermostat under the cutting table.

An employee was cleaning glue rails on a packaging machine. Another worker was troubleshooting the packaging machine where suction cups grab the paperboard boxes. This worker jogged the machine to see if the suction cups were grabbing the paperboard sheets and the employee who was cleaning glue off of the rails suffered an arm injury requiring surgery.
Employee climbing a pole fell approximately 15 feet suffering a broken right leg and was hospitalized.

On January 8, 2015, an Abilene Reporter-News employee was working with the large printing press in the company's press room. He stuck his hand into the roller system and had the skin on his right hand removed ("gloved") by the machine. The employee was taken to Hendricks Medical Center in Abilene, Texas, where he was awaiting surgical intervention.
An employee was fitting a piece of plate steel to the bottom of a barge when he slipped and fell, breaking his right leg.

Two employees were working in a lift bucket truck cleaning a cross arm when the boom failed and the bucket hit the truck. One employee remained in the bucket and the other was thrown out of the bucket. Both employees were attached to the bucket with harnesses and lanyards. One employee received a broken rib and bruising.
An employee was using an 8-foot ladder when he slipped. As he reached to catch himself, his little finger was caught on a shackle, amputating it.
An employee was holding a piece of string connected to a drill bit; when the drill cycled, it partially amputated the employee's right index finger.
An employee moving a patient felt throbbing pains in her lower back and was hospitalized with a back sprain.

An employee was moving walkboards. The employee slammed a walkboard to clean off excess mortar which caused an outlooker to break. This caused the scaffold to tilt and the employee fell sustaining a neck injury.
An employee was cutting cucumbers on a slicer and amputated the tip of her right thumb.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet while descending a ladder resulting in a broken ankle.

An employee was removing a sleeve that goes around a bar weighing approximately 50 to 100 pounds. The sleeve was secured with four bolts; three were partially removed and one was removed completely. As he turned the sleeve, his left ring finger got caught between the sleeve and bar, causing a partial amputation.
An employee amputated his thumb, index, and middle fingers while operating a foot-controlled chop saw to cut stock.
An employee fell 15 feet to  the ground from a walking surface on a section of scaffolding.

An employee was on the dock helping to load/unload freight into/from trailers. At approximately 2:45 a.m., he attempted to move freight (boxes shrink-wrapped on a pallet) manually when a board became loose and broke away from the pallet, propelling him sideways into a nearby forklift. He broke three ribs and was hospitalized.

An employee running a CNC routing machine tried to manually push down a part that he thought was loose while the machine was cutting it. He got stuck between the moving arm where the router cuts and a stationary arch. He was pinched, fracturing two left ribs and his shoulder.
An employee received a severe laceration to her arm from broken glass when attempting to stop a shoplifter exiting the establishment with stolen merchandise.
While at the Pultrusion Machine, an employee was stepping down from a resin cart, twisted his back, and could not get back up.

An employee was attempting to pump water into a natural gas line. After he was given the "all clear" sign by the pipeline supervisor, he opened a water valve and was instantly struck and injured by pressurized water. The gas line was not de-energized at the time.
An employee was cutting wood and lacerated his thumb.

An employee was working on the roof taking photographs and measurements when he stepped through a skylight and fell approximately 20 feet, striking metal shelving before landing on the concrete flooring. He suffered fractured ribs (all), a fractured sternum, a fractured back in three locations, and a fractured skull.
A worker fell off a manlift and was hospitalized for broken ribs and a punctured lung. The employee was not wearing fall protection at the time.
An employee was building a trailer frame when an 18 inch tall by 30 feet long steel beam fell onto the employee's left leg and fractured it.
An employee fell to the floor and broke his hip while performing his job duties.

Employees were changing out old aluminum electrical cables and replacing them with new cables.  The cables were in conduit.  The cable to be removed was de-energized.  The employee cut an energized cable and received burns on his right cheek from the resulting electrical arc flash.
An employee was sweeping the floor with a broom, lost her balance, and fell fracturing the left hip.
An employee was driving a clamp truck when it caught on fire, causing first and second degree burns to his lower back, wrists, and right leg.
An employee was cleaning equipment when two of the employee's fingers were amputated.

On March 29, 2015, an employee sustained an amputation injury to the pinky finger at the base of the fingernail. The employee was trying to keep two patients apart when one of them bit the employee's fingertip off.
An employee was helping another employee move a skid of metal. The skid rolled over onto the right pinky finger of the injured employee resulting in amputation of the finger at the first joint.
While adjusting the shear on the Schlatter machine, an employee's first two fingers on his left hand were amputated.
On August 14, 2015, an employee's left index finger got caught in the point of operation of a mechanical power press. The distal tip of his finger was surgically amputated (above the first joint).

A sanitation employee was underneath a scissor lift used for lifting pallets preparing to clean the area when a different employee unknowingly lowered the lift onto the employee under the lift consequently fracturing her right lower leg and dislocating the left clavicle.

On 10/28/15 at 11:45pm, employee 1 was assisting employee 2 move an extruder. The employees moved past the floor drain when the extruder shifted and employee 1's left hand got caught in between the extruder and an electrical panel box, crushing the hand.
