Employee 1 suffered fractures and compression injuries to the left hand.

While delivering product to a customer location, the employee's foot slipped off of a second level of concrete on which the ramp was set up. He attempted to regain his balance by using the hand truck (dolly) to stabilize himself, but the hand truck fell and his thumb was pinched between the ground and the hand truck. This caused a portion of his left thumb to be amputated just above the knuckle (just behind fingernail).

An employee was responding to a call of the A/C unit inside the attic not operating. She fell approximately 8 feet to the floor below through an open hatch in the attic, breaking her ankle and sustaining a head injury.

An employee was placing interior doors on a paint booth conveyor when the employee's shirt became caught in the conveyor. When the employee tried to remove the shirt, the conveyor caught, fractured, and partially amputated the employee's finger.

An employee was clearing out a dryer due to a buildup of pasta between the press and dryer when a coworker turned on the machine to blow the line free of pasta. The employee suffered amputations of the second, third, and fourth fingers below the knuckle, as well as a pinky finger amputation above the knuckle.
An employee was moving a mobile food tray rack from one area of the scullery to another. The employee lost balance and fell, suffering a broken hip.

On or about 2/2/16, an employee was cleaning a laminator machine with a brillo pad in his gloved hand when the laminating roll, which is hot and sticky, caught his glove and pulled his hand into the rollers. He was hospitalized with burns and a fracture.

An employee was running a deflashing machine. The main auger of the machine registered a fault. The employee cleared the alarm and vacuumed out the media. He reached into the auger to clear the media by hand. The machine was running at the time. His right hand made contact with the moving auger, resulting in a partial amputation of his middle finger.
An employee was delivering packages and was found by another employee in poor condition. The employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.
An employee was ripping wood on a table saw when the blade amputated two of the employee's fingertips. The saw was unguarded at the time.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while clearing a jam in a conveyor.

An employee pulled his semi and trailer off to the side of a service road close to a ditch.  The tractor and trailer began to lean over. When the employee exited the cab, he fell to the ground and injured his head, neck, and shoulder.

While attempting to clean out over flow candy from an unsecured tall display shelving unit, an employee stood on a 4 inch ledge to reach the area and the display tipped over and fell on top of her. Her right ankle was fractured.
As an employee was walking on site, he felt lightheaded and headed over to the gang box, where he blacked out. He was hospitalized for possible heat-related illness.

On March 28, 2016, at approximately 11:20 p.m., an employee exited his excavator and peered into the bin where he was placing additives. Wearing metatarsal gloves, the employee placed his left hand on the side of the bin. A piece of metal, used as a trough, was not secure and slid against his hand, amputating his left pinky finger down to the knuckle.

An employee was threading a machine with film onto a take-up roll. After changing over from job mode to run mode, the injured employee noted a problem with the film take-up roll and entered the area to address the issue. While doing so, his upper arm got caught in the ingoing spool. His upper arm broke and required surgery.

An employee degloved his left ring finger when his ring got caught while performing an adjustment on a straight line inserter machine. The employee was hospitalized and underwent a surgical amputation.
An employee suffered a back injury after attempting to prevent a patient from falling.
An employee was cutting insulation with a knife when his hand slipped, cutting and puncturing his upper right forearm. He required surgery.

On 8-18-2015, at about 8:40 a.m., three employees were de-energizing and locking out a 480 VAC circuit breaker. The breaker did not open properly. When the cubicle door was opened, an arc flash occurred, injuring the first employee with 2nd and 3rd degree burns to his face, arm, and chest. Another employee had no injuries, and the last suffered minor burns to the face and arms. The first employee was hospitalized.

Two employees were driving stackers, traveling in the same direction one behind the other and with the squeeze mechanisms trailing. The first employee stopped, and the squeeze mechanism of the first stacker went through the back opening of the driver's compartment and struck the second employee in the pelvis.
An employee was burned and hospitalized after a fire occurred at a natural gas well.
An employee amputated their right ring finger while in the process of washing wooden pallets. The machine was not locked out at the time.
An employee was repairing a water main when he slipped on a clump of dirt and broke his tibia, requiring overnight hospitalization.

Two employees were loading a catwalk and two pipe racks onto a trailer. When the second pipe rack was loaded, the forklift operator did not realize the forks were under the other pipe rack.  The movement caused the pipe rack to roll onto the right pinky finger of the injured employee, amputating the fingertip.
An employee sustained a left ring finger amputation while adjusting a guide roller on the case packer machine.

An employee of SM Fencing & Energy Services, Inc. lost his eye sight after receiving a head injury. The employee slipped on the ice at the project site while carrying a railroad tie. After the employee fell to the ground, the railroad tie fell on his head.

An employee was taking down a scaffold when he fell through a hole in one of the scaffold planks.  He hit the railing on the scaffold when he fell, injuring his ribs. The employee was wearing fall protection at the time. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee backed into a customer in the check-out line, causing her to trip and fall to the floor. She broke her hip and required surgery.

An employee was performing maintenance work on an injection molding machine, attempting to unclog a valve, when pressure that built up behind the valve caused it to release hot nylon. The nylon burned the employee's right hand, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee checking bulk tankers on a trailer platform fell approximately 3 feet while stepping down. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured tibia and fibula and a dislocated ankle.
An employee slipped and fell on a floor that was wet with wax stripper. The employee lost consciousness and sustained a concussion and head lacerations.

An employee was plastering a wall approximately 14 feet above the ground while working from a hydro lift when he fell to the ground, breaking his left wrist, fracturing his hip, and rupturing his spleen. He was hospitalized. The lift was not guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was cutting a 2x4 with a chop saw. While holding the board in place, he lost his grip, and his left ring fingertip hit and was amputated by the blade.
An employee was walking down the stairwell and fell. The employee was hospitalized with a head injury.

An employee was unhooking a crane hook from a conveyor that was loaded on the flatbed of a truck. The hook or chain from the crane caught on the conveyor, causing it to tip and knock the employee off the trailer. The employee suffered severe right leg injuries.
An employee was adjusting the forks of a fork truck while they were lifted approximately 2 feet in the air when the forks failed and fell, partially amputating his left big toe. He had surgery.
An employee was operating a pallet lift device in reverse. The employee jammed the left foot between the fork truck housing and the loaded pallet behind.
An employee was driving a shuttle bus. At a stop, he stood up, felt severe lower back pain, and passed out. He was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a laceration to the first digit of the right hand ring finger, requiring amputation above the first digit.
An employee was operating a lift and was pinned between the rail and the lift injuring his left toe.

Powdered product was being dispensed into a bag when the powder stopped coming out of the fill spout.  An employee reached up into the fill tube with his left hand/arm until his fingers reached the sliding gate valve, which opens/closes to start and stop the product flow. He pressed a button on a nearby solenoid valve with his right hand, opening the sliding gate valve in the fill tube. He then reached farther up in the fill tube and into the sliding gate valve. He released the button on the solenoid  valve, which caused the sliding gate valve inside the fill tube to close and amputate his left-hand middle fingertip.

On or about August 11, 2016, an employee was adding ink to the decorator can printing machine when the ink fell. When the employee attempted to grab it, the employee's hand became caught between the plate cylinder and the blanket segment, amputating the left ring finger.
An employee was storing purlin coil using a crane when the crane and coil fell on the employee, injuring both legs.
An employee was moving clothes (dresses) from one rack to another rack on the sales floor when she slipped. She required surgery for a broken femur.

An employee was performing tree trimming operations while tied off to a tree branch. The branch broke and the employee fell 12 feet to the ground, fracturing the L1 vertebra and requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell to the ground while walking on a loading dock, suffering a contusion.

A worker fell approximately 9 feet from a scaffold platform to the ground below sustaining a compound fracture to the jaw and a punctured liver. The scaffold plank bridged over the apartment breezeway and was supported by two walls that were approximately 6 feet apart. The platform was used in setting the rafter trusses.
An employee suffered a partial finger amputation when the wind blew an exterior door closed onto the employee's hand.

An employee was walking/working in an aisle when a metal tray weighing approximately 350 pounds was knocked off the third shelf of an adjacent racking system. The tray hit the floor and then hit the employee. He suffered a fractured left femur and a hematoma over one eye.

An employee was using a saw that kept clogging with sawdust. The employee placed the vac hose at the bottom of the saw, and the hose was sucked into the bottom. He sustained an amputation to his right-hand index finger.
An employee was jogging a bag machine when he injured his fingertip on the blade.

An employee fainted while on top of a ladder and fell approximately 10 ft. to the ground. The employee was hospitalized for fractured vertebrae, a fractured sternum, a fractured thumb, bruised lungs and bleeding in the brain.
An employee sustained fractures in the right foot when a rack fell on it.

An employee was carrying a metal pole to install filler between tables. He was walking by a table truss when he bumped the truss, which was being supported by a cross brace. The truss then fell over and landed on the employee's lower back and leg, pinning him down. He suffered a dislocated left hip and broken left femur.
An employee got both hands caught into a series of rotating chains and sprockets resulting into the amputation of four fingers on his left hand and the tips of three fingers on his right hand.
Employee had thumb pinched between a torque wrench and bolt. The employee was hospitalized due to a fractured thumb.

On Saturday, 06/27/2015, an employee was on a roof deck cleaning up after installing a roof parapet when he picked up a piece of plywood and fell through the hole that was underneath, falling approximately 16 feet and breaking his pelvis.

On 23 February 2015, at approximately 1030 hrs at the Flogistix manufacturing site in Pampa, Texas, employee was cutting a metal stud on a chop saw when the material kicked back and crushed the distal phalanx of the index finger (right hand). The employee was taken to Pampa Memorial Hospital where physicians opted to amputate due to the extent of the injury.
An employee was inspecting formwork for a residential house when he tripped over wire mesh and fractured his right arm, requiring overnight hospitalization.

On or about 2/6/15 at approximately 3:25 p.m., a worker was operating metal roller equipment. The worker turned on the switch and began feeding the sheet metal into the roller. Once a piece of sheet metal is placed into the rollers the machine begins the process of rolling the sheet metal into a cylinder form. The worker then began feeding another piece of metal through the rollers. At the same time, he reached over and removed the previously formed cylinder. The worker's glove was caught by the roller, which pulled his hand into the machine. The machine crushed his right hand.
An employee sustained a hernia while loading a piece of lumber onto a molding machine and was hospitalized.
While rolling cans, an employee's right-hand fingers were caught in the roller, crushing/avulsing the fingers and resulting in a possible amputation.
An employee fell through a hole in the second floor and suffered broken bones, lacerations, and contusions.
An employee sustained a broken arm after slipping and falling on a wet surface on the floor.
An employee suffered a left-thumb amputation when it got caught in metal cording used for safety harnessing.

On or about August 27, 2015, an employee suffered the amputation all four fingertips of the on the left hand.  The employee was using a concrete molding machine and in the process of inflating the interior core pinched his/her fingers between the core and the mold.
On or about May 22, 2015, an employee was cleaning with a sweeper and tripped over the cord and fell. The employee broke a bone in the left arm between the elbow and the wrist and hurt a hip.
An employee was using a Skilsaw to cut wood to form a sidewalk. The wood got caught in the saw and pulled the employee's hand into the saw. The employee's left thumb was cut off at the first knuckle.

Two employees were working on the super unleaded tank when an explosion occurred. One employee suffered burns to the arms and smoke inhalation. The second employee suffered burns to his lower extremities. Both employees were hospitalized.

An employee was presetting a roller channel machine.  While presetting the chuck, a jam occurred.  The employee tried to clear the jam.  The pusher activated and pinched the tip of the employee's right index finger.  The employee went to the emergency room, which documented the injury as an amputation.

An employee was clearing a jam while the planer feed rolls and pineapple rolls were still running. While he was holding the first board, a second board caught his finger in the split end of the board resulting in the loss of the right index finger above the first knuckle.
An employee's left-hand middle and ring fingers were partially amputated.
An employee was descending a fixed ladder when he slipped and fell approximately 4 feet to the ground, injuring his back and left foot.
An employee was prepping his merchandise before loading it on a truck for delivery. He pulled his lower back muscle while shrink-wrapping a loveseat and was hospitalized.

The employee was working with a crew repositioning a large rotor at a power plant. The employees were rotating the rotor 90 degrees. After rotating, the rotor stopped, then rolled back onto his hand resulting in a pinkie finger amputation.

An employee was working on the rig floor and tripped over an object that he just placed on the rig floor falling to the ground. The employee landed on his shoulder fracturing an arm and dislocating his elbow.
An employee was retrieving a check from a safe in the manager's office when she closed the safe door on her right ring finger.  Her right ring fingertip was amputated.
An employee in the maintenance shop amputated the top portion of his finger on July 9, 2015, and was hospitalized.
An employee leaving the kitchen slipped on tartar sauce and fell, fracturing a hip.
On or about January 27, 2015, an employee sustained serious amputation injuries after being struck by a pin setter.
While walking to a customer's location, an employee slipped on ice under a snow-covered walk and fell, breaking the right ankle. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was making a delivery to a customer. He went to pull the back roller door on the box truck and his left middle finger was caught in the groove of the roller door and smashed between the door latch and the truck bed. The finger was amputated.

An employee was using a pipe threading machine to attach a four-way coupling onto a threaded steel pipe. The employee used a pipe wrench to hold the coupling in place. When the pipe wrench was released from the coupling, the foot pedal was engaged and the pipe wrench came down and crushed the employee's fingertip, amputating it.

An employee was injured when she lost control of a forklift and attempted to dismount it.  The employee was pinned between the forklift and a wall.  The employee was taken to the hospital and received surgery.
On November 17, 2015, an employee was hospitalized after falling off a standard curb and breaking both ankles during a routine pre-trip inspection of their truck.
An employee sustained a laceration to the hand while cleaning the drywall finisher sprayer.
An employee was feeding rebar into the rebar bending machine when his hand was pulled into the point of operation, crushing his right pinky finger. The finger had to be medically amputated.

Two employees were replacing a high voltage single power line between two poles. One employee, was electrocuted at approximately at 08:15 AM and received third degree electrical burns on the right arm and back side.
An employee was changing a pin on a pneumatic cylinder when the cylinder's pressure released and amputated the employee's fingertip.
An employee was carrying 10 pounds of cheese from a cart to the production line when she fell and broke her hip.
An employee had to have the tip of his right middle finger amputated due to an injury.
An employee was working on a vehicle at the hospital when his thumb was caught between the frame and the switch, amputating his thumb at the joint.
An employee was injured in the left leg (thigh area) while driving a man lift from the east hangar to the north hangar. The employee hit a bump and drove into another vehicle.

At approximately 11:00 AM on April 15, 2016, an employee was cutting cow bones using a band saw.  The employee's right hand came into contact with the band saw, amputating the right pinky finger just below the first joint (distal phalanx).
Employee was driving a mini bus in San Antonio City and was involved in a head on collision. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery to treat a laceration to right eye.
An employee was operating a horizontal boring mill when he stepped backwards and tripped over the tracks of the mill. He fell onto the concrete floor and fractured his hip, requiring surgery.
An employee was pulling cut pieces from a Tsune saw with gloves on. The employee's glove got caught on the blade, pulling his finger into the vise and cutting the tip of his right middle finger off.
On or about June 24, 2015, at 9:30 a.m., the end third of an employee's second and third right-hand fingers were ground off while feeding meat into the industrial meat grinder.
An employee was at a customer location unloading material. The tote he was using had a wire that punctured his hand. The next day his hand became infected and he was hospitalized overnight.
An employee fell and fractured her left femur while walking toward the elevator bank. She was hospitalized.
An employee received an amputation injury to fingers on the right hand while changing the cutter on a molder.
An employee was working at a customer location and slipped while going down the rear, concrete steps and injured his right knee.

An employee was walking in an aisle while a forklift operator was approaching with a cart on the front of a forklift. He saw the employee at the last moment and pressed the brakes all the way to the floor. The load shifted, rolled forward, and hit the employee, injuring her right hip and left hand. She was hospitalized.

An employee was going to install bolts onto plates on furnaces located on the third level when he stepped on a piece of metal stair grating that had not been welded down. The grating flipped and the employee fell through the opening to the stair landing 7 feet below, suffering a fractured L1 vertebra.
An employee was climbing down the rail car ladder and fell sustaining head and back trauma.
An employee was cleaning a print roller when the rag that he was using got caught and pulled his hand into the rollers. His fingers were crushed.

Employee backed up his fleet vehicle to park it, then stopped the vehicle and stepped out to load his gear into his personal vehicle.  As he walked away from the flatbed, he slipped on black ice and fell, fracturing his right tibia.   He was admitted to Southern New Hampshire Hospital and had surgery at 11:00 am on 1/23/14 to repair the fractured bone.
An employee operating the pneumatic E-Unit press suffered an amputation to his left thumb from the nail bed up.

An employee was standing on a pallet holding an accumulator (equipment) in place while waiting for another employee to pick it up with a forklift. The employee standing on the pallet stepped in between the gaps of the pallet and fell down causing the equipment to fall on his right leg and fracture the femur.
An employee working on a residential roof slipped and fell to the ground, injuring his knee and back.
Employee slipped and fell in the company parking lot on her way to work and broke her leg.
An employee was removing left bottom roll belts from a pin at the DR machine. The end of the employee's finger was then caught between the pin and a horizontal brace on a hoist.

An employee received an amputation while working on the Komatsu machine.  The employee placed his hand under a guard and the machine activated, causing the thread roller to come down on the employee's hand.
On March 28, 2015, at approximately 1:00 p.m., an employee was stepping over the tongue on a cart and fell. The employee sustained injuries to the right arm and head, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was taking a Rhesus monkey out of the rig. She was unfastening the last head post when the monkey bit her right small finger.
An employee was using a handheld portable grinder to grind a vehicle bracket when the grinder came apart and struck him in the face, causing facial lacerations and multiple avulsed teeth.

Employees were removing derricks while unloading a ship. A breasting cable got hung up on a derrick. When the employees pulled the cable, the pressure caused the line to snap. The line struck two of the employees along the right side of their faces.
An employee was standing on the top of a ladder hanging a banner on the side of the truck. He fell several feet from the ladder and broke a hip.
An employee was helping to fill an asphalt tar kettle when the line failed and the employee's face and arms were severely burned. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was on a ladder removing a bolt with a wrench when it slipped off the bolt, causing the employee to fall and suffer a compound fracture of the ankle.

An employee was attempting to drill a hole in a metal plate with a drill press. As he held a piece of metal in his left hand, the drill press caused the metal plate to rotate with the drill bit and his hand to move with it. He amputated his left index finger and lacerated his left thumb.

An employee was pressure-washing a flat roof with an existing membrane for repairs. The roof had a parapet wall of 25 to 28 inches all around the perimeter. The employee hit the wall and fell over onto the grass below, suffering a broken ankle and requiring surgery. The building was a 2-story condominium.

On 2/22/2015 at approximately 8:45 PM an employee was carrying several cutting boards from the cook line to the dish area at clean up time. The employee tripped or slipped and fell on his left side. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured leg and hip that required surgery to repair.
An employee was exposed to bacteria, became ill, and was hospitalized.

The employee was cleaning a part with a scotch brite pad when he attempted to clean the burrs out of a part while reversing the machine. The pad was caught and drawn into the machine, pulling in the employee's finger and amputating the nail end.
An employee unloading furniture from a freight truck suffered heat stress and was hospitalized.
An employee was injured after slipping and falling in a room.
An employee lost his balance while using a table router on wood trim. His hand came in contact with the cutter head, partially amputating his right middle finger.
An employee was washing and servicing a bus. When he started to exit the bus, he turned his right ankle and fell to the ground, fracturing his right ankle and left lower leg.  He was hospitalized.

On November 7, 2016, an employee tripped and fell while picking up scrap buckets and stuck out the left hand to catch him/herself from falling. The employee's left hand entered a cut-out on a turning machine mechanism, amputating the middle fingertip.

An employee was working to undo forms around a casting area using a gantry crane. The employee was holding on to the cables at the main block as the crane was raised and caught his fingers between the cables and the pulley causing an amputation of his pinky fingertip and a partial amputation of the right ring finger.

An employee was installing an ice machine at a customer's location. While doing so, he bumped his left elbow on the machine and received a small scratch. The next day it started to swell and turn red. He was hospitalized for an infection in the wound.
An millwright working on a fan in the feed house suffered an amputation of his left pinky finger while rolling a fan belt back onto a pulley.

An employee was helping to place a motor on the bed of a truck using a forklift. He reached under the forks to unhook a chain when the forks came down crushing his hand and forearm.  No bones were broken, but he suffered severe bruising and a compression injury. The employee's arm was lanced from the wrist to the elbow to relieve internal pressure.
An employee was changing a jack-hammer in an air compressor unit and amputated his left ring finger.
An employee was driving an unloaded forklift when the forklift came into contact with a railcar staged at the dock. The employee's arm was caught between the railcar and the lift's roll cage.
An employee was struck several times by a patient with a knife. The employee suffered puncture/laceration wounds to the neck, face and abdomen.

An employee was performing maintenance work on a crawler crane's ignition system while standing on the track which provided only 5.5 inches of surface to stand on. The mechanic slipped and fell approximately 59 inches and broke his right leg. He was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was operating a jelly cup packing machine when it became energized. The employee's left index finger then contacted a moving part, amputating the distal tip.
An employee slipped on ice and fell in the truck yard.  The employee was hospitalized with a broken ankle.
On 02/24/2015, employee was working in the deli department when she tripped over cords on the floor and fell. She broke her hip and was hospitalized.
An employee was unlocking equipment for maintenance when he experienced dizziness, nausea, and vomiting. He was hospitalized due to heat-related illness.
An employee was helping a coworker replace struts. They were lining up pins when the supportive strap broke. The truck cab fell and crushed the employee's left hand, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee had trouble breathing and was hospitalized for possible heat stress.

An employee was measuring a pallet of paper on an automated conveyor line. The conveyor cycled and the employee's finger got caught between the paper and an I-beam. The employee's left-hand middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was assembling piping (10 feet long, weighing approximately 100 pounds) on a pump skid. When the pipe was set down, the employee's finger was caught between the pipe and the flange, amputating the tip of the left ring finger. The employee required surgery.

An employee was bringing product to the back of a truck trailer when a book case began falling. He fell as he tried to catch the falling case. His foot was caught in the truck ramp and he twisted his ankle, breaking it.
An employee fell 6-11 feet.

An employee was the last person on the roof after installing solar panels and wiring and had removed his fall protection equipment handing it to a coworker.  The coworker went down the ladder to the ground and held the ladder.  When the injured employee went to descend the ladder, he slid and a strap securing the ladder to the roof broke. He fell over 20 feet from the roof to a concrete surface below resulting in compound fractures to his left arm.
An employee was changing a water nipple/bracket when a pig pushed him up against the wall causing the amputation of the second finger on his left hand at about the first knuckle.

An employee was blowing down a bagger product feed conveyor with an air hose when his right hand became entangled in the chain drive. His right index finger was amputated with fractures to the remaining three fingers.
An employee fell approximately 14 ft. from a metal roof breaking his leg on impact.
An employee reached into a trim press to clear a jam and suffered a fracture to left forearm. The employee was hospitalized and underwent surgery to repair the fracture.
An employee exiting her vehicle slipped on the curb, falling on her right hip.
An employee passed out while repairing a tree trimmer. He was hospitalized for heat-related dehydration.
An employee was opening a valve on a tanker trailer. Chloroacetic acid came out of the valve and burned the top side of the employee's right arm.

An employee was operating the board edge unscrambler when he noticed a stick had become jammed beneath the floor chains. When he attempted to remove it, his shirt was caught on a chain lug that then pulled his left arm into the machine, amputating his left ring fingertip, crushing his left hand, and injuring his left arm. The machine was running at the time.
An employee was working on a tin roof. The employee stepped off the roof onto an overhang. The overhand collapsed and the employee fell breaking the right hip, arm, tail bone and ribs.
An employee was hospitalized after accidentally drinking chemical hand sanitizer.
An employee was climbing the storage racks to retrieve product and fell, landing on his feet and breaking both heels.
An employee was investigating an air leak in a drill machine when the machine cycled and injured the employee's hand, breaking a finger and causing ligament damage.

On January 10, 2016, at approximately 4:35pm, an employee was hospitalized after falling on wet, icy grass, while walking to her car after work.  The employee suffered a fracture and dislocation of her upper left arm resulting in surgery.

On October 28, 2016, at 6:30 a.m., an employee was removing a piece of stuck steel from the shear. The machine was activated and a 1 inch diameter piece of angle steel was propelled into the employee's left forearm. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery. The machine was not guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was troubleshooting the dough pump and amputated the fleshy tip of the right middle finger.

An employee, a char-house operator, was washing sugar off the floor around filter-top #15.  He tripped over a hose and fell to the floor.  Hot water (180 degrees F) from the hose got into his elbow-length gloves.  His back was burned when he fell backwards.

An employee was spotting the PIT operator, lost his footing due to some loose ground near the unloading area, and fell. While on the ground, his leg was crushed by the bridging material when it was unloaded onto the ground. The employee suffered a broken leg and ankle.

A temporary employee was helping to load a 3' X 3 ' bag of cement onto a forklift while standing on two stacked bags of cement, 6 feet tall. The employee lost his balance and fell to the cement floor causing a skull fracture requiring admittance to a hospital.
An operator slipped and fell off his excavator landing on a drainage pipe. The employee was hospitalized for a lower back fracture.
An employee raised the bed of a truck and contacted a power line. The employee received second and third degree burns on his hands and back.
An employee slipped on black ice and fell while walking on the sidewalk fracturing her lower leg while performing parking attendant duties.
An employee was removing a piece of plastic product from a mold when the employee's fingers were smashed between the mold and the machine, partially amputating the right-hand ring and middle fingers.
An employee suffered a ruptured ear drum and a fractured cheekbone after being struck in the head by a below-the-hook lifting device while changing a forklift battery on February 10, 2015.
An employee was replacing an overhead door recoil cable when the cable tightened and pressed his thumb against the overhead door track.  His left thumb was amputated at the tip of the bone.
An employee was bitten by an insect and had a swollen leg. He was hospitalized to cut/drain the bite area.
An employee fell approximately 6 feet off of a rig structure while nippling up the BOP and broke a tibia.
Employee's left hand got caught in a conveyor belt and pulley while increasing the tension. The employee's left index finger was amputated.

An employee was operating a paving machine and was backing up in a closed lane when a truck swerved into the closed lane. The truck's side mirror struck the employee knocking him to the ground. He struck his head on the pavement, and the truck ran over his right wrist fracturing it.
An employee slipped and fell on water that had dripped onto the floor from a wet shower bed, breaking his left knee and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was loading equipment from a forklift onto the bed of a pick-up truck. When he attempted to step backward, his foot became caught on an object and he began to fall. He tried to catch himself by reaching to the ground and broke his left arm.

An employee was retrieving work equipment from the roof when he fell through a hole cut by another employee. He suffered broken ribs, cracked vertebrae, and a dislocated shoulder, requiring hospitalization.
An employee amputated a hand while operating a cement delivery vehicle.
An employee was greasing/cleaning a machine barring when his shirt was caught in a roller, pulling his arm into the machine. He suffered an open left distal radius fracture with soft tissue damage.
An employee was repairing a chain hoist when his right index finger was caught between the chain and sprocket, amputating his fingertip.
At night, an employee was walking to his truck and was hit by a yard tractor.
On or about 6/5/2016, at approximately 14:15, an employee was cutting chicken breast with a handheld knife when the knife slipped and his thumb contacted the blade. His right thumb was amputated.
An employee was on a pitched roof. The employee slipped and fell sliding several feet off the roof resulting in back injuries and lacerations.

An employee was adjusting a belt on an energized conveyor with a wrench. The employee's hand slipped making contact and becoming entangled with the conveyor fracturing bones in his hand that required surgery.
While walking, an employee tripped and fell over the forks on a parked pallet jack, injuring the right leg/knee.
On September 16, 2015, an employee was troubleshooting a nail gun when the gun went off and the employee was struck by a nail in the left hand. The employee was hospitalized for hand surgery.
An employee fell from a two-story roof, sustaining back and neck injuries.

An employee was looking into a truck trailer while standing on the ground with his hands on the dock. A forklift then ran over his right hand and crushed the three middle fingers, requiring hospitalization.
Employees were replacing equipment to install a cannon ball. As they were replacing the equipment, an employee bumped one of the valves. Pressure was released, spraying onto the employee's neck.
While loading heavy brake parts into a machine, an employee suffered a herniated back disc and was hospitalized.

While spraying a runaround conveyor machine with a pressure washer, an employee noticed something on the conveyor belt. The employee was attempting to remove the object when the employee's hand was caught between the belt and a moving sprocket. The employee suffered a right arm fracture and tissue damage.
While working on a light fixture, an employee fell off a ladder to the floor.
An employee stepped off the edge of a roof while dragging a roof sheet, falling to the next lower level and breaking ribs.

An employee was using an oxygen/acetylene torch to un-solder a copper line on an HVAC system when refrigerant oil or oil vapors in the system ignited and caused a flash fire. The employee sustained first degree burns to his left arm and minor burns to his face.
An employee was cleaning the seasoning box. The left index finger was caught in the swirl and amputated.

On June 17, 2016, an employee was troubleshooting an aerosol line can labeler to try and release a jam. The machine was shut off and did not restart. While investigating the drive belt, his middle and ring fingers were mashed between the belt drive and belt pulley. His fingertips had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was preparing to pour concrete for a bridge tower/column. He was descending the tower when he fell approximately 16 feet to the ground, breaking his right-side hip and ribs.
An employee stepped off a curb and fell, breaking his left hip.
On October 4, 2016, an employee fell as he got up from his chair and fractured his hip. He was hospitalized.

An employee attempted to clean rice bran from the trunk of a whitening machine. His right hand contacted a rotating blade, amputating 1 inch of his middle finger. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
After delivering a package to a private residence, an employee suffered a compound fracture to the lower left leg after tripping on a landscaping rock and falling to the concrete driveway.

On October 28, 2016, at approximately 6:00 AM, a PVC pipe got clogged causing mud to overflow from the shakers. An employee went down to unclog it and when he did, the PVC pipe struck another employee, who was standing at the end of the pipe, on the neck. He was admitted to the hospital and was diagnosed with a fracture to the C6 vertebrae.
Employee had leg pinned between AGV-ATL #35 and #37  (Automated Guide Vehicle - Automated Truck Loader), resulting in a left leg compound fracture.

An employee was landing in a jump spot. Upon landing, the employee ran into a coworker who was already on the ground and pulling his parachute in. The employee was hospitalized with C6 and C7 neck fractures.
On 12/1/16, at approximately 8 p.m., an employee's finger was caught in a closing door, amputating the fingertip.
A framing employee was admitted to the hospital after trusses the employee was standing on broke causing the employee to fall approximately 9 feet.
An employee was sitting a the desk when a co-worker applied lotion. The employee immediately started coughing and suffered a bronchial spasm.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was driving a Toro cart, lost control, and hit a tree.  The employee was unconscious and was air-transported to Atlanta Medical Center where he was admitted in critical condition.
An employee was getting out of her vehicle to pick up a piece of mail that had fallen when she slipped on ice, breaking her left ankle and left leg. She was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee fell down the stairs while pulling a pallet jack, suffering fractured ribs and a lacerated spleen.
Half of an employee's right pinky finger was amputated by a lumber planner he was operating.
An employee was cleaning inside a grain bin when the sweep auger hit him on the leg, injuring his right leg calf muscle.
An employee was getting up from her chair when her foot got caught in the wires under the desk and she fell, fracturing the left hip.

An employee was cleaning a plastic mold with alcohol. He pulled a lighter from his pocket to melt some of the plastic from the mold.  When he struck the lighter, his hand caught on fire.  The employee tried to put out the flames on his pants and caught them on fire. The employee was hospitalized with first and second degree burns to his stomach, leg, left hand and nose.
An employee fell from a ladder and struck the ground while painting/staining a log cabin, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was feeding material into the moulder during the setup process. The employee fed a thin piece of material into the moulder and then thought it was jammed in the machine. When she went to the operator to point out where it was jammed, her glove was pulled into the cutter head and her index and middle fingertips were amputated.
An employee was tripping out rods on a servicing rig when his hand was caught above the rod transfer case near the swivel. His right arm was then caught and fractured on the rod transfer.

An employee was sitting on top of a toolbox while riding in the back of a pickup truck. When the truck made a right turn, the employee slid and fell off the left side of the truck onto the side of the road.
An employee was injured when the PIV he was operating collided with another PIV in a cross section between the aisles. The employee injured his left foot and suffered multiple broken toes.

On May 5, 2015, at approximately 12:30 p.m., an employee stepped onto the side of the box machine to fill the glue pot with glue sticks. The employee's foot slipped off the surface of the machine, causing her to fall to the floor and fracture her hip.
While working in the freezer an employee had a seizure and fell hitting his head.
An employee was helping to adjust a row boat line when the employee's left ring finger was caught/amputated at the second digit between the rope and a cleat of the float dock.
An employee was lifting a case of beer when he suffered a hernia.
An employee operating a forklift had his foot caught between the forklift and a pallet.
An employee was working on a closed I-64 exit ramp at IL Route 177. A vehicle being driven by a site employee struck a nearby roller, which then struck the employee, breaking both legs.
An employee was attempting to help a PIV operator move a crate when his finger got caught between the crate and the PIV forks.

An employee was manually adjusting a stack of empty boxes at the unloading dock.  Ice was present on the floor due to a leaking water sprinkler line.  The unloading dock is not heated.  The employee slipped on the ice on the floor and the empty stacked cardboard boxes fell onto him as he fell onto the floor. The employee suffered a broken right hip as a result of the slip and fall.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was helping to bag groceries when she lost her balance and fell to the floor, fracturing her left hip.
An employee walking through the front doors tripped and fell, fracturing an arm in multiple locations.

On July 14, 2016, at approximately 1:40 a.m., an employee was located at the end of the line where aluminum was being rolled onto a coil. Wearing cotton gloves, the employee was checking for edge cracks and used sand paper when he observed a spot. The roll was moving at approximately 900 feet/minute when the operator of the machine saw the coil buckle and hit the E-stop to prevent damage. While using the sand paper, the employee's left hand/fingers were severely crushed between the moving coil and the roller, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was struck and pinned by a car when it moved forward instead of backwards in a garage.
While an employee was attempting to unstop a jammed hopper, the still-rotating blades at the bottom of the hopper amputated the first two fingers on his left hand.

An employee was moving a tie rod part from a cart to assemble into a larger part.  The part slipped from his hands and when he tried to catch the 18 pound part his middle finger was crushed between the part and the table resulting in the amputation of the fingertip.

On 8/3/16, an employee was leaning glass sheets on a truck rack toward himself to identify/inventory loaded sheets when he lost control of the stack, which fell over and pinned him between the glass load and a hard object. The glass broke and lacerated his head and knee.

An employee was replacing plastic flapper in the de-icer machine when the start lever activated the de-icer. The employee's left arm was crushed inside the machine, which was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was stepping across a pile of dirt in the way of his work when he misstepped and fell, shattering his left ankle.

The employee had gone into the cement booth to clean the roller. He closed the safety gate and attempted to jog the roller. The employee had his hand on the roller and his left arm was caught in the roller and crushed.
An employee loading materials onto the roof fell through a skylight approximately 25 feet resulting in broken ribs and back.
An employee was moving a pallet of bags using a hand pallet jack when someone called her name. As she turned around, the hand pallet jack ran over and fractured her left foot. She was hospitalized.
As he was tightening a bolt on a piece of equipment, an employee's left hand was caught and fractured between a piece of metal slat and a sprocket.
An employee was loading a diesel generator onto a trailer when the load shifted and pinched the employee's left index fingertip, amputating it.
A temp employee was hospitalized with a skull fracture after being struck in the head by the bucket of a mini-excavator.

An employee was climbing up the crane's fixed ladder to access the deck of the crane in order to work on the jib bracket. As he climbed onto the deck, he lost balance and fell about 4 feet to the ground resulting in a broken left fibula. He was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was operating a manual assembly cell and placed a connector into the machine. The placement of the part was incorrect, so she attempted to reposition the connector. At the same time, a ferrule nut fell onto the finger activation switch, causing the machine to operate and partially amputate the employee's right index finger.
While cutting a board at a 45-degree angle, the cut piece jammed and flew back at the employee, hitting the employee's fingers.
An employee caught a hand in a pulley system while trying to untangle the cable resulting in a finger amputation.
An employee was standing on the bottom rung of a four foot ladder using a pneumatic sander on the bottom of a fiberglass swimming pool and fell, striking his left hip on a five gallon bucket.

An employee stepped into a storage tote to retrieve fishing line. The tote tipped over, causing the employee to fall into the hold of the ship. The employee suffered a broken right wrist and right leg, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was changing the boom cable on a drum. He was standing between the boom drum and the holding drum on the frame below. While feeding the dead end of the cable with his left hand, he was using his right hand to balance himself on the drum. In the process, his right hand slipped and was caught between the cable and the drum. He was then pulled down and flipped over. He landed on the floor between the drums, dislocating his right elbow and fracturing his right wrist.
An employee was picking up pieces of scrap from the floor when his finger was caught between a belt and pulley on a vibrating conveyor. His right ring fingertip was amputated.

An employee was terminating underground cables in a three-phase switching cabinet when an arc flash occurred, causing first and second degree burns to the employee's face. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was performing product quality checks on an AccuShear press machine. As she was lining up the product, the press cycled and the cylinder came down, crushing and amputating her third left-hand fingertip.
An employee was using a cutting torch on a diesel trailer when the oil holding tank exploded. The employee was hospitalized with severe burns to his face, right hand, and back.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet while descending a ladder from the roof of a residence. The employee sustained four fractured vertebrae, a fractured wrist and a cut on his head.
An employee was operating a tug and taking baggage to an aircraft. The employee swerved to avoid another employee in the area and crushed their left foot between a post and the tug.
A field mechanic was working on a vehicle on the side of the road. He pulled a cylinder from the vehicle and it dropped onto his left hand. His left middle finger was amputated.
While mopping the floor of the kitchen, an employee slipped and fell, striking the back, shoulder, and head on the tile floor. The employee was hospitalized overnight with bumps and bruises.
An employee was struck by a car exiting the garage and onto a driveway. The injured employee was walking behind the vehicle as it backed up to change direction.
An employee was installing a metal roof and handing sheet metal to his coworkers above when the sheet metal slid off the roof and cut him from his elbow to his shoulder.

Employee was crushed by falling sheetrock while it was being moved at a renovation site located at 205 Boulevard, Roland, Oklahoma. The sheetrock was leaned in an upright position, totaling 17 sheets or 1,360 pounds. The material fell on the employee's legs and crushed them.
On January 16, 2017, at approximately 3:30 p.m., an employee slipped on ice and fell. The employee was hospitalized for a concussion and bleeding on the brain.
On or about 8/09/2016, an employee was guiding an operator who was lowering a concrete mat. The spreader bar came loose and hit the employee in the lower back, fracturing his right femur.
The worker fell backwards towards the slump rack stairs while washing his concrete truck and sustained a laceration to the back of his head.
An employee was climbing a job made ladder, lost his grip and fell approximately 15 feet to the concrete floor below sustaining injuries requiring hospitalization.
An employee was installing a transmission line when the cable snapped, causing it to recoil and strike the employee in the mid section. He suffered broken ribs and a collapsed lung.

An employee was installing metal flooring and had rested the pieces to be installed. When the employee moved one of the metal grates, the other fell over and landed on the employee's hand, amputating the left ring fingertip.

On or about June 23, 2016, an employee was pulling trim from a conveyor belt when the trim broke, causing the employee to fall backwards. During the fall, the employee's left arm was caught under a roller, breaking it.

An employee was rushing through the automatic doors while they were closing causing her to trip and fall. The fall resulted in a fracture of the right humerus. The employee was hospitalized and underwent surgery.

An employee was cutting steel with a cutting torch while in a scissor lift. The steel beam twisted and turned the scissor lift over with the employee inside. The employee suffered a broken left femur.
An employee was loading concrete forms when they collapsed and partially crushed the employee, who suffered a broken hip and leg.
An employee was sorting cattle and was moving cows from one pen to another when a cow kicked his lower leg. He suffered a broken tibia and fibula in his left leg.
After spending all day installing a fence, an employee became ill and was hospitalized due to dehydration/heat exhaustion.
An employee injured his wrist and head when he slipped on a three-rung ladder. He was admitted to the hospital and treated.
An employee had just finished loading his trailer. While closing the rear trailer door, his finger was caught between the door panels, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee was working in the freezer. As he pulled a pallet out of the freezer, he slipped and fell, fracturing his neck and injuring his shoulder.
A maintenance man removed a guard without LOTO and his left pointer finger was amputated above the first digit.

An employee was spray painting for the second part of the day. He cleaned up his tools and was walking to his car. His legs became wobbly and the supervisor put him in a golf cart to cool him off. He collapsed and was taken by ambulance to the hospital.

An employee was cleaning mud from a roadway while a trackhoe was being operated nearby. A car came over the hill in the same lane as the employee. When the employee stepped out of the way, he moved in the direction of the turning trackhoe. His overalls were caught by the track, which pulled his left leg underneath. His left leg below the knee had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was walking in an office when he tripped over another employee, causing him to strike the corner of a desk and break his hip.
An employee was helping to dismantle a scaffold when he fell into an ankle-deep "trench," causing him to lose his balance and fall. He fractured his ankle.
An employee was using a saw to install water lines when the saw kicked back and lacerated his chest.
The employee was working in the receiving area moving a rolling rack of baked goods. The corner of the rack caught his right ankle and the employee's Achilles tendon was severed.
An employee was walking to a truck to turn on a pump when he slipped on ice dislocating and fracturing his ankle.
An employee was using a pry bar to unjam a cage when a nearby forklift operator dumped a full chicken cage. The full cage slid and struck the employee, causing a pelvic injury.
An employee was administering medication to a cat when the cat bit the employee's fingers on her right hand. The pointer finger was fractured. The employee was later admitted to the hospital.

An employee was working under a conveyor belt. When he reached for a non-moving part, his shirt sleeve was caught in the conveyor belt. His hand was then pulled into the belt, causing a strain and sprain to the wrist, minor burns from the belt's friction, and ligament tears on the first and second fingers.
A maintenance employee was working on a machine with a coworker when his right index finger got amputated in a rotating area.
An employee was cutting a palm tree with a chain saw while standing on an extension ladder. The chainsaw kicked back and lacerated his left bicep, requiring hospitalization.
An employee installing a satellite dish suffered a broken leg when the portable trailer stairs he was working from tipped over as he disconnected his testing equipment.
An employee got his foot caught on the hose of a drill that was on a ladder. The drill fell on and lacerated the injured employee's foot.

An employee was working in the graphite mixing department. The mixing process creates one pound graphite mix balls. Once the mixing process was completed, the employee dumped the contents of the mixer into a stainless steel box. One of the mix balls landed on the edge of the stainless steel box. The employee reached for the mix ball to throw it into the box. As the employee reached for the mix ball, he lost his balance and pinched his finger between the mix ball and the edge of the stainless steel box.  The employee suffered the amputation of the left middle fingertip as a result of the incident.
An employee was adjusting a plastic pallet and a wood pallet when his left index finger was caught between the two, partially amputating his fingertip.

An employee was unhooking the initial hook on a cattle's hind leg. While re-hooking it to another shackle, the cattle's leg dropped down. The slack was not removed from the shackle due to mud and manure. The hook went up, and the employee's right thumb got caught in the shackle, causing an initial avulsion that later required surgical amputation above the first knuckle.

An employee was holding a 2 x 4 stake while a coworker hit it with a sledgehammer. The coworker struck the employee's right index finger with the sledgehammer, breaking bones in the employee's right hand.

An employee was performing preventive maintenance on a pocket feeder and was manually lifting a section of the machine when it shifted, pinching and partially amputating his right pinky finger between two sections.

A maintenance employee was troubleshooting an automatic tool changer (ATC) on a lathe. The employee thought the ATC was stopped when he stuck his hand in to check the alignment. At that point, the ATC cycled, nipping the tip of his left 2nd finger.
An employee fell from a 2-foot ladder while screwing a metal piece on an air-conditioning unit, sustaining five broken ribs and a fractured lower back.

An Employee was working on the flat steak line running meats over the skinner when his left thumb was cut on the blade amputating the outside edge and end of the right thumb. A skinner is like a planner that removes the outer layer of the meat.

On December 3, 2015, at approximately 1:45 pm, an employee fell from an 8-foot fiberglass stepladder. The employee was installing an exterior light on the side of a building using a hammer drill while standing on the stepladder. The employee fell from the ladder and struck the concrete driveway, fracturing both wrists.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

On November 17, 2015, at approximately 10:40 am, an employee operating a stand up forklift to transport tires from the back of the building to the Tire/Battery Center hit a bump and fell off the forklift. The forklift rolled over his foot. He was hospitalized with two broken toes and some damage to the skin.
An employee's left forearm contacted an energized conductor inside an electrical enclosure resulting in electric shock and burns to the forearm and his palm.
An employee fell off a roof that was 10 feet high and fractured both wrists.
On April 15, 2015, an employee tripped over a trash can and fell to the floor breaking the left shoulder resulting in hospitalization.

An employee had finished unjamming logs in the log deck when he asked a coworker to use a log turner on the logs. The area was not completely cleared when the coworker used the log turner. One of the logs escaped and rolled onto the employee, injuring his left knee, fracturing his left fibula, and lacerating his right elbow.
An employee was removing boxes from a conveyor belt when the belt grabbed his gloved hand. The employee pulled his hand back and amputated his fingertip.
An employee fell 20 feet from a ladder and fractured his upper right arm in two places.
An employee was stepping out of the back of a delivery truck when he fell approximately 3 feet to the ground, fracturing his right hip.

An employee was attempting to move a pumping system out of a paint booth. A coworker assisted by lifting the pumping system with a forklift while the injured employee was observing/spotting. The pumping system slid off the forklift forks and pinned the employee between it and the wall of the paint booth. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right leg, broken right forearm, and a cracked sternum.

An employee was installing a robotic welder and finishing the cement grouting around the workstation when his right foot entered the service pit of an adjunct active robotic welder. The active robotic welder began its cycle and crushed/pinned the employee's right foot against the barrier guard and the welder. He suffered lacerations and fractures to the big toe and two adjacent toes. The active welder was guarded at the time of the incident.
A worker fell while exiting a van used to transport him to his designated work site.  He suffered a fractured right femur and will undergo surgery in the hospital overnight.
An employee was working on the second floor of the inside section loading material. He fell out of a window opening onto the pavement and fractured his wrist.
An employee was injured when the ATV he was riding turned over and landed on him.
An employee was injured after abandoning a moving vehicle during transport for repair. The car had failed brakes and no brake fluid at the time. The employee landed on concrete and was hospitalized.
An employee was adding hydrogen peroxide to a chemical pot that exploded. The employee suffered two fractured left-hand fingers and chemical burns.
A worker was disposing of waste into a foot-operated receptacle when the employee fell while using her foot to operate the foot pedal and broke her leg.
An employee was picking up a garbage dumpster when his left middle finger was caught between the cable and dumpster, crushing his fingertip.

An employee was working near a stack of square hollow structural steel members. An unloaded gantry crane made contact with the stack and knocked over members. Falling members pinned the employee's leg against an adjacent stack, breaking both ankles and requiring hospitalization.
An employee felt ill at work after using MEK solvent (Butanone) and was hospitalized.

An employee was greasing the chain on an edge banding machine when her rag and gloves were pulled into the machine, which then amputated her left middle and index fingers. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.

An employee operating a powered industrial truck drove over an oil spill and lost control. The employee slid and rested against an iron column. The employee's left leg was pinned and fractured between the powered industrial truck and the iron column, requiring hospitalization.
On October 30, 2015, an employee slipped and fell while using a degreaser to clean the floors at Philips Arena.  The employee was later admitted for chemical burns.
An employee was changing the grinding stone on the grinding  wheel when the grinder came on and the stone broke striking the employee. The employee had surgery for internal injuries.
An employee was overcome by heat stress while conducting oil-well servicing operations.
An employee carrying a bucket of water stopped short when cut off by a customer. The water spilled onto the floor, causing the employee to slip, fall, and fracture the left leg.
On or about October 27, 2015, an employee was standing at his work station resting a foot on the bottom shelf of a rolling cart. The cart moved and the employee fell breaking the right hip.
An employee was taken to a local hospital after suffering a broken leg during snow removal operations.
An employee was using a pry bar to align a flange when the bar slipped, causing him to fall backward and fracture his left ankle. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was attempting to unjam a label in the Automatan machine when his left hand became caught between two rollers and was de-gloved. The equipment was running at the time of the incident.

At approximately 3:30 AM on March 5, 2015, an employee cleaning a pit was pushing mud toward a vacuum hose when he felt a pull in his groin area. A supervisor and employees aided the employee who exited the pit and, upon further examination, determined that a hernia had occurred. The employee was admitted to the hospital and required surgery.

An employee was using a PIT to carry a plastic 55 gallon drum. The drum became wedged between the forks. When the employee tried to maneuver the drum, his pinky finger was caught resulting in a partial amputation.

Employee was unloading boxes from a delivery truck when some boxes fell. She stepped out of the way, tripped, and hit her head on the conveyor belt used to unload the truck. She sustained a concussion and was hospitalized.

An employee was helping a carry deck crane operator deliver items to the field. He followed the crane in a golf cart to the fab tent to retrieve equipment. As he was walking out of the fab tent with a strap in his hand and looking down at the strap to perform a visual inspection, the crane operator was putting his outriggers down. They did not see each other and an outrigger caught the employee's big toe. The outrigger smashed the steel toe of his boot, splitting and breaking his big toe.
Employee suffered an amputation of the tip of his left-hand index finger in a pinch point while conducting material handling operations that involved rolled steel on a support stand.

An employee was working with the injection mold machine when a plastic part got stuck and his arm got caught in the machine.  The mold closed on his hand/arm, resulting in crushing injuries to his hand and lower arm.
An employee was using a utility knife to cut a zip tie that was securing a reel of flexible hose when the knife lacerated his left leg.

An employee was struck in the face by a nail from a second employee's nail gun and admitted to the emergency room. The second employee shot himself in the stomach with the nail gun and was hospitalized.

An employee was using a meat grinder. He turned the machine off and reached up under the guard and into die because he thought meat was stuck in the die.  The blade hadn't completely stopped and his finger was amputated just above the cuticle.
An employee suffered back and pelvic fractures when a piece of machinery fell on him.
On December 1, 2016, at about 2:00 PM, an employee slipped and fell on a damp floor while walking inside the store, fracturing her knee and requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee's right index finger was amputated while operating a press machine.

An employee was operating a table saw using an 8-inch blade to cut a piece of wood. The wood piece became caught in the blade and was pulled in along with the employee's left index and middle fingers. His left middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee was hospitalized after being struck by a transfer beam that kicked out and struck him in the abdomen resulting in a broken rib and punctured lung on the right side.
An employee was changing the die on a press. The wrench slipped off a bolt and the employee fell breaking a hip.

An employee was standing between pallets next to a wall. A pallet-jack operator, who was trying to drive around another worker, struck the pallets, which in turn struck the employee and fractured the right ankle.

An employee was descending a ladder when he missed the last step. He grabbed onto the ladder of the injured employee, who was working next to him, knocking him off. The injured employee suffered a collapsed lung and cracked ribs.

An employee was dumping lime from a flatbed dump truck onto a customer's field when the truck tipped over. The employee was inside the cab at the time of the incident and suffered a cervical fracture, a leg hematoma, and several contusions.
An employee walked approximately 30 feet off a second-floor balcony and landed on his feet on the ground below, injuring his knee.
An employee was cutting a masonry block when the saw bounced off the block, kicked back, and cut his collarbone.
Two employees were shocked by an overhead power line while performing right-of-way clearing along the side of State Route 166.

On or about 3/23/2016, at approximately 9:30, an employee was working from a 15-foot fiberglass extension ladder to install satellite TV cable at a residential home. The employee was drilling holes to install clips that hold the cable to the side of the building. While working from the ladder, the employee fell approximately 15 feet to the concrete below, suffering injuries to both legs/feet that required hospitalization.
An employee stepped on a sample hole causing him to fall and injure the left ankle. The injury required surgery.

A temporary employee was cleaning out hoses using a gas powered pressure washer with a wand attachment inserted into the hose.  As the employee pulled the trigger to begin washing, the force of the water caused the hose to pull back from the wand which allowed the pressurized water to strike his left thumb and index finger causing laceration/injection wounds.

An employee was operating the 1708 machine, finishing a tube.  The machine cycled then stopped. The employee noticed the machine had stopped and removed the guarding to investigate the problem.  The employee saw that the material had pushed the home sensor and then pushed the material back manually, causing it to move forward again.  The material got stuck and at the same time pushed the employee's left hand into the clamp, causing an amputation of the left pinky finger, which left bone exposed.  The employee was transported to Unity Medical Center and admitted.

An employee was replacing a residential septic system using an excavator.  He placed his left hand on the bucket of the excavator to gain leverage as he moved an object with his foot.  His force against the bucket caused the bucket to move.  The movement of the bucket created a pinch point between the bucket and "thumb" of the bucket. His left ring finger was caught and crushed in the pinch point.

An employee was on the flatbed of a tree transport truck moving hoses. He was grabbing a loose tree bar when he fell backwards off the truck. The tree bar also fell on top of him and struck his abdomen, causing serious internal injuries that required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet from a mezzanine to the concrete ground below resulting in a broken hip and elbow.
An employee was operating an order picker. The order picker tipped over and the employee suffered a head injury.

An employee was running products and laying parts down for sensors to operate. The employee stood a part up, which bypassed the sensors. Four parts were in the catcher and one was being crushed in the machine. The employee attempted to pull the part out and his ring finger was amputated by the stamping machine's lock seamer.
An employee lacerated the right hand while cleaning a manual cutter.
An employee's left hand slipped while grinding a water meter casting, and the grinder cut the employee's little finger.
An employee was standing on top of a pallet while stocking shelves. The employee fell from the pallet to the ground and broke her hip. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee's fingers contacted the blade of a band saw, sustaining a laceration and requiring a possible surgical amputation. The saw was unguarded at the time.
An employee tripped on a floor mat, fell, and struck the door as she was entering the gift shop. The employee suffered a broken right arm and was hospitalized to undergo surgery.
An employee's right hand became caught in an electrical meat grinder, partially amputating the middle and ring fingers.
While coming out of a tank retaining area, an employee tripped over a retaining wall and fell to the floor, suffering a fractured left hip that required surgery.

An employee was pushing a cart with a spindle on top of it when the cart wheel hit a bump and the cart tipped over. The spindle fell on the employee's foot, flattening the employee's steel toe and breaking a foot bone. The employee required surgery and overnight hospitalization.
An employee was standing outside a tank that was being cleaned. The cleaning head came out of the tank through the manway and struck the employee causing a laceration to the abdomen and shoulder.
An employee lifted the guard on a table saw. His right hand came into contact with the moving saw blade amputating four fingers.

An employee was climbing a fixed ladder to go from one roof section to an upper roof section and missed the top rung. The employee fell 14 feet to the lower roof and hit his head. The employee suffered cracked ribs and a lung contusion. The fixed ladder had a cage around it.

An employee was replacing sign panels on metal arches over a terminal access road overpass on a parkway. He was working from a boom lift parked at the median while the inside lanes were open to traffic in both directions and the outside lanes and shoulders were closed. An automobile truck carrier struck his boom lift, ejecting him from the basket. His harness/lanyard pulled him back, and he bounced off the basket and landed on the pavement below. He sustained a fractured femur, nine broken ribs, a broken collar bone, a punctured lung, and lacerations on the forehead and calf.
An employee was troubleshooting and resetting a vulcanizer machine when the equipment crushed his forearm and lacerated his hand. The equipment was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee suffered a hernia and was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting/turning stainless steel on a summit lathe. As the shavings came off the stainless steel, they lacerated the base of his left thumb, requiring stitches and hospitalization.
An employee fell approximately 2.5 feet from a tender frame after finishing repairs on a motor resulting in broken ribs and a punctured lung. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting and deboning shoulders when the knife lacerated his abdomen. He was hospitalized.
An employee lost control of a pallet jack while backing up and was pinned between the pallet jack and a racking system. The employee suffered a muscle injury and was hospitalized.
On or about May 18, 2015, an employee became light-headed and "sick" after likely suffering from dehydration on the jobsite. The employee was hospitalized.
Employee suffered an amputation past the first joint of his left ring finger and tip of his left pinky finger while operating a machine in the PMP Dept.
An employee passed out while walking from dehydration. The employee was hospitalized for IV fluid treatment.
An employee was retrieving a plastic part from inside a cooling tunnel when her finger became caught in a conveyor nip point, amputating her right middle fingertip.

An employee was working at an oil and gas lease site when he made contact with a 480 V transmission line while working between the distribution box and the well he was inspecting. The employee received third degree burns on his hands and back and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was trimming tree branches from a ladder, lost his balance, and fell approximately 8 feet to the ground, fracturing his right-side ribs. He was hospitalized.

On 1/13/16, at 8:30 a.m., an employee was running a manual assembly press with two hand controls installed. While the employee's hand was in the point of operation, the press activated and pinched the employee's left index finger, amputating the tip.
An employee was lifting a section of metal roller conveyor when it fell on his left pinky finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee slipped in the icy parking lot while walking into work. She was hospitalized with an ankle tendon tear.

A crane operator was lowering material and an employee went to remove the hook from the material when the crane moved, causing the chain to tighten and pinch the employee's right index finger between the hook and material. The employee's fingertip was amputated.

An employee was using a crescent wrench and a one-half inch die nut to remove a sharp burr and metal shards from a stud. The employee's hand slipped off the wrench, slid down, and struck the stud, lacerating the left palm. The employee required surgery.
An employee was standing underneath a pole when a mass pipe came loose, fell 185 feet, and hit the employee's leg. The employee sustained a compound fracture to the leg and was hospitalized.
While exiting a room an employee slipped on a tray that was left by the door causing her to fall and break her right arm.

An employee on the north end of the veneer-cutting area was cutting 80-inch by 5.5-inch veneer on a table saw. The employee grabbed the cut from the front of the table saw while it was running. The blade caught the glove on the employee's left index finger and amputated the finger at or near the first knuckle. All guards were in place at the time.
An employee was working on a metal plate when the machine was activated and caught the employee's right hand, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was uncoiling steel from a reel when his foot got caught and twisted resulting in a fractured left fibula and torn ACL.
An employee slipped on the wet pavement and fell resulting in a broken hip.
An employee attached a tagline on some pipe casing. When the pipe was picked up, his foot was tangled in the tagline, ultimately breaking his ankle.
An employee was cutting wings with a wing saw and partially amputated the right thumb.

An employee was adjusting the legs of a floor scale while a coworker lifted the corner of the scale with a pry bar. The pry bar slipped and the floor scale fell and pinched the employee's left index finger, amputating his fingertip.

On February 1, 2016, an employee was unloading parts from a conveyor when the conveyor stopped because a part was stuck upstream. The employee attempted to retrieve the part when a piece of steel began to index, got caught, and pinched her finger. Her right thumb was amputated.

An employee was holding the top of a small manway cover and abrasive blasting the handle. The force of the blast media hitting the cover caused the cover to twist in the employee's hand, which caused his left hand to move into the blasting media stream. The blast media penetrated the back of his glove and abraded the back of his hand.
An employee tripped on a step and fell forward. When he fell, his left hand entered tar and received burns.
An employee slipped and fell on ice in the parking lot, breaking her right wrist.

An employee cutting meat with a band saw in the meat room received a deep laceration to the right hand between the index and middle finger. The push plate guard was removed while the band saw was in operation.

On 7/1/15 an employee was working at the Firestone Plant in the scale house, when it was discovered that a gate on the asphalt silo had a broken bolt and was not functioning properly. At ~ 12:40 AM while attempting to replace the bolt, his crowbar slipped and struck him in the face. He was admitted for in-patient hospitalization for a fractured bone above the eye (no eye loss/damage) and a fractured cheek bone.
An employee was unhooking the trailer from the tractor of a tractor-trailer and slipped. The truck ran over his right foot. His left wrist was broken when he fell.

An employee was standing on the flatbed trailer while securing the freight when he lost his footing and fell off of the trailer. His legs were tangled in the airline causing him to turn on the descent and strike his head on the ground. He was hospitalized for treatment of contusions to his head, right arm and wrist.
An employee was fixing a fan belt on the roof when his thumb was caught and amputated in the fan belt/wheel.
