An employee was picking up a 55-gallon gun press lid from a cart to be placed onto a forklift. The lid weighed approximately 100 pounds. After completing the task, he experienced abdomen pain due to a hernia and required surgery.
On March 11, 2016, an employee was hospitalized after being attacked and bitten on the face by a dog while delivering and/or picking up packages at a residential home.
An employee was walking from the back area when she slipped and fell, fracturing her left hip and wrist.

An employee removing a pallet jack from a pallet slipped and struck his right knee on the pallet jack. The accident occurred on or about 8:35pm on 7/12/15. The employee was admitted to the hospital overnight.
An employee stumbled and fell to the ground on the left side of her body and was admitted to Irving Baylor Medical Center with a possible hip fracture.
An employee suffered burns on his right leg while using a gas saw to cut steel. The employee was cutting steel when the sparks from the gas saw ignited his jeans. He was hospitalized.
An employee was injured after tripping over a cable on the floor.
An employee was cleaning a short weight tumbler machine when her hand was caught between the machine, amputating part of her thumb and breaking several bones in her hand.

One of the wheels of a semi-truck was trapped in a hole. The truck's driver asked an on-site employee to hook the truck to a yard dog so they could pull the truck's wheel out of the hole. The on-site employee hooked the truck to the yard dog and then boarded and operated the yard dog. As the yard dog began pulling, the brakes on the yard dog malfunctioned, causing it to move backwards. The driver of the semi-truck was standing between the semi-truck and the yard dog, and was crushed between the vehicles, sustaining two broken hips and a crushed pelvis.
An employee's right-hand little fingertip was amputated when a 2x4 piece of lumber dropped suddenly and smashed the employee's finger.
An employee was walking in the hospital hallway and looking elsewhere when she ran into a set of automatic doors. The employee felt backwards resulting in two arm fractures and hospitalization.
An employee received third degree burns to the left hand due to steam from a vegetable cooker.
On or about October 19, 2015, an employee's left-hand index finger was amputated by the chain of a red iron chain conveyor. The employee was hospitalized.
On 09/29/2015, about 10:30 am, an employee rolled a heavy piece of equipment onto his right foot. On 10/09/2015, the employee was hospitalized and had surgery to amputate two toes on the right foot.
An employee was in the computer room pulling wires while bent over. The employee stood up and struck the back of his head on a shelf causing a concussion.
An employee had his foot pinned between a pallet jack and a rack.
An employee was moving chem-grate flooring through a door when the employee's fingers got pinched between the door and the metal plate, causing an amputation.
Employee picking up items to take back to the hospital for sterilization slipped and fell breaking a rib and vertebrae.

Employees were rigging down the workover rig at about 11:30 a.m., on July 5, when an employee's right thumb and first finger were caught between the derrick tip section and stop plate. The employee's thumb had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was standing at a forklift removing the propane tank when a front-end loader backed into him.  His hip and back were crushed and he was hospitalized.
An employee was walking into work and slipped on ice. She broke a bone in her leg and required surgery.

The HVAC team was removing an air-conditioning system from a roof when an employee stumbled over and fell onto angle irons that were supporting the system. The employee was hospitalized and had two surgeries on his right thigh.

On October 9, 2016, an employee was loading scrap into a trailer that had an insulator sticking out of it. The trailer operator moved and the insulator struck the employee in the back near the kidney. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a seizure and fell over a parapet wall that had a 15 foot drop. The employee fractured both heels.
Employee was hospitalized after he fell 10 to 11 feet from the top of an 11-foot ladder.
On April 10, 2015, an employee was bitten by a spider on the right ankle while standing under a tree and patrolling the parking lot.
While working on a truck, an employee was struck in the face by a pry bar, suffering a laceration to the left cheek and eye.
An employee was driving when he struck a disabled motor vehicle and sustained several cuts and fractures that required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee injured his back while helping a client with a bath at his workplace.
Employee was hospitalized after burning his legs while welding structural steel. Hot slag caught the acetylene tank on fire.
An employee was conducting maintenance on the nacelle of the wind turbine when he slipped and fell onto a stair, landing on his right-side ribcage and suffering a collapsed lung.

An employee was tightening a fan motor belt. The belt was energized at the time. His left hand slipped and his fingers came into contact with the spinning fan blades, resulting in multiple lacerations to the left-hand fingers/fingertips. He was hospitalized and received stitches.

An employee was instructing other employees regarding the procedure on how to remove a 36-inch diameter pipe from within a larger diameter pipe. The pipe began moving too fast and rolled up onto his right leg, pinning him and causing his leg to break. He underwent surgery to repair damage and reset the bone.

An employee was helping the overhead crane operator pour a ladle of molten metal when the ladle got wedged under the top railing. The stopper rod opened, and the ladle contents fell out, hit the floor, and splashed the employee. He sustained burns from his hip down to his shin area, with third degree burns on his legs. He also sustained burns to his face near the mustache area, as well as to one arm and both hands.
An employee was hospitalized overnight for observation after she slipped on ice while entering the building and broke her ankle/leg.

On January 29, 2016, an employee was closing the door to a 30-yard industrial roll-off container when the employee's right middle finger was caught between the door and the latching mechanism. The finger was partially amputated.
An employee was changing a battery in a company vehicle. When he lifted the battery, he injured his lower back and required hospitalization.

An employee was walking through an atrium to go from one building to another when she lost her balance and fell into the approximately 1-inch-deep water. She suffered a shoulder injury and required surgery.

An employee was walking on a steel beam when his personal fall protection got hung up on a wire rope clip while anchored to a horizontal life line. He fell approximately 10 feet to the steel deck below and broke his leg.

An employee was reorganizing a janitorial closet. The employee moved a 5-gallon container of floor stripper from a shelf. The cap was loose and the floor stripper spilled on the employee's chest, left arm, and left foot, causing chemical burns. The employee was hospitalized.

Employee was walking towards the corner of the line kill to add oil to the equipment. He started walking through what appeared to be sawdust on the ground, but slipped and fell in what turned out to be an 11" to 12" deep mix of sawdust and lime mud. He suffered from chemical irritation and small chemical burns to his right leg.
Two employees were working on a scaffold when the scaffold's saddle hanger broke, causing them to fall approximately 24 feet to the concrete below. They were hospitalized.
An employee was walking through the employee dining room, tripped and fell fracturing his right hip.
An employee was opening small packages with scissors when her left index fingertip was amputated (no bone loss).
An employee was attempting to repair a gantry crane when stored energy caused the crane's hydraulic motor wheel to release and strike the employee, breaking the left arm and middle finger.
An employee was working in a six foot trench and suffered a fractured ankle when the trench caved in.

An employee was in a stock picker, stocking a pallet, when carton(s) fell off the pallet and hit the employee, causing crushing injuries. The employee's arms were pinned to the arms of the seat and a carton/tiles hit the employee's leg.

An employee was part of a rigging crew tasked with using an overhead 8-ton crane to move a heat exchanger through two columns. The employee pushed the exchanger through by hand and it swung back and struck the employee's left index finger and thumb. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was hospitalized after sustaining injuries during a snowmobile incident where they struck a tree. The employee broke an ankle, requiring in-patient hospitalization and surgery.
Employee was walking in the back area of the laundry facility when he tripped over his own foot and fell onto a laundry cart and suffered an injury.

On 1/11/2017, an employee slipped on ice while walking to her car during working hours. 
The fall resulted in a head injury requiring hospitalization.

An employee was performing forklift/rigging operations (material handling) with a telescopic handler (telescoping forklift). While adjusting the forks on the handler, the employee's right index finger was caught in a pinch point between the adjustment box and the forks, lacerating and fracturing it. The finger was amputated down to the first knuckle.
An employee fell while walking in a hallway and suffered broken leg bones. Employee has been hospitalized.
An employee was struck by a steel angle while performing maintenance on a piece of machinery, suffering a torso injury and neck laceration.

Employee was troubleshooting a monorail lift station.  A pneumatic hoist rail on a cylinder was lowered to troubleshoot the equipment. It caught the tip of the employee's boot, fracturing two toes on the right foot.
An employee was walking next to a forklift. A railroad rail fell from the forklift and struck the employee's right leg resulting in a lower leg fracture.
On September 6, 2016, an employee moving an irrigation pivot with a boom truck was struck in the head by the overhaul ball when the cable moving the load snapped. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was pressure washing a house and was stung by bees. Due to a bee allergy, the employee was hospitalized.
On or about September 14, 2015 between 3:30 pm-4:00 pm, an employee operating a chop saw in the Cut Shop had their right hand amputated (four fingers and half of palm).

On or about 5/12/2016, an employee received a partial fingertip amputation injury while operating a paint brush hand trimmer machine, known as a hand sharp edge. While manually holding a paint brush in the machine, her finger slipped and contacted the rotating blade of the machine. The contact resulted in a partial fingertip amputation.
An employee was pressure washing a roof. The pressure hose ruptured and the employee's upper left arm was lacerated.

An employee parked outside on the side of the street. When he opened his van's back door, a box fell out of the van and went into the ditch. As he attempted to get the box, he fell several feet into the ditch and broke his left tibia in his lower left leg.
An employee was using a utility knife to cut cardboard strips out of a full sheet of cardboard and amputated the left ring fingertip.
An employee was admitted to the hospital with several broken bones after being struck by a pole that was not securely rigged.
An employee's hand was on top of a gear box when the spreader of a crane smashed his left fingers, amputating his left index finger and fracturing his left middle finger. He was hospitalized.
An employee received an electric shock with the wrench cable the employee was holding made contact with the power line.
An employee stood up from the sitting position and fell to the floor, breaking both femurs.
An employee was cutting stakes using a skill saw and amputated his left index finger.
An employee fell and hit his head while trying to run away from a dog. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was hanging a horsehead on a pump jack. As the employee swung the horsehead into place and reached up to grab the weight, the weight was released. The employee's finger got caught between metal, and the fingertip was surgically amputated.
An employee was working on a unit with piping when he became overheated. He was later hospitalized for dehydration.
On 2/4/2016 at approximately 3:15 AM, an employee fell approximately four feet while climbing down a ladder and fractured a hip.

On or about October 22, 2016, at 1:10 p.m., while walking to the door of a private residence to deliver a certified mail piece, an employee tripped on the edge of the concrete driveway where it meets the grass forming a 2-inch difference in surface level.  The employee suffered two fractured bones in the right lower arm, requiring hospitalization.
On December 5, 2016, an employee fell to a lower level while exiting the roof, suffering cuts, scrapes, and possible fractures to the wrist and ankle.
Employee suffered an amputation of his right index finger while putting a bird's leg back into a shackle in the picking room. Employee's finger got caught in the moving shackle.
An employee was attempting to remove the lid from a ladle that contained molten metal. The molten metal splashed onto the employee, burning his right arm, right hand, and back.

On April 20, 2015, an employee was loading a powered wheel chair weighing approximately 400 lbs into the cargo bay of a 757 aircraft and got his left pinky finger caught between the wheel and the frame of the wheel chair resulting in the amputation of the pinky fingertip.
An employee was hospitalized with a lower back strain/groin strain after welding small parts.
An employee amputated the middle finger, index finger, and thumb on the left hand while operating a table saw.
An employee was closing a gate when her left thumb was caught and amputated between the gate and the frame.
An employee was draining condensate out of the treater line when a flash fire occurred, causing second degree burns.
An employee was exiting the break room and caught his right hand pinky finger in the closing door, crushing his finger.
On 12/08/2016, an employee fell off the back end of his tractor-trailer at a customer's loading dock and suffered a severe concussion, requiring hospitalization.

While operating a door lifter, an employee became caught on the knob. The employee was lifted up in the air and fell 4 feet when released, sustaining a cut on the leg. The employee received stitches and was kept overnight.
An employee slipped off a ladder while removing fryer hood vents from housing and the employee's foot/ankle went into the fryer. The employee was hospitalized for burn injuries.

An employee was helping unravel hose when his hand was placed in the buffer zone between the trailer and hose. His right middle finger was caught between the hose and the trailer, resulting in the traumatic amputation of his fingertip.

An employee complained of feeling faint while working at the customer service window of the post office. The air conditioning was not working all day. The employee was hospitalized due to heat illness.

An employee was attaching drill pipe to elevators using his hands. His fingers got stuck between the elevator and the drill pipe, which broke two fingers (pointer and middle finger of the right hand).
An employee was using an air powered nail gun and shot a nail into their left hand. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a horizontal band saw while cutting stock material. He was advancing the material when his hand came into contact with the blade. His pinky finger and two fingers next to it were amputated. He was hospitalized.
An employee was prepping a load for rigging when a power arc occurred as the employee contacted a power line. The employee suffered an electrical shock.
An employee loaded some roof trusses onto a flatbed truck. He started to band the load when one of the roof jacks fell and hit his head, resulting in internal bleeding and hospitalization.
On Sunday, July 26, 2015, an automobile drove through the front of the store; the impact injured an employee.
An employee had the right middle fingertip amputated while making adjustments on a moulder that was in operation.
An employee tripped on a portable monitor cord and broke the right patella.

An employee was lifting steel bar stocks 12 feet long and weighing approximately 20lbs to place into a CNC mill machine when he felt a pull across his stomach. The employee was later admitted to the hospital for pain in the stomach.

An employee was operating a mini excavator, removing a floor slab in the west annex of the green mile. The floor slab gave way, and the excavator fell one floor. The employee sustained a concussion and a severe laceration to the right forearm.

When an employee stepped onto bleachers, the bleachers broke, and the employee fell through and hit the ground. The employee suffered 13 fractured ribs, a punctured/collapsed lung, a dislocated shoulder, and multiple contusions and abrasions.
The employee was welding the support hood of a railcar. The employee got his left ring finger pinched between the porta power and the break rod support resulting in a fingertip amputation.

Two employees working from separate stepladders were replacing a leaky pressure-reducing valve in an overhead low pressure (12 psi upstream from the pressure-reducing valve), 2-inch diameter, steel steam line. There was a shutoff ball valve approximately 8 inches upstream from the pressure-reducing valve. In the process of replacing the pressure-reducing valve that was threaded into the line, the nearby shutoff ball valve (which was also threaded into the line) became disassembled, releasing steam that caused burns to one of the employees. The shutoff valve was closed before beginning the replacement, but it was not locked/tagged out. The main steam valve for the line, which was approximately 15 feet away, was also not closed or locked/tagged out at the time.
An employee's right pinky finger was amputated up to the first knuckle while operating a hydraulic press.

An employee was replacing a concrete discharge boot from atop a front end loader. While tightening a bolt, the wrench slipped and the employee lost his balance and fell approximately 10 feet.  The employee struck the hood of the loader and fractured ribs.
Employees were in a fist fight when one employee fell and hit his head on the ground, suffering a minor concussion.
An employee on a man lift was repairing the rudder of an aircraft when someone else powered the aircraft. His right hand became caught in the rudder, which then broke his arm.
An employee was moving a ladder and caught their right index finger in the hinge resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was operating a forklift to move equipment, which became unstable and started tipping. The employee dismounted the forklift to steady the equipment, which struck the employee, resulting in a broken tibia and contusions to other parts of the body.
An employee was struck by a steel beam that fell approximately 40 feet, suffering a head injury, leg fractures, hip injuries, neck injuries, and lower back damage.
While checking a car, an employee was struck by another vehicle being driven by a coworker. The employee was pinned between the car and the building, suffering a fractured pelvis.
An employee was loading equipment into a truck when his finger became lodged between a road case and a piece of wood, amputating his left second fingertip.
An employee's hand was crushed while engaging the locking clamp device on the baler door.
An employee was unstrapping office tables from the inside of a truck when the tables fell on top of him. He sustained 10 broken ribs and a gash to the head.
An employee slipped on ice and fell suffering a broken wrist which required surgery.
An employee was removing roof debris from the gutter of a residential house while standing on an extension ladder. As he reached his hand to remove debris, he fell off the ladder and hit the ground.
The injured employee contacted an energized electric line while directing roofing activities from a forklift-raised basket. He sustained electrical burns on his hand and was hospitalized.

An employee was pushing meat totes on a dolly from the meat cooler to the meat room. As he was going through the doorway, the totes fell off. He tripped over them and landed on his head, suffering a concussion.
An employee running from a dog jumped onto a car and crashed through the windshield.
An employee was operating turn-table #1 and mold #2 when the mold carriage latch amputated the right index finger and broke the right hand.

Employee's right pinky finger distal tip was amputated when pinched in an automobile door. The employee was helping to push start a customer's car related to a battery change when the customer closed the car door on the employee's hand.

An employee was moving a shaker panel with an overhead crane. A separate shaker panel had been leaned vertically on a wooden crate along the walkway. As the employee was operating the overhead crane, the vibration caused the vertical shaker panel to fall over and strike the employee, fracturing the employee's left tibia.
An employee's glove was caught in a conveyor belt pulley, injuring the employee's right forearm.
An employee was operating an alligator shear to cut up catalytic converters for scrap. A piece of sharp metal popped up and severed the employee's left middle fingertip.
While walking between registers, an employee slipped and fell to the floor, breaking a leg.

An employee was performing set up on a wire drawing machine when his hand was pinched between the wire and the block on the machine. His left-hand ring finger was partially amputated and his middle finger was fractured.
An employee was testing electrical equipment that they produce in the factory and was shocked and burned on both hands.

An employee was installing a steel plate on an inner-bottom using an overhead crane. As the employee lifted the steel plate with the crane, it became wedged between two steel frames. He continued applying lifting force with the crane and the plate sprang loose, striking him the face. He suffered multiple facial injuries, including trauma, a broken nose, an eye socket fracture, and a skull fracture.
Employee was hospitalized after sustaining a laceration to the left wrist while using a saw.

On February 17, 2017, at approximately 7:45 AM, an employee was uncoupling a 2-inch airline from an air compressor when the pressurized line became unhooked and whipped around, striking the employee in the lower right leg. The employee suffered right tibia/fibula fractures.
An employee sustained injuries to his left index finger while rigging down.
An employee received chemical burns to the right forearm while transferring 98% pure sulfuric acid from a tank truck.

An employee had just checked the status of rolls at a computer station in the roll stock warehouse and started walking away when a clamp truck in the warehouse struck the employee. The employee suffered a right leg amputation (mid-shin) and five broken metatarsals on the left foot.

On 12/8/16, an employee was operating a packaging line when her arm entered the discharge opening of a case sealer and contacted rotating parts. Her left forearm broke and required hospitalization. The machine was guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee reached beneath an energized conveyor for a label that was jammed. Her arm became entangled between a conveyor roller and the belt, resulting in a broken arm.

On February 29, 2016, 2nd shift (2:30 p.m. - 11:00 p.m.) the injured employee was performing his regular job duties to assemble wooden crates with a pneumatic staple gun, nail gun, and other hand tools. At approximately at 6:40 p.m., the injured employee was adjusting his position to assemble the bottom of the crate that was enclosing a part placed on the pallet on the floor. The injured employee moved around the crate to position his body and inadvertently pressed or had something else press the staple gun's trigger to initiate the stapling cycle. Subsequently it came sideways in contact with his right leg area above the kneecap and resulted in a puncture wound.
An employee was sealing bags of ice.  He tried to prevent a bag of ice from falling and his right index finger was amputated by the machine.

An employee and coworkers were setting up the small mortar mixer on a concrete masonry unit to allow the mortar to be poured into a wheelbarrow. As he was lifting the mixer, it moved forward, causing him to lose his grip. It slipped out of his hand and pinched his fingers between the top of the concrete masonry unit and the bottom of the back of the mixer, amputating his right index fingertip.

An employee operating a Bobcat suffered a broken arm and severe lacerations after a metal chain being used to lift a 450 lb. bollard pipe released unexpectedly and the pipe whipped around striking the operator.

An employee adjusting a skinner machine locked out the machine with a wrench and loosened a bolt. The wrench slipped off of the blade, causing her right index finger to contact the blade and remove skin.

An employee was using a capstan and rope. The rope got caught, and the employee attempted to untangle it. The employee's hand was caught between the rope and the capstan spool while wearing a glove. His fingertip was degloved.
An employee was at a truck wash location and fell and hit his head.

An employee placing material on a cut-off (plate) saw was injured when the material caught his left pinky finger and pinched it between the housing of the saw and the material. The finger was surgically amputated.
An employee was on a ladder helping a third-party contractor test and repair an electrical fuse bucket when an arc flash occurred, burning the employee's right hand and left eyebrow.
Employee was maneuvering a piece of raw steel to drain residual coolant from the tube. The employee lost control of the material, causing his finger to get pinched between the material and rollers.
An employee received an electrical shock and third degree burns while removing and replacing a pad transformer.
An employee was cutting foam board with a concrete saw when the saw kicked back. The blade impacted his arm, causing a laceration that required hospitalization.
An employee fell off a ladder and hit his head.
An employee attempted to stop a moving belt and sheave when his fingers were caught in the rotating parts, amputating the second, third, and fourth digit fingertips on his left hand.
An employee was checking the fried pie line when he felt dizzy and his hand got caught in the pie line rollers. The employee's fingers were degloved.
An employee tripped and fell, hitting her head.  The employee was hospitalized.
A temporary employee was operating a filler machine when the machine's roller bearings caught his glove and pulled his hand in, amputating his right index finger just before the first knuckle.
An employee tripped over a halogen light stand and suffered a knee injury, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was clipping paper on a white board. When she turned away from the board, she tripped on the leg of the white board and fell striking her left knee on the floor and her right knee popped.  She felt pain in the right knee and had difficulty lifting herself from the floor.  She was hospitalized overnight with a sprain, strain injury.
An employee fell off a roof deck and broke bones.
An employee slipped and fell while walking into a patient's room and was hospitalized with a broken hip.
An employee suffered a finger amputation while operating a saw. The saw was guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was slicing cucumbers when he dropped a cucumber into the slicer. He attempted to grab the cucumber with his left hand when the slicer blade lacerated his left index finger.

An employee instructed a coworker to reverse a forklift so he could use the back portion as a work platform. He then cut a piece of 1/4" manila rope to use as a tagline around the protruding end of a pipe. He attempted to tighten the rope, but when he cinched down, the 1/4" manila rope broke, causing him to fall face first into gravel. He suffered two fractured left eye bones and three fractured ribs.
An employee was operating a lathe when his arm became stuck in the machine. He was hospitalized with a possible amputation.

An employee's gloved left hand became entangled in a rotating metal drill bit/chuck while he was trying to sweep off metal shavings from around the drill bit. His left ring finger was surgically amputated.
An employee slipped and fell on a wet floor while going to get water and injured her left knee.

An employee was moving an oil pan with an overhead crane. The employee attempted to fit the oil pan between a second oil pan and a storage rack. The crane hook hit a support on the storage rack, causing the pan to break free from the crane hook and fall onto the employee's right foot. The employee's foot broke and required surgery.
An employee was pulling debris out of the cutter machine when the blade crushed and broke his right hand. The machine was activated at the time of the incident.
The employee stood on a pallet to look over a privacy fence. The pallet shifted and he fell off landing on his back and suffering a fracture in the lumbar region.

An employee was moving a 15-gallon stock pot full of boiling water when he stumbled. The water splashed him on his arm, chest, and back, causing second degree burns that required overnight hospitalization.

On 2/24/2015, at approximately 2:00 PM, an employee was injured while changing a tire on a large forklift in the forklift maintenance shop.  A smaller forklift was being used to lift the tire into position. The employee was holding the tire in place when the smaller forklift ran over his leg.  Incident resulted in broken bones in the lower right leg.  Injured employee was taken to the hospital and received surgery at approximately 7:00 PM.

Employee working in the Birchwood North Production area attempted to unjam the freezer tunnel with a tool.  The employee reached in with the tool (a few inches) when the tool became caught and dragged her hand into the equipment. Her right index finger came into contact with a pinch point (a roller and the guard), amputating her fingertip.
While working outside on a truck's waste collection route, an employee experienced difficulty breathing due to heat stress, requiring hospitalization.

An employee who had been installing pipe was descending a ladder when he blacked out due to heat exhaustion and dehydration. He fell to the ground (approximately 8 feet), breaking his shoulder and requiring hospitalization.

On January 20, 2016, at approximately 3:15pm, a city carrier was hospitalized after falling while delivering mail to a residential home. The employee slipped and fell on ice resulting in a skull fracture and bleeding in the brain.
An employee fell from a low boy trailer while loading a bulldozer onto the trailer. The employee suffered a head laceration and fractured vertebrae in the neck and upper back.

An employee was slicing thin like steak, and towards the end, he turned off the slicer, lifted the carriage and reached to retrieve the remaining product. As he reached, the blade had not come to a complete stop and the tip of the blade hit his right middle finger amputating the fingertip (soft tissue).
An employee was struck by a forklift, suffering a broken leg and ankle. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was spreading hot asphalt and fell sustaining second degree burns on the lower legs.

On November 13, 2015, at approximately 2:30 PM, an employee was working from an aerial lift and signaling a crane lifting a pipe. The crane was overloaded, tipped, and struck the aerial basket the employee was riding in.  The employee was bounced out of the aerial lift. When the crane sat back down, the employee was bounced back in the aerial lift and back out again. The employee suffered a spinal fracture, broken ribs, and multiple facial fractures, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was delivering parts when a shoe string got caught on a door stop at a customer's worksite. The employee tripped and fell, injuring the left knee.
An employee was attempting to re-spool electrical wire onto a drum when he tripped over the wire and hit the ground, fracturing his ribs, right index finger, and left elbow.
An employee was injured by a falling box.

On 11/24/15, at 1900 hours, an employee was operating a rough terrain forklift on a steep grade. The forklift toppled over and pinned his left arm underneath. He was hospitalized with a broken arm and had surgery.
An employee was walking to her automobile to travel to her next assignment when she fell off a curb at the site and fractured her arm in four locations. She was hospitalized.
An employee was using an excavator to load concrete slabs into a dump truck. The employee's right leg got caught between the concrete slab and truck tailgate, causing soft tissue damage.
An employee was adjusting a resin band with a bamboo knife when his hand was pulled into the fabric area. The lamination equipment pulled off part of his fingers (no bone loss).

An employee was operating a press brake and caught his right hand in the die. His index fingertip (from nail base) was amputated, his two middle fingers were amputated from the main knuckle and re-attached, and his small finger was crushed and may be amputated.
An employee amputated a piece of his right pinky finger while cutting a piece of wood.
While descending a rolling ladder and carrying a product, an employee tripped on the last few steps and fell onto the ladder, suffering multiple fractures and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was walking through a work aisle when she tripped on a co-worker's foot, causing her to fall to the ground and break her left hip. She was hospitalized.
An employee was operating the hydraulic press brake. The pull back safety device malfunctioned and the employee's right thumb was caught in the machinery resulting in a thumb tip amputation.
On June 28, 2015, at approximately 0900 hrs., an employee was bitten on the finger by a patient.
On 9/24/15, at 8:10 a.m., an employee's left middle and ring fingertips (including a portion of the nailbed) were amputated while the employee was setting up a bagger machine.

Two employees were operating a manual, foot-operated shear to cut aluminum sheet metal. The injured employee was helping to hold down the sheet metal when the second employee operated the shear, amputating the injured employee's right index and middle fingertips.

An employee was standing on tube steps, leaning over and dumping a bag of cellulose into the hopper. As he was dumping, a piece of the bag went into the hopper. The employee used a stick to drag the paper out. His stomach hit the control lid that moves up and down catching his left arm between the lid and lip of the hopper. He slid his arm out causing an abrasion and swelling requiring hospitalization.

On 9/7/16, an employee was moving wooden pallets by hand. He picked up one pallet and held it against his abdomen while bending down to pick up a second pallet. In doing so, two pieces of wood punctured his abdomen. One piece immediately fell out; the other had to be removed at the hospital.
An employee's finger was amputated while operating a cookie wrapping machine.
An employee's right thumb was caught in a safe door she was closing, crushing/amputating her thumb tip above the nail.

An employee was handling a cable that runs between a drum and the spud. He was trying to put slack in the cable line when the spud shifted and caused the cable to tighten. The cable struck and fractured his left leg just above the ankle.
An employee fell from an A frame ladder and suffered a right leg injury requiring surgery.
An employee was flagging and tripped, flipped, and fell hitting the curve. The employee suffered intracranial bleeding.
An employee was driving an ATV down a dirt road and it rolled. The employee sustained a broken hip.
An employee was pushing a vehicle that had broken down into a parking space and out of traffic. The employee fell and hit his head.

An employee sustained injuries to his ring and index finger while cutting a piece of wood on a table saw.  At the time of the injury on 1/14/15 it was believed that the employee had sustained lacerations to the fingers.  It was later found out on 2/4/15 that the injury to the index finger  resulted in an amputation while the employee was under medical treatment.

An employee was on an extended scissor lift tightening a bolt when the bolt broke and threw him between the top rail and the chain of the scissor lift. He fell 20 feet to the concrete below resulting in a head injury.
An employee fell down the stairs and broke her hip and femur.
An employee fell and rolled her hip on a curb outside the building. Her hip broke and required hospitalization.

An employee was hooking up a strap to connect a small excavator to a concrete saw. While a coworker was picking up the saw with the excavator, he attempted to readjust the straps at the moment the two pieces of equipment came together. His left ring finger was caught and amputated from the nail between the excavator bucket and the concrete saw.
An employee suffered a finger amputation when his finger made contact with a moving fan belt on the aerosol air system control fan.

On Tuesday, 9/22/15 at approximately 6:30 PM, an employee suffered a laceration to his right thigh when he backed into a motor's fan that was being repaired. The fan's protective shroud had been removed for the repairs. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was seriously burned while working at a fracking fluid recycling facility, requiring hospitalization.
Worker caught a hand in a running conveyor while cleaning and rinsing it. Worker suffered broken radial and ulnar bones in the right arm. The victim was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized for heat-related illness.
An employee was climbing up the ladder on the catwalk when he slipped and lost his grip, falling 5 feet to the concrete floor below. He broke his right lower leg and suffered an ankle injury.
An employee fell approximately 25 feet from a ballast tank.
An employee was repairing the roof's exhaust and got an index finger caught in the motor's belt resulting in amputation.

An employee was attempting to move a box of labels, which weighed approximately 42 pounds.  The box was located on a pallet on a lower shelf of a warehouse rack system. The employee lifted one box and placed it on an adjacent pallet. When he stood up and turned to get another box, he lost strength in his legs and fell to his knees. He was hospitalized with a back injury.
An employee was feeding wire from one roll to another. While guiding the wire his gloved hand got caught and amputated two digits.

An employee was unloading merchandise and cutting open a pallet of boxes stacked 7 boxes high. Some of the boxes fell on top of the employee and knocked him 20 feet to the concrete floor. The employee had surgery to repair a broken ankle and lower knee fracture.
An employee was lowering steel from a truck when the steel shifted and hit the employee's right ankle. The employee was hospitalized with serious bruising.
An employee was standing up from a bench when something snapped in her right ankle.
An employee fell 12 feet from a platform, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was operating a Yale forklift when he stuck his left hand outside the cab of the forklift. His left hand got caught between the front left vertical member of the forklift's overhead guard system and the metal horizontal rail of an adjacent grading table. He sustained injuries to his left hand, requiring a left thumb amputation at the hospital.
An employee was climbing a fixed ladder to the roof and fell. The employee sustained a fractured left ankle and leg requiring hospitalization and surgery.

The employee was attempting to rig a steel beam with a chain sling and overhead crane. While attempting to rig this elevated beam, it fell towards the employee. The employee tried to brace/stop the beam with his hand and the fore of the beam pushed him back, striking his face and chest as well, knocking him into another steel beam.  The employee was admitted to the hospital with a broken wrist. Surgery was performed to correct the injury to the employee's wrist. 

The injury occurred in the Welding/Fabrication shop.
An employee was performing maintenance on the volley elevator when a blade from the elevator caught his left arm and lacerated the forearm.
An employee suffered a fractured femur when he fell from a scaffold after the spreader beam that he had tied his fall protection to fell to the ground.
An employee was on a platform. When he stepped over a ladder he lost his balance and fell to the ground fracturing the right foot.

On Monday, October 17, 2016, an employee was at her carrier case on the workroom floor and bent down to pick up a mail tub to load into a hamper. When she lifted the tub, she felt a pop in her back and experienced a lot of pain. She was hospitalized with a back injury.
An employee was cleaning up trash and had his hand on the outside of the table when someone moved the table and it pinched his fingers, amputating his right middle finger to the first knuckle.
On July 27, 2016, at 5:30AM, an employee was preparing bread to be put in the proofer machine when she experienced dizziness/lightheadedness. She was hospitalized for severe dehydration.

An employee was inspecting metal stripes in the attic of a dormitory construction. The employee stepped on a soffit and fell through a hole approximately 9 ft. off the ground breaking the tibia and vertebrae.
An employee broke two bones in his left leg when he slipped in the pea gravel and his leg slid under a cradle that was being used to support and hold in place a steel pipe.
An employee was descending a 12-foot attic ladder hen he slipped and fell approximately 4 feet, breaking his left leg below the knee.
An employee performing work in a confined space sustained an amputation of his left foot.

The employee was troubleshooting a case alignment problem on the can line palletizer and noticed that the can case was misaligned. While he was examining the layer formation section of the palletizer, the machine cycled. The layer formation bar hit and fractured his right forearm.

On or about 20 April 2015 at approximately 1644 hrs an employee was hospitalized after a blunt force injury to the cranium. The employee was working on the gut table when he stepped on a bladder bag causing the employee to lose his balance and fall off of the table striking the posterior section of his cranium. The employee received a laceration to the posterior cranium and was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was cutting a steel plate when a scrap piece fell and was lodged on the cutting table.  The employee attempted to remove the scrap plate with an overhead crane when the two hooks came loose and struck him in the chest and face. He sustained three fractured ribs, a collapsed right lung, and a nose laceration.
An employee amputated the right middle fingertip while priming an icing pump on the blue colored icing line.
An employee was on a lift installing sheet metal at a job site when he fell off the lift and landed between two pieces of equipment, breaking his ribs.
An employee went into a food preparation room when she tripped on a rug, causing her to fall and fracture her right femur.

On or about September 11, 2016, an employee was helping to replace a hydraulic cylinder when the employee's finger was caught between the end of the cylinder and the mounting collar, amputating the left index fingertip.
An employee was hospitalized after suffering injuries to both arms while operating a milling machine.
An employee was sitting on a forklift when another forklift struck his left foot.
An employee was playing in the outside yard with a group of children.  The employee slipped in the grass and tore a tendon in her right knee.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery on the knee.
While an employee was grinding a weld, sparks caused his shirt to catch on fire. He received second and third degree burns from the mid torso to the upper chest area.

An employee had been tying rebar under a covered shed and reported having cramps at 10 AM. He was taken to the air-conditioned office and given fluids, but the cramps continued. He was then hospitalized.
An employee tripped and fell in the deli and landed on a knee, requiring surgery.
An employee slipped on an infant toy on the floor and broke her hip.

An employee was water blasting inside the economizer on tubes with a gun at water pressures of 3000-8000 psi when the control to the gun broke. The employee lost control of the gun and the water pressure struck the employee's inner left thigh, causing severe lacerations.

On June 06, 2015, at approximately 8:45 p.m., an employee was struck on the right leg by a rubber discharge hose that had been disconnected on one end after the pump was engaged by the equipment operator.
An employee was stepping backward from a chair in the cafeteria when she bumped into a bench behind her and fell, suffering left hip/lower back pain.

Frac technicians conducting monitoring operations on water levels of gauging tanks during oil and gas drilling operations are potentially overexposed to air contaminants and respiratory irritants such as chlorine, hydrogen sulfide, and benzene.  Recently, an employee was admitted to the hospital for observation and treatment after suffering from an extreme coughing episode after working a monitoring shift at the worksite.  A second employee was treated and released.
An employee sustained a right index finger amputation while cleaning a machine. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time.
An employee got off a ladder to move the ladder and while pulling the ladder towards himself, the ladder struck his right shin resulting in a contusion.
An employee was moving boxes on the conveyor when his right-hand middle finger came into contact with the belt, amputating his fingertip.
On December 13, 2016, an employee was replacing some underground piping and removed a section of existing pipe. The existing pipe then shifted and pinned the employee's left forearm, injuring it.
An employee was working on a pump trailer and was pulling on a wire in order to clean the door. The wire snapped and the employee fell off the trailer. The employee was hospitalized for a concussion.

An employee was struck by a section of traffic guardrail. A backhoe was being used to remove the section. When it pulled on the guardrail, a portion of the guardrail flung and struck the employee in his legs.

Employee was installing an incline conveyor.  He was using two chain falls and four come-a-longs. One of the come-a-longs was removed, causing the others to become overloaded, and the conveyor fell. The employee suffered broken bones in his legs, feet, spine, and pelvis area.
An employee was struck by a cable that broke from a choke while moving a utility pole resulting in the amputation of the right pinky finger.
An employee was stung by a bee and hospitalized following an allergic reaction.
An employee was injured on 3/26/15 while working on an inactive, disengaged brake. The employee tripped and was struck by a counterbalance in the chest and abdomen.
An employee operating a table saw amputated the middle fingertip (down to the nail bed). The table saw was guarded at the time of the incident.

After checking sulfur levels in a fertilizer building, an employee fell while descending a fixed wooden ladder and sustained a broken pelvis, broken ribs, broken C-3 vertebra, and internal bleeding as a result of the fall.

Employee was constructing a wooden pallet skid lift when the nail gun he was operating fired twice and injured his finger. The injury was underneath the employee's thumb. The employee was transported to the hospital, stayed overnight, and had surgery on his finger.
An employee was trying to readjust a trailer hitch when the employee's finger was caught and partially amputated between the trailer hitch and the ball of the truck.
While bending over to pick syrup up off the floor, an employee suffered a lower back injury that required hospitalization.
While an employee was cleaning a facility, a high-pressure water lance was accidentally activated. The lance shot forward and pierced through the flesh of his right forearm.

The last digit on an employee's pinky finger was amputated when caught between a metal plate attached to a pump and a trailer bed while unloading scrap metal into the Peddlers Yard. Suitable safeguarding was not in place at the time of the incident.
While preparing an empty apartment for lease, an employee was shot in the face by an unknown male.
An employee experienced a fingertip amputation while working on a piece of machinery.
An employee was scalded on the face, chest, and legs by steam and juice.
An employee was struck by a forklift truck while walking in the warehouse and sustained a leg injury.
An employee crushed his thumb between a door jamb and the railing on a scissor lift while lowering the lift from inside the basket.
An employee slipped on a wet floor and fell resulting in a brain bleed and a fractured right elbow.
An employee was operating a manlift and struck their abdomen against the roof joist causing a contusion.
An employee exiting a scissor lift missed the last step and fell approximately 4 feet, fracturing the hip.
An employee received a partial finger amputation after his finger got caught in a chain that was lifting a fuel barrel.
An employee was cleaning a power tool with break-cleaner spray and then activated the tool. Cleaner on the employee's hand and forearm was ignited causing possible second and third degree burns.
An employee was using a lathe to machine a part, which was approximately 6" wide, 5" long, and 16 pounds, when the part came out of the lathe and impacted his abdomen.

On or about September 12, 2016, an employee was repairing a vehicle when the unchocked vehicle rolled from its ramp and struck the employee in the head, causing lacerations that required hospitalization.

An employee was attempting to offload a car hauler when he lost his balance and jumped off the trailer approximately 5 feet 3 inches landing on his left leg. He sustained multiple fractures to the leg bones and was hospitalized for surgery.
On April 28, 2016,  at 8:20 am, an employee was raising a cope pattern with a hoist to place under a drag plate. His hand was under the plate when the pattern fell on his left pinky fingertip.
An employee was looking into the pilger machine when the hood fell, striking the employee on the back.
An employee fell through a skylight approximately 15 feet to the ground, sustaining two fractured vertebrae in his lower back, lacerations, and bruises.

On or about October 8, 2015, at 1135 hours, a worker for Hilmar Cheese Company was unhooking a hose from a truck that he thought had finished unloading heavy cream. The truck was still loading and the hose was under pressure. When the worker unhooked the hose, the valve slammed shut on his finger. The worker was taken to Dalhart Memorial Hospital and later to BSA Hospital in Amarillo, where the distal phalanges of his right index finger were removed due to the extent of his injury.

An employee was cleaning a food cart in the back storage part of the store. A forklift operator on the other side of the storage rack was pushing a skid with a cooler but pushed it too far, causing a pallet (weighing approximately 100 pounds) on the other side of the rack to fall on the employee cleaning her cart. She was hospitalized with injuries to her mouth, chest, legs, and feet.
An employee was troubleshooting an upper and lower flask of a mold trying to get the upper flask to seat on the lower flask properly. The flasks came together and crushed the employee's hands.
An employee was hooking a dolly onto a crane. The dolly rolled and pinned the employee between the dolly and crane fracturing the employee's pelvis.

An employee was operating a drill press to drill holes in aluminum stock. When he adjusted the material, his finger contacted the rotating drill bit. His right index finger was amputated above the distal joint.
An employee was walking with a knife when he fell and injured his leg with the knife.

On November 19, 2015, an employee was mixing a batch of chemicals and spilled resin near his face, and on his hands and arms. At the time of the spill, he took a shower and returned to work. Days later he began to feel very ill and was hospitalized.
On February 17, 2016, an employee was struck by the rear wheel of a powered industrial vehicle (Bobcat) resulting in a severe laceration requiring surgery.
An employee was changing the battery on a forklift when the battery slipped and crushed his thumb, fracturing and lacerating it.
An employee sustained a right index fingertip laceration while clearing a misfeed part in a strapper machine.
An employee was at the airport resetting a modem for the Doppler radars when he was assaulted and stabbed by a robber. He was hospitalized with severe injuries.
An employee was removing formwork when a piece of lumber fell from above striking the right foot and fracturing toes.
An employee amputated four fingers on the left hand while using a total positioning saw.
An employee broke his arm after reaching under a guard on the pail printing machine.
An employee sustained a broken ankle while stepping off of a four-rung ladder.
An employee torching a steal beam from a ladder got caught between the beam and a wall when the beam moved unexpectedly. He fractured his pelvis.
An employee was standing on the dock plate, helping to unload a truck, when the truck pulled away. He fell from the load dock to the concrete ground, injuring his head and shoulder.
An employee amputated the left pinky fingertip with a shaper machine.
An employee suffered a skin burn when hydraulic fluid caught on fire and landed on his forearm during a welding process.
Employee hospitalized with broken ankle after a large part fell on his leg.
A truck driver slipped and broke his right wrist while dismounting from inside the garbage truck.

On November 25, 2015, an employee was removing floor tiles with a razor scraper hand tool. While he attempted to replace a blade on the razor scraper, the blade contacted and deeply lacerated his wrist, possibly damaging tendons.
An employee carrying a nail gun tripped with his finger on the trigger and the nail gun shot a nail into his knee.

A maintenance employee was unloading metal bed frames from a truck at an off-site scrap yard. His finger became caught in the bed frame and/or caught between the bed frame and the side of the truck, partially amputating his left first fingertip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a mower when he lost control. His right foot went under the deck and was struck by the blade resulting in lacerations and fractures.
A city postal carrier was chased by a dog while delivering mail. The employee ran into the street and fell, striking his head on the ground. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion while working at the tire store on 7/18/15 and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was retrieving mailbox keys from a safe when the safe door closed on and partially amputated his right pinky finger.

An employee was assisting an air conditioning contractor position an air conditioner for the crane lift. The employee's right hand was caught between the air conditioner unit and the curb/asphalt causing the amputation of the right middle fingertip and a fractured finger.

Employees were descending a water tower in suspended scaffolding. About 30 to 40 feet above the ground, one of the motors locked up and the scaffold stopped. One of the employees detached his rope lanyard from his harness and attempted to slide down another rope lanyard. The employee fell off the rope hitting the ground and fracturing both legs and suffering severe rope burns on this hands.
An employee was wrapping a box of tomatoes when he was struck by a forklift, fracturing his right ankle.

An employee's left-hand little and ring fingertips/pads were amputated when the employee's hand got caught between a 500-pound steel calibration weight and a conveyor frame during a maintenance activity.

An employee was covering up equipment to keep it from getting wet in the rain. As the employee tried to tie up the cover his right hand was caught between a moving sprocket and chain resulting in a right pinky finger fracture and a laceration to the right ring finger.
An employee was performing general clean up duties with a fire hose and shovel when an explosion occurred. The employee suffered severe head trauma, contusions and a broken rib.
An employee missed the last rung while descending a ladder. He fell backward and struck his head. He was hospitalized with a head laceration and broken back.
An employee attempted to remove a jammed bag from a machine. The machine activated, clamping the employee's finger. A knife came down and cut the tip of the finger.

An employee was lowering material from the first floor to the basement using a hoist.  He put his left hand on the wire rope to position the load as he lowered it. His pinky finger got caught between the wire rope and the hoist.
A temporary employee was shot in the right knee while operating a nail gun to manufacture crates, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was bitten by an insect or spider. The bite area became infected. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery to clean out the infected area.

An employee was working from a 4-foot A-frame ladder when the soffit on which he was working de-stabilized and fell, knocking the ladder and employee to the ground. He broke four ribs and suffered a partially collapsed left lung.
On October 22, 2015, an employee tripped and fell over the plug and cord to a Xenex robot after plugging it in. The employee fractured a hip and elbow.

An employee was testing a solenoid on a small-piece folder (for folding patient gowns) machine when the back half of his wrench was pulled into the folder along with his hand.  The machine roller lacerated and crushed his left hand, breaking two fingers.

An employee was in a boom lift, replacing an emergency light at a warehouse. As he was lowering himself, the bucket swung into an industrial ceiling fan, which lacerated his left forearm. He was hospitalized.
An employee was laying decking, tripped over the decking, and fell 14 feet to the ground injuring his head and back. Fall protection was not worn correctly at the time of the incident.

On January 12, 2017, an employee was moving a personal owned vehicle and a government owned vehicle in a parking lot in order to have the snow removed. The employee slipped on ice and fell resulting in a fractured right hip and pelvis.
An employee suffered a head injury after tripping and falling and hitting their head on a work surface.
An employee working from home fell and broke her leg while getting up out of a chair. She was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was on the production floor moving a hot glue cart when the cart began to fall. The employee tried to stop the cart and glue pot from falling, but he fell with it and his hand contacted the melted glue. He suffered third degree burns to his hand.

An employee was changing steel form panels to create a box culvert. The corner panel (located on a forklift) had a loose screw that broke, causing the load to disengage and drop 6 inches. A panel fell on the employee's foot, causing an injury that required that hospitalization and surgery.
Employee fell approximately 15 feet. No fall protection was being used at the time.
An employee was removing the side quarter glass on a customer's SUV. The glass fell onto the employee's leg and the hard plastic molding on the glass lacerated the employee's leg.
An employee was moving a paper roll with an overhead crane. Her right pinky finger got caught and was amputated between the paper roll shaft and the bracket.

An employee walked close to an elevator opening. He rested his hand on the barricade (chain) that didn't hold his weight. He fell twelve feet resulting in a non-displaced fracture of his lower back and a possible fracture of his right foot.
An employee was cutting a dock plate when it came loose and landed on the employee's left foot, injuring several toes. Two toes had to later be surgically amputated.

An employee was taking laser measurements at a client facility in the freezer area. There was a roof leak and patches of black ice on the floor. The employee slipped on the ice and fell to the floor, sustaining a hairline fracture to his right hip and injuring his right arm. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning around a lint cleaner saw. The employee's sleeve got caught in the saw resulting in the amputation of the left middle finger.
An employee slipped and fell while taking inventory.
An employee was attempting to descend from a scaffold that tipped. He fell 5.5 feet from the scaffold onto a 3-foot ladder and suffered a laceration.

An employee was returning to her vehicle after delivering a parcel to the front porch of a house when she rolled her left ankle on the sidewalk. She then lost her balance and fell to the sidewalk, fracturing her right patella.
An employee was delivering mail and climbing snow-covered stairs when she slipped and fell, fracturing her ankle.
An employee was getting ready to weld a fabricated steel panel when he stepped into a precut lightening hole and fell, breaking his patella and requiring surgery.
An employee was moving a post-con cart when her foot got caught in the cart webbing. She fell onto the ground and hurt/broke her left hip.
An employee on a construction site was standing while talking and suddenly passed out possibly due to heat, hitting their head on the wall and falling to the floor. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell and was hospitalized.
An employee was checking a vacuum box container to see which box to load onto the truck. The employee then slipped and fell, striking the vacuum box platform.

An employee was instructing another operator on how to run a task with a new machine set up in place on the autogrinder machine. He used his right hand to point out a piece of glass as material was being fed into the machine on a small conveyor belt. His finger contacted an in-going nip point on rotating gears, and he sustained a right index fingertip amputation.
An employee was holding a pin while another employee was driving the pin in with a hammer.  The employee's finger was struck by the hammer resulting in the amputation of the fingertip.
Employee's finger was amputated when he placed his hand in a pinch point during a test.

On 08/01/2015, at 0700 a.m., an employee was removing chilled iron from a cupola moat when he sustained burns to his hands, arms, and face. The employee drove the bucket loader into the moat after water was applied to hot sand, which caused steam to burn the employee.

An employee was loading a dye header (a piece of carpet) into a sample beck. When she tried to pull the head end of the dye header from underneath the reel, the carpet pulled her arm between the reel and the carpet, breaking two bones in her left forearm.
An employee was struck by a door as he entered the facility, injuring his eye socket and cheek.
An employee was torching a piece of steel that was to be cut down to size. The piece of steel rolled over onto the employee's lower left leg and broke bones.

An employee was working with a screwdriver to remove a screw from a 480-volt circuit breaker when he hit an energized switchboard. An arc flash occurred, burning the employee's face and arm and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was redrawing a steel wire to reduce the diameter using a redrawing machine. When he attempted to untangle the wire, it amputated his left pinky, ring, and middle fingers.
An employee pulled on a rope that opens an overhead hatch. The rope broke, causing the employee to lose his balance and fall 30 inches. He broke his hip and required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee fell approximately 18 feet from a ladder. He was hospitalized with fractured ribs, a fractured clavicle, a collapsed lung, and numerous contusions and abrasions.

An employee fell approximately 15 feet from a fiberglass extension ladder while cutting a cable line at the mid line. The employee was wearing PFAS, but the positioning belt was not connected to the line. The employee sustained a broken collarbone and shoulder.
An employee experienced back spasms and back strain while loading a hand truck with bottles of water.
An employee fell out of her chair and injured her left arm.

A cold saw operator received an amputation to his right pinky fingertip (distal phalanx fracture). He placed a brass bar on top of the machine.  The bar was grabbed by the saw blade and pulled into the machine. The employee grabbed the end of the bar to pull it out while the machine was running, pinching his finger between the bar and a vise.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after being pinned between a remote control dirt compactor and pylon.

An employee was elevated in a work platform attached to a forklift when a piece of conduit fell, striking the basket and knocking him from it.  He fell approximately 20 feet and sustained a broken wrist and leg, requiring surgery.

An employee was walking down an aisle in a warehouse. At the same time, a coworker was operating a forklift in the opposite aisle. The forklift pushed some items, causing them to fall from a shelf and strike the employee. He was hospitalized with a compound fracture to his right leg, six cracked right-side ribs, a fractured pelvis, and three broken vertebrae.

On 02/29/2016 an employee was grinding a steel plate when the work stock got wedged. The work stock flipped up pinching his thumb tip between the work stock and the grinding disc. The employee was taken to the hospital for medical treatment. The employee's right thumb tip was later amputated.

An employee was installing a sign while on a 6-foot fiberglass ladder. He stepped off the ladder and onto a stack of water cases. The stack caved in, and the employee fell down, head first, to the concrete ground, suffering a head injury.

On 4/13/15, at approximately 5:00 p.m., an employee was setting up a metal grinding machine. During the setup process, he attempted to remove the part that was to be worked on. The manual control was in the reverse position at the time. As he pushed the job button with his right hand, his left ring finger was caught between the part and a machine guide, amputating his fingertip.

The employee was driving the powered industrial truck, stacking product on the top of the third pallet. The employee stacked the pallet and put the forklift in reverse. The employee then placed the forklift in forward, assuming that the forks were still elevated. The forklift fell on its side, causing the employee to break an ankle.
On or about April 5, 2016, an employee was guiding a die in a press when he attempted to remove a scrap. His right middle finger was caught between the die and die stop, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was exiting a trailer when he tripped and fell on the ramp. His right ring finger was caught and amputated in the metal grate opening.
An employee was adjusting a machine when his right-hand middle finger came in contact with the chain drive, amputating the fingertip. The machine was in operation at the time of the incident.

An employee was making adjustments to a belt conveyor and had removed the guard from the chain and sprockets. The conveyor was turned off and the adjustment was made. The employee turned the conveyor on to ensure the adjustment was effective. The employee was demonstrating to another employee what adjustments had been made by pointing to the parts with his left hand when the employee's hand became caught in the chain and sprocket resulting in multiple fractures requiring hospitalization for medical treatment.
An employee fell off the roof while installing solar panels and suffered a broken leg.

Employee was working on the back of the trailer when the lift gate inside the lift was activated. As the lift gate folded, it pinched the employee's left hand between the folds, resulting in an amputation of the left thumb, pointer, and middle fingers.
An employee's hand was caught between the air conditioner belt and pulley on a tree cutter machine.  The employee's left hand was crushed and the employee was hospitalized due to the injury.
An employee was stepping away from his tool box, tripped on a wire cable, and fell to the floor breaking his right hip.
An employee suffered an amputation injury when a valve slipped and pinched the employee's finger between the valve and the frame of the truck at or near Micahlucas 2-5H in Dunn County, North Dakota.
An employee working on a swing stage scaffold was lowering the scaffold when his left fingers got pulled into the pulley, partially amputating his middle and index fingertips.
An employee slipped off a rung while descending a fixed ladder. The employee used a hand to cover the face to avoid a direct strike and suffered a left wrist injury that required surgery.
Two employees received serious but non-life-threatening injuries when an M42 type submunition being disassembled exploded.  Both were hospitalized.

An employee operating a forklift lowered the forks while another employee was loading it. The employee's finger was caught between the pallet and floor resulting in amputation of the right middle finger to the first knuckle.
The worker may have been clearing a jam or retrieving some mail when he tripped and fell hitting his head on the floor or railing. He was found by another employee and admitted to the hospital.
An employee was repairing a forklift when a mast cylinder assembly fell rapidly and caught the employee's hand between it and the forklift.
An employee's leg was pinned between a truck and the powered pallet jack being operated.  The employee was hospitalized for treatment/surgery at Navicent Health.
An employee fell approximately 40 feet through the roof of a building.

An employee was laying metal decking when his foot slipped on a bar joist, causing him to lose his balance and fall 17 feet to the ground. He suffered a fractured rib, fractured vertebrae, and a lacerated liver, requiring hospitalization.

An employee finished connecting the drop fitting to start the fuel delivery. When he turned around, he tripped over one of the safety cones and fell onto the pavement breaking his hip. He was hospitalized.
On June 17, 2016, an employee was cleaning a part with compressed air when the compressed air injured the employee's hand.
An employee was walking on the company walking trail when she fell and broke her hip.
While exiting the roof, an employee unhooked his fall arrest system. He slipped and fell approximately 12 feet onto the lower roof.
An employee was stepping from a walkway with guard rails onto the roof when he stumbled and fell off of the roof edge. The roof was approximately 32-feet high.
A forklift driver was re-positioning a pallet when the pallet fell off the forks, striking and breaking a nearby employee's right leg.
An employee was unloading door material from an elevator when the material fell hitting the employee.  The employee suffered cuts, broken fingers, a broken hip, and an amputated right thumb.
An employee was clearing a wrap-up when her hand got caught between two rollers as she was re-threading the web. She partially amputated three left-hand fingers.

A die setter was using an overhead crane to lift a die (approx. 2000-4000 lb.) so that he could put wood blocks underneath it .  When the employee lifted the die, the load block was not centered under the die and caused the die to swing hitting the employee in the chest.  The employee suffered a fractured sternum, 2 broken ribs, and a punctured lung.

On or about 1/8/15 at 12:10 a.m., an employee was working between two boxcars located on a private railroad when the cars began to move.  The employee tried to get out from between the cars when one of the cars pinched his left foot, resulting in fractures.
An employee went to sit down in a wheeled chair when the chair slipped out from under her. She fell and hit her head, requiring hospitalization.

An employee cut the truck seal with a bolt cutter and opened the trailer door. When the door was opened, three hot water heaters fell out and one of the heaters struck the employee on the head causing a neck fracture.

An employee was unscrewing lock pins from a wellhead to remove a tubing hanger when an L-80 joint of tubing and hanger was ejected from the frac valve due to the pressure-to-weight differential. The tubing and hanger struck the employee's back, fracturing the L1 vertebra.
The employee was using a table saw to rip off a small section of a 12 foot long 2x2 when the employee caught his left hand in the blade, amputating the tips of three fingers.
On 5/9/16, an employee was clearing a paper jam from the feed wheel of a Peerless paper machine. When he raised the scrap shoot/shear, it fell down and amputated his right middle fingertip.
An employee was cleaning an extruder and amputated the left middle fingertip.

An employee was struck in the lower torso by the rear tires of a hostler/empty chassis. The employee suffered multiple rib fractures, a fracture pelvis, internal bleeding and a lower back injury.  The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was adjusting a needle valve on the flow indicating rotameter. The needle valve disengaged from the rotameter and caustic solution was sprayed in the employee's face. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was on top of the rooftop to gather tools and move to a new work location. As he was walking near an open vent hole, he tripped and fell approximately 26.5 feet through the hole to the ground below. He suffered broken bones and neck/head injuries. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was opening the door of his truck when a roll of material weighing more than 400 pounds knocked him down. He fractured his lower back.

An employee was working on a folder line. The folder line has two rotating cylinders that apply a stamp. The employee's right hand was caught between two running cylinders resulting in the amputation of the middle, ring and pinky fingertips.
An employee was preparing a mobile crane for transport and amputated a portion of the left index finger when the jib moved into place.
On February 23, 2017, an employee was cutting a piece of polycarbonate with a foot shear when the hold-down came down and amputated the employee's right ring fingertip and crushed the pinky finger.

On February 4, 2016, at approximately 4:00pm, an employee was operating a Ryder pallet jack in a 9'10" wide aisle way.  He passed a second employee operating another pallet jack in the opposite direction.  The load of pallets on the second employee's pallet jack struck a guardrail causing a pallet to fall onto the employee and lacerate his right calf.

An employee was using a scissor lift to gain access to suspended piping. The scissor lift controls failed allowing the lift to continue to elevate. The employee's head struck the suspended piping resulting in a fractured jaw.
An employee was performing maintenance duties when a range bull got out of its pasture. The bull head butted her and broke her pelvis.
An employee was delivering mail to a private residence and stepped up one step to put mail in a mailbox. As he was turning around to step down, he lost his balance and fell, breaking his right hip.

While loading an electric pallet jack onto the back of a trailer, an employee slipped and fell approximately 4 feet off the lift gate and onto the parking lot asphalt, fracturing a bone in the elbow area.
An employee was feeding lumber into the saw and amputated the left ring fingertip.
An employee was dumping trash from a can into a hopper when a piece of debris struck and cut him above the eye. He was hospitalized.
An employee walked behind a counter and slipped and fell, breaking the left kneecap.
Laundry employee was sorting laundry and tripped over laundry on the floor.  Employee fell onto the floor and fractured the right hip.
While cutting a piece of wood trim on a table saw, an employee cut the fingers on the left hand. The pinky finger required amputation at the hospital.
An employee opened the back door of a semi trailer and an unsecured bundle of cardboard weighing approximately 500 pounds fell on him.  The employee was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was loading a side dump truck while working on a median at the intersection of Lincoln and Lamay in Ft Collins. The driver was given the signal to pull forward just as the injured employee slipped on the curb. The dump truck ran over the employee's leg.
An employee was performing maintenance activities on a rock crushing machine when the machine's bucket struck him. He suffered a chest contusion and was hospitalized.

An employee was fitting the engine cylinder into its fixture and got his right hand pinched between the 150 lb. cylinder and the fixture resulting in the amputation of the right thumb and ring fingertips.
An employee was using an overhead crane and hydraulic jacks to separate tooling  when the hydraulic jack spacers dislocated and lacerated his left-hand middle finger. He was hospitalized.

An employee was repairing a riding lawn mower positioned on a jack. The jack failed while the employee was under it cutting and crushing the employee's head.  The employee was transported to hospital and admitted for treatment.

An employee was directing and parking an incoming aircraft. While on headsets communicating with the cockpit, the employee walked backwards into a moving jet bridge. The jet bridge struck the employee's right ankle, breaking it and requiring surgery.
An employee was removing snow and ice from the employee's vehicle in the company parking lot after completion of the work shift. The employee slipped and fell due to icy and snowy conditions.
On February 24, 2017, at 6:56 a.m., an employee fell on the snow covered sidewalk while walking into work and fractured the left femur.
An employee tripped on the stairs leading from the parking lot to the building.

An employee was performing maintenance underneath a truck when the jack holding the truck into position slid/slipped, causing the vehicle to make contact with the employees right leg. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right leg.
An employee's left pinky fingertip was lacerated when caught in a slip knot during the start-up of the Line 10 machine. The fingertip was amputated during treatment.
