An employee was helping another employee close the vault door. The injured employee's finger got caught in the door, resulting in a right index fingertip amputation.
On 7/28/15, an employee had been operating lift truck. After getting off the truck, the truck moved and bumped into the employee's leg, breaking it.
Three workers were raising the structural wall frame of a single family house when the wall fell onto an employee, fracturing his upper leg.
An employee fell backwards off the third rung of a ladder and received a hairline fracture of the pelvic bone on October 31, 2015.
An employee tripped over her shoe lace and fell while walking away from her desk, breaking her leg.

On January 13, 2016, at 4:40 a.m., an employee was working on a press. At the time, one sensor was not in all the way. She had her hand on one of the hand controls while she made the adjustment with the other hand. Her finger was crushed in the process.

An employee was trying to clear a blocked floor drain using an air hose. He attempted to pressurize the drain and hot water splashed onto his face, arms, and chest, causing second degree burns to 10 percent of his body.

A Ski Instructor was instructing a group of students down the trail.  He caught an edge of his ski, and went into the woods, where he fell and fractured his ribs, two vertebrae, his elbow (which will require surgery), and possibly his hip.  He also had puncture wounds on his thigh from the sticks/branches.

Two employees were working in the roll finishing area of the paper machine building. A 2,000-5,000 lb. roll of paper smashed an employee's feet and toes causing fractures and contusions requiring hospitalization.

An employee was fighting a fire in a remote area. The employee had an extra drip torch, which had leaked fuel. The residual fuel caught on fire, and the employee sustained second degree burns on the back of the arm, above the left elbow in the triceps area, as well as burns around both legs/sock areas.
An employee was fire-taping above the ceiling when his arm brushed against a pipe, scratching his right elbow. His elbow experienced pain and swelling, requiring hospitalization.
An employee slipped and fell down a flight of stairs while exiting a building. Weather conditions were a contributing factor.

On June 5, 2016, an employee was unloading a semi trailer using a forklift. She picked up a load, drove approximately 8 feet, and exited her lift. The forklift then rolled forward and pinned her between the load on the lift and another skid, breaking two legs and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was helping to guide a skiff pan onto its side to be painted when the load shifted and the strap came off of the forks of the forklift. The corner of the pan landed on his right foot. The resulting foot fracture required hospitalization and surgery to repair.
An employee was running underground conduit and began cramping. The employee was hospitalized for possible heat-related illness.

An employee was unloading a tractor trailer using a reach powered industrial truck (PIT). The tractor trailer pulled away from the dock while the employee was exiting the trailer on the PIT, causing the PIT to fall between the trailer and the loading dock. The employee suffered a broken left clavicle and facial fractures.
An employee was shot during an attempted robbery inside Roosevelt Field Mall.
An employee lost her balance while in the office. She fell onto her left arm and suffered a fracture.
An employee's legs broke in several places after being struck by an automobile that crashed into the facility.
An employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion after working 8-9 hours in the heat treatment area.

An employee's finger tip on the right hand was deeply cut when his finger slipped under the conveyer belt while adjusting the tension chain.  

At the McAllen Medical Hospital the doctor amputated the fingertip.
An employee was cutting tubing on a cutter when the tubing slipped out of place. She used her left hand to hold it in place. When the blade was activated, it amputated her left index fingertip.
An employee received burns to four fingers on the right hand from an arc flash.
While clearing a jam, an employee lost balance and fell off a three-step ladder, fracturing the right wrist.

An employee was using a jib crane to lower a mold onto a carrier that had a bolt laying on top of it. When the employee attempted to pull the bolt from beneath the mold, it dropped down and smashed his left middle finger between the mold and carrier. His left middle fingertip was partially amputated.
While descending a step ladder, an employee missed a step and fell, suffering a left ankle injury.
An employee was sweeping up leftover chips when a nearby distributor truck began to back up and hit the employee. The employee was dragged under the truck, cracking three vertebrae and two ribs.
An employee was working on a baker scaffold 5 to 6 feet high when he fell off of the scaffolding and broke a leg and cheek bone.
An employee fell on icy ground outside and broke her left hip.
An employee slipped on black ice while checking on trailers in the yard, fracturing an ankle.
An employee was on an oil rig handling the tubing and suffered a heat-related illness resulting in hospitalization.

A motorcycle entered the work zone and struck an employee who was cleaning up a pot hole. 
The work zone had TCD.
An employee was placing abrasive material in an injection molding machine to purge the machine.  The employee lost his balance and fell off of the machine, injuring his shoulder and forearm.
An employee was inching the ram down on a press when the plastic die spacer shot out and broke the employee's right arm.
An employee was climbing down a ladder from a stage and fell fracturing the tibia.

An employee was standing next to a bore pipe observing the work. An excavator was being used to pull an auger bit out of the bore pipe. A chain was attached to the excavator to pull the auger sections. While the excavator was pulling the auger, the chain failed and whiplashed into the employee's face. The employee lost the left eye and suffered a right orbital socket fracture.
An employee struck a pole while driving a forklift and was ejected. The employee lost consciousness, suffered a neck injury, and was hospitalized.
An employee was burned on the face and arm from a flash fire that occurred while changing the oil in a vehicle.
An employee was labeling equipment to identify two high voltage batch feeders when he was burned by electrical shock from the feeder.

An employee was using sulfuric acid drain cleaner to unclog a bath tub drain.  He felt burning in his eyes and throat.  He left the apartment and was transported to the hospital with breathing problems.
While making copies, an employee turned, caught the left foot on the copy machine, and fell fracturing the left femur.

An employee was reaching for boxes while on top of a pallet. When she turned to step off of the pallet, her foot got caught in shrink wrap, causing her to trip and fall. She landed on her left wrist and broke it, requiring hospitalization.
On Friday August 7, 2015, an employee was assaulted by a patient in a locked unit and admitted to the hospital.
An employee's finger was lacerated while working with a saw. He was hospitalized.

The employee was in the mezzanine pulling tires for a vehicle that was being serviced.  While walking to the mezzanine stairs, he stepped inside of a tire.  As he raised his foot to walk, his heel got caught causing him to lose balance.  He landed on his right knee.  The employee felt he could continue working and did not request medical attention.  He worked the remainder of his shift.  Three weeks later the employee was admitted to the hospital for an infection to the injured knee.
An employee experienced heat-related muscle cramps while loading materials onto a vehicle.

An employee was unlocking a device while standing on a cart 4.5 feet above the ground. The employee lost his balance and dismounted from the cart, landing on his feet and fracturing his heels. He was hospitalized.

An employee was injured and required hospitalization for a crushed pelvis and ruptured urethra when a waste compactor was activated and the anchor bolts holding it down broke, trapping the employee between the compactor and a wall.
On or about June 28, 2016, an employee was operating a dolly to move a hydraulic brake weighing several hundred pounds. The hydraulic brake fell over and injured the employee's knee.
An employee was catching a horse when it kicked her in the chest. She sustained a contusion and bruising to her chest and was hospitalized.
On 01/10/17, an employee was taking a part off of a manual lathe, lost his balance, and fell striking his upper back against the machine. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was helping a coworker assemble a vehicle seat.  The seat was moving down the assembly line on a jig, which allows the seat to tilt forward and backward.  The employee tilted the jig with one hand while his other hand was in a pinch point. The employee's right-hand pinky fingertip got degloved between the first knuckle and the start of the fingernail. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was swinging a sledgehammer to knock pins out of aluminum sows and smashed his left hand pointer finger in the process. The employee was taken to the hospital where it was determined that the finger needed to be amputated.

An employee was using a spud wrench to loosen bolts on a steel form panel. The nut was on very tightly, so he placed his foot on the wrench to loosen it. He lost his balance and the point of the wrench went up through the sole of his work boot, puncturing and fracturing his right foot.

On 1/27/15, the employee was getting a cat out of a carrier with the assistance of another person.  The other person was holding the box and she was getting the cat out.  The cat bit her hand.  After it continued to swell, the employee was admitted on 1/28/15 overnight for IV antibiotics.

On September 20, 2016, at approximately 2:30 PM, an employee was coring concrete using a drill. His hair somehow became caught in the drill and he suffered damage to his scalp and broke his neck. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was standing on the Tier 2 catwalk on the port/in shore side and slipped and fell through an open manhole.
An employee using a deli slicer was approached by a customer. Her right index finger was amputated by the deli slicer blade.
A employee fell off the roof and was hospitalized on 02/18/2015.
An employee was distributing mail from a pallet to mail routes.  He tripped over plastic wrapping and struck his head on a desk, suffering a laceration and head trauma and requiring hospitalization.
On or about January 10, 2016, an employee's left hand was lacerated by a belt while troubleshooting a towel folder machine.  The employee was hospitalized.
Employee was walking from the building to a government vehicle and slipped and fell on icy ground.  Employee sustained a head concussion.

An employee was conducting work on the 60-feet-high platform of an oil derrick, operating rigging to move piping into position. The employee became sick, vomited, experienced cramps, and was eventually hospitalized for heat-related health issues.
An employee was pinned between a railcar and the handrail of a transfer cable while switching railcars resulting in internal injuries.
An employee tripped and fell, breaking her hip and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was servicing a strapping machine that applies multiple polyester straps to compressed bales of cotton. The employee was checking the point were a friction weld fuses the two ends of the strapping together when the employee's right arm/wrist became strapped and trapped to the expanding bale of cotton. The right arm was caught and compressed under considerable pressure, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was shocked and fell backwards while pushing a button on a conveyor system.

An employee was standing on a step ladder to retrieve baking trays approximately 7 feet from ground level. While stepping down, she slipped off the ladder and broke her leg, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was standing near a pot belly natural gas heater, and his clothing caught on fire.  The employee was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was performing maintenance on a polishing machine. The employee was opening the plate/platform to get inside the machine to remove a part. After stepping in the open area of the machine, the employee felt a sharp pain/burning sensation in the right abdomen area. The employee suffered a hernia.

An employee was assisting a transportation driver who was catering a flight. He directed his coworker to secure the catering carts in her truck while he closed the aircraft door. When he proceeded to lower the handle of the aircraft door, his right pinky finger was caught between the handle and the hinge of the handle, amputating his fingertip.
Finger amputation.
An employee was scraping a hickey off a printing press roller when his hand was pulled into the cylinder-roller gap. He sustained a compression injury and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee received an electric shock and burns to the right hand and lower part of the arm and face while tightening a screw inside a cubicle.
An employee's thumb tip was amputated after getting stuck between rollers while threading the line.
An employee fell as he was exiting his truck. To avoid falling backwards, he reached to brace himself with his hands, but ultimately fell to the ground below. He fractured both wrists.
An employee was assisting a truck driver with a load when he slipped and fell to the ground, breaking his shoulder and requiring hospitalization.
A guide was back-country skiing with a client and fell, sustaining serious injuries.

An employee was on a 6/12 pitch roof tearing off shingles from a single story residence. The employee was wearing a harness and attached to a lanyard that was anchored on the roof. At the time of the incident, the employee was preparing to get off the roof and disconnected his lanyard from the harness. He was transitioning to the ladder and lost his footing falling 6 to 8 feet to the ground below. The employee fractured a bone in his back and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was training when he suddenly felt ill. He was hospitalized and treated for dehydration.
On or about January 30, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation of three fingertips while operating a rolling mill machine.
An employee fell through an elevator shaft of a two-story home thinking that the door led to a closet. The employee suffered a slight fracture to his lower back.
An employee preparing for food service passed out in the walk-in refrigerator while reaching for supplies.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee climbed a tree to cut a branch. As he descended, the length of the rope lessened, and he fell 30 feet.
An employee slipped while walking in the store, injuring his left elbow and requiring surgery.
An employee working in the laundry department inhaled laundry cleaner vapors while transferring residual chemicals from one container to another. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
On November 4, 2016, an employee was moving laminated beams when one fell, hit the ground, bounced back up, and pinched the employee's right middle fingertip, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was cutting a watermelon with a knife when the watermelon rolled and caused the knife to slip. The employee's right middle finger was amputated.

An employee's right foot received a compound fracture after it was squeezed by the tire of a garbage collection truck while he was collecting trash.  The employee underwent surgery and was hospitalized.
An employee was kicked in the chest by a horse while attempting to saddle it. The employee broke multiple bones and suffered a laceration.

On or about 1/5/15 at 6:30 a.m., an employee was riding a horse back to the barn after completing morning exercises. The horse reared up, could not withstand its weight, and fell over.  This resulted in injury to the employee, breaking his femur bone.

An employee performing wheel dressing operations on the TGI Centerless Grinder was injured when he reached into the grinding wheel to extract the dummy plug. He sustained a right index finger amputation.

An employee was preparing to drill a hole in wax paper using a foot-operated paper drill machine. She placed a stack of paper in the machine using a block to hold the wax paper in place. When she pressed the foot pedal, the machine drilled the tip of her right index finger, causing an amputation-type injury.
An employee was getting materials to set up the work site when a heavy sheet of plywood injured the employee. The employee sustained broken ribs and a deflated lung.
An employee was adjusting air conditioner vents when the malfunctioning unit caught on fire, causing second degree burns.
An employee slipped on water that was spilled on the floor and fell, shattering her kneecap.
An employee was bringing down a pallet of merchandise with a reach truck. While lowering the merchandise, her right harm caught a piece of metal, lacerating her right elbow.
An employee's right middle fingertip was amputated while pushing meat into an auger.
An employee was installing a fan belt on an exhaust fan when his glove was caught and his right thumb tip was partially amputated by the belt.
An employee was cutting meat with a band saw when the saw amputated his left thumb at the knuckle.
While on duty, an employee approached a shoplifter to request he return stolen items and was stabbed in the chest and left arm with a knife by the shoplifter.
An employee amputated the their left index fingertip while loading a weld fixture into a weld robot cell.
As an employee pulled a patient bed through a doorway the employee lost their footing and fell, fracturing a wrist.

An employee was descending a customer's folding attic entrance ladder located in the garage. When he stepped down onto the bottom section, it broke, causing him to fall to the ground. He fractured his left arm and left foot.

An employee and a crane operator were preparing to lift a cutter head (tool) into a transport rack. The crane operator picked up the tool and the employee's finger was caught in a pinch point between the tool and the transport rack resulting in the amputation of the right index fingertip.

An employee was shutting off the valve of a truck tank hose when the pressure caused the lid to blow off. The oil inside the tank then struck the employee, fracturing his pelvis and right wrist and causing a road rash on his chest area. He was hospitalized.

On 5/14/2016, at 11:30 a.m., an employee was stripping concrete forms. A wooden block was removed from between the two forms, which then came together and crushed the employee's right thumb. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
Employee was working on the HVAC unit and amputated his left index finger when it was caught on the HVAC's unit belt.

An employee was climbing up on the roof with a 10-foot extension ladder while carrying a box of air conditioner filters when the ladder shifted, causing him to fall about 6 feet to the ground. He suffered a muscle strain and bruising in his right shoulder and was hospitalized.

On January 14, 2015, an employee was pinned between a 4,000 lb motor and the wall of an elevator, when the motor and cart slid from the forks of the truck. The employee suffered a fracture to the right femur.

The employee was sitting at the edge of a large commercial dumpster with his feet inside of the receptacle.  The employee was attempting to reach for a piece of plywood, lost his balance, and fell backward, approximately 8 feet to the dirt ground below. The employee was hospitalized with fractures to the neck.
An employee's right index fingertip was caught in the pinch point of moving equipment, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was climbing a ladder to access a storage area above an office unit. The ladder slipped from under the employee, and the employee fell approximately 6 feet to the ground below, suffering a fractured rib and clavicle.
An employee was raising the flag outside of the post office. Two dogs attacked him, causing lacerations on both forearms, knees, and calves. He was hospitalized.

An employee was removing a temporary barrier wall. A loader with forks was used to lift the wall to relieve pressure so the employee could pull pins from it. The pin shifted as he was pulling it and his right index finger was caught between the bolt and the barrier wall, amputating it at the first knuckle.
An employee's leg was injured from slipping in the mud. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was cutting meat using a table saw (meat slicer) when the meat slipped from his grasp, causing his hand to contact the blade. His thumb and index finger were severed, causing amputation, and two other fingers were lacerated.
An employee was moving a 500 pound box. The box slipped and bent her right hand backwards shattering the wrist.

An employee was attempting to place a large dog into a kennel when she lost her balance and fell to the floor. The employee fractured her right ankle in two locations resulting in admission to the hospital for surgery.
An employee fell from a 4-foot stepladder while performing preventive maintenance, breaking their right hip and foot.
An employee fell 12 feet while climbing a ladder to gain access to a scaffold work platform.  The employee was hospitalized due to multiple fractures.
An employee was detailing a boat. While trying to remove plastic, she fell approximately 6 feet from the boat to the ground, breaking her collarbone, cracking her rib, and injuring her head.
An employee was using a pole pounder to pound stakes in when the employee's right glove became snagged and the pole pounder fell onto the right index finger, amputating it.
An employee was attempting to mount a heavy-weight headboard onto the wall when he felt pain in his back. He was hospitalized with a back injury.
An employee was unclogging the mixer machine and amputated the right middle and ring fingers.
An employee was traveling by ATV on a forest road. While turning a corner, he was thrown from the ATV and hit the ground. He broke his rib and collarbone and bruised his lungs.
An employee was walking up a steep roof while carrying a staple gun when he slipped and discharged a staple into his knee, requiring surgery.
An employee attempted to straighten logs that were out in the yard when a log fell and hit his left foot, resulting in an open fracture to the foot and hospitalization.
While operating a tug, an employee was ejected when another employee cut in front of the tug.

The employee was operating a sit-down forklift to load an outbound trailer. Upon forward motion by the trailer, the employee was struck by a metal strap which became dislodged from the interior of the trailer.  The metal lacerated the left leg.
An employee was conducting maintenance on a jet bridge when a telescoping air duct pipe disconnected and fell. It struck the employee on the right shoulder, knocking him to the ground.
An employee sustained an amputation while operating a rolling stainless steel plate machine.
An employee was hospitalized when she became ill, lost her balance, and contacted the floor resulting in a small linear fracture to the head.

An employee was moving a beam with a crane. He unhooked the beam and was lifting the hook when the hook caught the beam. The beam fell, striking him and breaking his right femur. He sustained a compound fracture to the right femur bone.
An employee was injured when caught between an order-picker powered industrial truck and a storage rack. She received multiple fractures in her back and was hospitalized.

On 12/15/15 at approximately 1:00 PM, an employee operating Rounder Machine #150 was in the process of feeding a 2" x 1/2" piece of copper stock material and inadvertently actuated the mechanism resulting in a partial amputation to the right index finger.
An employee was getting into the LLV when he/she closed the door on and amputated the right index fingertip (no bone loss).
An employee was blowing off a router bit with an air gun and lacerated the left hand and pinky finger. The brush guard was in place at the time.

An employee was repairing cable lines at the top of a telephone pole. As he was climbing down the pole using the preinstalled pegs on the pole, he missed a step and fell 10-12 feet breaking both legs and an ankle.

An employee was laying down insulation over a roof's hatch opening when he stepped on the insulation that marked the opening and fell to the concrete lower level. He was hospitalized with a fractured tailbone.
An employee was attempting to retrieve a tool that had rolled beneath a material feed system and her hand contacted the bevel gear resulting in an open fracture to the right middle finger.

An employee was using chains to tighten a forklift onto a truck when a chain broke and struck the employee's leg. The employee was hospitalized with a tibia fracture, talus fracture, and lateral malleolus fracture.

On May 16, 2016, at 11:05 a.m., an employee was replacing a light fixture while standing on a ladder that was approximately 4 feet off the ground. He came in contact with a live electrical wire and was shocked. He then fell from the ladder to the ground below.

An employee was operating a plasma cutting CNC machine in auto cut mode. The employee attempted to remove cut pieces of metal from the cutting table. The table struck the employee causing their foot to get caught on a floor grate resulting in a fractured right ankle.

On 2/4/15, worker was operating a Trumf press brake when the punch came down on his fingers while he was setting the press up to operate.  Specifically, the worker was placing a polyurethane cover over the die so that the part to be processed would not be damaged. The worker stepped forward on the foot pedal, which activated the press and injured multiple fingers.  The worker was hospitalized following surgery to place pins in the injured fingers.
An employee was conducting brick work from a scaffold. He fell 6 feet to the ground and broke both arms.

An employee was working on the soy bean preparation line when he caught his hand near a clam-shell-like device that stops the flow of soy beans to the scale resulting in the amputation of his left middle fingertip.
An employee ingested methanol and required hospitalization.
An employee was handling boxes of potatoes when he experienced pain. He was transferred to the hospital where he was scheduled for a possible hernia operation.

An employee was working from a roof approximately three stories high when he fell about 15 feet. He was wearing his harness at the time. During the fall, his right arm was struck and lacerated by a radial arm saw that fell with him. He sustained deep cuts in his tendons and loss of feeling in his fingers.
Employee on mail route slipped on ice, fell and broke the right ankle and leg below the knee.
The employee was installing a pipe on a new vessel and caught the left hand between the pipe and vessel, crushing the pinky finger. The fingertip was medically amputated.
An employee was removing forms from a column using a positioning hook. When the form came free, the employee fell with the form approximately 5 feet to the ground.

An employee was replacing a belt on a conveyor system with his hand inside the cover to pull the belt. Another employee pushed a button to jog the conveyor. Three of the injured employee's fingers were pulled into the in-running nip point. His little finger was surgically amputated.
An employee, who was driving a golf-cart, lost control and the golf cart over-turned, resulting in multiple injuries to his body.
An employee slipped and fell.
An employee was picking up steel and dropped a 70lb. piece onto his left foot. The employee was hospitalized with a contusion on the left foot requiring surgery.
An employee was removing an old roof when he experienced heat stress. He was hospitalized for severe dehydration and required overnight hospitalization.

An employee was assisting a mechanic in disassembling a gear box. The employee was holding an intermediate assembly inside the gear box when it shifted and created a pinch point between the assembly and the internal bore. The tip of one of the employee's index fingers was amputated.
An employee suffered electrical burns to both hands and fingers while removing the alpha-phase tap from the bushing of a recloser.
An employee was operating a spot welding machine, reached for a bolt, and crushed the right index finger in the welder.

An employee was unbanding a load of steel that had a wooden 4x4 block in between it. The steel band snapped and the steel hit the extra length of wood, causing it to fly up and hit the employee in the face. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a forklift and crushed his hand between a racking system and the forklift resulting in hospitalization.

An employee was cutting a piece of wood with a battery operated circular saw. The blade got stuck in the wood and kicked back lacerating three fingers on the employee's left hand. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee received a gun shot wound during a joint operation between the state of Texas and the FBI.
An employee was sitting on a conveyor when the manufactured piece struck and pinched him.  The employee was hospitalized with five fractured ribs.

On August 6, 2015, an employee was trimming scrap boards with a chop saw at the end of his shift. He activated the foot pedal while his hand was removing boards.  The saw amputated the tips of his middle and ring fingers.  He was transported to the hospital where the doctor removed a portion of the bone in order to close the wound.

On 10/22/2015 at approximately 10:30 pm, an employee was loading a stack of papers (car maps) into the folding machine when he felt a pop in his back. He finished his shift and went home.  He was later hospitalized for a back injury that required surgery.
An employee suffered a left index finger amputation behind the fingernail while moving an auger.

An employee was pressure washing pipes with a steam cleaner when the steam hose became disconnected from the cleaner and whipped around, striking the employee in the leg and fracturing the tibia and fibula. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was lowering a crane wheel using a crane when his finger got caught between the crane wheel and the steel rope. His right ring fingertip was amputated.

While sending air through a pipe for cleaning purposes, an employee used a hammer to hit the pressurized pipe to unclog it. As the employee struck the pipe, a strainer (which lined the inside of the cap) flew off, striking the employee in the forehead. The employee sustained a fracture to the eye socket and skull, which required surgery.
An employee fainted at work and hit his head on the floor.

An employee was clearing the large coffee bean hopper at a height of approximately 35 feet. He lost his balance and fell through the opening for the permanent ladder access. He fell 12 feet to a lower level and broke his right leg, requiring hospitalization. A full guardrail system was in place at the time.

On June 25, 2015, an employee was repairing a skeet machine in the back shop area, removing a leaky gear box from the side of the machine. When he removed the gear box, the main spring engaged, and the throwing arm released and struck the employee in the face. He received multiple fractures to both sides of the lower jaw, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was using an A-frame ladder to clean gutters around a building. The employee fell off the ladder, injuring his/her hip.
An employee was climbing down a fixed metal ladder when he lost his footing and/or grip and fell from a height of approximately 5 feet. He fractured his left leg bone beneath the knee.
Employee dragged her foot on the carpet and it caused her to fall.

An employee was hauling sand in a dump truck. He dumped the truck load of sand and was attempting to close the tailgate on the back of the truck. The tailgate failed to close completely. The employee attempted to pull the tailgate away from the vehicle to create momentum from the swing to close it. His hand was positioned on the bottom of the tailgate and as it swung toward the truck, it created a pinch point. His left hand was pinched between the tailgate and the vehicle frame, causing fractures, cuts, and bruising to the fingers.

An employee was laying sheets of plywood and was clearing debris when his right hand was caught between two plywood sheets. A coworker then tapped the boards together while the employee's finger was still between them, amputating his index fingertip.

Employee was cutting the butt end of a utility pole with a chainsaw . The chainsaw made contact with the employee's foot, which was near the point of operation, resulting in severe laceration and broken bones.

An employee had just finished delivering a package and was walking down a set of carpeted stairs when the employee tripped. The employee fell down about 4 to 5 stairs and landed on the ankle, fracturing a bone in the lower leg; employee required surgery and a hospital admittance.
An employee was walking from lunch break and was struck by a tractor trailer that was backing up. The employee received multiple fractures and head trauma.

An employee was getting into the side of a company van to sit on the floor to go to lunch. The employee touched a conduit that was stacked in the van, causing it to shift onto his hand and amputate his right index fingertip.
An employee was working on a roof when debris came in contact with an overhead wire causing an arc flash that struck the worker. He fell from the roof.
An employee was repairing an overhead light in the emergency room when the cover collapsed on his right thumb. The cover cut through the employee's glove and amputated his right thumb tip.
An employee was unloading a HVAC condenser from a flat bed truck and his index finger was smashed between the condenser and the guardrail of the flat bed truck, causing a partial amputation.

An employee was threading paper into the hot plate section of the running corrugator. The employee's gloved left hand was pulled into the nip point, trapping his hand/arm between the corrugator belt and the hot plates resulting in burns to the employee's arm and hand.
An employee was changing a trailer tire. A tire came off the rim and the employee broke their left leg.
A dump truck driver was preparing to dump a load of dirt. The bed of the truck struck an overhead power line. The driver received an electrical shock when he exited the truck.

An employee was assisting with the extraction of a 4-foot by 24-foot steel plate from an excavation. As the steel plate cleared the top opening of the excavation, it rotated and struck the employee in the right side, causing a serious contusion and small tear in the kidney that required hospitalization.
An employee was putting a hitch on a trailer. As she moved the hitch forward, she lost control of it and it fell on her leg. She broke her leg and was hospitalized.

On or about April 1, 2016, at approximately 10:10 p.m., an employee was walking from the receiving desk at the shipping dock when a forklift driver struck him. His left leg was amputated below the knee.

The employee was working on an elevated platform (scaffolding) removing form boards from a new concrete structure.  The employee was tied off to a form board that had been taken apart by mistake.  The form board fell 15'-20' to the ground pulling the employee to the ground with it. The employee suffered a fractured leg.
While moving baseboards to the scrap pile, an employee was bitten on the hand by a rattlesnake.
An employee was cleaning a blender when his glove was caught and pulled into the spinning auger, amputating his right ring and middle fingers. The blender was operating at the time of the incident.
An employee caught and injured their right middle finger inside a door jam.

An employee was replacing a gear on a strapping machine conveyor. Bundles (of aluminum) continued to be put on the strapping conveyor while the employee was installing the gear. When a bundle hit the photo eye, the conveyor belt engaged and amputated the employee's right index finger below the second knuckle. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time.
Worker fell about 42 inches from a scaffold when a scaffold plank broke.
An employee broke his leg after tripping over a cord. He was hospitalized and treated for the injury.
On 7/7/16, around 1:00 p.m., an employee started grabbing his hamstring and experienced cramping. He later felt unwell. He was eventually hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was walking around a corner, tripped over a box and fell breaking a hip.
An employee's left middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee fell from an extension ladder while climbing into the attic to change furnace filters. The employee suffered fractured ribs and a fractured right eye socket.
While exiting the back of a delivery truck, an employee's ring became caught on part of the door. His left-hand ring finger was severely injured.
On October 5, 2016, an employee was using a 7-inch electric grinder when it kicked back and severely lacerated the back of his left hand.
An employee was hospitalized after sustaining back injuries while lifting a 10-foot ladder.
An employee was using a band saw to cut down sirloin steaks when his hands came in contact with the saw blade, amputating his left thumb tip.
An employee was hooking up a backyard machine to a digger derrick when the employee's finger got caught between the hook and the backyard machine. The employee's pinky finger broke.
An employee on a center rider was about to start filling an order when a box of mangoes fell off a rack and struck him. He suffered a fractured right shoulder and was hospitalized.
An employee was reversing an electric stand-up forklift when their foot was pinched between the forklift and a concrete wall.
An employee was dumping product onto the auger that takes meat to the slicing machine. When he reached down, his right index fingertip was amputated by the auger.
An employee was cutting a branch from a tree using a chain saw. The branch fell striking the employee in the chest and knocking him to the ground injuring his back and chest.
On or about January 18, 2016, an employee was walking from a control room on a concrete walkway and slipped on ice falling down four steps and breaking an ankle. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell on an ice-covered sidewalk in the parking lot, breaking her hip and requiring hospitalization.

A maintenance worker was using a pneumatic die grinder with a carbide cutting wheel to cut a piece of metal. The cutting wheel got in a bind and broke sending pieces of metal into the right side of the employee's neck and causing a laceration.
An employee fell down a flight of stairs, breaking her ankle.
An employee had completed a run of five fasteners on an upsetter machine when their left hand got caught in the dies of the machine. The employee's left-hand pinky and ring fingers were amputated.
An employee was loading a cow into a chute when the cow raised her head and smashed the employee's right hand next to the chute, amputating her pinky finger to the first joint.

On or about 16 April 2015 at approximately 0830 hrs an employee suffered an amputation of the distal phalanges located on the thumb of the left hand. The employee was retrieving keys from a safe when the door was accidently closed pinning her thumb between the door and the frame of the safe.
An employee was working on a boat and fell while descending the ladder breaking the left radius.
An employee received an electrical shock.

An employee was tailing in a piece of pipe while the drill rig was picking up the other end. The pipe swung into the derrick of the rig and caused the other end of the pipe to flip up, striking the employee in the mouth.
Four workers were in a crew truck located in a work zone when it was struck by an automobile.
While sweeping a work area, an employee vomited and became disoriented from heat exhaustion, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was bringing a steel plate down onto a pillow block. While he was adjusting a piece of sheet metal, the block turned and pinched his finger between the block and plate, amputating his left index fingertip (part of nail).
An employee was injured when working on a conveyor.
An employee's glove got caught in a metal lathe, amputating the index, middle, ring, and pinky fingers of the right hand.
An employee fell six feet from a scissor lift while removing a piece of wall angle.

An employee was using a portable grinder to cut a metal stand when the grinder wheel shattered and caught his glove, pulling his hand into the grinder blade. He required surgery and hospitalization for a hand laceration.

The forklift operator was lifting the bin of tootsie pops. The bin slipped and the injured employee was trying to remove the bin that had fallen when his left index finger was caught between the bin and the steel rail. The left index finger was amputated between the first and second joint.
An employee was struck by a pallet on a forklift that was being operated in the area where he was working. The employee sustained a fractured pelvis.
An employee's thumb was caught by the safe door when closing it. The pad of the employee's left thumb was cut off and could not be reattached.
A pizza delivery driver was robbed, shot and beaten at approximately 7:50 pm February 4, 2016.  He was hospitalized.
The cap on a pressurized water tank blew off and the pressure knocked an employee over. The employee suffered a concussion, a broken jaw and a cut on his right arm.

An employee was adjusting a belt on an HVAC compressor. The pulley kicked on and the speed of the belt injured the employee, resulting in fingertip amputations on the index and middle fingers of the left hand.

An employee was sorting parts in the parking lot when a semi-truck owned and operated by the employer backed into him, causing a right leg laceration and fracture. The employee was taken to the hospital and admitted overnight for observation.
An employee had delivered mail to a mailbox at the front door of a home. As she turned away, two dogs appeared and attacked her, biting her head, right and left arms, and right and left legs.
While installing a refrigerator and pushing it into place, an employee's finger became stuck between the wall and the refrigerator. The employee's right index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was changing the top die on the 12-foot press when the die holder became loose. The ram and assembly dropped about 10 inches onto the employee's hands. He was hospitalized with a fractured right hand.

An employee was dispatched to an oil and gas weld site to pick up produced water. When he made it to the worksite, he set his truck in position, connected the hose, and engaged the vacuum pump. A fire then occurred, causing second and third degree burns to both of his arms and part of his torso, as well as minor burns to his neck, face, and ear.

An employee was retrieving cleaning materials from a rolling cart to detail a car when a car drove into the area, crashed into another vehicle and that vehicle struck the rolling cart. The cart then struck the employee and pushed her into a wall. She was hospitalized with broken ribs and a broken pelvis.

On 8/21/2015, two employees were traveling toward each other in the same aisle on separate stand-up forklifts. They collided, and one employee suffered a right foot injury, including a laceration and possible broken bones. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was standing on top of a masonry wall, removing the wall forms, when a wall form fell. The employee's personal protective equipment was attached to the form. As the form fell, it also brought the employee down 10 feet to the ground below, crushing the employee's left hand, fracturing the spine, and causing lacerations.
An employee fractured his hip when he fell down on the asphalt in the parking lot.
An employee suffered from heat exhaustion while taking metal products off the belt or table, requiring hospitalization.

A maintenance employee was attempting to realign an overhead conveyor belt while on a scissor lift. While attempting to reach up and pull a lever, he started to lose his balance. To steady himself, he reached his left hand up into the conveyor belt and his glove was caught in the belt, leading to a deep abrasion on the top of his left hand that required surgery.

An employee was pushing a deep fryer back into place after cleaning behind it. One of the fryer wheels became caught when a loose drain cover on the floor shifted. The fryer and employee fell, and the hot cooking oil in the fryer spilled onto the floor and onto the employee. He received 3rd degree burns on his right hand and on both legs from the knees down.
An employee broke his foot while trying to leave his car with his wheel chair on 05/04/2015 at 4:30 PM.
An employee was retrieving documents from a safe and closed their left pinky finger in the safe door resulting in a fingertip amputation.
On March 31, 2016, at 12:00PM, an employee tripped on an electrical extension cord and fell.
Employee was walking through the facility, tripped over her foot and fell. Employee sustained a hip injury and was admitted to Warren Hospital.

An employee was unloading drywall from a forklift. The weight of the drywall caused the forklift to tilt as the drywall was being moved off the forks. As soon as the drywall was fully removed from the forks, the truck tilted back in place and injured the employee, who suffered major swelling of the neck/spine and required hospitalization.
An employee fell down stairs in an office building resulting in a shoulder injury.
An employee was delivering parcels to a residence and was struck in the head with a pipe by a burglar.
An employee's finger was caught and amputated in a hydraulic gate lift.
An employee was loading bags of cement/asphalt onto a cart at Lowe's when a wheel on the cart broke. The cart collapsed onto the employee's foot, amputating a toe.
An employee saw a build up of rice on the rice polisher feed hopper. He shut off the equipment to clean it. His right fingertip got caught in the feed hopper and was amputated.

The crew was checking valves in the side curb pump. The injured employee was attempting to work on the suction valve while the engine was being energized. The drive line rolled the pump and the #4 plunger stroked forward and crushed his hand.
On or about October 31, 2015, an employee was delivering a parcel and was bitten by the homeowner's dog that resulted in hospitalization and 26 stitches to the jaw.
An employee was reaching for a liver on a conveyor-type table when his right wrist was lacerated by the knife he was holding. The laceration became infected and required hospitalization.
An employee's left ring fingertip was amputated while using a fabric saw to cut a stack of fabric.

On February 18, 2017, at approximately 5:30 p.m., an employee was replacing the chain on a breading machine conveyor that was turned off. The power was restored to the machine while the employee was checking the tension of the chain. The moving chain caught and amputated the employee's right index fingertip.
An employee was operating a time saver machine (which is similar to a wood planer but for metal) when he lost his balance and received a laceration from the thumb to the forearm.
An employee was walking and tripped and fell breaking the femur bone.

An employee was guiding a vehicle into the bay. The coworker driving the vehicle was unfamiliar with it and accidentally hit the gas instead of the brake, pinning the employee between vehicles. The employee suffered a right leg injury.

An employee was moving a transport dolly loaded with approximately 200 pounds of sheet metal. As he was turning the dolly, his right pinky finger got caught between a stationary table and the dolly handle resulting in the amputation of his right pinky fingertip without bone loss.
Worker fell when exiting a shuttle bus. Worker hit the shuttle stairs and injured lower back and leg.  Worker was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting brick using an automated saw when his finger went under the saw blade. His right index finger was amputated below the fingernail.

An employee was walking alongside a forklift moving decking. He was wearing a harness because he would eventually have to go up to an elevated position. The lanyard from the harness became caught on a pipe, causing the employee to fall, which then caused the load to shift. Decking sheets then pinned the employee's left hand between a column and the sheets, injuring his ring finger.
An employee was operating a Komatsu Dozer and fell off. The dozer ran over his left arm and fractured it. The employee also sustained a wrist injury and two broken ribs.
An employee amputated the left middle and ring fingers while running metal through the flat press.

The employee was washing a stripper filler machine with a 4 to 5 inch diameter flexible hose that hung down from the ceiling. The employee noted a sharp pain in the back during the cleaning operation and heard a pop when the employee bent over to pick up the tool.
An employee helping with solar panel equipment experienced legs cramps, requiring hospitalization for heat exhaustion.
An employee was walking up stairs and fell, injuring her face, head, right forearm and right knee.
An employee was attempting to realign a part in the rotary stencil machine when he amputated the left index finger.

An employee slipped and fell while cleaning the batter conveyor with a green scrubbing pad. His right index finger got caught in and was partially amputated by a sprocket on the conveyor belt drive train.
An employee fell from a ladder while installing new HVAC units. The employee sustained a fractured skull and brain swelling, two fractured vertebrae, a displaced sternum, and fractured ribs.
While moving a 125-pound wooden door to a table, an employee's finger was caught between the table edge and the door frame. The employee's right middle fingertip was amputated and fractured.
An employee was using a hoist attached to a bracket to pull a guy wire right.  The bracket broke causing the guy wire to strike and break the employee's arm.
An employee fell from a platform that was 2 to 2.5 feet high, sustaining a punctured lung, fractured ribs, and fractured vertebrae. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell on ice in the parking lot, breaking her tibia and requiring surgery.

An employee was attempting to lift a slurry tank to move with a pallet jack. The tank rolled catching the employee's right middle finger between the slurry tank cribbing and the asphalt ground resulting in an amputation to at least the first knuckle.

An employee was using an electric pallet jack to put a load on top of a conveyor when the forks of the pallet jack became stuck on the conveyor and lifted the back of the pallet jack. The back of the pallet jack then landed on the employee's right foot, causing fractures.
An employee lost balance and fell sideways to the concrete floor, breaking the left leg.

An employee installing electrical conduit in a room with sodium hypochlorite piping fell from the ladder that he was working on and onto the piping. The hazardous chemical splashed on his left leg and arm. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was stepping into a lime loader truck when his knee popped and he fell to the ground. He tore a ligament in his left knee.
While an employee was stacking lumber, the lumber fell on and amputated his right-hand middle fingertip.
An employee fell from an eight-foot ladder resulting in a broken right ankle.

An employee was being lifted on a pallet by a forklift to fix a boom. The forklift got too close to the boom and the employee was crushed between the forklift and boom resulting in contusions to the abdomen and legs.

A worker opened a valve that allowed monoisopropylamine to enter an empty tank. Vapors from the monoisopropylamine entered the shop environment and migrated to a neighboring area where an employee had a serious reaction and experienced respiratory distress. She was hospitalized.

An employee was pouring cement from a truck when he noticed a hard piece of cement on the conveyor belt. When he attempted to remove the cement, the belt lacerated and broke several of his right-hand fingers.
An employee was driving a small tug machine called a mule when he ran into a pole and suffered a broken shin bone.
An employee conducting an electrical test on a cable product contacted a live electrical current, suffering burns from an electrical shock. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee slipped on ice formed on steps of a residential home when delivering mail, which resulted in a broken arm that required hospitalization.
On July 19, 2016, an employee suffered a partial little finger amputation while guiding the well casing into a bore hole.
An employee was attempting to replace an air-conditioning louver on an inside duct when an air filtration unit fell and struck the employee's right pinky finger.
An employee was observing a supervisor during training on the production floor when the employee's left arm got entangled in the conveyer drive shaft.
An employee was positioning a wind brace and connecting a mast to a work platform. He fell back on his lanyard and his upper arm was caught in a pinch point between the mast and the wind brace.
An employee climbing a fixed industrial roof ladder lost his balance on the upper landing and fell to the level below, injuring his ankle.
An employee was preparing to change out the equalizer block on a crane when the block fell over and struck the employee, who suffered broken bones in both legs.

On 2/13/2016 at about 1:30 p.m. an employee who was cleaning around a floor grain auger with an open gate fell into a hole around the auger.  The employee's leg was caught in the moving auger and the leg was amputated around the knee.  The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was transporting a container filled with metal chips using a forklift. When he attempted to pull the handle on the hopper, his left finger was crushed between the handle and the forklift mast, resulting in a partial amputation halfway through the fingernail.

On Thursday, 06/11/2015 at 2:15 PM an employee at the Hampton VA Medical Center was injured on the job in the Main Kitchen (Building 116/Room 103) of the Nutrition & Food Services Department (N&FS). The employee had finished with food production efforts for the day and began daily sanitation/clean-up efforts. The employee was responsible for cleaning and sanitizing a 100-gallon kettle.  At the time of the injury, the equipment was left in the "on" position; the paddles were rotating; and the probe had been removed from the bottom of the kettle thereby creating a small circular opening. The employee was cleaning out the circular opening (finger in upright position through the hole) when the paddle struck his finger. The paddle severed 1/2 inch of his middle finger on his left hand.  Bone was visible. The employee was rushed to the Emergency Room for re-attachment efforts.

An employee had delivered a parcel to a house and stepped off the step onto a walkway when she twisted her left ankle. She then tried to catch herself with her right leg and heard a pop. She fractured her right leg in three places and was hospitalized overnight.

On February 26, 2017, an employee was driving a forklift and was turning around in a small area. There was another forklift that was non-operable in the same area. The employee backed up the forklift and struck the forks of the non-operable forklift. The forks penetrated the employee's right heel and tore tissue from the bone.

Two employees were working at a food preparation and heating cart when a flash fire occurred as they opened the door to the heating compartment, shooting flames out at the employees. One employee received second degree burns to the hands and face; the other employee received third degree burns to the hands and face.

An employee was cleaning the floor around a machine when an unsecured piece of plexiglass (36 in by 36 in) fell about 36 inches from a ledge and landed on the employee's right thumb. The finger was amputated and required 28 stitches to repair.

An employee was walking in a designated walkway though the warehouse on her way to the break room. A forklift driver drove a forklift into the walkway and did not see the employee. She was struck by the forklift blade on her ankle, and then fell to the concrete floor. She suffered lacerations and contusions to her ankle and thigh, as well as an unspecified head injury. She was hospitalized for treatment.

While an employee was moving a small pile of hot material with a bobcat, a flash of steam entered the cab of the bobcat. The employee exited the cab and tripped into a pool of hot water, receiving first and second degree burns and requiring hospitalization.
An employee pulled a pallet from a stack and got a severe splinter in his right hand. The wound eventually became infected and required hospitalization.

An employee was moving a winch on a cart when a drain in the floor caused the cart to tip and the winch to fall. While trying to grab the falling winch, the employee's thumb was smashed against the floor.
An employee was feeding a patient when she turned and lost her balance. She fell to the floor and landed on her left knee, fracturing her kneecap.
An employee fell on icy stairs while exiting the building and fractured the left ankle.
An employee was conducting rigging operations in a vessel's cargo bay when he stepped back on ulexite mineral and fractured his right tibia.
A maintenance employee using a metal punch struck his left hand with a hammer, experienced swelling and inflammation, and developed an infection that required hospitalization.
An employee was using the paper cutting board when he amputated the end of his left-hand middle finger.

An employee removed a guard from a conveyor belt motor to check the chain and sprockets for tension. The employee reached toward the running chain and sprocket and his left thumb was caught between the chain and sprocket resulting in an amputation of 1/4 inch to 1/2 inch of the thumb. The machine was energized at the time of the incident.
While walking up a slight incline on a concrete surface, an employee lost balance and fell to the concrete, suffering head trauma and requiring hospitalization.
An employee jumped off the 2nd floor balcony to avoid being bitten by a dog and was injured. The employee jammed the left thumb and sprained their lower back upon impact with the ground.

An employee was working with a high-pressure processing machine and was trying to put the push arm back when the machine reset and caught the employee's finger between the sheet metal and the push arm. The employee suffered a contusion and amputation to the left ring fingertip.
An employee was laying down rods that were being removed from an oil well when he began to feel fatigued and lightheaded before collapsing to his knees.
An employee received a partial amputation to the right middle finger while clearing a jam on the Skive Machine (leather trimmer).

An employee was on the fourth rung of a ladder that was leaned up against a modular home.  A tractor moved the modular home while the ladder was still leaned against it. The employee fell from the ladder, breaking a foot and hurting his/her back. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was clearing a jam in the palletizer machine and cut a finger when it was caught in a gear.
An employee was removing patients due to a fire in an elevator shaft. The employee was exposed to the smoke and fumes, suffering a respiratory tract issue that required overnight hospitalization.

An employee was cutting sections of a vertical pipe (shaft for a valve). When he pushed the last cut section out of the way, the pipe fell straight down and pinned his fingers between the pipe welds, breaking his right-hand middle and index fingers.

On 3/11/2015, at approximately 8:30 AM, an employee was injured when the tank load he was unloading  shifted on his forklift. His finger got caught between the forks and the load when he reached in to secure it. He was taken to the hospital and received surgery.

An employee was on top of a scaffold performing dry blasting operations. The employee was kneeling to reach the lower area and lost balance. The employee blasted the left hand and was hospitalized as a result of the injury.
An employee slipped on water on the floor of a patient's bathroom and fell.
An employee was walking between a cooker and a pot when a water hose began to whip around and sprayed him with hot water and steam. He suffered a second degree burn to his upper back.

An employee was working on the side of a column that was supported by a wood planked scaffold forming concrete foundation on a wall. The employee lost his footing and fell three and a half feet to the ground fracturing his right lower back.
A maintenance employee fell through the roof of a paint booth he was disassembling when the roof bowed.
An employee was exiting a transportation van and missed the bottom step causing the employee to fall about three feet to the concrete side walk.  The employee's hip was shattered.
An employee was hospitalized after a horse kicked him in the chest.
An employee was preparing the workplace for underground electrical work and suffered a heat-related illness.

An employee was using a table saw to cut plywood to size.  The employee's right ring and middle fingertips were amputated at the first joint when the fingers came in contact with the table saw blade. The saw was not guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was working on the line, got bumped by another employee, stepped back and lost her balance falling and breaking her left wrist.

An employee was untangling a wire tangle at the capstan.  The machine was still in operation at the time.  The employee tried to cut the tangle when his left hand got caught in the ball of wire, amputating two fingers.
Employee was hospitalized after the circular saw he was using slipped and cut his left thigh.

An employee was positioning the bucket on an aerial lift when his fingertip was caught between the bucket and a ceramic insulator that was hanging from the pole. He suffered a partial fingertip amputation of the left middle finger (distal phalanx).
The employee's arm was caught at the head roller of raw material hopper Line #1.  The arm was surgically amputated to free him from the bagging machine.

An employee was attempting to set up a dryer system to dry peanuts before shipment to a processing facility. The employee's right hand went through the grating of the face of the dryer and the fan blades amputated three fingers. The dryer was in operation at the time of the incident.

An employee was using a 24-inch pipe wrench to make up a connection on a sinker bar, which was on stands on the ground, when he lost his footing and slipped. His lower right leg became twisted and suffered a spiral fracture.
An employee was hanging drywall when planking from the scaffold attached to the wall gave way. The employee fell approximately 10 feet and broke both legs.

An employee was performing duties related to lawn care when he was overcome by heat. The employee complained of a stomach ache and started vomiting. EMT services were called and the employee was taken to a local hospital where he was treated and kept overnight for observation.
An employee was checking the cotton for moisture and the bagger ram caught his left arm and broke it.

An employee was pressure-washing a metal belt using a diluted solution of Oxofoam (a corrosive material). The spray contacted the employee in the neck/shoulder area, causing chemical burns to the skin.
On March 3, 2016, at approximately 3:15 p.m., an employee fell 32 feet from a roof while installing metal panels. The employee suffered broken ribs and a broken pelvis, as well as a hand laceration.
An employee was cutting the plastic bands off of a bundle of cardboard boxes when the knife cut her arm.

An employee was standing on a step ladder and reprogramming an overhead garage door in the company shop when the garage door opened and knocked him off of the ladder to the concrete floor. He suffered a facial fracture and right arm laceration.
An employee had an allergic reaction to cleaning chemicals used in her area of operations. She was admitted to the hospital for breathing difficulties.

An employee was unloading the last window from a container when the previously unloaded windows that were stacked against the container fell against his lower leg. He was hospitalized with a broken tibia and required surgery.

An employee was pulling the release rope on a self dumping hopper. As the hopper was dumping, the hopper slid forward and the safety chain separated causing the hopper to fall off the forks of the lift truck. The employee still grasped the release rope and as the hopper fell his left ring finger was amputated between the fingernail and the first knuckle.

An employee was heating and circulating a chemical batch in a process tank. The employee opened the automatic valve in the control room to begin the transfer of hot molten chemical material. Two bottom drain valves were left open on the transfer line spilling the hot molten chemical material onto the floor. The employee was hospitalized for second and third degree burns to the lower extremities and both hands and arms.
While installing a press mold, an employee's wrench slipped, causing the employee to fall backward to the concrete floor. The employee suffered a broken left hip.
An employee suffered a shin burn when a fire occurred while he was re-fueling equipment in the horse barn.
An employee was threading paper into a slitter machine and contacted the slitter blade amputating the left index fingertip.

On or about 13 Jan 2015 at approximately 14:30hrs an employee fell approximately ten feet from a platform above a ceiling to the ground below suffering a fracture to his L1, cracked ribs, and broken teeth.
An employee was getting up from a chair when the chair broke, causing the employee to fall and injure his right ankle.
An employee climbed into the cab of a new truck to see if it was automatic or manual transmission. As he was getting out of the truck, he fell and struck his head on the ground, fracturing his skull.

An employee was working on the deck of the barge assisting with securing the dredge swing anchor. The employee placed his left hand between the anchor and the side of the barge. While lifting the anchor, the employee's left thumb was crushed and suffered a partial amputation (above the knuckle).
An employee became sick after being bitten by a spider.
An employee operating an assembly machine got her finger caught between two clamps when the machine cycled on its own, receiving a near amputation injury.
An employees' finger was amputated when it was caught in a roller of a print roll machine.

Employees had removed the canopy top off a small 36" excavator to get it through a doorway.  They were in the process of putting the canopy back on when it slipped and hit the safety lever, which activates the boom.  The boom swung around, and the excavator bucket struck the backside of the injured employee between his ribs and pelvis.  The bucket was constructed of sharp metal, which caused a severe cut that required stitches. The employee was hospitalized overnight for observation.

Employee in the HVAC maintenance department was lifting filter boxes.  At some point, the employee's back became tight and the employee laid down to stretch it out.  Employee was unable to get back up.  An ambulance was called and the employee was transported to the hospital and held overnight.
An employee slipped on an icy sidewalk at a client site and fell shattering a knee and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was working along the exterior east side of the building when an unknown assailant stabbed the employee with a knife. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was blasting angles inside the cargo tank on the upper level of a scaffold. A 6-inch pipe approximately 24 inches above the scaffold deck was running horizontally behind him. During the process, he stepped backwards, lost his balance and fell backwards over the pipe as pressure remained on the hose. His legs went in the air during the fall the blaster blasted his right leg below the knee. The employee suffered a deep laceration and injection injury to his lower right leg.
An employee's right middle finger was caught and partially amputated in a pinch point while positioning an h-pile.

An employee was using a grinding machine to level concrete floors. The machine blade got caught in the ledge, pulling the machine forward and breaking the security barrier. The machine and the employee fell 10 feet.
An employee fractured his hip because he tripped and fell at a construction site.

An employee was attempting to set down an excavator attachment that was being lifted with an overhead crane when the attachment came loose and rolled onto the employee's foot, crushing it. The foot had to be amputated.
An employee was bitten on the hand by a cat and required hospitalization.
An employee suffered first and second degree burns to his face, chest, right shoulder, arm and hand when he was sprayed with hot power steering fluid from the concrete truck.
A piece of metal framing fell off a cart and struck an employee in the face.

On February 15, 2017, an employee was performing a leak check on a stainless steel vessel. A nut had become stripped, allowing a bolt to fly off and hit the employee in the nose and forehead. The employee was hospitalized with lacerations, a broken nose, and a broken eye socket.
On July 11, 2016, an employee was sorting merchandise and lost consciousness. He fell and struck his head on a table, fracturing his eye socket. He was hospitalized.

An employee was forming a footing for a water treatment plant. He was working inside a 4-feet-tall trench form and fell while crossing back over to the outside of the trench, breaking his right tibia and fibula.
An employee was working on a presorting machine. She was pushing a stack of mail trays across the floor when the trays fell over. She fell over with the trays and fractured her leg.

An employee was moving equipment out of a shop being remodeled. He was laying a drill press down flat onto a dolly. The press slipped and his left hand got crushed between the drill press and the dolly. His left hand broke and was lacerated.
An employee was retrieving merchandise from a layaway storage area and felt groin pain. He was hospitalized for hernia surgery.
An employee was operating a pulling unit on a rig when he tripped on a pipe, fell,  and broke his leg.
An employee was walking in the parking lot and slipped on ice between 5:30 AM and 6:00 AM on April 1, 2015. The employee was hospitalized and sustained two broken ribs and a subdural hematoma.
While sweeping the front store area next to the tower baskets, an employee began to experience respiratory/breathing problems. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was using a propane floor stripper. The employee started feeling ill and went to the hospital. Blood tests showed elevated carbon monoxide levels.

An employee was setting up to repair a heat transfer leak on a mill and was exposed to organic vapors through a chemical reaction. The employee was using brake clean and a water miscible degreaser detergent when a chemical reaction occurred.

On or about 1:15 p.m. on November 4, 2015, an employee cutting meat on a vertical band saw sustained a partial finger amputation to his left index finger.  The employee wore layered cotton, metal mesh and rubber gloves on his right hand, which he used to turn the meat during cutting/trimming.  He wore layered cotton and rubber gloves on his left hand which he used to take the trimmed pieces of meat and set aside for freezing or packaging.  His left hand inadvertently contacted the moving blade while placing a trimmed piece of meat to the side.

An employee was taking the bolts out of an 8-inch flange when the 40 lb. flange fell 1 inch onto his left pointer finger, resulting in a laceration. The finger had to be amputated at the knuckle at York Hospital.

Two employees were pouring material into an alloy melting pot when it splashed back onto them. One employee suffered second degree burns to both arms; the second employee suffered second degree burns to his right leg. Both were hospitalized.

While delivering letters and packages, an employee went up a set of stairs to a customer's house and rang the bell. Suddenly, the employee passed out due to dehydration and fell down the stairs, puncturing his left lung and fracturing a rib. He was hospitalized.
A worker was carrying hot water in a kettle and was burned when it spilled on both legs.

An employee was moving the head of a welding machine from one stiffener fitter machine to another. He put his right hand on top of the head to slide it down to the next stiffener. His hand slipped off and landed on the plate that the head rolls on. His right middle finger landed above the hole that is inside the plate, and the head rolled over his fingertip.

An employee was operating the production line (slitter) and attempted to remove a piece of scrap while the line was operating. A production line pivot arm came down and struck the employee's right arm fracturing it.

While stepping off an electric pallet jack, an employee's foot got caught between a loading dock platform and a metal barricade. The bone(s) above his big toe shattered. He was hospitalized and underwent surgery. The jack was in motion at the time of the incident.
An employee was delivering mail in a residential area when a dog chased after him as he crossed the street. He fell down a 5.5-foot retention wall embankment, breaking his pelvis and vertebrae.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut plywood when the blade lacerated the employee's left-hand fingers.

A motorized conveyor flipped over while unloading a trailer. The conveyor belt was stopped; when an employee tried to flip it back to its normal position, the conveyor started back up, pinching his finger between the belt and a roller and resulting in a partial amputation. Approximately 95 percent of his left ring fingernail was removed.

An employee was clearing a clogged dust collector pipe. The employee was standing on a home-made platform that had been elevated approximately 10 feet in the air by a forklift.  The platform measured approximately 12-feet long by 42-inches wide.  The employee stepped off to the side of the platform where the platform was not supported by the forks, and the platform tipped from the forks.  The employee fell approximately 10 feet to the ground below.  The employee sustained nine broken ribs and a punctured lung.

An employee was checking the wire on strander machine #265. The wire was stranding onto a bobbin and somehow his finger got under the wire. The tip of his left middle finger was amputated to the first joint.
An employee was using a pipe wrench to unstop the motor of the bagger when the pipe wrench slipped and hit him, breaking his left jaw and lacerating his neck. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was laying a metal deck with another employee when he lost his footing and fell approximately 20 feet over the leading edge. He suffered several fractures to the back and neck bones and a gash on the side of his head.

An employee was standing on a movable machine bed. The employee reached up to grab a rail and caught her hand in a shear point between a bearing block and the machine frame. Her right hand pinky and ring fingers were amputated to approximately the second joint.
On September 22, 2015, a delivery driver amputated a portion of his right hand ring finger while stowing the Tommy Gate on his vehicle after usage.

An employee was checking lights with the use of a scissor lift that was extended approximately 19 feet. The scissor lift was struck by a bridge crane. The employee fell with the lift resulting in a break to the employee's left femur. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting steak meat on a band saw when the saw cut his left thumb and index finger.
An employee was hit by the blast of a sand blaster, which injected media into his leg.
An employee exiting a bucket truck lost his footing on the last step and fell to the ground fracturing his left leg.

A crane operator was stacking concrete slabs. A slab on the stack slid and struck another employee on the ground in the left thigh area. The employee was hospitalized due to deep laceration to the thigh requiring surgery.

An employee was loading a tractor trailer when the tractor trailer unexpectedly pulled off while he was still inside. He fell approximately 5 feet from the rear of the trailer to the asphalt ground below and landed on his face. His face and chin were lacerated and/or abraded, requiring stitches.

An employee was finishing a concrete double v-beam with a trowel when a coworker entered the building with a forklift. As the coworker passed the injured employee, his tire caught the employee and pinned him against the form and forklift. The injured employee suffered scrapes to his back, right arm, and right torso.
An employee was smashing down the trash on top of a metal dumpster when he fell 4 to 6 feet, injuring his head, left calf, torso, and scapula.
An employee was struck by a bucket while engaged in cement pouring operations. The employee was hospitalized with pelvic area injuries.
An employee was under a running truck tightening a packing gland and was injured by the PTO shaft.
An employee was trimming tree limbs when he was struck by a truck driven by a patron. He suffered right leg and head/brain trauma, requiring surgery.
An employee was mowing a green and caught his hand in the spinning blade when he went to empty the basket while the mower was still powered.
An employee was transporting racks of water bottles on a cart when the cart became caught on a drain depression and tipped over, causing the bottles to fall on him. He suffered three broken ribs.

An employee was polishing a rotating part in a CNC lathe. The glove he was wearing got caught, amputating his middle finger, lacerating his ring finger, and breaking his pinky finger. He was hospitalized.
An employee amputated the right middle finger while operating the brake press.
An employee was using a band saw to cut material when the material kicked back and struck the employee in the chin-jaw area, causing a laceration.
An employee was attempting to free a coil chain from a coil when his left middle finger was caught between the chain and the coil, amputating his fingertip.
An employee tripped over roofing materials while walking and fell to the ground, injuring a wrist.
An employee amputated two fingers.
An employee was hospitalized for heat stress.
An employee fell from a crate while drywalling, lacerating his eyebrow.
