The tip of the employee's right index finger was amputated when it was caught between the fabric and the rollers of the doffing machine.
An employee was walking on a catwalk when he tripped on an object that protruded from the floor of the walkway and broke his left femur.
An employee's lower left arm was amputated.

Two employees were adjusting forks on a forklift before lifting a load of building materials at a distribution warehouse. While attempting to spread the forks apart, one of the forks fell off of the tracks. Because the fork was no longer seated in the tracks, it fell to the ground, striking one of the employees. The employee sustained a broken leg (fibula) approximately 2 to 3 inches above his right ankle and five broken toes on his left foot.

An employee had his hand on a screen printer while another employee was performing a calibration. The machine went to park and caught the employee's left thumb. The left thumb was amputated from the nail forward.

While placing springs into a grinding machine, an employee contacted the guide edge of the grinding machine, amputating the right index fingertip. The machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.
Employees were tightening a ring on a steel drum when the ring slipped and a bolt came flying out, striking one employee on the side of his head, just below his hardhat.
An employee fell 20 feet from a roof while delivering shingles to a customer site, suffering blunt trauma.

The company was having a United Way rally which was done once per year. They were performing a treasure hunt and the employee was going from one station to another. As the employee crossed the gravel parking lot, the employee slipped and fell breaking the right wrist.
While changing a street light, an employee contacted the electrical filament and suffered an electrical shock. He was knocked unconscious and required hospitalization.

Employees were transferring a barge from dry dock to land. The barge commander gave the "stand clear" signal to everyone.  The injured employee's hands were not clear of the lifting cans. The employee's fingers on both hands were crushed between the lifting cans and the bottom of the barge.

An employee was operating the slitting machine while wearing gloves. While actuating the rollers on the slitter, the employee attempted to remove a piece of scrap. The roller pulled his glove into the point of operation, causing an open avulsion to his left thumb and an open wound to his left pointer finger.

Employee was installing a new cable on a home while working from a Lunar, 28 foot fiberglass extension ladder. A gust of wind made his ladder move and he felt like it was going to fall so he jumped off the ladder toward the grass to avoid the concrete patio and landed on his back.
An employee was loading stone slab on a transport cart. The crane clamp got caught on the cart and kicked out the stone slab which struck the employee.
An employee was in the bathroom when she slipped and fell. She was hospitalized with bone damage.
An employee was loading a bulk flour trailer. A loading cap came off the trailer under pressure and struck the employee in the face resulting in facial lacerations, a nose fracture, and broken teeth.

An employee was working on the ground aligning the bottom of a 13 3/8" casing joint into the drilling rig v-door by hand. A winch on the rig floor was lifting the joint top through the v-door. The winch line was lowered causing the bottom of the pipe to slide into the injured employee's left foot resulting in a compound ankle fracture.
An employee suffered an amputation to their right index finger down to the first knuckle when it was caught in an agitator shaft.

An employee was helping to take a cable winch system down. The system had been used to pull a heat exchange bundle. The employee's hand was on a poly snatch block when the operator moved the cable. The employee's fingertip was caught between the cable and poly snatch block, resulting in a distal finger amputation.
A worker reached into a running palletizer machine to adjust a sensor.  A compression bar came down, breaking his arm. The machine was guarded at the time.

An employee was moving an overhead crane and had the crane remote in his hand. He was lifting a bundle of rebar with the crane. There was another free-swinging chain hanging from the crane. The hook at the end of the free-swinging chain hit the employee in the face, crushing the right side.

On March 23, 2016, at approximately 1:30 a.m., an employee was cleaning out a vertical blender. When she opened a 10-inch x 10-inch door on the side of the blender, her right hand was caught between the side of the blender and the moving auger, amputating four fingers. The machine was energized at the time of the incident.
An employee sustained a broken arm after reaching into a conveyor.

An employee was removing a flattening plate from a coordinate measuring machine (CMM). He positioned himself on the CMM table about 38 inches off the floor and was attaching a hoist chain for a forklift boom attachment when the 2-inch probe shaft impaled his body, requiring surgical removal.
Employee suffered a skull fracture after slipping and falling on a wet floor which had recently been mopped.

An employee was using a side boom along a pipeline when the wooden mat broke apart and the lift began to rock. The employee exited the side boom and landed on some rocks, injuring his left elbow, ribs, abdominal area, lungs, and the right side of his face. He was hospitalized.
Employee was reconnecting the battery on the forklift when he pinched his left pinky finger.
An employee fell and broke his left arm while descending from an 8-foot step ladder.

On 1/31/15, an employee amputated the tip of the left middle finger in a Garrido paper sheeting machine while removing a paper jam. The employee's finger was caught between a metal pusher attached to a belt and the machine itself, removing about 1/2" of the employees left middle finger.
On Monday, May 9, 2016, at approximately 3:00 PM, an employee was exiting the facility when he tripped and fell down the front steps. He sustained head and elbow injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee installing conduit for primary underground wire was hospitalized for heat stress.

On April 15, 2015, a maintenance technician cut all his fingers while using a table saw.  The cuts were stitched at the hospital that day.  On April 23, 2015, two fingers were amputated as a result of infection.

Employees were dismantling/removing heavy equipment at the Amazon facility. One of the employees got on a stand-up forklift to move some things while cleaning the area and got his leg caught between a concrete wall and the forklift. The employee was not trained to operate the forklift.
An employee was cutting a steel pipe with a power grinder. The grinder kicked out and seriously cut the employee's leg.
While descending a step ladder, an employee fell from the lower rungs, injuring his head and torso and breaking two ribs.
An employee was caulking the inside of a railcar when the doors closed on his upper legs, compressing them.
An employee was guiding a steel load that was being lowered from a tower crane when the load pinned and crushed the employee's right foot.

Employee was painting the interior space on a 6000-gallon water tank. He was wearing a fresh air respirator; the compressor was outside with a line that ran into the confined space through an access point on top. The tank attendant didn't get a response so 911 was called and entry was restricted until the air was confirmed clear.  By the time the all clear was issued, firefighters arrived and performed rescue operations. The employee was taken to Kootenai Medical Center. He had a pulse and was breathing on his own, but was still unresponsive. His PPE included a  Survivair Respirator with compressor, full enviro air suit, Tychem SL chemical suit, another paint suit underneath, and a Bullard hose system.
An employee fell and fractured his shoulder. He was hospitalized.

Employees were building transmission power lines at the site location. They were changing out the cross arm of the power line structure and had the cross arms supported with two slings and a crane.  The injured employee removed the bolt that  held the cross arm onto the pole.  He rested his hand on the edge of the bucket he was working from; the cross arm slipped, landed on his hand in the sling, and pinched his finger between the cross arm and the bucket. His fingertip flesh was removed.
A third party truck driver was loading natural gas condensate into his tank truck when an explosion occurred and injured the driver. He was hospitalized for burns to both hands and his back.
An employee was cutting meat with a band saw and amputated his right thumb at the first knuckle.

An employee was walking along the top of a trench that was 4 feet deep, and was carrying a 13 foot long, 8 inch diameter PVC pipe.  The victim slipped, fell into the trench, and sustained a broken neck.

On 12/18/16, an employee was walking up the basement steps while carrying a few packages of frozen meat when she missed the top step, lost her balance, and fell. When she attempted to brace herself from the fall, her right hand went though the lower tier window of the back door, severely lacerating her right wrist.
A employee was stabbed in the back, neck, head and leg by another employee.
While using a table saw, an employee's right index finger and right middle finger contacted the blade. The employee's right index finger was amputated.
An employee was lifting an object with a crane when the object fell onto the employee's left foot, amputating all of his left toes.
An employee was walking behind an operating forklift when the forklift driver backed up and ran over the employee's foot.
An employee become overheated while laying bricks during a construction project at a church.

An employee was helping a Lull operator offload crates of switch gear from a truck when one crate became caught on another. The Lull operator then tilted the forks down. The products slid down and pinched the employee's right fingertip, amputating it.
An employee fractured a knee after slipping and sliding down the lint slide on a cotton gin.
An employee was walking outside the warehouse when the employee slipped on a thin layer of black ice and fell to the ground breaking an ankle.

An employee was participating in annual emergency egress aircraft training. The toe of the employee's left boot caught the top portion of the inflated slide, causing the employee's leg to bend slightly at the knee. As the employee landed on the emergency egress slide, the left leg became wedged under the body and twisted. The employee's left leg and foot were fractured, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell at the job site on October 30, 201, and injured his left elbow requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell 15 feet from a metal deck to the concrete floor below and broke a leg.
As the employee was straightening a rebar to lay a block, the rebar snapped. The employee fell 14 feet over a parapet breaking the right knee and pelvis.
An employee was existing the tractor trailer, missed a step and fell breaking a hip.
An employee was working on a 20 ft., wet roof when he fell. A personal fall arrest system was used, but it was too long.
An employee suffered an amputation injury while rigging up a top drive at or near Parshall, North Dakota.

On September 1, 2015, an employee parked his semi truck in the shop on the cement floor for servicing. He was going to lift the truck onto jack stands by first lifting it with the jack lift. While lifting the truck, the employee got down to the floor level to look beneath it. The handle of the jack lift fell, striking his left-hand little finger against the floor and resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee fell approximately 6 feet to the ground while climbing a stepladder, breaking his clavicle and sustaining bruises and lacerations.
While braking parts on a press brake, an employee's right index finger was caught between a part and the upper die. The fingertip was amputated at the nail.
An employee was inspecting a disassembled actuated ball valve on a workbench. The employee placed a finger on the valve when it cycled and amputated the left middle fingertip.

On or about 16 April 2015 at approximately 1530 hrs an employee was leveling a section of the construction site with a 2007 Ingersoll Rand SD77DX Vibratory Smooth Drum Roller, when the vehicle started to slide down the embankment. The employee dismounted the vehicle and injured his neck upon impact with the ground.
Employee was moving a wall while using a crane. One end of the wall fell and broke the employee's arm.  Surgery was performed, and the employee was hospitalized post-surgery.

The employee removed the safety gate of the inserter machine and got in front of the machine to clean the paper out. The machine started to move and the employee was pinned between the pockets of the machine and the crossbar resulting in multiple fractures.

On May 7, 2015, an employee was injured when attempting to align a two-part bucket with a hydraulic cylinder and block. The employee's left hand was crushed between the two bucket parts, sustaining fractures and requiring surgery.
